text: Aroma of dark dried fruit and spice. Complex flavors of wheat, malt, spice and fruit. Lots of carbonation. Alcohol is fairly well hidden. Great Weizen Bock!

Bottle from Geers. Dark brown colour, beige foam. Nose of plums, raisins, banana, wheat. Taste is caramel sweetness, than a lot of sour lemony notes. Almost undrinkable, Something went wrong here I suppose. Will rerate if I get another bottle.
Dark brown and cloudy with luscious white head. Quite a sweet caramel aroma. Similar to taste, dark caramel malts. Very creamy and full in the mouth. Booze-y sweetness is definitely there.

500ml bottle. Clear dark mahogany brown, large off white foamy head. Nose is big roast malt, caramel, wheat, black cherries. Delicious malty, raisin, spice, banana, clove flavors. Medium bodied and holds the alcohol well. Tasty finish. Nicely put together, this is a really enjoyable beer.

Never head a wheat doppelbock, but its a pretty interesting combination of flavors. This one was a bit boozy for being 8.2 but the overall flavors were rich and authentic. It pours absolutely gorgeous with a medium and long lasting fine head. Overall and gem worth trying.

Brewed in 2013 edition, bottle wrapped in decorative paper. Beer from The Cave, Glasgow. Served in 14°C, Tulip Glass. Old beers after long maturation can be unpredictable, and this for sure was. Grenade! Beer explodes while opening, almost whole carbonation disappears in few seconds along with cascades of foam. Colour is two dimensional, light clear brown at the top, dark hazy brown at the bottom. A lot of big pieces of yeasts floating in the glass. Aroma is wine like, old cherries confiture, overripe fruits, hint of plum and roasted malt. Taste is also similar to aged dry wine, rich and very smooth alcohol, plums, overripe bananas, apples, cloves, roasted note. Anyway it was for sure interesting experience to try 4 years old Weizen Bock.

Bottle from The Stoke Beer Festival. Pours a 
Aroma of plum, maybe cherry, wheat, caramel, banana, some brown bread, slight vanilla and subtle spicy fruit esters. Taste of plum, raisin, bready malts, wheat, some caramel, toffee, slight vanilla, a little banana, a hint of cherry and subtle spice. Medium bodied and soft carbonation. A long, sweetish, spicy fruit finish. Wow! A complete Weizenbock which delivers on what it promises. So smooth and flavourful that you could sip it all night. Delicious.
On tap at Damian Beer and Ale. Hazy brown colour, small white head, not a strong aroma, I can smell raisins, plums. But taste is very rich, plums, raisins, hops, quite sweet. Sweet finish. Liked it.
Banan, trochę goździka, słód, suszone i karmelizowane owoce (śliwka, morela), w tle karmel.

Aroma has typical yeasty banana bonbons, darker fruits like raisins and dried apricots, Als some smokier esters.. taste has malty sweetness and something more sharp or vinous. Bready, caramel and also spices in the aftertaste.

W aromacie goździki, przejrzałe banany, słodowa pszeniczna słodycz. Smak jest dość gorzki, lekko palone nuty przeważają nad słodka pszenicą, gładkie i kremowe w strukturze, ale mogłoby być bardziej złożone.
Duft maltet karamel svag Smag karamel malt sød sirup maltet hved øl Ester humle frisk lime
Zaskakująco dobre piwo, w aromacie suszone owoce i lekkie czerwone wino, w smaku, podobnie, dość słodkie, bardzo niskie wysycenie. Mega pijalne mimo woltarzu. Biorąc pod uwagę cenę - rewelacja.

Bottle. Hazy amber, thick, creamy, very stable, white head, copious lacing, awesome looks. Aroma malty, overripe bananas, cherries, bready, clove, slight alcohol, hints of pumpernickel. Taste thick, sweet, smooth, slightly mealy. Carbonation low to none, bitterness medium, fitting, slightly alcoholic. Aftertaste overripe bananas, clove, cherries, prunes, bready, alcohol warming, tobacco. Probably the best Doppel Weizenbock on the market.

This is perhaps the best German beer in existence. Pours a nice robust brown, with basically no aroma except some plummy almost Belgian smell to it. The taste is a delicious, dark, plummy, malty, bubblegum... with some wheaty banana in there. 8.2% ABV is hidden very well, and it would be a great warming winter beer. Good for getting home at almost 9:30pm, learning that Dr. Ruth is 88 years old, banishing the ghost that lives in your fluorescent lights, listening to lovely songs by Dying Fetus, and hangin with your sensual booboo.
Drinked in bottle from drinkstore.ie, reassuring dark color and very satisfying taste in mouth. Im not a big fan of weizen beer but this one is amazing, one of its kind

Botella en 99 cervezas.

Vierte en color castaño algo turbio. Fantástica espuma muy generosa de burbuja pequeña y muy persistente.

De intensidad media-alta en nariz, presenta notas de plátano maduro y caramelo, así como alguna nota cítrica y algo de clavo. Sensación alcohólica. Complejidad media-alta.

De entre los gustos básicos destaca el dulce, que se acompaña también de un punto de acidez. El postgusto da plátano maduro, lo que resulta totalmente consistente con lo que aparecía en nariz.

De cuerpo medio-alto y textura cremosa, no es una cerveza realmente refrescante. Más bien al contrario, resulta cálida debido a la sensación alcohólica que transmite.

La persistencia en boca es notable, donde el dulce de plátano maduro se impone a la acidez y pesa en la boca. La sensación alcohólica se remarca en cada sorbo.

Warka z datą przydatności 02.03.2018. Piwo w barwie miedziane, wysycenie średnie, piana drobno i średniopęcherzykowa, dość obfita, ale szybko redukująca się do opaski. Zostawia jednak niewielką koronkę na szkle. W smaku i aromacie nuty bananowe i chlebowe. W posmaku zarówno słodowa słodycz, jak i lekka alkoholowa goryczka oraz minimalna kwaskowatość pszeniczna. Alkohol jak na tę moc bardzo dobrze ukryty. W ogóle piwo dobrze zbalansowane smakowo i bardzo pijalne.

Muy sabrosa. Sabor a malta predominante. Espuma densa marron clara
 Color bonito, turbio.

Dunkelbraune Farbe, naturtrüb mit cremiger, langlebiger Schaumkrone. Dunkle Beeren im Antrunk, gut hefiger Körper mit Bananengeschmack und Vanillenoten. Eine feine Hopfennote (Hallertauer Herkules) gibt dem ganzen ein gutes Finish. Der hohe Alkoholgehalt von 8,2% wird gekonnt versteckt.

Slightly cloudy, medium head, copper color. Fruity aroma of banana, dried plum, raisins, cherries. Full body, medium carbonation. Very fruity taste. Same notes like in aroma. A touch of sourness. Great.

Aromat mocno słodowy - dużo nut chlebowych, a także nut charakterystycznych dla słodu pszenicznego, ale także szuszone owoce - głównie wiśnia i coś, co kojarzy mi się z wanilią. W smaku czuć dosyć gęsty płynny chleb uzupełniony o intensywne nuty śliwkowe. Całość jest raczej słodka, alkhol - choć trochę wyczuwalny jest dobrze zakamuflowany. Bardzo solidna propozycja

Drinked in bottle. Amazing mahogany colour. At the nose, mature banana, mature plums and intense, warm alcoholic notes. In mouth is full, creamy, very satisfying. Notes of plums, some hints of cinnamon and sweet light coffee. The palate is dry and very warm and complex. Fantastic beer
From decervecitas. In Bavaria glass. Playing 8bit Adventures. Like an alcoholic version of a hefeweizen. Not so bad, but a big deception after tasting their superb tap 5 and seeing this one scores.

Pours with a light brown thick foam. Color is dirty and cloudy home beer-, sahti-, plum juice- or mead-like. Aroma is very similar to that of sahti. Being mainly plum juice and a strong fermented or even spoiled grains. Slight note of alcohol. Palate is a bit dry, not quite balanced, but decent. Taste is simlar to light sahti, but its nicer since the fermented aroma is not too overwhelming. Overripe bananas, slight hints of plums and raisins. Some bitter hoppiness as well. Its quite reminiscent of sahti, but a "better" version of it since its fresher. Its clearly a quality beer, but I dont quite fancy the style. Therefore it deserves a mid-range score.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2017 Bottle from Savor Growl (says brewed in 2007): brown pour, amber tint. aroma of sweet dark fruits. tastes are smooth bread sweet raisin, banana, light spice. not sure what sitting for tens years does to this, but its delicious. will have to try a fresh one to compare.

bottiglia. 0,5 L. Bellaspetto, ambrata scura. Molto complessa e particolare. Buona, anche se un po pesante, sia per il corpo che per la gradazione, entrambi importanti. Rispecchia perfettamente lo stile doppelbock; mentre il frumento utilizzato nella ricetta non incide particolarmente né sul gusto né sullapparenza (la birra si presenta abbastanza limpida e la schiuma non particolarmente persistente).

Bottle from Fakta, Hammel. Pours brown with an off-white head. Aroma and taste is malt, banana, dark berries, wheat, caramel, yeast, dark fruits. Full body. Soft carbonation. Slightly dry fruity finish.
Bottle. Aroma of caramel, plums, raisins, overriped banana and cloves. Starts heavy sweet but finish light bitter with lingering roasty notes. Medium body and oily texture. A nice one...
From the bottle poured into tasting glass. Strong alcoholic nose, Cloves, malty. Taste high carbonated, sweetish yeast, banana, phenolic. Finish is liquorice banana... Long lasting...

Highly overrated, not bitter but STRONG alcohol taste. I had to chase it with water, not fun. I spent way too much money special ordering a case of this ($5/bottle). Going to give the remaining 23 away. A true struggle to finish 1 bottle of this. Disappointing. Troegenator blows this away.
Encore une fois, wow! Laventinus a été une très belle surprise pour moi. Recommande par un connaisseur. Aucunement désappointé.

50 cl. bottle. Hazy dark copper/brown coloured with a creamy beige head. Head is at first frothy but it dissipates more quickly than some other similar styled beers. However, it stil keeps a thin head for a long time. Aroma is banana-dominated along with ripe fruits such as plums and raisins. Some alcohol can be smelled. Taste is sweet, fruity and somewhat spicy - really pleasant. Very slight bitterness and some sourness can be tasted, too. It is a full-bodied and creamy-textured beer with average-to-high carbonation. A bit warming in throat and chest but it still has a smooth feeling, smooth and pleasant finish. Well-balanced. This beers RateBeer rating is higher than that of Tap 5; however, even though this is indeed a very good beer, I think I like Tap 5 better.
Bottle at home. Floral, banan-ey, malty, toffee nose. Pours hazy auburn with a generous off white head. Big soft caramel sugary mouthfeel, but with a decent whack of booze behind it. Quality.
Flot mørk bock med rødligt skær. Duft af tørret frugt og malt. Smagen er næsten vinøs med marcipannoter. Seriøs øl.

Pullo 0,5 l. Lasissa tumman ruskea ja mahonkinen. Vaahto tasainen, parin sentin mittainen. Tuoksussa vehnää, banaania, luumua ja viikunaa. Maussa edelleen banaanisuutta ja luumua, mutta myös vehnämaltaiden katkeruutta. Lopussa mukaan tulee alkoholia, mutta maku on tasainen ja alkoholista tulee täyteläisyyttä. Kaiken kaikkiaan hyvä nautiskeluolut eri tilanteisiin.

500ml. Bottle. Hazy brown with a big white head. Aroma is dominated by banana, with some malts in the background. Taste. Ryebread, banana, spice, dark berries. Ending has some bitterness to it. 

I Bought it for 20DKK in Fakta, very good beer at that price.

Pours clear, light brown with creamy head. Sweet, fruity aroma of banana, fig, plum, grape. Taste is wheaty, sweet with banana, grape, plum, light toffee; earthy and lightly dry in the finish. Quite nice.

A bottle of Unser Aventinus. 
Old bananas that someone has stumped upon aroma. Some delicate canned corn seems there but its just the absurd intensity of the bananas. A bit of caramel and strong malty sweetness in the aroma. Taste is sweet and full of bananas and maltiness

Bottle to chalice. Aroma bananas, clove, prune, bread. Brown with ruby tinge, foamy big head, fairly good retention, good lacing. Flavor of brown bread with raisins, dark berries, mild banana, tangy baking spice. Mildly sweet finish with anise-like note. Creamy, moderate high carbonation.

50cl-fles van bij Bierhalle Deconinck te Vichte. U: Helder kastanjebruin met een gebroken witte schuimkraag. G: Sterk gekruid, karamel, banaan en gedroogd fruit. S: Zoet met pikante toetsen. Gepeperd; karamel, esters en gedroogd fruit. M: Volmondig met medium carbonatie.

kolor ciemnobrązowy, piana bardzo słaba. W aromacie słodowo, słodko. Są rodzynki, skórka od chleba, słodkie owoce, banany. W smaku bardzo pełne, słodkie. Goryczka niska, ukryta za słodami. Lekko alkoholowe. Czuć skórkę od chleba, karmel
Brown with a tan head. Aroma of dark dried fruit and spice. Complex flavors of wheat, malt, spice and fruit. Lots of carbonation. Alcohol is fairly well hidden. Great Weizen Bock!

Poured from bottle brown iced tea color with a nice off white head. Aromas of dark fruit raisin prune toffee malt and hint of banana. Taste is nice creamy dark fruit followed by banana fig and clove well constructed beer.

Served from bottle into weisse glass at home. Pours dark amber brown in color, very low clarity with large creamy light tan head. Rich aroma of dark fruit, raisins and prunes with clean caramel malt and a hint of banana. The fruitiness becomes more banana forward as it warms. No hop aroma detectable. Flavor is more dark fruit, with a more "preserved" character compared to the fresher aroma. Complex toasty malt flavor with another small dose of banana. No hop flavor and only a very mild alcohol flavor detectable. Finish is surprisingly crisp for how rich the flavor is. Full bodied, almost creamy with medium carbonation. Very low bitterness. Overall this beer is very enjoyable, the complex aroma and flavor seem to change with each sip. The superb drinkability and intriguing flavors seems to make this beer a standard for the entire style.

Mahogany with an off white creamy head. Huge banana aroma. Custardy, creamy, with loads of bubble gum, grape and peach. Reminds me of Bubblicious gum, juicy. The flavor starts with a sweet raisiny wave, followed by banana, clove and fig. Almost no heat from the relatively high ABV. The texture feels light on the tongue, like a custardy vanilla cream, with a peppery, licorice finish.
50cl bottle purchased @ La caisse de bière. Couleur rubis, notes de réglisse et de prune.

Bu avec nutjes ! Santé ! 
Bouteille de 50cl.
Verre teku 33cl.
Couleur Brown / acajou belle brillance je trouve ! 
Mousse peu présente voir inexistant ! 
Au nez : note épicé et réglisse je trouve malts caramel.
En bouche : cest la longueur qui mintéresse. 
Note épicé assez forte et note réglisse intéressant. 
Le malts caramel assez longue en bouche donne un vraiment bon goût .

Brązowe, zmętnione, z bardzo przeciętną pianą. W aromacie banan, rodzynki, ciemne owoce. W smaku słodkie, śliwkowe, bananowe, z chlebowo-rodzynkowym posmakiem. Goryczka delikatna. Pełne, sycące. Alkohol dobrze ukryty. Klasyczne i bardzo dobre
Bardzo dobry Wizenbock. W smaku śliwki, banany, szlachetny alkohol i odpowiednia goryczka. Bardzo dobra cena i bardzo dobre piwo.
Aromat po ogrzaniu glownie banan.slodowosc w smaku i aromacie umiarkowwna. Alkohol dobrze schowany . Delikatna sliwka

Birra dal colore ambrato. Schiuma color caffellatte cremosa e persistente.
Allolfatto caramello, miele, toffee e malto tostato. Al palato ben corposa ed oleosa, con note di caramello, nocciola, miele, toffee, malto tostato e caramella al caffè. Nel finale lamaro è quasi assente. Birra eccezionale da consumare a sorsi piccoli data la sua corporatura.
Ottima
At Toms Place, pours dirty brown with a beige head, aroma of fruits, dried fruit, caramel, flavor of dried fruit, yeast, malt, oxidation, medium bodied

Ar: Brown sugar and banana bread; ripe peaches and plums, some rich caramel, toasted malt, and maple syrup; hints of black pepper. Ap: Cloudy amber-brown; large light tan head with great retention; leaves a beautiful cap of dense, frothy foam. T: Dark caramel and banana up front; clove and black pepper; deep toasted malt, but also airy, bready malt flavor; a touch of ash, peach, and treacle; pepper and clove on the finish, with lingering soft bitterness and herbal accents. P: Medium-full body with very high carbonation; finish is medium-dry. O: World-class weizenbock; combines a beautiful pour with balanced flavors of wheat, rich malt, banana, and clove.
Bottle from zlata ladjica. Some roast notes, low wheat, esters low phenolics, some burnt caramel with some raisins and spice. Interesting, although the alcohol is a bit more prominent than expected.
Dark red. Rich yeasty spice, fruit and wheat malt, on a full, sweet taste that finishes lightly bitter. Full body. Overall, a great weizen bock. Complex, balanced, and very tasty.

brown, hazy, small off-white foam; yeasty, wheaty aroma, banana, some alcohol but "noble" one; medium bitterness and sweetness, slightly sour; medium body, smooth feel, soft carbonation, long bittersour finish;
Overall: no flaws, great aroma and taste, very good

UPDATED: APR 19, 2017 W aromacie banany, zboża, ciemne owoce, śliwki, nieco nut wytrawnego wina, fenole. W wyglądzie miedziane wpadające w brąz, z konkretną beżową pianą. W smaku pszeniczne, bananowe, z wyrazistą fenolową nutą, do tego ciemne owoce, śliwki, rodzynki, figi, wytrawne wino, dzieje się tu dużo, Ciało aksamitne, delikatne, pijalne. Rozgrzewające. Ogólnie bogaty, bardzo smaczny weizen bock

UPDATED: APR 6, 2017 Cerveza de un altísimo nivel. Un aroma muy intenso, afrutado y muy agradable. Posee una apariencia algo turba de color caramelo con una corona de espuma beige. Tiene un sabor y paladar intenso y afrutado que combina lo dulce con lo amargo. Notas de caramelo y café. Es final es algo alcohólico, pero entra con mucha facilidad.
De las mejores cervezas que he probado jamás.
user_location: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, SPAIN

text: Toffee caramel, roasted coffee beans, figs, plumcake. On the palate is round and super balanced. The acidity is just perfect. It also has that delicious saline background....Kind of stuff you cand drink over the years.

Enjoyable wheat doppelbock, not the prettiest pour yet still a lovely ruby color. Aroma is somewhat lacking, giving off hints of brown sugar and plums but a bit underwhelming. Tastes thick and mildly sweet with a rich bottom end, full of plum and fig and clove and the slightest dark rum notes on the finish. Mild bitterness on the fade balances the wheat ale sweetness, and the yeasty tang rounds off with a smooth heartiness. Way too drinkable for its ABV. Nice.

Bottle at home, from Beers of Europe. Yeasty banana aroma as to be expected, but refreshingly so. A hazy chestnut - treacle toffee. Off-white head - its creamy but soon dissipates. I grabbed this from the fridge as soon as I got home from a shot day at work so suspect its over chilled. A hefe banana and cloves sweetness, with some sourness. A hint of herbal bitterness in the finish. All well balanced. Medium bodied. Slick. Soft carbonation, which is more prominent in the medium finish. Damn enjoyable. Sehr toll. But need to try again less chilled (but with me more chilled).

500 ml bottle in Weizenbier glass. Chocolate brown colour, Weizenbier-typical foam head. Banana, rum and roasted malt aroma. Sweet-malty taste. Almost no bitterness. Alcohol is dominant and warm. Carbonation soft, full body. Thick texture. Nice match with blue cheese. Great Weizenbock!
Aroma of plums and yeast. Significant carbonation. Nice bitterness and feel in the mouth. Alcohol well hidden. Very balanced and sophisticated for a wheat beer.

Bottle, 0.5l. Hazy dark copper pour with two finger creamy off-white head. Very good head retention. Nose pretty much the usual hefe, grassy, yeasty and fruity with banana notes. Slight citrus notes. 

Medium body, softly carbonated. Thick and creamy texture. Taste is subtly sweet with a bit of tartness, nicely balanced. Aroma of yeast, grass and hay. Usual banana and cloves. Peppery. As it warms up a bit, it gets more complex with caramel and liquor coming more into the play. Nice wood notes. Excellent subtle alcohol presence, not imposing, somewhat hidden, nicely warming. Once again beautifully balanced. Long finish, herbal, grassy and slightly dry. 

Tasty one.
Bottle. Pour was dark amber, huge lasting off white head. Aroma of spice, banana, fruit. Taste was sweet, raisin, fig, banana, spices.

Ive been drinking the Aventinus many times (probably around 50-80) during the years, both on tap (@Schneider Brauhaus) and bottle. Finally reviewing from 50cl bottle in weisse glass. Pours a moderate to abundant creamy off-white head, nice orange/ruby to dark mahogany brown colour, haziness depending on how much sediment you pour. Smells deep and very fruity, cherries, berries, sweet bread / xmas loaf, with typical but refined weissbier aromas like clove, ripe banana, esters. Taste follows the path of the aroma, with raisins, berries and cherries again, dried fruits, caramel, blended all together in a great crystal malt background, wheat hints; really spot on medium plus sweetness, which leaves space to a light bitter finish; fruity and light tartness coming through. Heavy and full bodied, creamy and silky, alcohol is well blended. Very complex, juicy and tasty. Takes all the best from the more standard blond weiss, paring it with nice darker malts and fruits, light roasted elements. Possibly my absolute favorite german beer, and favorite in the wheat/weiss/weizen bock category. A benchmark,defines the style. Absolute masterpiece.

Une bière dune exceptionnelle complexité. Cette Aventinus est dune richesse gustative incroyable à la fois sur les épices et le fruit qui ne peut laisser indifférent. Elle en est surement une grande Weizen Bock (ma connaissance du genre étant encore limitée), et elle en serait une grande bière si lalcool y était brin mieux intégré et le final plus travaillé. En verre, elle est de couleur chêne foncé (EBC de 48 environ) surmontée dune mousse beige, stable à un centimètre dépaisseur. Le nez est une pure splendeur, dune richesse et dune complexité hors du commun qui plus est, évolutive. Les arômes de caramel et de céréales se mélangent à des notes épicées (réglisse, pointe de girofle) et de fruits (fraise, banane, moût de raisin). Plusieurs minutes sont nécessaires pour lappréhender entièrement. Lattaque,suave porte déjà des arômes épicés (notamment de la cannelle) auxquels viennent sajouter des notes de fraise et de caramel. La deuxième bouche se porte sur les fruits jaunes mûrs avec une arrière bouche très riche sur la banane, le moût de raisin et les épices. Une très belle composition. La présence en bouche est digne des très grandes bières. lamertume, peu intense (IBU de 16 avec une utilisation dHallertauer Herkules connu pour ses arômes épicés) est cependant bien intégrée et relève convenablement les arômes. Lalcool (8,2 % Abv) plus présent en troisième bouche nest malheureusement pas tout à fait bien intégré. Les arômes de réglisse et de pruneaux sont néanmoins agréables. La succession darômes, très différents, est quant à elle bien pensée. Lensemble glisse remarquablement bien dans une belle homogénéité. Le final marquera la deuxième petite fausse note. Celle-ci, dune longueur acceptable (mais qui aurait tout de même gagnée à être un peu plus longue) ne présente rien de remarquable et se positionne principalement.sur le malt Deux petits bémols qui ne permettent pas de faire naître démotions particulières et qui laisse des regrets tant le nez était prometteur. Je me retire donc ce cette Aventinus.
W zapachu czuć mocno wędzonką, troszkę słodami ciemnymi. W smaku czuć, ze pszeniczniak palony, ale i bardzo mocno odczuwalny alkohol i to pomimo, iż jest piwo schłodzone.
Clear brown liquid with yellowish head. Aroma of leather. Taste same + caramel, medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour.

Appearance: brown, clear, white foam, rocky head. Aroma: leather, smoked fish, bread, wheat. Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter. Palate: medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, almost no aftertaste.

Butelka 500ml.Kolor brązowy, piana średnia ale trzyma się dobrze, mętnawe. Aromat wędzonych śliwek, karmel. W smaku chlebowe z mocną pszenicą w tle, rozgrzewający alkohol, goryczka średnia, mocne wysycenie, bardzo dobre piwo. Chyba najlepszy weizenbock jaki spożyłem, Bawaria górą.

Pours brown from the bottle and leaves a thick, foamy head. The aromas lead in the direction of a classical dark Weizen, with overripe banana being dominant. Taste is a deep, rich mix of banana, chocolate, and light berry tang with a light hint of spice. Finishes with chocolate and a light alcohol warmth. Im not entirely convinced by the palate, which feels thin at the outset. Not until the finish does the full depth of flavor come through. Still, this is very good stuff.
Sötét borostyán színű hosszan tartó habbal a tetején. Édes, cukros illat. Testes kis sör. Fantasztikus banános, búzás, melaszos ízzel. Igazi mestermű.

Kolor: ciemny bursztyn, mętne 
Aromat: goździki, banan
Smak: Trochę słodkie, dużo banana, na końcu goździk daje mocno po kubkach smakowych, wysycenie dość wysokie, lekki alkohol wyczuwalny choć goździk go trochę maskuje ale w miare ogrzewania sie piwa alkohol coraz bardziej odczuwalny, goryczka niska, solidny podwójny koźlak

Piwo lekko metne w kolorze brazowym z obfita drobnopecherzykowa piana pozostawiajaca ladny lacing na szkle.W aromacie jakby wedzone, sa banany i dojrzale pomarancze, jest tez troche karmelu i drozdzy. W smaku nie jest tak slodkie jak sie spodziewalem, niska goryczka i wysycenie na srednim poziomie. Zdecydowanie nuty pszeniczniaka mieszaja sie z ciemnym chlebem i przyjemnym rozgrzewajacym alkoholem.

Kvass color. Really soft foam.Orange and roasty aromas. Inspite of high degree of alcohol the sweet toffee and caramel taste will may your toungue feel almost orgasm and bubbly bread and caramel notes will finish that. Very good.
W zapachu wędzonka i banany i suszone owoce. Brązowe z niezbyt obfitą pianą. Gładkie. Mimo mocy alkohol niewyczuwalny. Wysoko nasycone.

Vintage 2012: Aroma is absolutely lovely. Dark fruits and red berries, sweet malts and light toffee notes. Almost like smelling a bowl of candied fruits and dark bread. Taste is as the original, maybe a bit more vineous with more "red" flavors. Smooth toffee candy and raisins. Ripe banana as well, as it should be. Maybe a little less carbonation than a fresh one, but very close to the original. Mild roasted notes. Maybe I should have tasted this against a fresh one, but its very close in taste and ageing seems to do very little to this besides the color and slightly enhanced flavors?
Лучший вайценб& из того, что пробова& В аромате черносл& вяленые бананы, карамел&

Bottle. Hazy brown beer with large tan head, great lacing. Aroma of banana, bubblegum, caramel, apple, wheat. Taste is medium+ sweet and very light bitter: ripe bananas, plums, caramel, spices, subtle bread notes. Medium to full body, oily texture, average carbonation. Complex, tasty, classic example of the style.

2013 vintage 500ml bottle from Sake no Taniguchi. Cloudy ruby-brown pour, low creamy off-white head. Delectable aroma of banana toasted on brown bread, clove spice, vanilla, plums - hard to take my nose out of it. Similar flavour, sweetness from banana, a hint of chocolate, wheat and bread dough, dark fruit more noticeable as it warmed, spice in the backend with light booze warmth. Very creamy and smooth, easy drinking, light tickle from carbonation, medium-full mouthfeel. Loved it.
Tasting @ Havregatan 20170127. Bottle (500 ml) from Systembolaget. Fruity and sweet with dried fruits, malty, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, malty and sweet.
Beer tasting @ Jorn69 27/1-17. Bottle from Systembolaget. Malty, dried fruity and sweet. Body is medium, the finish is sweet and dried fruity.
Bottle from systembolaget. Beer tasting@ Jorn69. Pours a amber colour beer with a small head. Dried fruit with malt and banana. Dry finish

Cette bière est lune de mes amantes les plus attirantes et je reviens a elle avec des yeux de biche épleurant sa disponibilité plus dune fois par mois. Ceci venant de quelquun qui naime pas les bières de blés est assez surprenant, mais cest justement cela qui fait tout son attrait: elle se donne a tout le monde la coquine! Son blé malté lui conférant un côté caramélisé si doux et réconfortant, elle fond littéralement dans la bouche et malgré sa forte teneur en alcool sa douceur et rondeur la rend accessible a tous. Il me semble quil y a quelques années elle avait un gout de cacao plus prononcé mais cela nenlève rien a sa perfection, seulement elle peut changer de tempérament avec lâge. Elle est douce au palais malgré une carbonisation qui persiste longtemps. Des saveurs de poire, banane, carvi, sucre brun, caramel et un petit côté terreux la rendent intrigante a souhait, mais ne traumatisera aucun non-initié par son audace tout en retenu. De même, elle est démocratiquement accessible a tous avec son petit prix qui devrait faire sorte dexemple a plusieurs microbrasseurs cherchant a chatouillé le marché de luxe ou la bière nas vraiment pas sa place.

Deep, rich, and malty, Aventinus is the kind of beer that makes winters more bearable. The pour is dark amber with a creamy layer of long-lasting suds. Sweet aromas of candy sugar, fruit and malt starch. Banana, molasses, prune, plum, raisin, anise, and subtle chocolate flavoring. Its full-bodied but velvety smooth. For all the sweetness and the relatively high ABV, this is almost unreasonably easy to drink.
Im not a big fan of weizen beer but I have to admit this is super! Almost the perfect one.

Aroma is caramel, wheat, alcohol, toffee, banana maybe. Appearance is reddish brown, off white head, not clear. Taste is caramel, dry, banana, wheat, toffee, clove, some booze. Mouthfeel is medium body, light spritzy carbonation, dry booze caramel wheat aftertaste. Overall, better than expected but still not a style I usually enjoy.

Pours a murky copper color with a light off white head. Aroma is sweet with wheat at fruit notes. Taste is pretty complex and balanced. Flavor consists of bread, bananas, raisins, light roast. Alcohol not noticeable in taste. Medium body, light finish, nice soft carbonation. Ill drink this again for sure.

Miedziane, mętne piwo o obfitej pianie, która redukuje się do pierścionka przy brzegu szkła. Aromat wyraźnie bananowy i lekko alkoholowy. W smaku słodkie, dużo dojrzałych bananów, trochę alkoholu. Goryczka jak na pszenicę dość wysoka. Ogólnie udany koźlak pszeniczny, w sumie klasyka gatunku, więc ciężko się do czegoś przyczepić.

Bottle, 500ml. A dark reddish beer with minimal head. Aroma is of dried fruits and alcohol. Taste is medium bitter with moderate carbonation. Medium to light bodied with a somewhat watery finish. Wheat and slightly alcoholic lingering character.

8. 12. 2016, Ljubljana, Gas Station with boyz. Bottled. Fullbodied Heffeweizen.

Bottle labeled 2012 from Geers, Gent - BE. Color: clear dark amber beer with no carbonation and really small white foam. Smell: caramel and toffee malt domination. Bread notes. Taste: full body with caramel and toffee malt domination. Good balanced and good attenuation. Really nice beer. Bread notes. Aftertaste: caramel, malt and bread. Really good.

Bottle

Appearance: dark amber with fine white foam.
Taste: wheat, sweetness in the aftertaste, a little alcohol.
Palate: full-bodied, big carbonization.

0,5l bottle. Hazy dark copper colour with slowly shrinking big creamy, thick off-white head. Aroma: Rich biscuit, banana and caramel notes in a very sophisticated way. Taste: Sweet, rich malty start in a very dessertish way with a hiding light tarty tone that is fallowed by a very pleasent medium bitter mouthfeel. Well balanced and has a very creamy texture. Bottle at home. Dark brown with a white foam which falls to lacing. Nose is intense: banana, malt, chocolate, dark fruit. Taste is equally intense and delicious. Rich, sweet, malty, licorice, chocolate, bananas. Palate is creamy. An outstanding beer.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2016 Mooi donker bier met romige crèmekleurige schuimkraag. Redelijk kruidig aroma. Lekkere, licht complexe, volle smaak. Banaan, kruidnagel, pruimen, (rum)rozijntjes, peperkoek, rode druif, lichte koffie, beetje anijs. Licht portachtige zachte warme afdronk. Top genietersbier.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2017 Pours mahogany with a thin tan head. Aromas of caramel. Taste is quite sweet but balanced. Notes of bananas, caramel, oranges, plums, raisins, liquorice and cognac. Body is full and creamy with moderate carbonation. One of my favourites!
As a standard, simply the best. Other beers may be able to approach or equal, or even surpass its complexity, but with just the four beer necessities in life? Unregrettable.

(bottle)

Kolor:  Miedziany. Piwo jest mętne. 
 Piana:  Umiarkowanie trwała, lekka, średnio wysoka. Pianę formują średnie i drobne żółte oczka, które szybko pękają.
Wysokie wysycenie niszczy niemiłosiernie pianę.
Pod koniec degustacji jest jej niewiele powyżej 2 milimetrów.
Krążki na ściankach tylko gdzie niegdzie. 
 Zapach: Zapach, który unosi się nad butelką jest średnio trwały. Po odkapslowaniu dochodzi do nosa aromat wyraźnie estrowy (ciemne owoce). Dalej pojawia się odrobina fenoli (delikatny goździk).
Kolejno do bukietu zapachowego dołączają chleb pszenny i trochę tostów.
Lekki banan też się gdzieś tutaj zaplątał.
W aromacie alkohol jest zupełnie niewyczuwalny. 
 Smak:  Smak wyraźnie melanoidowy (tosty, skórka od chleba), potem odrobina ciemnych owoców (rodzynki), na sam koniec przyprawowe fenole (goździk).
Posmak pszenicy bardzo widoczny.
Piwo jest sycące, zapychające. Po jednej butelce 0,5l czuje się jakbym zjadł syty obiad. 
Goryczka niewielka, przyprawowo-owocowy finisz. 
Procenty zamiecione pod dywan.
Piwo mocne i konkretne, pytanie tylko czy smaczne? 
 Wysycenie : Wysokie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Aventinus jest to najstarszy na świecie fermentowany górną fermentacją pszeniczny Doppelbock.
Obecny na rynku już od 1907 roku!

Piwo jest konkretne w smaku, mocne i cholernie treściwe.
Jest to jedno z najmocniejszych piw pszenicznych jakie miałem okazję degustować.
Dominują tutaj akcenty estrów owocowych (rodzynki), mnóstwo melanoidyn (przypieczona skórka chlebowa, tosty), nuty pszenicy, a na dopełnienie całości dochodzi do tego lekki fenolowy finisz.
Alkohol został dobrze ukryty.
Całościowo piwo niezłe, aczkolwiek oczekiwania miałem znacznie...znacznie wyższe i trochę się zawiodłem.
Aromat tym bardziej roczarowuje...
Na otarcie łez pozostaje piękny firmowy kapselek.

0,5lt bottle @ Valentin - Curious Bierkneipe, Volos Greece
Full bodied with great palate but still very drinkable, not showing its 8,2% ABV. Sweet, strong taste that lasts with low to medium carbonation.

Its Vintage 2012 Edition is even better in taste with a fuller body, but of course it looses in carbonation and aroma. After all, a better version but to enjoy slowly, with the "normal" version to be the "every time" choise

Beautiful clear brown with tiny bubbles rising to a thick, frothy tan head. The head subsides with no lacing. Aroma is caramel and banana. Sweet, full body, thick on the palate with average carbonation. Long mellow finish. Very nice!
Brown, nice head. Aroma: banana, toffee. Full body, medium sweetness, lightly bitter. Malty flavour, lots of bananas, some caramel. Sweet finish with some cloves and alcohol. Nice balance.

So good.

Very good: sweetness of fruits + appropriate heaviness, nicely mixed and balanced.

Bottle. 2012 vintage. Taste of dried fruits, red berries, caramel, banana, cloves and cardamom.

Botella en una @Cata. 16/10/16 BBD:01/02/17
Color ambar, aroma caramelo, maltoso, sabor caramelo malta.

Bottle 0,5l tape6. Belle couleur brune à reflets orange. Mousse blanche assez persistante. Nez malté, épicé, caramel, fruit. Bouche : ne ressemble pas à quelque chose que je connaisse. Bonne effervescence, amertume, prune, épices ... cest tout ce que je sens. Pas trop mon truc malgré lavalanche de bonnes notes lues sur Ratebeer.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2016 Pas la bière la plus appétissante, avec sa couleur brune troublée et une mousse qui disparait assez rapidement... Mais on nen a cure ! Nez très intéressant, avec une odeur très agréable de confiture de châtaigne (jen consomme régulièrement !), de caramel, de miel (de châtaigne bien sûr), de noisette, de liqueur, de chocolat à la fraise, de pruneau, de banane séchée... Les houblons sont assez inexpressifs au nez, mais le reste, très gourmand, compense aisément. En bouche, la carbonatation est faible, on retrouve les 8.2% dalcool, mais ils sont parfaitement équilibrés. Lamertume se développe sur les premières secondes de chaque gorgée, sans sécheresse, tandis que le final fait la part belle aux céréales et aux malts, le tout en douceur. On retrouve de bonnes saveurs fruitées, comme la cerise, la poire, la prune. Une bouche bien pleine, sans faiblesse, qui se bonifie au fur et à mesure ! Une vraie réussite, et une des meilleures Allemandes que je connaisse pour le moment... Bouteille 50cl, V&B Grenoble.

Nagy, nagyon tartós, halvány bézs színű hab, barna szín. Enyhe, karamelles, leheletnyit konyakos illat. Karamelles, gabonás, fűszeres, aszalt szilvás ízvilág, enyhe konyakos aromával. Közepesen testes és szénsavas, enyhén keserű. Finom sör.

500 ml bottle. Pours cloudy brown with large, lasting tanned head, some yeasts floating. Aroma of buisciut, vanilla, wheat and alcohol. Excellent taste, yeasty, wheat, vanilla and plums. High carbonation, alcohol is well hidden. An excellent beer.
Flaska från SB, vintage från 2012. Mörkt brunröd med beige skum. Lite syrlig doft med inslag av vinbär och banan. Krämig munkänsla, med aprikos, kola, banan och lite syra.
[backlog] 04-09-15 // bottle at Domsgickel, Mainz. Pours a cloudy brownish colour. Aroma is strong ripe banana, dried fruits, plum some raisins. Full body. Yeasty. Smooth.

Cloudy brown beer with cream-colored head, banana, medium body, good balance, banana is not dominated,
Keg at Ushers. Pours murky brown with a modest light brown head. Aroma is apples and bananas. Taste is green apple tart, banana sweet, caramel sweet, figs.

As Schneider Weisse Tap 6 Mein Aventinus.

A 500ml bottle with a best before date of 19th May 2017 and poured into a Riedel weizen glass. It poured a slightly cloudy dark amber brown colour with a big four finger white head that dissipated slowly to a nice thin creamy cap and left nice lacing. Aromas were of biscuit malt, wheat, banana and clove. Tastes of banana bread, brown sugar, clove with a touch of plum, caramel and apple skin. Creamy, medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall very nice and easy to drink which is great since I can now (finally) get this regularly.

As Unser Aventinus. Pours a deep brown with a low off white head. Aromas of raisins, muscovado sugar, roasted nuts, plums, oak, ripe apple, dried marinated fruit. Taste is nutty with caramel notes and dark bread. Mouthfeel is quite substantial and somewhat creamy with moderate carbonation. Very good indeed

Keg @ Victorian Craft Beer Cafe, Halifax. Clouded brown with a thin head. Has a fairly heavy sweetness, which is not overbearing, but certainly hides its strength. Theres plenty of weiss character in its nose.

Delicious complex taste. I love this beer and will buy it again soon. Blah blah blah blah blah

Aventinus poured a deep amber body, my only complaint about this beer was the carbonation. It is bottle fermented which should give it massive amounts of carbonation, however mine was rather flat, with very little carbonation and a few yeast floaters. Aromas of banana, spices, and some fruit notes coming through. Flavor was similar to the aromas with banana, fruit, sweet malts and a little caramel to boot. Overall it is a very good beer, and i cant wait until i get some more. Originally rated on 10/9/2008.

Bottle from the schneiderweisse kulturbox. Had this one for Three weeks and I finally have the right time to try it. Smells of banana and sweet hops. Taste is immidiately full of the Weizen notes, body brings a bit bitterness with it and finish a bit of sweetness. Great Balanced taste, you dont notice the increased alcohol at all.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso fa pensare al luppolo. Lintensità olfattiva è normale e la persistenza olfattiva è sufficiente. Il cappello di schiuma ha una buona tenuta e finisce con un pizzo a contornare il bicchiere. La grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine, con carbonazione media. Lapparenza del liquido è opalescente. Le bollicine sono fini. La carbonazione è abbondante, vivace, persistente ed insistita. Il colore è ebano chiaro. Il corpo è rotondo. Lamaro è medio. Lintensità gustativa è elevata e la persistenza gustativa è sufficiente. Il gusto è piacevole. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono di birra beverina. Il finale è secco e dissetante. Il retrogusto è intenso. Laroma in bocca riporta sentori di miele, frumento, fieno, frutta secca, arrostito, resina, fiori, erba, alcol presente e lievito.

500 ml bottle at Bavarian Bier Cafe in Brisbane. Pours deep with large tan head. Malty, sweet aroma. Well balanced flavours of malt, raisins, sweet fruit. Very well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a bottle into a Weizen Glass. Beautiful clear brown with tiny bubbles rising to a thick, frothy tan head. The head subsides with no lacing. Aroma is caramel and banana. Sweet, full body, thick on the palate with average carbonation. Long mellow finish. Very, very nice!
UPDATED: AUG 24, 2016 Strong wheat aroma with huge white head. Dark brown appearance. Sweet taste with wheat overpowering any other taste. Brown sugar notes. Strong weisse.

Damn well made doppelbock with wheat. Very nice full body and malt character complemented by the wheat grist. Schneider Weisse bar in Munich.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Schneider Bräuhaus. Aroma is fresh and clean with perhaps some perfumed citrus, banana and a little alcohol. Pours dark toffee with a thick head. Flavour is all fruit, with some raisins up front, a little apple and pear later and something a bit tropical left in the mouth. What really impresses is the smooth palate. Beautiful texture, and a lack of bitterness or sharpness helps hide the strength. Very nice.

From a bottle into a Ayinger glass. Pours brown with amber head and lace. Aroma of roasty malts and ripe bananas. Medium carbonation and significant mouthfeel. Flavors of roasty malts, ripe bananas, cooked raisins, minerals, cereal, slight bitter fruit rind. Overall rich, flavorful, complex but very tasty.
Bottle. Very nice beer but not perfect. Maybe I expected more...and the reality feel a bit short. Nice color, good feel one the tongue and so on. Still not quite a top ten beer for me.

$4.49 bottle, Wine Warehouse. Ive shaken this thing up because I saw sediment at the bottom of the bottle, so Im letting it sit for a bit.

Pours murky brown with a large beige head. Looks like apple cider, non-alcoholic kind that sits in jugs in the fall on grocery store shelves. Smells of apple cider, in a way, or perhaps thats the psychology... Caramels and banana too...

Taste is bittersweet banana, spice, alcohol. Very nice, very smooth.

Bottle 500ml. Served at cellar temperature. Pours a deep, murky copper. Head is beige, large, foamy and mostly lasting. Aroma is dominated by strong notes of cloves and banana bread with bubblegum, caramel, raisins, milk chocolate, coriander seeds (light) and a pinch of cinnamon and ginger powder. Flavour is smooth with a very light bitterness; cloves, dried banana, (sweet) brown bread rolls, brown sugar, dried currants, red grapes, light spices (cinnamon/ginger) and notes of tangy wheat in the finish. Medium bodied with lively carbonation and a decent length finish. Deceptively well hidden ABV!

Bottle
Aroma-floral, honey, peach, nectarin
Appearance-amber, hazy, white foam
Taste-medium sourness, lightly bitter, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Aroma: cloves and peachy, malty, banana.
Appearance: hazy amber color and white head.
Taste: zesty, cloves, banana, peachy, semi-dry, nicely-covered alcohol.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, zesty.
Overall: Great weizenbock, really complex and balanced.

0,5 L bottle, served in weizen glass. Poured murky dark reddish brown with a four finger creamy tan head. Lively carbonation in glass. Nice aromas of overripe banana, roasted malts, caramel, raisins. Taste: Banana, dates, caramel, raisins, figs, candy sugar, banana bread, roasted nuts, plums, chocolate, roasted malts. Very creamy texture. Medium to full body with a very malty sweet finish. A delicious weizen doppelbock!

Tumma, colamainen väri. Todella paksu kermainen vaahto, säilyy pitkään. Haju hiivainen ja banaaninen. Maku makea, banaania ja hiivaa, hieman sahtimainen. Lämmetessään maku ja ennen kaikkea makeus korostuu.
500ml bottle. Hazy reddish brown colour with a thin off white head. Aroma is yeast, banana, fruit cake. Taste is similar, with added caramel. Excellent beer, reminds me a lot of Belgian abbey beers.

Wow. Pretty epic. So much depth, glorious taste. Pretty ultimate, though very strong 8.2%. One bottle and I'm done. Raisins, banana. Black colour. Not your normal wheat beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Doppelbock non filtré, non pasteurisé, de 8,2 % abv et en format 50 cl (merci).
Tap 6 de cette série Schneider, avec mats dorge et de blé.
IGP des bières de Bavière. Mon exemplaire avait été embouteillé le 27 janvier 2016 à 14h22  précision allemande !!
Couleur roux foncé auburn, à la clarté nette.
Bulles fines par centaines, partout, vives.
Mousse beige, très crémeuse, stable à 7 mm. Superbe.
Magnifique nez complexe fruit/bois/malt, avec réglisse et cuberdon.
1ère bouche veloutée à la splendide entame malt/épices/levure, avec un rétro-nez vineux.
Arrière-bouche vineuse, boisée, très distinguée.
2ème sur bois, fruits mûrs, pointe dépices.
Arrière-bouche large, complexe.
3ème de grande allure avec vin, bois, réglisse, accompagnés du malt et dune belle levure.
Arrière-bouche comme du pain complet.
Longueur avec raisins, amandes, fleurs de lotus. En seconde couche, viennent du fût et des fruits mûrs.
Jambes fines, serrées, groupées.
Levure douce, mais boisée et de caractère, très grande ligne.
Alcool à la très belle progression sur la longueur, pour offrir dautres nuances fortes.
Finale aux belles envolées.
CONCLUSION : très grand bière indiscutablement, avec moins de texture quune quad, mais précisément cest un doppelbock  Ceci ne lempêche aucunement de nous proposer des envolées
de saveurs strictement extraordinaires !! Dailleurs, un score affiché de 100/100, avant le mien,
parle par lui-même !!! Les aventinus sont les bienvenus ...

Reddish chestnut colour, cloudy. Big creamy head by low retention. Aroma- plum, prune, raisin/dried fruit, apple, nuts, as well as the familiar wheat beer banana aroma. Taste- chocolate/caramel. Theres a bit of a spicy mouthfeel but creamy as well and malty. Very warm and smooth. Palate is certainly sweet with a bit of fruit tart/sourness. Medium carbonation and full bodies. Creamy warm smooth finish.

Muddy, dark brown pour with some tan lacing. Malty aroma, some banana, roasty, maybe even a bit smoky. Rich taste, a bit sweet in the beginning with a bitter finish. Rich body, smooth, creamy mouthfeel, medium carbonation. Delicious.

Copenhagen 29/7 2016. 50 cl bottle from Meny. A lot going on the label with a founder surrounded by gold medals, the brewery and something that looks like a lump of god hemorrhaging blood. Pours hazy dark reddish brown with white head. Settles as patchy thin layer of foam. Intense aroma of banana, oak barrel and alcohol. Hints of citrus. Strong carbonation and thick creamy palate. Taste is medium sweet followed by light bitterness. A little bit of dark alcohol in the aftertaste - without being boozy. Very nice, balanced and pretty muscular wheat beer.
Pours a deep dark colour, with amber reflections. Creamy capuccino head. Aroma is bananasplit and rum. Taste is banana liquer and candy apple. Reminds me of an old favorite Grimbergen. Really nice!

Bottle at home picked up from Bottledog KingsX. Im sure Ive had this before, but thought id hit this one to try to get through the most rated beers on the site. A mostly clear reddy amber brown coloured pour with a lasting beige frothy head. Aroma is nice dried fruits, fruit cake, banana bread, yeast esters, mineral. Flavour is composed of nutty malts, toffee, spicy dried fruits, woody tannin, fruit cake, banana esters. Some sweet brown breads. Palate is semi sweet, rounded frothy spritzy carbonation. Good stuff.
Good balance . Good taste . Good body. this is a perfect weizenbock of Schneider. But I think It's a little bit more sweet. However overall this beer is very good.

Dark brown to red colour, some carbonation. Aromas of banana, malt, bread, caramel and some licorice. Very smooth taste, rich full body, very strong. Long finish. Excellent beer, certainly one of the best I ever had.
From tap in munich. Pours dark brown. Aroma of banana, raisin, plum and bread. Some light maltiness with a little sweetness. Went very well with the roast pork I was eating.

Dark brown colour with reddish hints, probably not too hazy, some carbonation visible. Big (actually not so much for the style) fluffy white head, surpisingly scarse retention and lacing. Aroma of ripe banana drowned in dough, with some dark fruit hints in the background. Taste follows the aroma with maybe a slight hint of caramel. Overall clearly on the sweet side but not overly so. Leaves a pleasant sweet aftertaste, alcohol is very well hidden. Medium to full body with average crispness, nicely creamy and still quite lively. Not super complex, but well done and highly enjoyable
500ml bottle. Pours a hazy brown with a high tan head. Aroma is bananas, smoky notes, spices. Taste sweet, caramel, spices. Classic, excellent.

Cola-like brown color, medium light tan head. Fruity aroma, dark fruits, toasty malt, bread. Medium body, moderately carbonated, no alcohol. Moderately sweet flavor, malt, raisins, off-dry finish. Quite lovely.
Bottle. Lovely deep ruddy brown colour with a white foam. Lovely fruity pear aromas, sweet and not bitter dark malts, warming booze. Complex, fruity, very soft mouthfeel. Great balance. A classic.

Color café turbio, corona de espuma con burbujas compactas en el fondo y algunas más grandes en la superficie. Aroma dulce con notas a plátano, al paladar se percibe un sabor dulce sutil, con notas a plátano y pasas. Conclusión: siendo justos las cervezas de trigo no son de mi gusto, esta cerveza supero mis expectativas, la verdad muy recomendable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at home. Pours Dark brwon with a small white head. Aroma of yeast, plum, wheat malts and notes of banana and raisins. Quite sweet. Very good.

Kupferfarben mit beiger Blume; deutliche Aromen von reifen Bananen; starker, alkoholreicher Körper, Geschmack nach Banane und Trockenobst; sehr gut aber nicht so überragend, wie 100 RateBeer Punkte signalisieren
Bottle. Over ripe bananas, spice and brown bread. Thick body with a huge head.

0.5 l bottle from Pivoteka, Zagreb. Shared with Vinja 666, lovely Anja and Goran. Thanks Vinja! Bottle wrapped in paper, with a tag on a string. Brewed in 2012. Pours murky reddish brown, lasting creamy off-white head. Smoky barrel and yeast aromas - banana, vanilla. Sweet, yeasty but then sour with a smoky meat, prosciutto finish. Lasting dry finish, very warming, full body. Simply a great beer, very well made.

500 ml bottle out of a fridge. Pours dark amber with thick brownish color. Apricot and other fruit on the nose, Sweet and at the same time spicy taste. Also hints of baked bread. High alcohol but very smooth. Very nice overall.
bottle, hazy amber colour with a tanned head. nose of sweet malts, caramel, sweet toffee, ripe banana, salty licorice, plums, earth thones, cookie dough, slight roast, chocolate, very complex brew.

2008 bottle from andersons. Nose is malt and wheat and dark sugar like. Some plumlike and wheat burst up front and medium body. Lingering flavor and full mouthfeel. Toasted cereal and darker esters coming thru. Really good.
Pours a dark caramel brown with a medium head of tan foam. Nice deep wheat flavor with some light malts. Similar flavor to a Dunkelweizen. Refreshing and tasty.

Remekül fest a pohárban a híres búzabak, vöröses-rezes beütésű teste fölött krémes hab pihen meg hosszasan. Illatai teltek, intenzívek, mazsolásak és tejszínesek, a belga karakterrel rokonszenvezők szívébe már ennél a fázisnál, és már csak emiatt is belophatja magát. Hasonló súlyú kortyok következnek, komplexek, tökéletesen érettek, mélyek és hosszú utóéletűek. A mazsola, tejszín és az élesztős fátyol itt is meghatározónak bizonyul, karamelles és száraz vörösbor-szerű zamatok teljesítik ki a képet. Igen tartalmas ital, ebben a stílusban jobbat nehezen lehetne alkotni.

darkbrown with huge brownish head, heavy banana and fruit aroma, with some spicy phenolic background, some malt, very fruity taste with spicy finish, medium sweetness, some alkohol warmth, quite spicy, creamy mouthfell,

Pours a dark brown color with a good sized foam head that dissipates quickly. Leaves a thin, bubbly head with no lacing. Lots of chunkies at the bottom.

Alcohol comes through strong in the aroma. Fig, grape and cherry come through as well. Lightly roasted malts.

Taste is very similar to the nose. Masterfully executed. Fig, cherry and prune are strong here, with presence of banana in the background. Licorice. Very pleasant dark fruit notes linger heavily on the tongue, pairing very nicely with the moderately high alcohol.

Medium bodied. Doesnt end up with as much bite from the alcohol as the aroma suggested. Very easy drinker for the flavor profile and ABV; quite unique in that sense. I easily downed this, and could go for another.

Truly sensational beer. A must try.
This is very very good dopplebock. Aroma of banana and plums, taste is banana with some rosty finish. The beer is full bodied.

Bottle. Chestnut color, hazy liquid, white head, heavy sedimentation. Smell of banana, yeast. Aroma of alcohol, banana, citrus. Too much alcohol in rather boring beer. Nothing special. Tap 5 is way better.

Aroma: Banana, chocolate, quince, raisins, clove, metal (skin-test confirmed). bit low intensiveness. Appearance: Color is dark brownish, high and dense ecru head. Taste: Delicate, banana, raisins, caramel, bread, clove, some metal, very light herbal biterness, minimal chocolate notes; after warming the whole beer gets intensive - maltiness gets stronger, mostly bready and caramel tastes, also clove gets a bigger role, some minimal licqueur alcoho occurs. Palate: Finish is sweet, carbonation is low, body is medium-high.

Bottle. Shaker. Brown, medium hazy with medium, very light brown head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma is quite intense - bananas, raisins, some dried fruits, hints of nuts. Very nice semi-sweet to sweet taste in the end slighlty bitter. Medium body, oily/creamy texture, soft carbonation finish is sweet and lightly boozy. In general very good and refreshing beer, pretty well balance with all the goods that waizen should have.
Pours a murky reddish brown with a big tan head. Aromas and flavours of clove, banana, dried fruit, some spice, smooth and rich. Lovely.
Hazy brown with a medium white head. Aroma is malty and yeasty. Taste is dark malts, caramel, roast, banana and yeast. Full bodied, boozy and very German, great with meat.

Dark brown beer with a thick beige head. Aroma is lovely, bananas, sweet malts, yeast. Taste is sweet, yeasty. Bananas and dried fruits. Alcohol is present but not overwhelmingly so. Aftertaste is little bitter. This is no question the best weizendoppelbock Ive tasted so far.

Bottle @ Whole Foods. Sorry but this was not my cup of tea. Looks good. Even smells good. But the taste was like an astringent fruity vinegary wine or something. I couldnt even drink all of it. Hard to believe i would say this about a Bavarian Bock but this was Awful stuff! Cannot recommend to anyone.
Bem encorpada. Malte bem presente, assim como o caramelo. Por ser uma doppelbock é bem alcoólica. Ótima cerveja, mas não vale 100 pontos.

0.5L bottle. Looks fantastic in the glass, cloudy dark chocolate brown colour with a huge off-white smooth creamy head with good retention. Aroma of banana, yeast, cloves/spices, dark malt. Taste is wheaty, yeasty, banana and dark fruit, spicy, floral, with a little sharp hop bite in the finish. Lovely smooth mouthfeel, full bodied, average carbonation, alcohol fairly well hidden given the ABV. Fantastic beer, instant favourite.

Dark brown beber, with a beige head, some nice caramel and sweet banana notes are perceived at nose. When is tasted it has a medium body and some nice roast malt flavours are felt, the aftertaste is bitter sweet but really well balanced.

Aroma of burnt Carmel and raisins, has hints of toasty malts.Appearance. Cloudy brown color with a huge white frothy rocky head.Taste has nice alcohol warming with hints of coffee and caramel. Sits very well on the palate with the alcohol warming fading quickly. Overall the best tasting weizenbock I have tried.

Taste: robust caramel malts, thick, bready wheat, some sour notes.
Baked bread nose.
Dark brown and mostly clear with a good size foam head. Full body
Trübes dunkles rotbraun mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, hefig, fruchtig, reife Bananen, dunkle Früchte, Pflaumen. 2012er Flasche.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2016 0,5 l Flasche. Aroma: Hefig, bananig, süßlich. Erscheinung: bräunliches, trübes Bier, cremefarbener, stabiler, für ein Weizen flacher Schaum. Geschmack: Hefig, sehr fruchtig, leicht süßlich, säuerlich. Nachgeschmack: sehr weich, leichte Säure bleibt, dezente Bitterkeit kommt, leicht alkoholisch. Gesamt: hervorragend.
Tastes of caramel. Very sweet. Well balanced. I can see why this scores so highly. Just not my cup of tea.

Aroma of dark malt, raisins, wheat, banana and gingerbread. Pours opaque dark brown liquid with a medium-sized, soapy white head. Medium sweetness of wheat as well as citrus hops and sweet caramel malt, notes of cherry, almonds, liquorice, dark fruits and plums. Full body with a creamy texture and average carbonation, sweet, fruity finish.

Pours a deep amber colour, with reddish reflection to the light. Two fingers creamy head that holds all the while, and a creamy lace all around the glass. Aroma of banana, chocolate, cloves, rainsins, rum. Medium body, palate is dense and thick. Taste of chocolate, bananas, clove, vanilla, rum. If anybody told me its aged in oak, Id believe it. Great.

Mørk, sød og kraftfuld hvedeøl. Tydelige frugtnoter i smagen. 

God til mørkt kød eller søde desserter. Kan anbefales. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Excelente cerveja alema tipo weiss. Otimo paladar com um aroma que identifica uma autentica cerveja alema.

Bottle (from firma bier as Schneider Weisse Tap 6 Unser Aventinus). Pours dark brown with beige head. The head stays. Aroma is sweet, caramel, banana, wheat. Flavor is very sweet, caramel, roast, fruits, banana, some alcohol. Body is nice and full. Finish is sweet, burnt bitterness and warming alcohol. Overall: great brew, sweet and boozy, just as I like it.
I knew this one was going to be good! No bitter...very dark burnt amber color, no lacing. A bit sweet...very tasty!

UPDATED: APR 13, 2016 Brown, dark color, hazy. Average off white head. Excellent lacing. Aroma of wheat, bananas, prunes, caramel, bit of spices (cloves), rum. Medium sweet taste. Medium body, oily to creamy. Sticky. Sweet warm, liquor finish. Short lasting. Bit spicy (cloves). Fantastic beer

Bottle pour into nonic pint glass from Julios Liquors. Aroma is dark fruits with fruity esters of banana and clove. Appearance is lightly hazy orangish red with nice sparkle, finger width fizzy white head with poor retention and no lacing. Taste is moderately sweet banana and clove. Palate is medium to full bodied with creamy texture and lively carbonation (dominates the palate) with clean, dry finish. Overall, nice all around though I wish more of the complexity of the aroma came through in the taste.

Bouteille datant du mois daoût 2015 prise au SAQ Sélection sur Maisonneuve. Couleur rubis foncé. Arômes de blé, familier avec cette brasserie bavaroise. Au goût on ressent le sucre, mais tellement bien balancé. Un produit phare pour la brasserie, mais aussi pour le genre.

Not my first rodeo with the Aventinus. But finally decided to rate it. Deep dark brown with medium tan head. Aroma is wild! I cannot demystify a single note in this jungle of emotions. Taste is well balanced everything. Medium finish, a bit of alcohol warmth though. Overall excellent!
0.5l bottle. Pours hazy dark brown with huge biege head. Aroma of dried fruits, raisins, banana, port wine. Great taste.
50 cl com amigos em Nuremberga. Cor escura com toques de rubi e espuma pequena mas cremosa. Sabor a chcolate, frutos secos.Robusta mas suave.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2016 500ml bottle. Julian code dates it to 205th day of 2014. Pours a tawny dark copper colour. Nose is esters, soft fruit, banana, some spice. Palate is bright banana candy with nice malt backbone. Mouthfeel is very well balanced with a medium body. This is fantastic.

2012 bottle, picked up from Utobeer drunk, 30/3/2016, celebrating Englands magnificent 20-20 result in the cricket against the awesome kiwis! 

Poured into goblet glass. Alcohol gushed despite it being held safely in my cellar for a while. It looks like dark ditchwater. Its really unappealing to look at but that does not bother me at all. 

Aroma is barely, nugget sweets, caramel, fresh bread, prunes, figs and campfire wood. Taste is huge. Epic bready texture, raisins, blackcurrants, gum drop sweets, velvet, smoke, prunes, figs, soft malts, effortlessly drinkable for the style. Just an awesome beer. Just overlook the appearance unless I got a bad bottle??

500ml bottle at Mikes Hot Dogs, Xiamen. Pours hazy dark brown with a white head. Aroma of yeast, banana with some malt. Malty bittersweet finish. Not as good as I remembered from the first time I had it.

Bottle at home. 0,5 L, this will do the trick. Clear dark amber/chestnut brown with white head. Very sweet and thick roasted caramel malts. Bananas, bananacandy, a complex blend of spices and fruits. I taste a hidden light lambic sour, dried prunes, raisins, chestnut, grapes, cinnamon, laurel, licorice, pine resin, honey, maple syrup, alcohol, light layer of dustiness. Over medium sweet and light bitter. Full body, very malty, complex and balanced palate. Full mouthfeel, above average carbonation and long complex sweet, spiced and nutty finish. Very nice beer but this big bottle is gonna be overkill for me alone!
Drank liters of this when on Erasmus in Munich. Now, years later, I found this well aged bottle, and its even better then I remembered. Lovely sweet complexity.
Pours dark plum with a lasting white lacing. Taste is plum, raisin and banana. Very nice beer.
From a bottle. Not my favourite style, well made but a touch too much of a spicy finish from the yeast. Not bad, just not for me.

Dark amber, hazy, fine and lasting mousse.
Medium body, moderately flavored, low-key mouthfeel with low heat and carbonation, short palate.
Moderately bitter, off-dry.
Malty, barley drops taste, discrete ripe banana flavor.
Pleasant but did not live up to the fame.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours with a creamy and quite generous head which slowly recedes. Aromas of plums or prunes, banana, raisins, figs, some red fruits/cherries. Its relatively sweet but not over-sweet and with a nice thick mouthfeel, the alcohol is quite excellently hidden although it does start to come out when it warms a bit, generally a delicious beer that Im happy to have rediscovered (last drank it about 10 years ago!) Definitely one to try :)
Pours dark red to brown color with tan head. Sweetish aroma of roasted malts banana and alcohol. Not fan of this beer sryle but its good one.
Excellent Doppelbock. Sweet and tasty. Fine medium body. You can apreciate the great wheat roasted malts in its delicated aroma. Overall, one of the best doppelbocks out there.

Bought this a couple of times from a local store. Im convinced from other reviews that this is a remarkable brew, and that Im picking up some old and stale bottles, because what Im drinking doesnt compare to the various Unibroue products, which I get fresh.
How : bottle Appearance : dark red/brown, small off-white head. Aroma : caramel, plums, raisins, floral, fresh yeast, banana, hay and spice. Palate : medium to full body, average carbonation.

Keg at Cafe Beermoth, Manchester. Dark amber shade. Lasting off-white head. Lots of fruity notes, big strawberry jam, quite bready, definitely wheaty in the taste. The balance of the taste is very good, being nicely sweet but not cloying. Very well put together.
Brown color with medium thick micro foamed white head. Banana, liquorice, plum, some light roasted malt notes. Taste is medium sweet with light dry aftertaste. Big body, really flavorful beer.

Bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours hazy dark reddish brown. Aromas of toffee, roses, orange, pineapple and violets. On the palate it is acidic yet full-bodied, with some sticky resin flavours. Very nice indeed.

It is pretty much how they describe it - banana, some raisin (but in a good way), some dried plums. It is dopplebock, so it is a bit heavier on the taste, a very good taste :-), but on alcohol as well (dont let it fool you).
Long lasting white head. Medium carbonation, medium sized bubbles. 
Dark yellowish brown color, almost the same like the beer bottle. Many consider it a nice cold day evening beer, but I like it in the beer garden after work as well (perfect for nice warm spring eve or the dying summer).

Along with Yves at his home dark brown colored body with off white head and a spicy yeast malt herby hops aroma a spicy herby fruity sweet caramel malt hops alcholic bitter taste with a alcholic bitter finish

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2017 Pours dark with an amber tinge and a sizable head. The taste is quite something.. strong taste of banana associated with wheat beers. It has the same sweetness and alcoholic hit (straight to the head) that most strong Belgium beers have. The mouth feel is superb, silky smooth when it rolls around your mouth, this is something I love in a beer. Sometimes I think people are more generous with their ratings when beers make them this jolly!
Really interesting beer, it has faint weizen yeast aroma, combined with some stewed and boozy fruit influence. There is a sweet plum finish.

Shared with wim at my home. Light brown colored beer with medium off-white head and no carbonation visible. Herby cooked vegetable aroma. Medium sparkling palate. Finish is sweet fruited slightly hopped.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

(50 cl bottle from local supermarket; BBD: January 30th 2016) Consumed alongside a dry matured beef steak and butterfried borettana onions. Poured at fridge temperature into a Maisel & Friends footed tulip reveals a hazy dark copper body with two finger creamy toffee head that fades somewhat yet leaving beautful lace. Aroma has notes of banana, raisins and bubblegum. Oily texture, medium body, soft carobonation and a lingering sweet finish that has only a lightly boozy touch. Flavour is sweet but never cloying and in a way that is well integrated with the flavour complexity and the ABV in a fashion that resembles some of the big Belgian beers. I cant claim I understood the style before but this one is definitely warming me to it. The beer also seems to work nicely complementarily with the heavy richness of the beef and to elevate the sweetness of the onions with its complexity. Definitely recommended and great value at a discounted supermarket price of 1,50!
Bottle at green sheep. Nose of banana, slight roasted malts. Taste is slight sweetness, dominated by banana and other fruity esthers. Very nice and complex beer.

Pint bottle poured into wheat beer glass. Three finger light tan head lingered for couple of mins. Nose banana, slightly nutty. Taste wheat, banana, nutty slight malt. Very good really like this style!
Absolutely remarkable beer with notes of plum, raisin, caramel, brown sugar, cinnamon, and dried berries.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2016 0.5l bottle from hieber, 1.20; also in schneider kultbox in marktkauf/edeka. pours an opaque brown with a big steady creamy head and a nice lacing. aroma of banana bread, a hint of raisins and dried fruits. flavour of banana cake, dried fruits, nuts, wood, coffee. astringent finish, full body. fizzy carbonation. alcohol is barely noticeable. very complex and interesting.
UPDATED: JUN 13, 2017 Hazy, dark brown. Aroma of malts, caramel, raisins. Very well balanced, malty, banana and clove, chocolate, cherry with quite bitter finish. For a doppelbock, just great.
Классич& и эталонн& в своём роде и виде пиво. Как элитный и качеств& эскорт.

Bottle from BevMo! in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is plums, rum-soaked raisins, spiced fruits, bananas, minor floral notes. Taste is chalky / wheaty with dark fruits and floral flavors...some herbal liqueur / booziness. Not a big fan.

50cl Fresh in Vienna. Pours hazy dark brown with thin brownish head. Aroma of malt, raisins and sweet licorice indeed. Very close to dunkel, but is weizen and indeed super malty as a good bock should be. Tangy and fizzy, with medium body and a creamy finish. A bit dry. No 8.2% is noticeable at all. One bottle is more than enough for a person. A close sibling of Aventinus Eisbock but rather more gentler. A superb brew!

Bottle as a gift from Helsinki. BB 06.11.2016. Pours a very hazy coppery brown with a slightly creamy white head. The head is thick and retains nicely. The nose is wheat, wheat, wheat at first (as its cold), then warmer notes of banana and a bit of spices, bubblegum sweetness. Tastes so rich... not exactly sweet, not bitter at all, not... Well, difficult to say. Its luxurious. Malty, wheaty, with a touch of bananas. A bit of bitterness later on. Smooth in the mouth, carbonation just enough and very thin. Theres a sharpness on the palate (do I dare say plastic?) which makes it just a bit less enjoyable. Otherwise very good.

Aroma: banana, caramel, clove, raisins, floral, bread
Taste: medium sweet, light bitter, caramel, banana, clove, earthy, raisins

Very light smell of dark fruits...wish it had more oomph on smell...taste is plum and banana pretty much exclusively...no bitterness...not really sweet either...dry and low carbonation..light alcohol burn

From. 500 ml bottle into a ? Glass. Pours a purplish brown with a TON of very frothy off white head. Great fruity aroma with banana and cloves. Mouthfeel is luxurious. Taste is wonderful with lots of banana cloves bubblegum dark fruit and dank cheese. Best doppelbock Ive had. The depth of flavor is outstanding . let it watm.up a bit first.
Very dark Ruby/red in color. Tastes and smells of a fruity wheat. A very milky smooth finish

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2016 Update Oct 21 2016:  4 year old bottle. Murky brown pour with a thin beige head with decent retention. Notes of bananas,  dried fruit, sherry, brandy, spices, caramel, bananas. Smooth mouthfeel, medium carbonation and a sticky sweet finish. Delicious.

An excellent weizenbock. Very rich smell: bananas, cherries, vanilla, dark fruit. Taste follows the same notes, bananas, dark fruit, caramel, dried fruit.
Bottle. Hazy dark bronze pour with a egge shell head. Notes of bananas, cloves, spices, wheat, yeast and some sweet malts.

Bottle in Germany. Pours a brown ruby color with a soft tan head. Aroma is a fantastic baked banana bread, cloves and yeast. Taste is heaven on earth. Nothing like it really. Palate is smooth alcohol well hidden. In the top of the German Beer food chain.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours dark cola color with a off white head. Taste sweet, caramel, malt. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

Schönes Dunkelbraun im Glas, wie ein Colaweizen. In der Nase sehr malzig, würzig. Im Trunk sehr gehaltvoll, Bananen, Nelke, im Abgang alkoholisch, aber für 8% trotzdem sehr süffig.

Bottle 50cl / Botella 50cl.
@ Cerveceria Internacional, Sevilla, España.
A: Dark amber / Ambar oscuro.
T/S: Malt, sweet, banana / Malta, dulce, banana.
UPDATED: FEB 17, 2017 Lækker og spændende Weizen Bock. Særdeles frisk og indbydende. Måtte godt være lidt mere bitter.
Medium white to mokka head, dark brown coloured body, fresh fruity yeasty banana sour smell, banana some ice cream yeasty some malts taste, medium to high carbonation, medium bitter

Aroma:

Slight aroma of malts, wheat, banana and plums.

Appearance:

Turbid amber/brown beer with a medium off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Medium/heavy sweet with wheat, malts and banana.
Aroma is banana, spices, clove, bread and alcohol. Taste is moderate sweet, light bitter, spicy and malty flavor, also some harsh alcohol.

Flasche 0,5l: Schwarzbraun, kräftige Trübung, fester feinporiger Schaum; kräftige malzige Süße in der NAse, dunkle Süße, Röstaromen, dunkle Fruchtaromen; kräftige dunkle Süße im Körper, Malzzucker, cremig, Schokolade, nussig
Flaske. Farven er brunlig rød. Skumkronen er høj flødefarvet og fast. Aromaen er sødlig frugt og krydderier. Smagen er kompleks og fyldig: figner, rosiner og malt. Kan stærkt anbefales.

Dark brown, cloudy, tall rocky head, exellent retention. Smells of spicy yeast, roasted malts, banana, dark fruit, candy. Medium body. Oily. Complex flavour of spice, dark fruit, banana, port wine, grassy hops. Excellent balance. Alcohol well hidden. Its a delight. Marvelous
Bottle from Wine Rack at PP. Dark hazy amber pour with frothy dense head. Aroma is so weizen and malty. Taste is same - very very malty, weizen foaminess. Not my thing.

At Chappies. Pours red bronze. With a thin white head. Initial spice coriander with a slight sweetness. Almost a Christmas ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Tap at Watering Hole. Cloudy reddish amber to brown with a soapy off-white head that lingers throughout. Chocolate covered banana, tart lemon, prune, raisin bread and light funkiness with some roastiness all present on the nose. Full-flavored on the palate with a light bodied feel. Slighty warming on the finish but really complex flavors hide the abv very well. Wonderful complex...great fall/winter beer.
Fantastica Weiss. Cremosa, turva, sabor torrado, caramelado, alcool beme scondido. Bem equilibrada.

Pours a dense dark red to brown with a tall khaki head of fine foam that hangs out and leaves a thick wall of lace. Nose involves cinnamon raisin bread, light sulphur, dark fruit and stone fruit notes, and light clove spice. Quite sweet, lightly tart, somewhat bitter. Medium bodied, creamy, softer action, with a long toasty, drying, and spicy hopped finish. An excellent brew that I imagine would really shine paired with a hearty meal as the label suggests.
Good aroma of wheat malt, roasty notes. Beautiful brown appearance, fine white head. Medium sweetness, light-medium bitterness. Full body, creamy texture, average-soft carbonation. Great beer!

Bottle (Schneider Weiss Tap 6 Aventinus). Pours hazy brown-bronze with thick biege head and some lacing. Plum and banana aroma with clove. Some raisin upfront followed quickly by banana bread which increases into a long, pleasant finish. Lighter body than expected with fine carbonation.

500 ml bottle. Light hazy copper brown color with light beige head. Malty and yeasty aroma, caramel, dark dried fruits, banana, spicy. Sweet and light bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Caramel, bread, chocolate, dough, herbs, nuts, leather, earthy, alcohol, skunky, woody, licorice
Nelken, Schokolade, Rosinen, Bananen im Antrunk, anschließend eine Spur Kardamom und Nelke

Very good. Easy to drink wonderful dark beer. Deep brown with a good head and medium carbonation. Full of flavor but not too heavy or sweet. Flavor is malts sticky caramel dried fruits plums licorice and some funky overripe fruit.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 10C). Bottle 50 cl - Batch 1821010715. AROMA: rich and complex with balanced maillard notes (toasted bread crust) and esters (banana and dried plums). no hop aromas. APPEARANCE: dark-brown color and hazy. large tanned head with good retention. TASTE: like aroma with balanced and significative maillard notes (toasted bread crust) and esters (banana and dried plums). low bitterness with a semi-dry and bread crust finish. PALATE: medium-full body with moderate carbonation. slight alcohol warming. OVERALL: an oustanding weizen bock from an outstanding brewery.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2016 Tonaca di frate chiaro con riflessi giallastri, opalescente, schiuma ocra leggero poco persistente.
Aroma di banana classica di lievito da weizen, mela cotta, cannella, banana candita, leggerissima pesca sciroppata, lievissimi sentori di affumicato.
Al palato banana, mela cotta, prugna e note tostate.
Coda leggermente tostata ed erbacea con una elegante nota alcolica e fruttata sempre di banana.
Corpo pieno, non molto carbonata.
Molto buona ma di difficile interpretazione.
corpo medio,gusto fruttato spezie con qualche nota di cioccolatoretrogusto morbido veramente molto potabile
Schokoladenbraun, leichter heller Schaum, süßlich schokoladig in der Nase, cremig im antrunk, voller Körper, schön süßlicher Abgang, angenehme bittere, sehr trinkbar

Embouteillée 25/03/15, bue après plus de 7 mois. Robe ambrée et foncée très claire, filet de mousse et aucune dentelle. Arômes de sucre dorge, banane, caramel, pain doré, baies confites et vanille. En bouche, sucre dorge et banane surtout. Beaucoup de baies également, cassonade, crème brûlé et vanille. Un léger fond citronnée. Texture légère à moyenne et un beau corps mince mais persistant. Excellente

Opaque ruby, purple, and brown hue with a minimally sized white head. Absolutely remarkable aroma with notes of plum, raisin, caramel, brown sugar, cinnamon, and dried berries. Incredibly complex gustation as well featuring biscuit, caramel, plum, raisin, banana, caramel, yeast, brown sugar, and toast with a creamy and lingering finish. Truly amazing.

Čapované v Beer Time Nitra. Tmavšia kalná farba, biela krémová pena, ovocná banánovo slivková aróma. Plná chut, stredná rezkost, krásne pšenicovo ovocné tóny. Paráda!
