amazing beer with amazing taste. eveyone should drink this. one of my favorite beers..
Uit de fles 0,5l. Donkerbruin bier. Aromas van mout, gedroogd fruit en bananenschuimpjes. Dit komt ook in de smaak terug, die is zoet-bitter. Lekkere weizenbock/dunkelbock

The rich aroma of dark fruit, wine and dried fruit tones.
On the palate, a nice fruity acidity, harmonious sweetness of caramel. Delicate bitterness arises in which you can make out even the little notes of dark chocolate.
The bitter aftertaste turns stronger starts playing woody tones, perfectly set off by acidity, flash cherry pits. At the finish finally felt strong enough beer, but no alcoholic is not in sight.

Thick light/medium brown. Minimal coating.

Nutty and extra sweet. Minimal smell of malts, more like alcohol.

Fruity creamy smooth. Very slightly spicy and zesty.

Very tender and rich. Does not feel like a strong beer.

Overall : Absolutely delicious! Very complex and one of my favorite beer ever tasted.

Enjoyable but it did not meet my expectations. Roasted malt was spot and not too sweet. Banana, cloves and dried fruit are barely there. Perhaps the bottle was on the shelf for a while but not as good as I remembered.

Dunkel, hefetrüb, mittelporiger Schaum
Vollmundig kräftig
8,2% sind gut verborgen.

Bottle 50cl. Deep brown, nearly black. Tiny off white head. Aroma of malts reminds me also of wood. Taste is rather flat, almost no development. Mild bock taste, with a weizen touch.
Full of dark fruit like a constipated geriatric. Raisins, currants, prunes. Fantastic balance with a nice thick mouthfeel. A definite departure from your typical Schneider.
A house typical wheat bear with malty and wheat character combined. The doppelbock is present with a nice warmth. Simply a "nice weiss beer".

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2016 Dark hazy brown color, big foamy head. Amazing rich aroma of bananas, cloves, malts,liquorice and a little bit smoke. Taste goes the same way with smooth and smokey finish. Amazing, just amazing beer! One of my favourites

Price/performance = excellent! Very sweetish, fruits - plums. Caramels, very malty. Very rich and good balanced. Totally on my drink list.
Quite too much easy drinkable for ABV 8.2.

Light white thin head with a dark brown body. Aroma is sweet with sugar and banana. Taste matches aroma perfectly.

Brun öl med mörk beige krona. Doft och smak: mörk frukt, sötma, karamell, malt, vete, alkohol. Bra öl men den blir nästan för mäktig för mig. Hade önskat att den bet till lite på slutet för att kapa det söta/mäktiga. Men jag förstår att det snarare är vad jag gillar än ölen i sig som är bra!

Oct. 15-2015- 0,5 l bottled 24.11.2014 fine bavarian craftwork - it took 35 years for me to rate it :-)
Although not my favorite, I recognize that this beer is very good, a pleasure to find a German beer so well done. But I find it too big. I with 33cl would be enough.

Brown / copper color, cloudy liquid and huge head.
Aroma of caramel, bread and banana.
Taste is sweet, a bit bitter and strong alcohol.
Excellent Weizen bock... love it!

0,33l vom Fass im Bräuhaus. Ein Duft nach Rosinen, Dörrobst und Hefe. Dunkle, naturtrübe Kastanienfarbe mit wenig Schaum. Im Antrunk zuerst die Hefe, dann Malz und Dörrobst. Dickflüssig im Mund. Abgang süßlich. Extrem runder Bock. Die absolute Topbewertung verpasst es nur wegen des zu schwachen Dufts.
Dark amber colored with a brown and thick head. Aromas of caramel, matured frouits and malt. Perfect balanced and the high amount of alcohol is well implemented.

Bottle from Meny (Amager), Copenhagen - brown pour with big beige head. Aroma and taste is sweet and light roasty malty and wheaty, with some caramel and toffee notes, some dark fruit hits, yeasty, with some nice spices, drinks well. Good stuff.
Высокая шапка плотной пены, сам напиток рубинов& Солодов& вкус нефильт& пива, чувству& пшеница, нотки карамел& Сладков& послевк& Честно говоря, ожидал большег& от столь разрекл& сорта.

Farbe richtig dunkel, dunkelbraun.
Schaum gut.
Nase: kaum, ein bisschen dunkle, röstig würzige weizenmischung.
Geschmack: kräftig, kantig für ein weissbier. Vor allem im Abgang toll: richtig volle Ladung weizenmalz, anderersrits für 8.2% noch recht bekömmlich und runder Gechmack. Wenns glas leerer wird kommt noch eine kellernote mir rein, sonst eeher so karamell und Holz.butterscotch, banana, 
Sehr lecker.

Ambra scuro, con bella schiuma beige chiaro. Splendido aroma di caramello, malto, dark fruits. Sapore super, perfetto bilanciamento tra la weizen con la banana e la dolcezza e corpo di una bock. Molto beverina e corpo leggero nonostante lalcol. Frizzante il giusto. Perfetta.
A far too easy to drink Doppelbock! Nice roasty and fruity aromas, perfectly balanced. Deep black with a nice head. Rather Sweet.

500ml bottle pours dark, opaque in glass, violet red brown with light edge and two finger creamy head. Nose is corn flakes, raisin, dark fruit, bread, plum. Mouthfeel is super soft, creamy, delicate, perfect. Taste is a continuation of the nose, toasted corn flakes, dark bready grain, dark plum and grape, banana. So rich and full, complex but inviting. Finishes with a touch of sweetness, dark bready caramel and grape, banana corn flake, raisin, creamy, low bitterness, a hint of warming alcohol. Phenomenal.

Dark, cloudy appearance with ample foam. Aroma is of cereal malt, chocolate, citrus. Flavor is very malty, a little sweet, sour, alcohol, and a little bitterness. It taste a lot like a dopplebock but has some wheat beer flavor in there too.

500ml bottle bought at Berliner German Bar & Restaurant in Langham Place, Mongkok.
Looks: Translucent dark mahogany colour with a thick layer of dark brown yeast sediments; Two finger head with crumpety off-white foam which lasted for 2 minutes; Small sticky lacing and quite active carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragment malt, with strong wheat and tartness, banana, vanilla, alcohol, strong caramel, toffee, sugar, cloves, strong spices, strong yeast, light lemon and grass.

Taste: Medium to strong sweet dark malt, with moderate roastyness, nuts, fairly strong wheaty tartness, strong plums, raisins, banana, strong caramel, fairly strong alcohol, very strong molasses, strong wood, light earth, cloves, strong spices, strong yeast, lemon, medium bitter hops and grass. What a bliss!

Body: Mid to light body. Thin but slick palate.

Mouth Feel: Complexity ahoy! The dark malty body stands up well in the presence of equally strong wheatyness. Very good roasty nutty woody characters. Boozy plums and dark fruits upstage the banana. Strong caramel and right-on strong sweetness. Spicy clove-y with fairly strong lemony hops to round. Way to go!

Hoppiness: Wood, strong spices, light lemon and grass in nose, and much stronger in taste. Bitterness is fairly notable for an abrupt, moderate astringent sweet finish.

After Taste: Fairly dry. Roasty, fruity and slightly boozy to mouth.

Comments: This is a very well-made and complex Weizenbock - malt and wheat are well presented, fruity esters are impressive, booze is strong but undisturbing, and woody, spicy lemony hops in abundance. This is the yardstick of the style, and I am in for a treat!

Не очень большая кремова& пена, тело темно-ян цвета.
Оm яркий аромат жареног& банана (ассоци с тайским& роти с бананам& довольн& много жареных оттенко& Присутс& легкие карамел& тона. Легкая сладост& и очень легкая горечь на фоне, довольн& сбаланс& Очень-оч неплохо.

Bottle. Aroma bananas, a hint of smoke, burnt sugar, caramel, toasted. Hints of roast. Rich malty aroma. Clear deep brown colour, relatively stable head. Taste is suprisingly well balanced. Rather soft mouthfeel, alcohol mostly hidden and manifests only in slightly warming aftertaste. Bitterness in the background, rich malty flavours in the foreground. Banana, lightly spicy, light roasted, toasted, caramel, burnt sugar. Excellent.

Ill bet few reviewers remember Hacker-Pschorr Hefe Weisse beer - the way it USED to taste, before Paulaner bought up the brewery and completely ruined the beer. That old HP Weisse was my favorite beer and Ive missed it terribly. But now, along comes Schneiders Aventinus (or, at least, Ive just discovered it), with a taste more closely resembling the late, great Hacker-Pschorr than any other beer Ive ever tasted. Absolutely remarkable. A complex, malty brew with a unique flavor not found anywhere else. To me, the epitome of German brewing craftsmanship. Heres hoping Schneider never sells out!
Оценки говорят сами за себя. Это пиво лучшее и в своём стиле и вообще.

Pours in fuzzy brown color with large off white head, mostly disappearing, hazy liquid. Aroma of fresh apple juice, hops melted chocolate. Fresh taste, medium sweet, light bitter, light alcohol notes. Medium body, thick texture, average carbonization
Kompot z suszu, bardzo gesty kompot. Nie moja bajka ale warto spróbowac ........
500ml Flasche. Dunkelbraun und trüb mit Hefestücken. Kleine Schaumkrone. Karamellaroma. Sehr malzig. Leicht süss.

It pours amber with a thick, creamy looking white head. It has aromas of bananas, plums, and roasted aromas. It has flavors of liquorice, roasted malts, dark fruits, and alcohol. It is smooth with alcohol warming on the way down.
On tap. Deep amber color with white head. Aroma - Malts, dried fruit, caramel. Taste - Sweet, caramel, bread, fruit, wheat.
I didnt write much for some reason. Aroma: Malt, light sweetness, wheat. The flavor is similar. Its sweeter than other wheat beers but highly balanced. Nice.

500ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy, dark brown, creamy large off-white head, leaving only some lacing on the glass. Sweet aroma, raisins, banana, plum. Smooth mouthfeel, medium carbonated and full body. Taste starts sweet with caramel and banana, brown sugar, dried dark fruit, cloves. Finish with sweet alcohol warming.

0,5 Flasche aus einem lokalen Getränkemarkt. Dunkles karamellbraunes Getränk mit wenig Kohlensäure und kaum Schaum. Riecht nach Hefe, reifen Beeren, Röstaromen, leicht metalisch. Sehr ölig im Mund entfalten sich als erstes Aromen reifer Beeren, Schokolade, Weizen, dann wird es leicht bitter-hopfig.

A classic "oh & I will take that too" purchase brings home this classic German beer. Pour in the glass & fire up rate beer & holy smokes this is a 100/100 score beer. Click the friends tab & check validity & see pootzboy loves this (I value his beer scholarship & Zappa fan boyness) & even fellow hophead Hippyhop (still dont know if hes a hippy or a hiphop aficionado) tips his hat at this. Its a fantastic beer, all yeast & wheat & banana & clove & Germanic precision balance & epic beer history goodness. Give a sip to Ms Tiki who is smoking a cigar (the 1st of 2 it turns out) -- this is a significant development as she announced today after 6 glasses of rosé wine that she will no longer breastfeed our little one year old baby & is celebrating the liberation of her body -- says its a tasty treat (& she hates beer the way Stephen Harper hates democracy) & shes right: this is a treat.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2015 WYGLĄD: Barwa bursztynowa, zmętnione. Piana drobna, wysoka, długa. Pięknie oblepia szkło.
AROMAT: Intensywny. Spora dawka przypalonego karmelu połączona z bananami, goździkami oraz guma balonową.
SMAK: Analogicznie do zapachu. Paradoksalnie bardzo dobrze pijalne i orzeźwiające.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2016 Not a big fan of Bockbier, but Schneider Weisse never lets me down. 
Matly beer with lots of banana, dark stone fruits and wheat. Not a strong hop aroma, but its also not lacking hops. 
The mouthfeel is just brilliant.
Great beer.
UPDATED: JUN 20, 2017 one of the best weissbier in the planet. strong, dark fruity, balanced and silky. it has real quality.
Absolutely delicious! Pours a beautiful dark with a lot of frothy head. Slightly sweet and a malty finish.

This is my new favorite. I usually buy St. Bernadus 12 for my standard beer, but this Aventius is my new go-to. $4 for a 500 ml bottle cant be beat. This taste is just outstanding and smooth. Creamy mouthfeel, mild banana, some sort of spices, not cinnamon or anything too strong but it tasted like a snickerdoodle cookie or something. I was happy that the banana was actually not that overpowering and seemed to be kept in check by something slightly vinous. I could drink these all night on the one hand and yet on the other hand I could also drink one and study its complexity for hours. This beer is both challenging and easy to drink if that is even possible. This beer is clutch. A dopplebock masterpiece.

Pours murky dark brown with a red tone. Head is light brown and goes down fairly quick. Nose is bubble gum, toasted malts, sweet toffee, bread, dark fruits. Really nice! Flavour is lots of sweet malts, fruity yeast, banana, wheat, bit of clove, tiny heat from the alcohol towards the end. Great full mouthfeel, with a long lingering after taste. A perfect sipper!

When poured into glass it produces a cloudy, not very long lasting head. Hazy amber coloured beer which serves aromas of banana, caramel, bubblegum, bread, doughy yeast, alcohol, intense toffee, floral hops, dark fruits, cream liqueur. Flavours of yeast, wheat, sweet malt, fruits, spices and warming alcohol. Creamy texture, full body, more than average carbonation, but not unpleasant. Finish is, as per description, similar to those from good schnaps. Overall very good! In my opinion just too good for drinking, sniffing is the way to go.

Turva,coloração marrom acobreada,espuma inicial volumosa mas que não se mantem;aroma frutado(banana),condimentado(cravo) torrado,caramelo,chocolate igualmente notados;sabor adocicado,frutado lembrando uva e banana passa com leve amargor no final,álcool presente mas bem inserido,corpo médio,boa carbonatação,retrogosto adocicado. Embora seja uma boa cerveja e bem inserida dentro do estilo,ela me decepcionou,principalmente pelo "corpo",um pouco abaixo para uma Weizenbock e pelo "excesso" de dulçor no sabor o que prejudicou o conjunto.

Bottle. Pours murky amber brown with light brown head. Aroma is sweet, malty, yeast, bubblegum, caramel, candied sugar. Slight toast. Taste is sweet, wheat, candy, yeast, sweet peach, toasty marks, smooth body. Well hidden alcohol. Slight bitter finish. Some candied sugar.

Først : jeg er ikke glad for hvede øl.
Men denne her er god!
Den har karakter af en dobblet bock, men den er god sød i det.

Cloudy, brown with reddish hue, moderate beige creamy head. Aroma is of spices, cloves, sweet banana bread, bit of alcohol, some toffee. Taste is moderate sweet wheat, toffee-caramel, banana bread, more cloves and spices, hint of alcohol with some warmth. Medium to full bodied, moderate carbonation, creamy.

Bottle. Dark ruby-copper, transparent and sparkling with good whitish foam. Aroma: strong fruit and berry esters, strawberries, red grapes, wheat malt, port wine. Taste: warming, red port wine with fruit and berries, with a little brandy, strawberries, wheat, raisins, dried apricots, peach, caramel. Great!

Murky like the Yarra. No discernible aroma apart from a slight aniseed. Wine like with a touch of whiskey and sherry. Legitimate flavourgasm. Lightly carbed, the alcohol escapes detection like the Fucking ninja on that tenchu game on ps1 that I smashed in year 8.

It was a superlative experience. From the beggining expecting nothing. Very cheap beer in a 500ml bottle. Didnt look anything special. After pouring it. Everything changed. The smell its superb, one I felt very attracted and spend a lot of time on it. For me it was like smelling a yeasty pancake of banana plus cream and peach marmalade. It looks like scotch royalty. A very deep caramel color, perfect foam, symmetric, good consistency. Superb taste! It does not feel like wheat, it made me feel happy. I had a Ratatouille-Ego flashback while drinking this beer. Everything is going to be ok with a beer like this. Humanity may still exist to benerate this beer for generations. Long live the Schneider Brewery, an experience that every human being may have.

500 ml bottle. Very dark amber color with creamy white head. Fantastic smell! Cream, yeast, wheat and caramelized malts, also banana. For resuming this beer, guys, now i feel like a grandfather of the countryside germany that has seen all his family grow and is going to die in peace soon. What a beer! The palate is just perfect, I cannot describe how good this is, makes me feel in peace and good with myself. A beer to makes you believe in humankind and in greatness.

0,5 bottle. Pours murky brown color with medium off-white, mostly diminishing head. Lively carbonation, medium body, hazy liquid. Aroma of bananas, vanilla, clove. Flavor is medium sweat, light bitter, spicy and alcoholic. Finish is medium long and astringent.

0,5 l bottle. Real brown and unclear in the glass, smaller head. Clove and yeast on the nose, not a lot. Taste starts with way more volume. Dark wheaty, yeast, banana, dry. Fruity with an alcoholic bitterness. Later some vanilla hints. A good one but not straight to the roof top.
Wheat texture. Sweet and spicy. Bock taste. Slight fruit background perhaps dates or raisins. Paired well with banh-mi style chicken sandwich.

Cerveja de cor castanho claro, meio acobreada e turva. Aroma com forte presença de caramelo/toffe e alcool muito forte. Alto acidez no sabor e médio amargor. Cerveja de textura muito adstringente e aquecimento alto, devido aos seus 8,2% de graduação alcoolica.
Clásico. Rico aroma tostado, espaciado... Sabor complejo, lleno de matices, pasas, frutas, especias, chocolate.. Absolutamente suave en la boca. Esconde perfectamente el alochol
Had a sample at World of Beer Fest in Milwaukee. Pours dark reddish brown with small head. Taste is very sweet, but is not annoyingly sweet. Perfect dessert beer.
bottle to glass. malty not much hop presence. found this enjoyable but not my favorite.
UPDATED: JUL 5, 2015 2008 version. Dark brown with lose foam. Fine carbonation and much alcohol. Dates, raisins, caramel, biscuit, plum, dried fruit coupled with yeast aromas - banana and cloves.
Dark cloudy amber in color with high off-white head. Aroma of malt,yeast and banana. Taste is strong sweet with thick texture. You can taste alcohol, but its not too much. Very nice beer.

Bottle to weizen glass
Wheat, bread, lemon, banana. Caramel coloured with a frothy off white head. Lots of effervescence and little lacing. Taste is sweet grape and yeast.

Trigo refermentada en botella. Marrón oscura. Espuma muy abundante (4-5 dedos) . Una efervescencia bestial recién servida. Rico aroma tostado, espaciado... Sabor complejo, lleno de matices, pasas, frutas, especias, chocolate.. Absolutamente suave en la boca. Esconde perfectamente los 8 grados... hasta que acabas con ella. Muy muy bebible. Estupenda.
Deep amber. Beige head, not persistent. Fairly intense and persistent at nose. Chestnut honey, caramel raisin, chocolate, sherry, banana, alcohol. Medium body. Average carbonation
Bruin troebel bier met schuim, Tap 6 volgens etiket. Smaak is complex, licht zoet en licht bitter, caramel, fruitig, bier met "body", absoluut een van de beste Weizen ooit gedronken.

Pours a murky red-brown with a huge, foamy off-white head. Nose is dried fruits and a cider-like spunk. Taste is slightly sweet. Caramel comes through while sipping. Medium body. Lively carbonation. Very nice!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Brasserie V in Madison. Very easy smooth drinking beer. Brown caramel body with a slight malty aroma. Sweet caramel taste.

12.9 oz. bottle vertically poured to a logoed, proprietary glass at Lunar Brewing Co., producing a thick & frothy, light tan layer that lasted persistently on top of the cloudy, amber highlighted, brown colored liquid, leaving ribbons & patches of clingy lacing. The nose was tart & juicy, kind of prune juice-like, with additional esters as pit fruit skin, and spice as subtle clove. Medium bodied, with only average carbonation, partly due to the pour, and some creaminess to the mouthfeel, the taste was more as a blend of dried fruit and some dark varieties, with complementary alcohol included. Probably a bit of age on this bottle, although I didnt receive Chucks discount, but still damn smooth and tasty as the benchmark for the style.
500ml bottle. Hazy brown body with a brief medium head. Yeast, clove, banana, some ripe fruit and chocolate.
On tap at The International. Pours reddish dark brown. Wintery warm nose. Strong taste, spices, but only a little bit of Weizen left. Enough to notice, still. A must-try indeed.
Bottle. Hazy brown colour with off white head. Bread, wheat, yeast and banana aroma. Sweet, bread, banana, fruity, yeast, wheat taste. Medium body.

8.2% ABV. Weizenbock.

Pours out with a fine thick head. Deep caramel coloring. Nice thick malty nose. First mouth feel is smooth and mellow. Not much in the way of hops with the nice warm and mellow embrace of toasted barley and malt dominating the entire experience. Its like falling into the arms of an old lover, its comfortable, sensual and oh so pleasurable to be home.

The 8.2 % ABV guarantees that warm "just loved" feel. Very nice indeed.

Food pairing ideas: charcoal grilled chicken wings, steamed sea bass with ginger.

S:
-banana,caramel,toffee,chocolate,vanilla
T:
 the nose
F:
-slight alcohol-warming
-full body
O:
Absolute classic
Ottima weisse originale, particolarmente corposa. Bevuta al Weisses Bräuhaus, un tizio tedesco mi spiegò "una va bene, due siamo al limite, tre troppe".

Excellente (bien que je préfère la dunkel de Weihenstephan...).
Au nez, un arôme de banane prend tout de suite au nez et sévapore de suite une fois servie et un peu réposée.
Ce même arôme peut choquer de prime abord en bouche dautant plus quelle paraît sucrée. La laisser reposer léquilibre, gomme la banane (qui aurait été écoeurante). Le tout passe finalement bien avec une fin de bouche légèrement épicée.

50cl bottle shared. Pours murky brownish amber with a creamy off white head. Aroma is wheat, yeast, some fruits, banana. Taste is similar with a light final acidity, almost no bitterness. Medium body, smooth mouthfeel, medium carbonation. Excellent.

500ml bottle from Summerhill LCBO. 8.2% Alc./Vol. Pours a hazy ruby brown colour with one finger of lasting white head. Aroma of cherries, yeast. Taste is so complex that its hard to identify each flavour. Cherries and bananas are present for sure along with some plum notes. Finishes a bit spicy.

Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. A very dark brown hazy coloured beer with a spicy plum, marzipan and chocolate flavours followed by burnt currants, sherry and liquorice notes on the warming finish. Superb!

500ml bottle @ Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. Pours hazy muddy brown with orange hints. Gorgeous overripe banana aroma. Will never get tired of that. Creamy textures with luscious banana & vanilla yeast esters. One of the greats.
Way solid beer....really good stuff...great berry and wheat flavor...smooth and enjoyable....(#480)

Pours a very murky dull green-brown with an immediately vanishing head. A smoky character on the nose with date and tartness. Moderately thick. Drinks like a quad with a faint tartness and some earthy notes at the finish.

Butelka 0,5 l. Barwa bursztynowa ciemna, lekko metna. Piana wspaniale puszysta, jednolita, stabilna. Zapach lekko owocowy, drozdzowy. Poczatek bananowy z dodatkiem gozdziköw. Wyrazny ciemny owoc sliwka. Roslinka, trawiasty smaczek na koncöwce goryczka chmielowa.  Pomimo wysokiej zawartosci alkohol nie mocno dominujäcy. Fantastyczny podwöjny pszeniczny kozlak nie tylko na zimowe wieczory przy kominku ;-)
50cl @ bottle. Scura di stile tedesco. Bottiglia troppo frizzantina ma comunque piacevolissima.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2015 Bottle: Swampy brown pour; tons of haze with a puffy, off-white, well retaining head. Aroma of bubblegum, spicy yeast, clove, banana, apple skins, mild prune, soft wheat, modest phenols, black cherry, dry wheat, toasted caramel, a hint of cardamom & cocoa dust. Pretty complex. First sip coats the palate with a blanket of toasted wheat. Lots of bubblegum, banana, & clove from the yeast esters alongside a moderate alcoholic warmth. Notes of overripe dark fruits, corianders, orange, prune, white pepper, dates, & slightly stale toffee towards the finish. Maybe just a touch over-carbonated. Lofty mouth feel. Overall, nice stuff, though I probably prefer Weihenstephs Vitus.

Dark brown color with small head. Aroma has malt, chocolate and ripe fruits. Taste is malty sweet with a long nice only a little bitter finish. Flavors of ripe fruits, plums, caramel, malt banana and some spices. Very tasty.
Bottiglia. La bevevo spesso qualche anno fa in un pub fornito di birre di buona qualità. Gusto molto complesso ma grddevole

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2015 I must say this beer is actually two beers; so Ill write two tastings: In the first one we have a fresh one, brewed the same year it is being sipped. The tasting notes would be like this: "Pours hazy brown, tan head. Intense aroma of banana. Thats all. Fizzy, sweetish, full-bodied. No bitterness. Long finish." So, a nice beer indeed, but rather monotonous. Now, for the second tasting, were having a beer brewed three years prior to the moment of drinking (in this particular case brewed in 2012). It would yield something similar to this: " Pours dark cherry red with tan head. Aroma is complex and vinous: lots of blackcurrant, blackberry, bilberry and cherry, along smoky and liquor scents. In the mouth it feels soft, dense, mouth-covering. Good sour notes and restrained bitterness. Great." Now its up to you to decide wether to drink it young or aged. In my particular case it has gone from 3.6 up to perfection, so the choice is clear.

Dunkelbraun und trüb mit beständigem Schaum. Geruch hefig bananig und beerig. Geschmack malzig süß und würzig: Nelken, Schokolade, Zimt, Pflaume. 
Tolles Winterbier.

Just a stunning beer. Dark chestnut hue. Aromas that are off the charts gorgeous with baking spices, bread, perhaps even some dried fruit. The breadth and depth of flavors is amazing: strong and concentrated, this is a brew worth contemplating but it maintains great balance, never veering off into booziness or fatiguing the palate. If theres a beer I like more than this--anywhere--I cant think of what it is. Not for those who demand overwhelming hop presence. In my book this beer is a classic.

500ml bottle from the state store 
Pours clear dark mahogany with a medium sized off-white head, some lacing. Aroma of toasted malts, chocolate, dark fruit. Taste of sweet caramel, dark fruit, wheat with a spicy finish 
Good

From 500 ml bottle. Pours a clear but dark copper-bronze with a frothy cream coloured head. Aromas of raisins, currants, dates, stewed apple, banana and cinnamon. Taste starts out with cooked apple and pear before rich dark fruit and spice comes through. Ripe banana, more spice and a slight alcohol warmth. Medium bodied with a long finish and a warm spicy aftertaste. Excellent.

Bottle. Dark ruby in colour, great white head. In aroma really lots of clove, then citrus, some banana, yeasts. In taste dried fruit, bananas, malt, some citrusy. Full bodied, meidum bitter finish, alcohol gives warming. Very well done weizenbock, one of the best.
Es una cerveza que está muy buena. Tienen un aroma a plátano y comino muy bueno. Muy recomendable.

Super Grand stooormrik huve! SkumBanan doftlighet, jäst, malt & estrar. Helig skumbanans smak, kittlar i gommen, estrar & krumelurer. Mörka makter & mörk malt. Kolsyrig. Vetebullar!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The Everest of Weissbier! One of the most aromatic beers in the World, as The Beer Hunter MJ said. 

Bottle & Tap in its own glass. Dark ruby blurred color. The foam is huge and persistent.

Smell: Clove, banana, yeast, little bit alcohol, and dark fruits such as plum and raisin. 

Aroma: Bananai plum, and raisin. It warms your mouth while you are drinking it. Very well balanced and highly bodied. Smooth finish in the palate with hints of dark fruits and ripe banana. 

Must try!
Got this as 2008 vintage. Beer is complex with notes of plum, cherry and spices. Sherry like glass.
Expertly balanced beverage with a mild sweetness that never goes overboard. Pleasant creamy mouthfeel yet carbonated enough to feel fresh. Quite pleasant.

Botella 50 cl. Color castaña apagado, espuma beige poco persistente. Aromas a plátano maduró, ciruelas, compota de frutas, maltas tostadas y levadura, cola. Cuerpo cremoso un poco pegajosa carbo media baja, de burbuja gorda. Frutal y dulce con final mas seco donde la levadura domina.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2015 500cc bottle. Dark ruby with thick everlasting tanned head. Taste is bit yeast, banana and lots of caramel. Some wheat, dark fruits, raisin, carob and some nuits also. Everything very well balanced and with a nice alcohol warmth. Lovely carbonated. Just outstanding.
500ml bottle courtesy of McTapps. Black brown pour with creamy off white head. Bananas, dark fruits, zing and creamy on the palate. Easy drinking, best wheat beer Ive tried.
Butterscotch in colour, butterscotch in taste. Very good beer, fizzy. Dark purple brown is very special colour, very natural look. So much taste in weiss! Powerful in alcohol, powerful in everything.

Bottle from January 10th 2014. Wheat, yeasty, fruity aromas. Hints of pear. Banana. Copper brown. Thick off white head that stays forever. Dried fruit and banana bread in the taste. Some warming alcohol sensation. Great.

Hazy dark copper pour with small off white head. Aroma of malts, butterscotch, yeast, fruits, wheat and bread dough. Taste of wheat, caramel malts, banana, cloves, yeast, bready and faint fruits. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel, slight orange peel on the finish. Perfectly balanced, awesome beer!
50cl bottle. Pours brown colour with big brownish head. Aroma of raisins. Very strong taste. Low bitterness. Full bodied and well balanced. Very nice aftertaste.

A: Malte torrefeito, um pouco de whisky, woody, butterscotch
A: brown, cloudy, frothy, brown foam, beautiful
T: heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, alcoholic
P: full body, creamy, fizzy, astringent, long finish, 
O: Really good beer!!! One of the favorites!

Bottle. Dark brown, almost ruby hue with big but fast disapearing cream colored head. Lots of cloves, brown sugar, brown bread, Indian spices, massala, honey. Medium sweet with hint of tart fruits and light sicy bitter finish. Medium to full bodied with lovely creamy feel, light alcohol presence and carbonation a bit on the high side. Very nice.
Pours dark brown, medium off-white head. Aroma of caramel, dark malts and fruit, licorice. Medium-high sweet taste. Medium-light body, thin texture, sweet but not too sweet finish. Very good overall.
Wow this beer was good. It was like drinking liquid candy. I would get this again but the ABV was so high!

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2017 Several times& several batches: pours dark purple brown colour, hazy, with long lasting creamy head. Aroma: weizen yeasts, crisp, bread like, toffee & caramel like malt profile, esters which takes on banana, dark fruits, plums, prunes. Flavour follows aroma: Nice sweet malty mouth fell lingering through finish. Overall: Very good beer, representative example of this style.

Tapped at Asbury Festhaul and Biergarten. Excellent alcohol retention but never gave the slightest hint of foul filmy resin. Caramel sweetness only enhanced the malt and fruit. Many facets to this baby. Good stuff.

Big, eatery nose; banana, lemon, clove. Taste starts with tart lemon and a mild bock yeast characteristic sourness, balancing a nice malt backbone. Moves to dark fruits and raisin speaking up, then moving to a blast of esters, yet finishing quite dry. A great example of the style, and quite drinkable for the abv.

500 ml, bottled 06.09.13
Dark brown, hazy body, with a medium, creamy, beige head.
Wonderful, deep, unique aroma of ripe banana and various other ripe fruits, marzipan, nuts, some vanilla, wheat, some spices, some booze.
Taste follows this, with some more roast and sligh hops, maybe not fully on par with the nose, but very smooth and warm.
Full, creamy, velvety mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes alcohol warming, astringent, roasty, a bit bitter and smooth, sweet malty.

Delicious! A Weizenbock like no other, accomplished and perfectly balanced. Especially the nose is amazing, a beer you cant stop smelling! Overall still not my favourite brew from Schneider Weisse, but another fantastic, unique wheat beer by one of my favourite European breweries.

Uitgeschonken in 0,5 liter Weihenstephan bierglas. Donkere bruine koperkleur, iets mistig met licht beige schuimkraag die hoog is maar wel snel weer verdwijnt. Geur van rozijnen, cacao en  winterspecerijen. Volle en krachtige smaak, met tonen van gebrande mout, koffie, cacao en specerijen als kruidnagel, nootmuskaat en zwarte peper. De afdronk is medium lang en kruidig met verwarmende alcoholische accenten en peperige afdronk. De alcohol is wel enigszins aanwezig, krachtiger dan gebruikelijk bij Duitse bieren, ook begrijpelijk met een percentage van 8,2%. Deze Schneider Weisse Aventinus is het beste Duitse bier tot nu toe wat ik heb geproefd met mooie, kruidige en complexe smaken met een mooie balans in zoetheid en bitterheid tezamen met een fraaie complexiteit in het smaakpallet.

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2016 Lalcool, le bois et les raisons secs dominent le nez. Il y a un peu de banane, des figues et des prunes bien mûres en bouche. Excellente, et sans défaut je dois bien lavouer. 8/4/8/4/16=4.0

10-08-2016: Je déguste à linstant une bouteille à température de cellier datée du 12-08-2016. Les épices se font plus présentes au nez et le parfum de banane sest estompé. En bouche, il y a un petit côté "fruit rouge" me rappelant le Porto. Cest toujours aussi bon et il y a une belle chaleur dalcool agrémentée de poivre à la toute fin!

Barwa ciemno brązowa (herbaciana), piany mało i szybko opada. Aromat przjyemny, złożony i intensywny, mamy przejrzałe banany, rodzynki, śliwki suszone i lekki aromat rumu. Aromat pokrywa się ze smakiem, słodycz obecna ale nie za duża, lekka kwaskowatość i niska goryczka, wszystko to razem bardzo dobrze gra i powoduje ze piwo mimo swojego kalibru jest dosyć pijalne i nie jest aż tak ciężkie. Wysycenie średnie - ale nie przeszkadza, dość treściwe. Kolejne piwo z Schneider Weise które dla mnie jest genialne.

Bottle. Brown body with fast disappearing tan head. Aroma is malts with banana with ripe fruits and hints caramel malts. Taste is sweet malts with some fruits. Aftertaste is sweet malts with some bitterness and hints of malts. Nice one.

From a 500ml bottle on 27/3/2015 (bottle labelled Tap 6). Pours a cloudy reddy brown with a small to medium head. Has a powerful aroma of ripe banana, with some dark fruit also in the mix.In the mouth, its sweet and inviting, with banana, plums, and some caramel set off against some pronounced wheaty, spicy notes. There is just a hint of bitterness to counter the dessert like elements. The palate is silky and a touch creamy, with the carbonation average to lively. This is an absolutely delicious, complex yet subtle brew, and definitely the finest German beer Ive downed to date.

Poured from a 500 ml bottle into a pint glass. 
Aroma- Pure heaven, great smell of yeast, caramel, honey and malt
Appearance- This is a dark murky brown brew with swirling sediment and a small off-white head.
Taste- A masterpiece! I love this flavor, well balanced fruit and spice with malt and yeast. perfectly blended.
Palate- This is a medium to heavy beer with moderate carbonation. Has a nice semi-dry finish.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2016 C?est une grande bière. C?est par contre dommage que Schneider aille changé ces étiquettes, je préférais les anciennes. Cette bière se marie à merveille avec une bonne viande ou un boeuf bourguignon. Comment la décrire: elle a une robe trouble, brune, canelle. Ces arômes tirent sur la prune, les épices, le froment et on peut dire une pointe de houblon. Elle peut avoir une petite pointe dacidité. Dans tout les cas, cest du grand art.

Have enjoyed young ordinary bottles and the paper-wrapped brewery-aged vintages 2009, 2008, 2006 & 2004 over the past year.

All are quite enjoyable but the 06 & 04 are remarkable. 04 has nearly lost all carbonation (6 bottles so far) but retains all the dark fruity caramelly wheaty goodness, just more mature and sophisticated.

Cellar temp into a snifter the 06 & 04 are perfection to sip and enjoy. Stick to the 06 or younger if your beer must have carbonation, but if not and you can get the 04 enjoy the even deeper character that develops.

Complexe à définir. Belle couleur rouge foncée, rubis comme jai pu lire ailleurs. Alcool présent au nez, bien caché par les nombreux arômes: banane, fruits secs... bel éaquilibre global. Très intéressante.

Bottle. Hazy dark brown color with small head. Aroma has malt, chocolate and ripe fruits. Taste is malty sweet with a long nice only a little bitter finish. Flavors of ripe fruits, plums, caramel, malt banana and some spices. Very tasty and interesting one.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2016 Hazy brown, thick light brown head, dirty looking. Aroma of malts, slight banana, raisin, liquorice. Taste is sweet malts, cloves, caramel sweetness, slight tastes of weizenbier banana and yeast. Quite heavy for a weizenbock as abv implies. Nice.

Bottle, 500mL Home. Trade with @Jaghana. Last one of the suitcase ! Merci encore Pascal, tu as changé ma vision, très naïve, des bières allemandes... A dark brown opaque beer witha big beige creamy head ; good retention. Roasty aroma, banana, prune, clove, licorice, alcohol. Medium sweet, light warming background suspended with light dry bitter refreshing waves. Medium body, silky texture, good carbonation, bittersweet finish. Overall, delicious weizenbock well balanced ; firework aroma when temperature gets higher.
Pours a reddish brown color. Aroma and taste are dark fruits and some brown sugar.

Bottle. Tan, fizzy, mostly diminishing head. Brownish dark amber colour. Aroma is plum, ripe banana and toasted malt. Taste is ripe banana, roasted malt and liquorize with some acid short aftertaste. A great beer.

Det är något fascinerande med de som tar i från tårna, satsar så att blodkärlen i pannan spricker och på köpet lyckas med sina bedrifter. En onödigt stark weissbier som bevisar sig vara helt nödvändig är en sådan. Kan sorteras in i samma kategori som spjutkast på 98 meter och höjdhopp 2,45 meter över marknivån.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2017 Bottle and keg. Hazy ruby/brown body with a thick off-white head. Faint lacing. Arome of rum, prune, toffee, brown sugar and banana. Flavour of chocolate covered raisins, banana bread, stewed apple and peppery spice. Full body with a creamy, frothy texture. Soft fizz. Wonderful concentration of flavours - sweet and warming.

This is a unique brew. Mine was aged for almost 7 years and very, very good. The better with age some say and I believe it. The awesome thing about this beer is sometimes if you have a little whole in the wall spot with a great out of US selection... You may find this one already years old setting on the shelf. Enjoy.

Bottle. Pours clear dark brown with a medium, beige, quickly disappearing head that leaves very little lacing. aroma of brett, alcohol and faint malt. Light to medium body, lively carbo, flavors of caramel, light liquorice, sweet raisins and bananas, lightly bitter and medium sweet and a finish of medium duration thats lightly bitter and sticky sweet.
A great beer: dark red brown colour. Fruity taste, with some plum, bananas and roasty nuts, perfect bitterness and a nice refreshing mouthfeel.

500 ml bottle, brewed in 2006. The bottle came wrapped in paper and had a tag on purple cord saying that the Schneider Brewery decided to age 240 cases of Aventinus each year starting in 1999, with each batch being held a minimum of 3 years. Served in a mug, the beer pours dark brown with about a half inch light tan head. Head retention and lacing were both decent enough. I like the aroma, the brew smells like cloves, vanilla, plums, raisins, and some dark bread. I think the taste is similar to the aroma, but with the addition of some caramel, sherry and bubblegum. Mouthfeel/body is medium, its creamy and coating with a moderate amount of carbonation. I liked this brew a lot. Too bad I cant remember where I bought this aged version at, I know Ive had this a little while but havent seen it around for a while either. I just know I liked it a lot, and will certainly buy this version the next time I see it!

Pours a hazy dark amber topped by a finger or so of creamy tanned head showing excellent retention and lacing properties. Decent effervescence spotted through the glass. Beautiful beer. The nose is lightly roasty and gives notes of banana, raisins, plums, pumpkim seeds and a touch of hickory. The taste is along the same lines with a distinct fruity bitterness coming through a medium-light body with a nice round sharpness. The finish is woodsy with hickory. Great beer Im glad I tried out. Cheers!
Świetne. Aromat mocny i wyraźny (banan i guma balonowa). W wyglądzie ciemna herbata. W smaku jest bardzie fajnie, choć mi brakuje trochę goryczki. Polecam!

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2015 50 cl bottle. 
Dark red-brown color, average offwhite head. Fruity smell. 
Astonishing aroma of ripe banana and strawberry with an huge wiezen malt backbone. Great aftertaste with bubblegum, almond and whiteboard marker.
Taste sweetish, thick creamy texture, sticky alcoholic and aromatic finish. Average carbonation. Really massive, nothing to lose against belgian strong ales. Excellent.

Banana and dryied fruit aroma.
Apperance: dark brown color.
Taste of dark fruits and banana. 
Overall: very tasty, great beer.
This is crazy good. Pours a deep burgundy/brown. Aromas are sweet banana and dark dried fruit. Sweet smooth and malty. No alcohol. Just dried fruit and banana flavors. Awesome.
Aroma is apple, plum, yeast, light clove and sweet grain. Taste is very sweet malts, dark fruits, yeast and earthiness. Appearance is a murky orange with a thin pearl head that retains fairly poorly.

Pours a copper brown color with a white head. Malt, toffee, caramel, dark fruit, spice, yeast and molasses aroma. Fig, raisin, plum, molasses, clove, caramel, biscuit, banana, toffee and malt flavors. Medium full body and average carbonation. Clove, banana and malt finish.

Cloudy brown color. Awesome head. You can smell out the bananas, the and fresh aromas of hefeweizen, malty caramel and bready aromas too but unfortunately with alkohol. Good aromas of gingerbread occurs after heating and than the beer becomes heavier and has more body and taste :) Not the best weizen bock I ever drunk but its definitely in the top 3.

Smooth, rich and full flavour. One of the Best Schneiders Weisse.
You smell the awesomness.Its taste like banana with hints of Caramelle.A long tastefull Taste in the back.
Cloudy dark amber clour with a huge head. Aroma is fruity, banana, wheat and fresh yeast. Intense. Taste is full with strong alcohol tail.
Cerveza con un sabor muy agradable, segun la echas en el vaso el olor ya te deja un buen gusto. Muy agradable para tomar en cualquier momento

The pour is a gorgeous opaque ruby with a medium tan head...nice retention and lacing. The aroma has nice dark fruits...raisin and fig...with hints of clovey spice, banana, and an earthy/woody nnote.The flavor follows suit...excellent balance of fruits, spice and roastiness along with a mild leathery/earthy hoppiness...just an awesome beer. The mouthfeel is full and silky with a dry earthy/leathery/dark fruit finish that brings a mild boozy warmth.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2017 Bottle at home. Beautiful (!) dark brown/chestnut-like colour with an off-white foamy head. Fruity nose and taste with ripe banana, plums, figs and raisins along with spices (ginger, clove) and liquorice. Quite complex. Medium body and carbonation, weizen-smooth mouthfeel.
3.2.17 Vintage 2012 ed. Taste is very malty, caramel, honey, ripe fruits, lightly funky: interesting.

Bottle, pours ruby brown with a beige head. Banana, brown sugar, raisins, plums, fairly boozy, chocolate, almond, caramel, dark ripe cherries. Medium to high sweetness, medium body, creamy mouthfeel, lively carbonation. Lovely!

Dark amber/cider color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of wheat, yeast, bananas, clove, fruit, & spice; Flavor of wheat, yeast, caramel, clove, bananas, dark fruit (notably prunes), raisons, some citrus, and spice; Nicely balanced and complex; The gold standard of the style.
Een middelmatig bruin bier waar er zoveel van zijn. Zowel de smaak als de geur zijn niet slecht maar ook niks speciaal

BOD 2010. From the label tied on with a purple cord, "Therefore in 1999, the SCHNEIDER brewery decided to start aging a limited number of cases of AVENTINUS each year in their historical ice cellar in Kelheim with each batch held for a minimum of three years." 

Pours a dark amber with a deep dark ruby hue. Outstanding head volume, good retention and excellent retention. The final pour delivers yeast sediment from bottle conditioning.

World Class rich complex nose of dark fruit (raisin, plum) over a rich malty caramel base. In the background are notes of banana and clove with a hint of chocolate.

Full bodied with a rich creamy texture. Well carbonated with rich effervescence from the middle on - palate perfection.

The flavor profile is World Class - intense, complex and perfectly balanced. It begins with a burst of raisin and plum that slowly yield to chocolate notes over a surprisingly subtle caramel sweetness. The middle effervesces into a burst of banana and clove. As these flavors fade, a subtle bitterness emerges as does a hint of alcohol. The finish is a slow fade with notes of bitter chocolate.
50cl bottle thanks to ruigo. Thanks pal! Color is dark copper. Thin to medium white head. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter. Aroma is malt, chocolate, banana, light yeast, wheat, alcohol.

0,50cl fles via 8 Zaligheden, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 8,2%
Uitgeschonken in Jupiler Tauro glas

Uiterlijk: koperbruin met luchtige volle schuimkraag

Aroma en smaak: caramel, kandijsuiker, zoet, fruitig als banaan

Conclusie: smaakvolle bock, hoge waardering hier is te begrijpen 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Toffee nut brown in color. Light in carbonation. Smooth with hints of caramel, dates, and malts.
Powerful aroma of bananas, some brown sugar and spices. Could inhale this all day long. Multi tiered flavor, banana on the front slight licorice and alcohol on the end. Very good stuff

Dark brown color. Banana, licorice and dark malt flavors in the nose. The taste is very heavy, effectively hiding the notable alcohol content. The taste is dominated by dark malt aromas, licorice and banana notes. I think the beer taste is a bit too heavy.
on tap at BierStube in Philadelphia; brown color with a big tan head; fruity, caramel malt aroma; bananas and cloves with lots of caramel malt and fruity, sugar notes

Poured from a pint bottle into a weizen glass on 12.29.13.

A: Opaque dark brown. Very thick looking. Big, fluffy head.

S: Banana, cloves.

T: Roasty banana, with cloves, malt, and alcohol burn.

M: Creamy.

O: The alcohol is not hidden very well as it is with other weizenbocks. It almost overwhelms the flavors. Its good, but there are better weizenbocks.
Cerveja marrom claro, com aromas predominantes de caramelo, cravo, banana passa. Sabor equivalente com presença aquecedora mas equilibrada do álcool, Retrogosto doce, persistente e alcoólico.
Cereal, chocolate, raisin, vanilla, malty,banana, clove. Wonderful rich, and malty dopplebock. Favorite beer!

Bottle. Brown pour with a kaki head. Sweet caramel malty aromas. Sweet dark fruit and cola notes. Good body and mouthfeel. An off putting bitterness almost prune like. Anyways. Not worth the 3.99 rating.

Russet color pour with creamy, fine, lasting head. Nice texture to the beer. Fruit banana bread on the nose, flavors of raisins, licorice, and clove on the palate. Mid-palate is well-balanced and hides its 8.2 ABV quite well, cola on the finish. Overall, a very nice Strong Wheat Ale.

Theres really not much point in filling in this comments section as the description above nails it perfectly. Theres certainly nothing original about this stuff, its just a textbook example of the style. Flavours and aromas are simple, but everything pops, and it all goes down so smooth for an 8.2% beer. A classic that deserves every bit of its cred.

Bottle I have been holding onto for about 7 years. The aroma is malty, fruity, some fig, raisin. Pours a clear copper/amber with off white head, mostly diminishing and no lacing. The taste is a little sweet, sour and some bitter. The body is medium, the texture a thin creaminess and the carbonation lively, the finish is bitter. Pretty good.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2015 Bottle. Small head vanishes fast. Murky dark brown. Roasted and herbal aroma. Velvet carbons open in mouth. Sweet, strong, complex and well balanced. Herbs, cola, liqourice. Oily and dryish palate.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Ciemnobrązowe, bardzo mętne piwo o średniej pianie. W aromacie słodko z wyraźymi bananami i nutą przypraw. W smaku pełne, słodowe z wyraźnymi nutami owocowymi i lekkim karmelem.
Excelent beer to share with a friend. You feel plenty when you drink it and notice its complex taste.

Schwarze Farbe, große beige Schaumkrone, die auch lange bestehen bleibt. Riecht intensiv nach überreifen Bananen und Vanille, aber auch nach Schokolade, Mango, Himbeeren und Alkohol. Süß im Antrunk, was dann in einen würzigen Mittelteil übergeht, der schließlich herb endet. Stellenweise kommt auch ein bisschen trockener Alkoholgeschmack durch, aber sehr wenig. Komplex und lecker. Weist sowohl Charakteristika eines Weissbiers, als auch eines Doppelbocks auf, sehr interessant.

[50cl thanks to ruigo] Color is hazy brown with a nice beige head. Body is full and creamy with medium carbonation. Aroma is bread, sweet vanilla, raisins and banana. Taste is in accordance, is sweet, banana, yeast, cloves and some roasty notes. Aftertaste, is long, dry and sweet.

Cloudy brown pour, off white head. Nose is wheat, light bubblegum, tropical fruit. Middle is spice (faint cloves & nutmeg), sweet wheat malt. Finish is lightly spicy & dry. Complex all the way through!
Farm murky amber color like burnt sugar in color. Sweet welcoming aroma. Full bodys taste. No signs of booze. Balanced!

Piana drobna, beżowa. 
Kolor brązowy, nieprzejrzyste. 
W aromacie nuty pszeniczne, wymieszane z chlebowymi. Lekko winne. Goździki, bananów prawie nie czuć. 
Pachnie świeżo, rześko. 
W smaku nuty winno-chlebowe. W drugiej nucie lekko likierowe. Słodkie, goryczka niska. 
Wyczuwalne nuty pszeniczne, plus skórka chleba. Lekko kwaskowe. 
Alkohol niewyczuwalny, ale lekko grzeje. Zamaskowany bardzo dobrze. 
Pełne, treściwe. Niemalże czuć, że jest gęste.

Bottle 50cl. Clear amberbrown color, lots of small bubbles, big frothy light beige head, stable, thick layer of 5 mm stays all the way, good lacing; sweet wheat aroma, banana, light vanilla, raisins, figs, yeast, dough, hint of alcohol; taste medium sweet, light to medium bitter, banana, yeasty and roasty notes, bit spicy; medium to full body, oily to creamy texture, average carbonation, lingering mild sweetbitter finish, light fruity notes, bit alcoholic; overall quite complex and well-balanced, an excellent wheat beer and a great doppelbock.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2016 SB centrallager, flaska. Aromen är frisk inte så fuktig dock. Gyllenbrun färg med härlig lovande grumling av hefe. Tilltalande smak. Som gjord för weissbierglas....lättdrucken med fin kolsyra. Weissbockrna blir inte bättre. Aromen växer efterhand.
2016 lagrad från 2012 dricks 20161225 samtidigt som gulliga Mao badar. Russin och en obestämbar fatkänsla. Kjejraren av julöl 2016. Ähh Kaiser....
skulle ge 4.2 - 4.4 om jag ratade om den.

50cl bottle. Pours deep reddish-brown with foamy white head. Aromas of banana, alcohol and hay. Taste has earthy aromas of bread and fruit, but the alcohol keeps popping up in the oily feeling. Decent bock, but nothing spectacular to my taste.

500ml bottle. pours cloudy light brownish ruby with pillowy beige head. aroma is bananas, cloves, malts and spices. taste is very smooth. nutty, wheat, chestnuts, prunes and plums. finishes with spice. great.
Without a doubt, my favorite daily evening beer, but it has to be respected, because the bottle too much they can quickly avenged!
Strong berry aroma. Hazy brown colour. Big fruity taste with a lot of character. Great.

Bottle - lively deep ruby body with a big foamy light brown head. Aroma of rich cocoa, bubblegum, cloves and yeast. Taste of coffee, cocoa, cloves, hints of roast malt, light bitterness to finish. Lots of spice with hints of caramel. Medium body, high carbonation. Quite sweet.
Pours a murky dark amber with a medium cream white head. Nose has banana and liquorice. Malty flavour and banana. Medium body with a nice after taste.

Scents of banana and plums top off this reddish ale that poured with an inch of froth. It had a spiciness that linger a little but not over powering. Very smooth with a little alcohol punch at the end.
500ml bottle. Dark amber color with one finger off white head. Smells of dark fruit. Tastes like banana and dark fruit, maybe plum. Ends dry and fruity.
Intensely nutmeg and spice hiding the ABV. Terrific malty taste in combination with the spice like a heavy fruit bread. Strangely with little of the typical banana esters.

Pours dark brown with thick, creamy off-white head. Smells like caramel and bread malts, figs, spice, floral hops, dates, and sugar. Tastes rich, like sweet malt with strong dark fruit, light floral notes, light spice, mildly sweet finish.
Mooie donkere kleur met een flinke schuimkraag. Bier is lekker zacht van smaak. Bouquette is fruitig. Smaak wat bitter en vlak.

500 ml bottle to a snifter. Deep mahogany with foamy beige head which fades to thin lacing. There is clove, banana, dark fruit, toasted biscuit and sweet toffee on the finish. Impressive complexity for a wheat beer. Could almost pass for a Belgian triple... Very tasty.
Brown with beige colour. Banana, lots of it, caramel. A lot of sweetness - sweet fruits.
500ml bottle. Tastes: caramel, riped bananas, raisins, dark fruit. Rich and full of flavour. Sweet malty finish. Satisfyingly warming. Complex, really delicious :P
Bottle. Pours hazy brown with a thick light brown head. Aromas of caramel, malt, sweet bananas, wheat. Taste is sweet ripe bananas, some wheaty notes, wood, malt, caramel, slight smoke.

500ml bottle conditioned. Pours a cloudy brown colour with a large white head which retains well. The aroma is sweet banana the flavour is sweet banana and sour at the same time with a lightly spicy finish which lasts. Very good beer.

Pours a medium dark ruby red color with a light tan head. The aroma is of sweet fruity bananas. The flavor is of sweet fruit. The body is medium with a banana aftertaste which is not my favorite. Overall it was okay.

Banana upfront with notes of cloves and rich melanoidins. Appearance is brown with a slight haze. Flavor has a rich malt flavor with notes of cloves and bread. The beer is malt forward. Hop bitterness is low. Mouthfeel is full with medium high carbonation. Overall, it's a malty smooth tasting beer with notes of banana and cloves. An overall great tasting beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

cream colored foam. hazy chestnut colored brown.
smells banana, cinnamon and strawberry. reminds me of christmas spices. good body, sweet, alcohol is apparent. subtle bitterness.

Bottle, 500ml. Pours mostly clear dark brown with some yeast residue. A fine, dense, medium tall , beige head. Aroma of sweet jasmine, caramel, corn, floral. Mouth feel is creamy with a medium-thick body and gentle to medium carbonation. Tastes mostly sweet, but not too much, with very very light sourness and bitterness. Flavors of caramel, strong corn flavor, jasmine, bread, fresh ripe fruits, floral, clove, liquorice, grapes/berries, slight herbal-medicinal (in a good way) hops, not bitter, slight alcohol. No straight-up malt flavors. Ends not too sticky with sweet floral honey taste. Great flavor complexity, very nice drinking overall. Very sweet, yet not too sweet, thanks to the slight sourness and background hops.

Bottle. Nice aroma of banana and clove. Flavor is banana, dark fig, and prune. Finish is slightly bitter. Body is medium. Carbonation is fine and prickly. Not sure how I havent rated this one yet, but on the way home today I had a craving for this and so I bought it. Overall this is a well made affordable beer that I like, especially in the fall.

Barwa ciemnobursztynowa o jednolitym zmętnieniu, piana obfita, średniotrwała, głównie średniopęcherzykowa, lekko beżowa, lacingu brak. Zapach palonego słodu, gdzieś w tle karmel z lekką świeżością. Niezbyt intensywny. W smaku nie jest zanadto intensywne. Spodziewałem się czegoś totalnie mocniejszego, zwłaszcza biorąc pod uwagę alkohol i ekstrakt. Tutaj jest dość spokojnie, przyciszony klimat. Goryczka jest średnia, nie zalegająca. Bardzo pijalne. Piwo jest takie, jakie powinno być.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2015 Questa weizenbock si presenta con un bel colore ebano, con riflessi dorati e ramati, con un bel cappello di schiuma beige molto fine, quasi cremoso, dalla buona persistenza. I primi odori che vengono fuori sono di banana, prugna e di leggero tostato di fondo. Le note etiliche sono ben evidenti. Il corpo è ben strutturato e con buone caratteristiche maltate. Al palato ritroviamo le note fruttate come quelle dellolfatto. Buona beveribilità grazie alla poco briosità, persistenza del retrogusto ottima.

Vierte marrón oscuro anaranjado con media cabeza de espuma que perdura largo rato; en nariz aromas a caramelo, cerezas y uvas pasas, entrada suave y maltosa con notas ácidas y leve amargor, cuerpo ligero con carbónico medio-alto, siguen notas a malta tostada, pos gusto largo y algo picante, cerveza refrescante fácil de beber pero bastante alcohólica; no muy compleja y se hacen largos sus 50 cl.

Flasche (50 cl) aus einer Getränke-Hoffmann-Filiale, Berlin (Abfülldatum: 13.02.14). - Sehr tiefes Kupferrot, trüb, üppige Schaumkrone. - In der Nase überreife Banane, etwas Zimt, im Hintergrund vielversprechende fruchtig-herbe Noten (Mango, Erdbeere). - Antrunk sahnig und füllig mit Banane, Birne, Zimt und Nelke aber auch komplexen fruchtig-säuerlichen, an Weihnachtsgewürz erinnernden Noten (Schwarze Johannisbeere, Orange, Muskatnuß), die die füllige dunkle Malzsüße in Schach halten. Mild rezent aber spritzig, weich und sahnig im Mund. Im Abgang nur milde fruchtige Herbe, leicht pfeffriger Hopfen. Der Alkohol bleibt vornehm im Hintergrund und macht sich erst einige Zeit nach dem Leeren des Glases in fieser Weise bemerkbar. - Komplexe aber runde, füllige aber nicht breite Verdichtung bester Weizenbieraromen. Ein Hochgenuß selbst für Biertrinker wie mich, die Weizenbier in der Regel meiden.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2014 Tuerie intergalactique.Proche de lAventinus de cette même brasserie mais en plus "dilué".Tout y est et tout y est bien : les fruits secs (abricots, pruneau), les bananes cuites, sèches ou très mûres, le côté confiserie/bonbon.Lalcool réchauffant, le biscuité de lensemble et la très fine amertume.

Draft @ the wharf in Aalborg. 
Lots of ripe banana, biscuit, some plum. Hazy brown with thick tan head. Small head lasting. Moderate+ sweetness, light bitterness. 
Finish is sweet and long, fully body, oily texture, lively carbonation.
classique classique! si cest ça une vrai Weizen Bock! bien jen prendrai une anytime! cest presque comme boire des muffins aux bananes et noix..
UPDATED: NOV 3, 2016 A brown, unfiltered wiessen dobbelbock, with low, brown head. Aroma is carsmel, banana. Taste is sweet.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2014 From Piligrim in Moscow. Hazy brown with a medium-sized beige head. Aroma of banana, wheat. Taste is banana, brown sugar, dark fruits. This is very nice. Cant believe that it is 8.2%.

1 pint bottle, poured into a bell glass at approximately 45 degrees F.

A: Pours the color of weak coffee or strong tea, pooling into the glass as a lovely shade of burnished copper, cloudy and murky with a red-copper sheen where light shines through along the sides of the glass. The head is a pale, faint tan, and lingers a while as a cap which leaves some sheet lacing that slowly slips back down to the surface.

S: Toffee-sprinkled wheat bread dipped in caramel, slathered in some banana and grape preserves.

T: A malt explosion, all toffee-caramel bread. Hints of banana and cloves swim through the sweetness, alongside some faint grape-raisin-black cherry echoes. Theres a touch of herbaceous bitterness to the finish, and oddly, I get more alcohol heat from the Aventinus than the Aventinus Eisbock.

M: A tad on the thin side, towards watery, but still somewhat sticky, with lively carbonation.

O: A phenomenal doppelbock, managing to keep the focus on sweetness, malt, and fruit flavors, without much of a noticeable hop presence. In a straight comparison, Id choose the eisbock version every time, but that is an entirely different category of beer.

Bottle. Hazy brown color with huge beige long-lasting head. Aroma of banana, dry plums, some spice (clove). Taste is semi-sweet, with good amount of notes and nuances. So nice aftertaste! Long, rich and smooth. Should be sipped for better experience. Brilliant weizen!

Bottle 0,50L. Hazy, dark amber colour with large, froithy, light brown head and lively visible carbonation. Aroma is mixture of caramel and citrusy/grassy hops. Taste starts light sweet and caramely with its silky texture. Finish is light bitter and long lasting. Full body, soft carbonation. Excellent beer!

From: Brewers Droop, Bristol
How: Bottle (end dated 2015.06.18)
Blood alc: 0mg/100ml

Aroma hints banana and fruity / berry spices, some diacetyl. Big foamy lasting white head which lets through more spicey aroma as it slowly fades. Flavour is deep, fruity / estery with a little banana, a lot of spice and fairly dark but still having a lightness. Mouthfeel is silky smooth. The only thing Im not so sure about is a slight plasticyness near the end of the mouthful, but I think that is just the wheat

Dark brown body with a beige head. Aroma is sweet dark fruits, some spice, malt. Taste is sweet with light bitterness. Very refreshing. Medium to thin body but mouthfeel is sleakier than what I expected from the looks. Very nice beer.

Bottle from wick at both ends, Sheffield. Chestnut brown with a good foamy off white head. Aroma is banana and clove, some Christmas spice and dry fruit. Taste is slightly spicy and sweet with some sour tang. Nice fizz and foam on the tongue. Like this one.

Bottle. Dark brown, cloudy, small to average and fully diminishing head. Moderate to full, malty  wheaty and sweetish aroma, banana and fruitiness with notes of "sahti". Body is medium to full, malty  wheaty and sweetish flavor, some fruitiness and banana, faint alcohol. Finish is average, malty wheaty and sweetish, some fruitiness and light banana, light alcohol and spiciness.Fruity weizen bock - too sweet for me. Hides 8,2% well. OK but "Dont Believe the Hype".

donker bruin met kaki kraag
aroma is heerlijk vol, volmoutig, rozijn, lichte chocolade, gist, banaan.
smaken zijn alcoholisch, rozijn, aardse mouttonen, banaan, glad maar ook romig, iets aan de dunne kant, matig zoet, zwak bitter, mooie zachte bock met goede smaken.

Bottle at home, 18th October 14, pours a big head, that dissipates, dark murky, red brown. Aroma, dried fruit, banana, slight spice and liquorice. Taste is rich, smooth, banana, dough, dates, some toffee, quite sweet, Not bad

it does, however, produce a great head and a big bodied beer, but the flavor and overall impression were were pretty good, but not quite what i was hoping for based on previous ratings. 8/09-one of the few ive had to re-visit. Had with Schneider Weiss & Hopfenweiss...more balanced than i remember, and quite tasty. Worthy of a 4+ rating. Maybe i had one past its prime?"

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2016 Drank with Kaspar @ Cafe Jos 16-10-2014. Interesting beer this one. Weizen hints are still present, but it also tastes like a bok. Good combination. Also hints of fruits and sugar, the beer is moderate sweet. This moderate sweetness is however a bit too dominant, the taste could have been deeper, more compelling. Still nice beer.

Edit: rated a bit lower after sampling at the Stone brewery bar in Berlin
Pours a cloudy amber, head is sligytly tan. Aroma is malty and fruity, dark fruits. Taste is warm from alcohol, malty.

Tap at Sly Fox. Amber/brown pour with foamy, creamy head. Aroma is fig, pistachio, dark fruits. Lots of banana and plum flavors here. Chewy malt, brown sugar/toffee quality. Fairly sweet and warming. Solid.

0.5l bottle poured in a my Weihenstephaner Weizen glass.
Delicious beer. Simple like that. The delicacy of a Weissbier, the power of a good bock with a fruity and spicy bouquet. 
A: Cloudy brown color with a creamy and persistent head. High carbonation. Dirty as a typical Weissbier (looks like thin wheat in the bottom of the bottle) 
S: Pure pleasure. Very fruity and spicy. German yeasts and caramel malts are relevant. Less banana flavors than a traditional Weiss.
T: Good as expected. German yeasts and malt are again, relevant. Toffee and very light liquor upfront taste. Not bitter at all (only perfume hops could be felt). Balanced sweet.
M: Heavy and creamy body. Good carbonation, balanced sweet in the beginning and very low bitterness in the end. 
D: High. Alcohol is almost imperceptible despite the 8.2 ABV. High quality German beer.
[ BA Review @ 2/4/2010 ]

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2015 Eight-month-old in a 0,5 l bottle. Dark red-brown colour (only if you hold it into the light; if not it is just a murky brown). Hazy liquid with off-white head which fades quickly. Aroma/flavour of dark fruits, molasses, rock candy, figs, chestnuts and dates. Slightly sweet taste with a hint of bitterness. Full mouthfeel, average carbonation. Overall a very good beer. Flavour reminds me of a belgian quadrupel. In comparison, it lacks a bit of intensity regarding aroma and flavour.

From a bottle. Pours dark brown with thick, creamy off-white head. Smells like caramel and bread malts, figs, spice, floral hops, dates, and sugar. Tastes rich, like sweet malt with strong dark fruit, light floral notes, light spice, mildly sweet finish. Medium body and carbonation.

The Eisbock variety of this is the best beer I ever tasted, so I was very interested to see how the more "standard" variety compares. It smells equally good - brownish odour with wood, oil, cheese and cured meats in the bitones, dark chocolate brown with attractive brownish yellow foam. Tastes of soy, chocolade, beechwood, plum, rock candy and many other nuances that I cant place. An excellent beer, also when not frozen.

Pours dark roasted amber color with a beige dissipating head. Aroma is bananas and dates. Flavor is complex fruity with chocolate, banana, dates, and sweet malt. Very smooth not sickly sweet even though it has a lot of sugary flavors. The sweet palate balances out the weight of the 8.2% alc. Very nice evening sipper!

The beer is ideal for a night drink and complex thoughts. 
The taste is complex - from fruit to some candies. 
The only weak thing is smell - it feels like its rotten

Bottle in the Town Street Tavern, Horsforth. Cloudy chestnut beer with a Good cream head. Loads of flavour with banana, wheat, citrus and spice with cinnamon and cloves especially. A touch of chocolate and treacle. Really tasty.

Bottle from Cornelius as part of my German beer education. Pours murky ruby brown, decent off white head. Big banana nose, fruity, yeasty. Sweet fruity taste, very smooth. Hides alcohol very well. Mysterious but tasty.
Perfecto final de una etapa y buen comienzo de otra. La vista y los recuerdos no se borran. Thanks

500 ml bottle. Cantt believe I have not rated this before now. Pours a copper color with a rocky beige head. Aroma has it all! Bananas, toffee, rum, cloves and allspice. Tangy, complex yeasty toasted wheat malt flavor upfront. Chewy malty mouthfeel. Complex flavors abound. Raisins, vanilla, sourdough, toasted wheat and tropical,fruit. Tasty and a must have.
Thats the best beer ever what I drink. Beautiful color and delicious beer. I hope I drink more.

For a cold Dagobah water lookin mahfah it sure is tasty. Smell is of burnt toffee, roasted malts, wheat, bubblegum, basement, dank, leather and brown sugar. Taste is well.....what you smell in this case, and its very good. Its everything you could ask for in a German brau. Nice peppy mouthfeel, the alcohol is 8.2% (I JUST looked) and you can barely taste it. Get one into you.

Bottle BBE: 16/06/15. Chilled. Very murky, dirty brown body with a considerable, bubbly tan head. Aromas of wheat, over-ripe banana, plum, dough and citrus. White chocolate and macadamia nut cookies. Medium sweetness, a touch of sourness, and an underlying bitterness and dryness. Fullish body, thick, smooth texture, lively carbonation and a lasting finish. An outstanding beer.

Lets face it, it pours a murky swamp water brown with a big frothy head, and I am plenty okay with that. Aroma is of yeast, wheat, basement, plums, and grapes. Tastes of plums, grapes, wheat, and herbs. Average carbonation and smooth with a surprisingly light mouth feel for how strong it is. It also hides its booze very well. This was some great swamp water.

Bottle. Pours a dark mahogany color with a nice head that fades to spotty lacing. Aroma of dark fruit, banana, hint of chocolate and malt sweetness in the background. Taste of dark fruit, some malt sweetness with bit of chocolate. Subtle bitterness and a clean finish. Fairly full nody, smooth with robust feel that is enhanced as it warms. Very well balanced and no hint of the 8.2% ABV. Very enjoyable beer, nothing like a classic style to wrap up the day with.

Bottle from Julios. Poured into a snifter. A lovely deep purple brew with a froth tan head that totally disappears. Deep earthy aromas of plum, raisins, dark sugar. Flavor is very well balanced. Dark fruits, herbs with a pleasant sweetness. As good as anything you can get!

Bottle at the Merchants Inn Rugby, German theme night. Not seen this before and was by far the most adventurous beer on offer, poured ruby with strong head, hints of raisen and licorice, doesnt taste strong abv. A very good beer. So good I had 2 bottles :-)

Elle est belle, d?un riche brun trouble, avec un petit col crémeux. Goût qui s?affirme par des élans fruitiers de type banane. En arrière-bouche, un intéressant mélange de sucré et d?amer. D?une consistance plutôt crémeuse. Superbe.

Bottle at home on quiet evening. Pours ruby brown with rich nose of dark fruits. Tastes of raisins, figs, slight citrus, brandy, and plums. Chewy mouthfeel. Round palate. Quite delicious fun knocking off classic brews.

In bottiglia. Colore marrone cappuccino, schiuma abbondante e persistente. Aroma di banana,, frutta secca, noci, tostato. Al palato corpo medio e gradazione ben nascosta. Aromi di frutta secca molto intensi, speziato e tostato meno evidenti. Finale lungo e appagante.

Very dark amber, almost black color with a very creamy, light beige head that eventually dissipates completely. Aroma with hints of toasty, nutty, caramely sweetness. Noticible alcohol taste with minimal alcohol effect. Sourncess balanced with a sweet finish.
This beer is magnificent. The head retention seems almost unnaturally good. The beer smells, looks and tastes amazing. The body is full. The taste is delicious, full, and decadent.

0.5l bottle. Hazy brown color with white head. Aroma is banana, cloves, wheat, yeast, some vinous notes and fruits. Taste is medium to heavy sweet. Alcohol is barely notable. Full body and soft to average carbonation. Overall its really great and tasty beer.

0,5l bottle at Kolars Beisl/Wien1. Tasty strong Weizen. Good one.............

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Solid. Pours murky brown. Aroma is full of banana. Medium bodied, finishes slightly dry/tart.
UPDATED: NOV 30, 2014 Full-bodied fragrance with notes of banana and yeast. The flavor is also dominated also by some banana but with malt tones. A very well made weizendoppelbock. Simply amazing!

On tap 0,5l at Weisses Bräuhaus, Munich. Pours a ruby colour wheat doppelbock with a creamy fine head. Aroma of ripe bananas, raisins and plums meet liquorice and roasty aromes. Full-bodied and warming, with a well-balanced and smooth finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 0.5l. Hazy brownish-amber with medium brownish creamy head. Sweetish malty aroma, banana, yeasty, spicy, cherry, a bit sweaty. Sweet banana flavor, light hoppy bitterness, yeasty, herbs, medium sourness, notes of cherry, complete and balanced. Medium carbonation. Bitter-sour aftertaste.

Bière allemande achetée à la SAQ. De couleur brune, avec des reflets orangés, elle est exhaussée dune mousse blanche correcte. Nez puissant de levure, de bananes mûres, de sucre brun. En bouche, cest puissant, sucré. Longue en bouche, cette bière foncée offre des notes de blé prononcées. Goût dune blanche forte. Cest sans aucun doute agréable, mais ça manque doriginalité, cest unidimensionnel. Quand même un bon produit. Disons que je ça me fait davantage apprécier lavant-gardisme de non micro québécoises. Cheers!

Bottle, shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: clouded brown beer, small stable off white head.
NOSE: smoked, grains.
TASTE: smoked, ham, oké, but not my style. Like the little sourness.
You can taste that this beer is great, but its not really my type of beer...

50cl bottle from Wegmans, McKinley Rd, Buffalo, NY. An opaque chestnut pour with a fast fading cream head; aroma of roasted malts and bananas; smooth with a strong plumy fruit taste, mingling with dry licorice; and a satisfying malty finish with a trace of warming spice. Excellent.

Draft at Madrones in Frederick, MD. Served in a tulip glass, dirty brown color with off-white head. Aroma of fruit (banana, apple, some berries), bread, caramel and kind of a lactose note. Taste adds notes of clove, yeast, brown sugar and vanilla. Light-medium body, moderate carbonation, soft with fruity/sourish finish. Excellent weizenbock, lots of malt/yeast flavors.

Bottle. Well carbonated murky brown body with a large off white head. Nose is oak, wheat, banana and brown malt. Strong clove note. Blue cheese. Mouthwash, alcohol. Sour cherries. Sweet with a tangy bitter finish. Rather nice. Drinkable for its strength.

Hazy brown color, light beige head. Aroma is fruit, wheat and malts. Taste is sweet and fruity, wheat, bit of smoke, very balanced. Alcohol well hidden. Maybe because of the yeast at the bottom, every sip of this beer is a bit different making actual experience to the end.

light beige head with no lacing. brown colour. aroma is banana in your face, cloves, esters. taste is esters, strawberry, banana, cloves with a dry aftertaste. milkshake? medium body and carbonation.bottle 50cl / bbf may-2014

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2015 Aroma of raisins and grass. Hazy brown color with white head. Very nice medium bitter and sour taste. Light palate. I really like this beer, but having tasted the big brother, the eisbock version, I cant help to compare the two, and to me the eisbock is one of the best beers I have tasted. So this one, although very awesome, falls a little in comparishment.

Tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours unclear reddish amber with a big, fluffy, off white head. Aroma has baked fruits like banana and apple, a tiny bit of smoke or leather, wheat and caramel malts. Taste is sweet, spicy, banana, caramel, wheat, again this leather thingy. Really smooth taste and body as well. Medium to high carbonation, and a well hidden alcohol.
Botella de 50 cl de el c. Ingles tomada en julio de de 2001. una gran sorpresa alemana con sabores y aromas intensos y un cuerpo medio casi a fuerte de 8 vol. Para repetir.

Drink cool (10-12°C)
Eye: beautiful reddish-brown, hazy/dull with a nice big white to beige head that dissipates not too quickly. little carbonation. make sure you get out the yeast from the bottom.
Nose: Sweet yeast, (dryed) fruits such as raisins, cherries and prunes.
Mouth: wheat, bread, dryed fruits, banana in an oily or butterlike body.
Palate: sweet finish. yeast/wheat, banana and fruits remain.
Overall: very nice beer. ill definitely have this one again

Drak golden matte and hazy cloudy color. Considerable tan head. Rich arome, quite malt and caramel with lots of alcohol nuances. Medium sweet taste. Medium body, quite sticky texture, lively carbonisation and alcohol finish according to the rather high alcohol amount. Overall a good one!

Poured from bottle. Aromas of banana and caramel. Almost clear dark red with tan head. Medium sweet taste. Full bodied with creamy texture and average carbonation. Overall an a very well balanced strong beer.

Transfer from BA review on 10-11-12- 
 Served on tap in a 10 oz chalice glass

 Appearance  The beer was served as a hazy medium brown color with a thin off white head. The head had a moderate persistence fading to leave a nice level of lacing.

 Smell  The aroma is heaviest of a brown bread smell with tons of darker fruit notes. For the fruit, raisin, plum, and a lighter cherry flavor are all there. With these aromas is a good hint of booze and a light amount of yeast and banana.

 Taste  The taste begins heaviest of the darker fruit flavors of raisin and plum with a more subdued brown bread taste mixed within. As the taste advances some light banana flavors as well as a wheat and yeasty flavor coming to the tongue. Toward the end, a pleasant warming alcohol flavor comes to the tongue, leaving a nice sweet warming taste to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the thicker and fuller side with a lighter carbonation level. The overall mouthfeel very nicely compliments all the dark fruit and yeasty and light boozy flavors very well.

 Overall  This is one tasty and very drinkable brew. It is renowned for a reason. Very well done. Tons of great flavor and an overall joy to drink.

50 cl. bottle @ the bungalow Spier, bought @ Mitra Beilen.
Hazy brown with an off-white head. Malty yeasty aroma with overripe banana, vanilla and caramel. Sweet taste but not overly so. full round creamy mouthfeel. A great weizen bock.
A big toasty roasty beer that doesnt drink as heavy as it tastes. Well balanced and malty - the alcohol content doesnt impede its complexity. A hint of spice plays ball with the yeastiness.

Cloudy brown with a nice beige head, which sticks to the glass. Rich aromas of dried fruits, apple, roasted malt and a hint of yeast. Taste starts sour, decent bitter with a light sweetness. Thick texture, with a proper carbonation.

1/3 litre in the Munich beer house. Murky brown with an off white head. Overripe banana and farmyard aroma. Big juicy mouth filling dried fruit, plum and a hint of toasted almonds. Full bodied thick juicy mouthfeel, lasting finish Delicious.
