UPDATED: DEC 29, 2014 Cloudy chestnut brown color, huge off white head with nice retention. Full body, oily texture, lively carbonation. Aroma is wheat, banana, red fruits, raisins. Medium sweet, light bitter, long light bitter finish. Nicely balanced, very good.

Bottle from Utobeer. Gusher, unexpected and messy. Aroma is yeast wheat toffee. Pours annoying. Aside from that its a muddy brown with an off white head. Big candy/chemist/bubblegum/pepto bismol aroma, mostly cherry pb. Nice... flavours similar as aroma. But its also big toffee, solid spice, cloves, cinnamon, candy... nice.

OLD NOTES JUN 6, 2004
Comes in a BIG pint sized bottle, alot of beer for the strength of it, but I was up for the challenge. Typical smell of a weizen style beer, fruits 

and wheat, plus caramel tones. Pours deep redish amber thick with sediment, even big chunks! Thick off white head to top it off. It tastes like a 

dunkelweizen on steroids. Thick surupy texture full of tropical fruits, chocolate and caramel notes, and spice. Definately a sipper, yet masks the 

alcohol very well. Very good.
Nice cloudy brown golden color with stable white head. Strong banana and citrus aroma. Quite sweet but really well balanced. Nice huge body the alcohol is masked well great beer.

Huge in so many ways. I cant recall describing another beer as plum colored and scented. Full bodied and sweet, this goes down oh so easily. High-alcohol content nicely tucked away. I enjoyed this from a bottle and would love to find it on tap some day soon.

Poured from a pint .9 oz bottle into a snifter a very dark amber brown almost reddish.
Aroma of bananas, fruity Belgium malts.
Flavor is dark fruits raisin, prunes quite sweet yet balanced with roasted malts.
Quite a smooth drinkable brews experienced at our Rate Beer 100/100 tasting. So perfectly good.

Pour is dark murky brown with an extremely tight light tan head. Nose is estery with notes of banana and lemon. There is a faint tangy yeast and some dark berries behind. Taste has a touch of dark malt to it, bright esters of lemon and banana with more peppery spice and stronger berry fruitiness. Carbonation is strong with a lighter body and dry finish.

Another favorite in my recent tastings. Pours a dark brown with a nice thick tan head. Creamy malt balances fruit flavors and aroma. I need to go grab some more of these

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is one excellent brew. It pours a very dark brown almost black color, with a tan head that quickly dissipates. Upon smelling the beer, you can smell a strong caramel and malt presence, as well as alcohol. The first sip is pure heaven, very smooth and refreshing. There are slight fruit flavours and a lot of spice. One might also notice a very very slight chocolate flavor. Overall this is one very smooth beer, and very strong at the same time.
Banane und Trockenobst schon im Aroma. Im Geruch dann eine ausgeglichene Restsüße.

Cerveza oscura ligeramente turbia con espuma en tono marfil bastante densa y persistente. Aroma marcado a plátano, cereales, especias dulces.
En boca entrada voluminosa, con cuerpo, alcohol perfectamente integrado, con una mezcla de dulzor y amargor.
Tap at Ale House. Pours amber brown with a clingy beige head. Aroma of banana, clove, raisin and fig. Flavor follows nose. This is very smooth and easy to drink at 8.1abv.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2015 23/10/2015: 9/4/8/4/17 From 0,5l Vinatage 2009 bottle as Schneider Weisse Aventinus Vintage 2009. Pours clear dark rubby to brown liquid, small frothy to fizzy tan to brown head, Aroma: banana, vanilla pudding, raisins, cherry, wood, light warming alcohol, Taste: medium to heavy sweet, light to medium bitter, light to medium sour, fruity, raisins, candied fruits, banana, lemon zest, cherry, warming alcohol, Palate: medium body, average to lively carbonation, slick to creamy mouthfeel, long sweet lemony zesty aftertaste, Overall: very good, fruity, intensive, strong and warming, yet very drinkable. Enjoyed.
2/10/2014: 10/5/9/5/18 From 0,5l bottle, BBD: 12.07.14 App: Pours beautiful hazy caramel brown liquid, big frothy tan head. Aroma: banana, wheat, plum, strawberry, citrus, candied fruits, raisins, clove. At the end with rising temperature some alcohol present, but not unpleasant. Taste: heavy sweet, fruity, medium bitter, light sour. Gorgeous taste of banana, plum, berry fruit, citrus, candied fruits- fruit heaven garden. Pal: full body, creamy texture, lively carbonation, long pleasant bitter finish. Overall excellent unimaginably good beer full of fruits, very very drinkable, full flavored.
Dark ruby body topped by creamy tan head. Chocolate, banana, clove aromas lead to similar flavors with hint of vanilla. Creamy, smooth & simply delicious. World class brew.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy dark amber with a large creamy small-bubble off-white head, Aroma is ripe sweet bananas, toffee, plums, cloves.Taste is sweet caramel, banana, dried fruits, licorice and a touch of cloves and alcohol. Finish is light roasted bitter, plums and alcohol. Medium/full body with a lively carbonation.
Nice balance between the darker malts and the wheat aromas. Dark caramel with a good head. Aroma is very reminicsant of a hefeweisen. The taste is a slightly sweet with a balancing malt-bitterness.
Do not have to say much more about this masterpiece than that it is one of the best beers I have ever tasted! Period!!!

Currently my overall favorite beer. I can drink it anytime with anything. Watch your driving as its high alcohol content, but not so high that its part of the flavor. Also, drink as cold as possible.
Very nice banana nutty yeasty malty aroma. Taste is the same. Very well balanced and full flavored. Really enjoyable. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Slightly disappointed by this Schneider brew. Maybe too late in the evening. Said to be a dessert beer but I found it slightly tasteless.

A loose beige head disappears, loads of banana and bubblegum on the aroma, and tonnes more in the flavour. Initially lots of clove which clears. Very carbonated. I like this better than I rated it, but the appearance let it down.
Very dark amber. Aroma is strong hops. European pour left a big head. After taste is short. Flavor is unique to any other beer I have had before. Would drink again/10
Bottle 500 ml. Pours hazy brown, fruity sweetish aroma. Malty, fruity, spicy flavor. Full bodied, complex, heavy. Nice one for winter days.

Bottle. Pours a hazy medium brown, with a moderate light tan head that dissipates rapidly. Minimal lacing. Nose is caramel malt, bananas, and dough. Taste follows the nose, with moderate caramel and banana notes. Creamy mouthfeel. Very good wheat doppelbock.
Barnás búzasör intenzív banános-alkoholos-malátás-élesztős ízzel és illattal. Vitán felül a legjobb búzasörök között a helye.

Pours in dark hazy amber body with low head, ruby notes againts light. Aroma is loaded with banana, clove and light yeast character, caramel, toffee, licorine, dried raisins. Taste is caramel sweet with burn candi or toffee like background, lower bitterness. Body is full with higher carbonation.
Flaska delad med @msbrindbergs. Brun grumlig vätska med ljusbrunt skum. Fruktig doft med mycket banan. Väl dold alkohol. Fruktig för att vara veteöl. God men ingen sensation.

Troligen den konstigaste ölen jag druckit. 
Ser ut som östersjödy ungefär. 
Galen doft med en tydlig ton av banan. 
Smakar som en fruktsallad med lakrits men ändå weissbier.
Pours hazy brown with big, off-white, lasting head. Aroma of caramel, raisins, banana and cloves. Medium-high body. High carbonation. Nice, long and aromatic finish. Enjoyed it.
UPDATED: JAN 31, 2014 God duft av rosin og plomme. Fin mørk rødbrun fatge. Lite skum, litt langs kant. Frisk fruktig smak av plomme og rosin.

Bu en bouteille de 50cl, belle couleur trouble blanche et une mousse compacte, en bouche elle a tout dune blanche allemande grosse attaque sur le malt de froment avec un reste de banane en fin de bouche.

Dimmigt gyttje vattens brun med ett orange skum. Doft: Äpple, banan, fruktsallad, vete öl, jäst, "sågning i furu planka". Smak: Vete öl, päron, handkräm, rosenvatten, lite tuggummi. Mycket väl dold alkohol, särskilt med tanke på att det är så lite humle i smaken.

Bottled. Many many thanks to Netty and Tomas. My premiere of this weizen bock. Nose piercing banana aroma indeed! Thick head, brown color. 
The taste however is a blend of bananas and medium sourness and that disturbs me a bit. It is the attribute that disturbed me with unser original. I dont know why but this bitterness or sourness that comes with a Schneider Weisse is not my glass of beer. The finish is dry and bitter. Alcohol is well hidden.
Overall this beer is good, I think overhyped, but good. My favorite to date is still Sommer Weisse (I have had only 4 SWs in my life to date).
Alchohol, yeast, and some wheat aroma. Mostly sweet taste, dominated by yeast, bread, some banana, raisins, and plums.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2015 0,5l fles, donker kastanje bruin bier met een crème schuimkraag. Moutig licht, aardse tonen, prikkelend van de gist. Smaak is volzoet met banaan, tikkeltje alkoholisch en een volle afdronk. Niet helemaal mijn ding erg zoet en de alkoholisch is te nadrukkelijk aanwezig, 0,5l fles is te groot.
Bottle to shaker. Yeasty banana aroma. Cloudy burnt orange. Banana flavor. Tingly carbonation.

Bottle poured into a weizen. Pours a hazy dark nut brown with a half finger of thick khaki head. Aroma of wheat, clove, brown sugar and caramel. Taste is medium sweet. Banana and clove with wheat and brown sugar. Full bodied, slightly fizzy carbonation, and a very long finish. Great beer, no idea why it took me this long to tick it.

50cl bottle in a lager glass. Cloudy dull colour with a thick, white, foamy head (too much). Aroma was a little underwhelming and the mouthfeel a little watery. Most prominent flavour being banana with the obvious fruity notes being present. Unfortunately, tried this after the Aventinus Eisbock so maybe a little too much expectation.

On tap at Apex in Portland. Murky brown with big off-white head into an Aventinus 0.5l glass. Fruit and banana and bready aromas. Big flavor similar, moderately sweet, rich, amazing. Full-bodied and smooth. Hides the alcohol well. Just lovely. I could drink this all day.

Wheat and fruit bomb (mostly banana), some malty backup, caramel,, intense yeasty character, some interesting spices, kinda bread. Sweet, almost no bitterness. Very smooth. Nicely balanced high end beer for decent price. Should grab some more

Has a thoroughly unpleasant first taste, an almost stilton-esque quality to the head, which thankfully matures and opens up delightfully on the tongue, and by halfway down the bottle, youre wasted and enjoying yourself so much that the flavour becomes second nature and you are quite happy to slow down before you pass out. Warning: dont drink two if you want to remember the rest of the night.

Pours cloudy amber brown. Plum, over ripe banana and burnt fruits on aroma and taste. Complex. Tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Brun, uklar. Tæt, blivende skum. Aroma: gær, rosiner, banan. Ditto smag plus karamel. Vinøs eftersmag, solid fornemmelse. Temmelig god.

Deep brown hazy liquid. Huge, very long lasting, creamy head. Aroma is malty, with licorice and bread. Mouthfeel is light, alcohol perfectly masked. Sweet long finish. Taste is strong licorice; also caramel and dark fruits. Complex and balanced.

Cor marrom com espuma de boa formação e media persistência. Aroma de banana, passas, caramelo e um pouco de malte tostado. Sabor de passas, malte tostado, boa carbonatação, médio amargor e dulçor. Final seco com amargor persistente. Ótima cerveja bem refrescante. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Drinking from a 05 l bottle. I smell wood, alcohol, caramel, banana and clove. Lots to smell, but I cant say I love the smell. The beer is clear, brown with quite a brown head. 
In the taste its mainly sweet with some bitter to keep it balanced. Bitter sticks. Low carbonation, good in alcohol.

500ml bottle to Schneider Weizen glass, pour is a murky brown with an off white head that leaves a little top. Aroma is strong dart fruit, well roasted malts.....huge plum and raisin notes, some banana, clove.....herby/medicinal stuff. Taste is quite sweet but not overpowering. Squares off with a bit of roasted bitterness but not much in the hop department. Its a lot like combining a light coffee with notes of licorice, raisin and slight dark fruits. Very slight sour notes as well. Palate is medium bodied which comes to me as quite a surprise given the aroma seemed to be fairly heavy and how strong it is in the grain department. The beer is deceptively light considering the strength and lack of sugar addition though the carbonation is fairly generous which helps. 

Overall this is a solid beer though a bit heavy on the banana notes. I feel like this is more a fine liqeur meant to be savored, but its quite good so I dont expect this glass to last me long. Cheers!

Bière brune cuivrée aux reflets roux, totalement voilée, très effervescente, et surmontée dune copieuse mousse brunâtre, dense, persistante. Arômes de blé, pain grillé, pâtisserie, caramel, cassonade, céréale rôtie. Arômes également de malt fumé, bacon, charcuterie, jen suis très surpris! Le breuvage présente également des effluves fruités (banane, mûre, raisin, figue, prune) et épicé (clou de girofle et poivre surtout), avec une pointe dalcool. Le nez est très complexe, et plutôt agréable et intense. En bouche, le pétillement est plutôt faible, lonctuosité et la rondeur sont bien intéressante cependant, cest soyeux au palais. Au goût, caramel, cassonade, pain grillé, le malt fumé est définitivement moins présent quau nez. Par contre le fruité et lépicé sont bien présent en bouche, cette bière est passablement poivrée, et lalcool est également présente au goût comme par sa sensation chaleureuse. La finale amène un certain houblon floral et légèrement herbacé qui apporte une amertume de faible à modérée. Sucré, épicé, amertume, les saveurs sont admirablement bien intégrées les unes aux autres et léquilibre de cette bière est parfaite. Voilà une excellente bière, très complexe, adéquatement intense, et fort agréable à boire!
Uma Weiss dunkel de cor bastante turva e escura. Levemente picante e forte gosto de caramelo.
Brune foncée. Beau collet beige. Sucré. Levuré. Très fruité. Raisin sec. Datte. Malté. Caramel. Banane. Légèrement amère. Très bien.

Pours a thick muddy opaque brown, with a nice tan head and great lacing. Aroma is dominated by a mixture of banana cream pie notes, and banana bread aroma notes. Tasting reveals more banana, raisins, plum, and a tad of red liquorice. Overall this beer warms the palate, and has a very smooth finish. Most excellent!

Soft aroma of ripe bananas, little sour also.
Flavor is little sour and also sweet, chocolaty even.

poured from 500ml bottle into weizen

A - pours a nice dark brown colour which passes very little light. very thick, very foamy, three fingers worth of head that dissipates at an average speed.

S - banana and spices are present off the top. there a hint of clove and dark fruits in there. smell is the only let down here for me. 

T - this beer is very nice and has a great number of tastes coming through (much more than i expected from the smell). its surprisingly refreshing off the bat (at least for me) for a darker beer and there is very little if any of the 8.2% of alcohol coming through. you can taste the typical clove and banana which is why i love these beers so much, along with a nice caramel malty flavour as it sits in your mouth. you can defintiely taste some of the dark fruit that i could smell after the pour. i wouldnt call this a summer beer but im definitely enjoying it on a nice summer day with a baguette. more refreshing than your average dark beer.

M - a very creamy taste which goes down extra smooth. medium carbonation which seems a perfect balance to the taste of this bad boy. not too much of a lingering aftertaste but my mouth is defintiely wanting more after each sip.

O - i love wheat beers! im usually a bigger fan of the typical hefeweizen, but i do like to try some of the darker wheat beers. after weihenstephaner dunkel, this is the best dark wheat beer ive ever tried. i could enjoy this beer all year round and i can see it pairing great with a steak on the grill. it was hard to keep this one in my glass and as i was so pleasantly surprised by it, I am planning a trip back to the LCBO to buy another few bottles for the weekend. If you like wheat beers or dark beers or any kind of beer of quality...get this beer.

Serving type: bottle
UPDATED: APR 12, 2016 Salmiakkia ja vehnää. Mahtava väri. Maailman vanhin vehnäolut. Aivan mahtava tuote. Ei petä ikinä, eikä koskaan. Janoon tai nautiskeluun.

A loeil, bière brunatre claire, très trouble, haut col de mousse blanche, pas très engageant. Au nez, cest déjà nettement mieux, arômes de levures et de fruits confits / a leau de vie (prune, banane). En bouche, cest encore mieux : les fruits confits sont forts présents avec lalcool toujours derrière. Manque juste un peu de longueur. Très bonne bière allemande (cest pas si souvent ...) !

From the bottle poured into weizen glass. Appearance is cloudy medium brown that rises slowly from off-white foam that fills the glass. Some patches of lace stick to the glass. Aroma is bubblegum, clove, banana, raisin, roasted wheat malt, and a whiff of alcohol. Taste is dominated by fruity sweetness coming from the malt and banana, apple, raisin, and tropical fruit esters. The sweetness is complimented by the spicy clove and anise flavors. A fuzz of alcohol in the swallow. On the high end of medium bodied, creamy and thick texture, lots of carbonation, sweet estery finish.
Middle brown color with cloudy wheat down. This makes it look à bit strange. Aroma of bananas and something spicy. Taste is fresh and very well balanced. Sweet, ripe fruit and licorice.

Shared a 50cl bottle from Maruhn (Darmstadt). Pours a cloudy brownish colour with a thin off-white and persistent head. Aroma is banana, grassy and spicy. Very suave. Average carbonation and medium creamy body. Taste is ripe bananas with a soft bitter and dry finish. Overall, a fantastic beer.

Bottle from Highland Package in Birmingham. Hazy brown color with white head. Aroma of malts and flora. Taste of malts, banana, and nuts. Sharp aftertaste. Light bodied. A great beer. I highly recommend it
It is a different weizenbock. It has a sweet/herbal taste at the end. Smooth and low carbonation.
Bottle. Muddy brown colour. Aroma is banana raisins. Taste is banana raisins wheat and cloves. . Great body smooth feel. A v good example o this style

Pours hazy dark reddish brown colour with a small off-white head. Aroma is sweet with fruity and caramel notes. Taste is sweet and rather complex. It has notes of banana, apricot, plum, caramel and even some yeast. Some very moderate bitterness in the finish. The taste of alcohol is suprisingly restrained, despite the high ABV. Soft carbonation. Smooth and full bodied mouthfeel. (0,5 l bottle, best before 25.07.2014, poured in a Schott Zwiesel Bavaria -glass).
Bottled , Prague , CZ , Malt,wheat,spices and great fruity aroma , Hazy brown color with huge frothy lacing head , Sweet taste with long pleasant finish , Full body , Soft carbon , Superb beer.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2014 Rather hazy to opaque and solid brown-mahagony, dark amber in colour with a frothy beige off white pillowy head. Noses of malt, lightly aromas of roasted walnuts and almonds, dried wheat, light fruity of cooked banana, some faint hints of hop and wood develop fading into dark fruit aromas like plum with a touch of bitter chocolate. Very faintly lively on the palate with a slick/oily texture offering a medium-full body. Medium sweet with some faint hints of bitter tasting notes on the back of the palate. Really well balanced with a finish which is pleasantly lingering on for a good while offering sweetness of nuts, dark fruits and malts. Adds a nice slick texture to the finish after a while. Very nice!
Impressive aroma, impressive taste, impressive beer. Too strong for sessions - but perfect in a session (albeit near the end)

Plus foncée (fruits vieillis, raisons noirs, corps plus profond) que la Schneider Weisse Original TAP 7. Le corps demeure très vivant et agréable mais la buvabilité laisse davantage la place à la dégustation. Ça demeure une bière très raffraichissante. Un très beau compromis en fait!

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2013 Aroma: dark fruits, sweetness. Appearance: very dark brown, hazy, amber head. Taste: sweet, rich. Palate: heavy body, alcohol noticeable. Overall: great Weizenbock! Bottle at the Octoberfest Pub, London.

Bottle info: 10.354 3
0725 2823

Dunno what that means, but I think its bottled around Xmas, 2010

A: pours a dark brown ale with limited clarity and a small hint of orange on the light source. Two fingers of peanut head falls slowly to a broken quilt of the same. Insane lacing.

S: Yeast wins. Clove, banana, coriander on the nose. Then the doppel aspect comes thru - darkened malts with molasses characteristics and some brown sugar.

T: match the nose. Add some hints of copper. Also some extra sweetness. The flavor is good, but not even close to the best or among the best doppelbocks. Too much copper flavor.

M: Medium to light for the style with moderate carb. Dry finish.

O: Good, but not special. I wouldnt put this with the best of the doppels.

Serving type: bottle

05-24-2011

Bottle @ home. Pours hazy brown with a frothy quickly diminishing head. Aroma is sweet and complex. Nicely balanced between clove and ripe bananas. Smoke, raisins, plums, and of course lots of wheat. Smooth full bodied mouth feel. Taste is similar, with a a really nice long lasting dry fruit character, slightly sour and moderate earthy bitter finish.
Litt uklar brun med beige skum. Nøtter, banan og hvetelukt. Søtlig banan, lite bitter. kort søt ettersmak.

Its absolutely massive beer! The aroma is so complex that Im lacking words to describe it - cloves, bananas, yeast, smoke, peat, malt, toasty, etc. Sweet in taste, smoothly carbonated, very slow sipper that reveals a layer after a layer with each sip. Warming up as well!

UPDATED: APR 2, 2014 
Look: Equal, thumb high thick off-white foam, again equal fast retention. Lots of sparkling, almost no lacing. Dark brown with some amber undertones. Lovely stuff.


Smell: Dark fruits, raisins, figs. Then comes roasted, caramel, molasses wheatines. There are some spice and yeast notes. Pleasant, balanced and inviting. 


Taste: Again dark fruit at start, goes to sweet, caramel middle and closes with banana esters, cloves. Hard to find any hops but there is some woody bitterness. Sweetness stays with you for a while. Alcohol well hidden. Smooth and balanced ride.


Mouthfeel: Medium to full body, almost syrupy (but in a good way). Leaves coating. Carbonation is smooth. Surprising drinkability for such a fat, strong beer.


Overall: Pinnacle of weizenbock style. Hard to imagine anything better. Complex, balanced, fuck yea.

Rating #800- December 2, 2013- Dont know why but I like celebrating big number ratings with 100th percentile beers. 12 oz on draught at beer revolution. Nose is pastry shop, banana, and a mild floral note. Bold and medium-full bodied for 6.5%, medium alcohol warmth. Medium-heavy carbonation, quite bubbly golden pour with white cap. Mouthfeel is clean, taste is banana, nice yeasty kick, finishes perfect with a hint of lemon zest and fir tree needles. Love this style, and couldnt be more enamoured with this brew.

Interesting one this, I bought it on a whim as Ive not tried the style before. It pours a murky brown colour with a frothy tan coloured head, which starts big and soon diminishes. The smell is fine though nothing too exciting, revleaing a kind of sweetish wheat beer scent. The taste for me was of dried bananas and plums initially, followed by other dried sweet fruits. Behind that has the wheat beer taste along with a bit of yeast (to provide the much needed bitterness). It is rather frothy and creamy in the mouth with a noticable but mild level of carbonation.
To sum it up then, this was a nice beer although perhaps a little sweet for my liking. At times it reminded me of a strong Belgium ale but without the complexity. I would be happy to drink this again but I cant see myself being in a hurry to purchase any more.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2017 Vintage 2011. Appel, sherry en witte wijn zijn de kern woorden als aroma. Smaak is appel, druif en verdere frisse zoetheden zoals in de betere dubbeldranken. Een apart soort bier, wat geuze, middel lang gerijpt. Tap @ Bierpreuvenement Horst 2013, laatste in de rij van 10.
#2 banaan in de smaak! Zoeter dan van de tap, ditmaal dus fles. Nasmaak wel wijn appel. Aroma zelfde. 
#3 smaak is toch wel complexer dan in de gedachte was opgeslagen. Smaak plus 1. Aroma is niet uitmuntend, beetje vlak. Palate plus 1.

Heerlijk weissenbier. Vol aroma, mooi schuim, licht zoete nasmaak. Net uit de koelkast op een zomermiddag op z'n lekkerst.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhoneEarlier Rating: 11/15/2013 Total Score: 3.5Heerlijk weissenbier. Vol aroma, mooi schuim, licht zoete nasmaak. Net uit de koelkast op een zomermiddag op z'n lekkerst.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle into an English pint. Pours a really murky brown with some lighter reddish tinges around the edges near the glass. Light, quickly dissipating head. Nose of rich roasty maltiness, dried fruits and a bit of banana. Medium sweetness with flavour of plums and a hint of something sour on the back end. Full bodied and pleasant on this snowy evening.

Pours brown and leaves the same colored body with some red/amber-ish tints around the sides of the weizen glass; just a little bit of lacing; the smell has a large amount of roasted dark wheat with a good amount of dark fruits coming through in a sweet and somewhat "banana" estery sort of way; the flavor is mainly sweet and yeasty with that roasted wheatiness coming back to embolden a lengthy sort of sweetened yet sticky aftertaste and a dry sweet finish, its not as easy on the palate as probably some would like, but hey an 8.2% weizenbock, what does one expect?.... overall, I say this is a great weizenbock that should set the standard for the style, get this before you try any other just so that you know what to expect with this style

Have had this one a few times in the U.S., but bought this bottle in Germany. Now for the review. Wow - this beer is something special. Aroma is extremely rich - malt - almost meaty to a point (luckily a good one). Pretty sticky but not too much, and the complexity and strength justify it. Celebrator might have a contender. This is great. [Needs another review for top rating.]

Bottle poured a murky brown hue w/ huge long lasting rocky tan head. Big fruity aroma. Initial flavor is moderate sweet w/ a moderate sour finish. Tastes are apricot, raisin, peach, and a light banana and clove yeast. Medium to full bodied, lively carbonation, and creamy mouthfeel.

Troebel, hazelnootbruin bier met compacte, beige schuimkraag. Licht melig en zacht in de mond, met een medium body. Aroma is behoorlijk fruitig, zeker voor een bock: banaan, peer. Verder caramel, mouten en het duidelijke aroma dat bij een tarwebier hoort. Smaak is medium zoet, zeer licht zuur, heel weinig bitter. Erg lekker!

Robe ambree sombre, belle carbo. petit col persistant.
Aromes de banane, pain.
Un vrai bonheur de douceur et de rondeur en bouche Superbe equilibre entre sucre et amertume. Pas de flaveur trop dominantes, cest un bon melange de banane encore avec des malt torrefies et du caramel.Elle chauffe un peu avec ces 8%

This one is always easy to find at "Trinkgut" liquerstore chain across Germany. My favourite one to represent wheat and bock beer combination. Thick aroma and full body tangles into this one for sure!

Interpretazione molto particolare e apprezzabile di una weizen scuora ad alto grado. Gusto intenso di banana tipico, arricchito dalle note tostate. Resta uno dei prodotti più pregiati di questo ottimo birrificio tedesco.
UPDATED: MAY 5, 2016 Pours a murky brown with an off-white head. Aroma of bready malt, caramel, banana, raisins, plum, vanilla. Slight sour notes in the aftertaste. Interesting and tasty brew.

Bottle from a local supermarket.

Pours rustic-brown, with a mighty lasting wheat-head. Strong carbonation.

Aroma: banana peels, ripe bananas, clove and some white honey. A delight!

Taste: Bananas (lots of them!), sweet sponge-cake and wheat сream porridge . Finish brings some warm alcohol notes and dark fruits (sweet grapes?). Lovely!

Overall: And excellent beer. The one to be rediscovered on a regular basis!
Hazy amber brown with medium head when poured from tap. Sweet full bodied taste with a hint of fruit. Solid beer.
UPDATED: NOV 30, 2013 Nice Weizenbock. Or even doppelbock as they call it. Taste begins with the typical Weizen flavors and ends in a nice roasty caramel bokfinish. Very good.

Bottle. Pours hazy brown with beige head. Nose is bread, clove, slight plum as it warms. Flavour is bread and wheaty with the fruity flavours being more banana than plum/prune even as it warms. Nice stuff, I prefer the Eis version I guess since intensity of flavour fits sweet heavy beers.

Bottle:
Pours light cola brown with a thick, light beige head and floaties...
Baked bread aroma.....banana and raisin, nut.
Taste is sweet, creamy, molasses and plums...dark wheat.
Rich, malty, tasty...sweet.
Excellent....not at all boozy, either.

Pours a very cloudy brown color and a off-white head that fades rather quickly. Nose has loads of bananas accompanied by rich spicy, fruity, liquorice and yeast accents. Taste is fairly sweet with a very mildly dry finish. Carbonation is above average but very soft. Palate is rich and creamy. Excellent balance with a rich warming taste.

Sans être un inconditionnel des bières Allemandes, il faut reconnaitre que celle-ci a du corps et du caractère.
Fruits confits, banane, céréales... Une attaque assez puissante mais pas très longue en bouche.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2013 Takes the best of a what bear and a dopplebock and convinced them. The great body of the what with the flavor of the Bock. An excellent beer. I use this as a gateway beer to get people into better beers. It works. It?s complex, yet easy to love.

The best wheat beer I have ever tasted. I do not like the style but this one manage to round of the bitter wheat taste in the finish. 
Found this one in Schillerstraße,Berlin.

Cest brunâtre, cest trouble, cest ténébreux, la petite mousse blanche cassée venant toutefois illuminer le verre dun aura angélique. Des flaveurs de fruits confits (raisins, prunes, bananes) pénètrent les narines intensément.et enveloppent la bouche. Une texture légèrement crémeuse jumelée à lalcool qui cogne constamment à la porte caressent le palais à chaque lampée. Un exemple quasi parfait du style weizenbock.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Hazy brown colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Fruit, malt, wheat.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Fruit, wheat, alcohol, wheat.
Tapped in Pivovarsky Klub Praha. Color - caramel, a bit darker, white/yellowish head. Clean aroma of wheat and a bit of malts. Tastes very good with a bit sweetness. Very good one!

From tap at Weißes Brauhaus München. Amber brown bear with tan head. Perfectly poured in 0.3l Aventinus glass. Aroma is dried fruits, malt, slightly sour. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter, plum, dried fruit, molases. Full bodied, touch of booze. One of the best Weißbier ever.
Tasteful wheat beer, with brown fruity taste and whitiesh head, smells good and earthy. A delicous and strong german wheat beer

Half Litre bottle, poured into over sized wine glass A: Very dark amber, opaque, retained some of the one finger head, initially lots of lacing but faded. S: Yeast, wheat, candy sugar, fruit, apple. T: So many layers, wheat, fudge, molasses, initial booze burn faded to the point where it was undetectable, cocoa like bitterness at the finish. M: Heavy body, thick texture, smooth, moderate carbonation. O: A sipper, holds up against moderate Belgian offerings, second half went down much faster than the first.
Perfection. I have turned more people on to this beer than any other. This beer is a life-long devotee sort of thing. PERFECTION!

A: Brown/Orangish Hue, Passes Some Light, Thin White Head Ring, Minimal Lacing

S: Raisins, Black Plum, Sweet Bread, Mild Bourbon

T: Red Plum, Raisins, Wheat, Mild Brandy

M: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Sweet, Mildly Drying

Overall, a really solid weizenbock with nice fruity notes but not overly sweet and mildly drying, very complex and simple at the same time.
Dark-ruby with a fine white head. Nose of complex fruits. In mouth strong notes of fruit and light bitterness, Very good german beer.

Bottle from Beer Run. Ruddy reddish brown pour with a moderate off-white head. The nose is strong wheat. Plenty of red fruits, bruised banana. Caramel and cocoa. Rich, robust, sweet. The taste is smooth wheaty banana smoothie. Burnt caramel and cocoa, earthiness cuts the sweet flavors. A touch of tobacco. Bubblegum. Medium body, soft carbonation. Pleasant.

This beer is a long time favorite. Recently re-tried for reviewing purposes. The appearance is wonderful; nice dark caramel in color, with a retentive whiteish/cream head. Smell is wonderful, clean, earthy, lightly spiced with clove. Taste is delicious! I get clove, sweet malt, a slight licorice flavor, and a sweet yeasty type note as well. The feel of the beer in my mouth is what I remember liking most about this beer. Its very creamy and light, and leaves a smooth silty finish. The aftertaste is of ripe banana, yum.

50cl bottle. Completely hazy, brown with big head.
NOSE : very pleasant aromas of banana, tart, cheesecake, vanilla, nuts, cherry. 
SIP : medium body with creamy texture. Decent carbonation. The beer is sweet and yeasty. Banana and cherry notes play well in the background. It gets a bit boozy. Develops some delicate dry finish with yeast and fruits dominating till the aftertaste. After couple of sips it warms with the booze. The aftertaste reveals spices and earthy notes on the tongue. 
OVERALL : its really tasty. Rich in flavor and still quite easy to drink. Cooked fruits like flavors well balanced with yeast and floral notes of hops. It deserves its reputation.

0,5 l bottle BB 28. Jun 14 
caramel, cereal, dried fruits,floral, vanilla, woody, alcohol, brown, cloudy, tan foam, frothy, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, thick feel, sticky, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Pours a opaque brown with a big offwhite head that leaves good lacing. Aroma is composed mainly of bananas but there are also a few nice fresh wheat notes here and there. Taste is sweet and malty. Flavors of bananas again and bread. Not much spices in this one. Body is medium, mouthfeel silky/creamy. Carbonation is medium and the drink feels a little heavy overall. Still, a mighty fine drink!

bottle 50 cl
Appearanced: Dark ruby red colored cloudy with a off white head
Aroma of ripe bananas, spices caramel, rainsins herbs
Very complex taste a bit sour, some bitter, some sweet ( banana, dark fruits), licorice. wheat, some spices
In the finish some dried fruits, phenolic and alcohol comes true but not in a very good way
Silky texture, its a bit creamy, but still very drinkable, very finely textured carbonation.

A clear favourite until I was spoiled further bei the Eisbock version of this.
Dark brown, big white head. Banana, herbs, raisins, yeasty. Slightly sweet, but mostly dry and sour. Alcohol gives warmth. Strong and complex, one of the classic wheat beers for sure.
bottle 50cl @ home. pours cloudy dark ruby. Aroma of ripe bananas, spices. Smooth, yeasty, spicy banana flavor. reminds me of sahti. Very nice.
Sour yesty aroma, cloudy brown colour, with a nice well laced head. Complex taste slightly sour, with a phenolic finish.

500ml bottle. Pours cloudy mahogany with a big off-white head. Sweet and fruity aroma of apple, raisin, plum, banana bread, chocolate and caramel. Taste is wheat, dark fruits, banana, cherry and licorice. Velvety smooth mouthfeel. Sweet on the nose, fruits and herbal bitterness on the tongue with a warming alcohol finish. Wow!

Poured into a pewter stein. Aroma bananas & roasted grains. Taste is bananas, roasted malts & caramel. Smooth drinking, creamy with a boozy finish. Lovely.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 500 ml at home, poured into a weizen. ABV 8.2%
Pours a murky red brown coloured beer that although is so muddy looks really nice. Two fingers of off-white head, thick and creamy, with excellent retention. Really slow activity in the glass with hundreds of tiny bubbles inside moving in sow motion. Thick lacing lleft on the glass.
Aroma of ripe bananas, some spices, bubblegum, some dark fruits like raisins.
Very fruity taste, really amazing. Spices, bananas, ripe pears, raisins, plums, wheat. The alcohol very well hidden, very highly drinkable.
Thick full body, seems nutritious in a way. A meal in abottle. Very good carbonation.
Great, tasty beer and so easily available, in a reasonable price, what more to ask.
A strong and fine wheaty flavour, loveable aroma and an aftertaste of dried fruit and almonds, a favorite.
Aroma: Sweet, caramel, roasted bread, little sour Appearance: Brown tea-like color, cloudy, off white head, full lace Taste: Creamy, caramel, bit fruit, slight bitter, very nice after taste
(bottle) hazy brown colour with a tall brown tan head; creamy palate; aroma of wheat and spices; mellow and balanced flavour;
Schneider Aventinis Tap 6 pijem v Sunrise pub na Smrtnikovi ulici 4, Ljubljana, Slovenia. VABLJENI :)
Sent le Caramel, mais pas trop sucre. Goute le caramel et le raisin. La mousse ne dure pas longtemps. La couleur est un beau rouge vin donnant vers le.brun. Tres bonne biere a prix tres abordable.o

Bottle. Pours murky coffee brown with small white head. Aroma is ripe apples, plums, raisins, roasted malt, coffee, caramel, burnt sugar and gravy. Taste is medium sour, light sweet and light bitter. Body is chalky and full with fizzy carbonation. Finish is long and light sour with notes of sweet licorice, coffee, caramel, prunes, balsamic vinegar, yoghurt, chalk. Excellent complexity with classic weissen character.

Bottle from App Vintner aged since 2005 - pours a clear tea color, off white head that quickly settles. tasting after it has a chance to warm up from the fridge, its got a nice dark fruit character with some lingering clove. Very nice!
Dark amber red color with no persistent head, caramelwheat aroma and taste, one particular weiss type of beer, full body and good carbonation
Very nice tastes and aromas. I recomend drinking it with a dessert and take a pacefull time!.
On tap at Sergios on 9/14/13. Clear reddish copper pour with a thick beige head. Aroma of banana, clove and caramel. Malty flavor with lots of banana and clove before a caramel finish.

Opaque brown pour. Big white head that stays. Smells of banana, yeast, raisins, apricots. Big banana yeasty bready gingerbread (cloves) flavor with noticeable alcohol drying. Moderate sweetness. Good creamy mouthfee

I poured a 500ml bottle into a wheat beer glass. It was bottled on May 8, 2013 and cost $4.99 ($0.30 per ounce).

Appearance: An opaque shade of brown proper. Pours to a large, eggshell, frothy head which doesnt completely dissipate, but doesnt leave much lacing.

Smell: Though it has the traditional banana and clove aroma, its more of a spicier variety - like that of a Belgian Trappist ale. Some alcohol is noticeable, too.

Taste: I havent had a German weizenbock in a long time. In fact, the last brews of the style I had were the collaborations between Schneider and Brooklyn Brewery. Those were pretty special beers, but what about a standard, perennial German weizenbock? After all these years, I think Schneider Aventinus (Tap 6) is my first foray into the style, so Im definitely kicking myself for having waited so long.

While Schneider Aventinus definitely has a lot of similarities to a traditional hefeweizen, its not simply a hefeweizen plus more. This drinks like the bigger, stronger beer it is. It starts out sweet with a flavor akin to cinnamon bread, with a prominent wheaty character as well. Its much different than the taste of a doppelbock. Only a hint of bitterness at the crest of swig, followed quickly by a strong combination of alcohol and spice. What traditional hefeweizen is to banana and clove juice, weizenbock is to banana and clove liqueur. Spicy, zesty, almost Trappist-like with the amount of energy here. Additional cinnamon sweetness on the finish combined with light alcohol warmth and dryness in the aftertaste. 

Drinkability: While its pretty obvious that Schneider Aventinus is a big beer, its not a challenge to drink. The mouthfeel is soft and velvety, so its quite comfortable in the mouth and super smooth going down. While there is some spicy character, its not too intense. At 8.2% ABV, its not surprising that the alcohol is present, but at least it complements the palette so as not to be distracting.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2014 8.2% At World Craft Tasting 2013, Osaka. A muddy cloudy brown with a light beige head. A fruity wine like aroma which reminds me Belgian yeast, very estery. Interesting balance between the fruity spicy qualities of a weizen & the malty body of a bock. Pretty good. ----Dec 2014----Sample from bottle at Hanshin Seed. Unser Aventinus. A murky looking cloudy brown. A sweet malty spicy aroma.The beer has a fairly full body with a smooth mouthfeel. Great flavor, sweet bready caramel malts, lots of complementary spices.  Wonderfully balanced, the centuries of refinement comes through. Much nicer in bottles than on draft but not the best looking beer.

Appearance: Cola colored with little carbonation or head
Aroma: Bread and toffee
Taste: Chocolate malt with unique sherry flavor and caramel hazelnut finish 
Overall: This is the 2005 Vintage as every year the brewery sets aside 250 cases to age at least 3 years. An excellent Doublebock that shines as an example of what can be done with aging
Drinking from bottle, aroma is sweet and yeasty eaters, taste is bubbly sweet with a smooth finish, nice beer

Appearance: Dark amber. Large persistent off-white head. - Aroma: Light and balanced maltiness. Fresh acidic and alcohol. - Flavour: Complex fruity flavours (banana and strawberry). Chewy maltiness. - Overall: Full body, long and balanced. Sweet carbonation.
May 2010. 500 ml. bottle. Medium brown color with a tan head. Aromas of malt, banana, clove, yeast, spice. Sweet flavors with tropical fruit showing through, brown sugar finish.

Smells like a delectable caramel, honey raisin bread. Excellent aroma. Taste is equally impressive, resembling a sweet, slightly (but not really) biting aftertaste. Sweeter than most, but good for one or two. Highly recommended of the doppelbock is your style.
Great beer. Bananas and raisins. Somewhat sweet but not cloyingly so. Pours a pale brown with some head. Very nice beer.

Pours hazy deep reddish-brown with a voluminous off-white head. Wonderfully complex aroma with notes of banana, clove, bubblegum and alcohol. Flavor follows suit with some nuttiness and a very smooth finish with just enough spice.

Pours bronze into copper brown with a rich and foamy off-white head that really lasts. Aroma is wheat and banana clove and spices. Taste is banana with a touch of raisin and licorice, then malt and noble hops and a slight bitterness to finish. Fruits and a touch of sour aftertaste. Thickish and somewhat cloying mouthfeel. The alcohol is there but quite hidden. The wheat brings more fruit flavor than a traditional d-bock, making this a uniquely complex and tasty beer. Why drink a wit when you can drink this beauty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great beer! Banana smell. Much more than a beer, this one is a meal. Beautifull deep pale brown color. Complex.

Pours deep hazy brown with a lively tan head. Aroma is dark and fruity and spicy. You just KNOW its going to be a good beer. Taste is just an amazing sweetness. No bitterness here at all. Just an amazing dark fruity sweetness with mild spice and coffee-like flavor towards the end. I could drink this forever. Please stay on my tongue. Palate is nice and creamy. Goes down so smoothly. I think this could be a good starting point for new craft beer drinkers as well as being a benchmark not just of this style, but for beers in general. The first time I had a sip of this beer, it blew my mind. Literally.

This is a really, really awesome beer. Ive enjoyed it this weekend and it really blew my mind. Its heavybodied and however it does a good effort of hiding it, it contains quite a lot of alcohol which is not too hard to taste.

Drank from bottle, did not get much of an aroma or appearance. Good carbonation, not too much, or too little, typical of other aventinus I have tried yet missing the smooth creaminess. Slightly biter on back of tongue. Sweet, slight fruity sourness. Decent beer, but I dont get all of the hype.
500ml bottle. Pours a very hazy dark brown with a medium head. Aroma is smoky banana and dark fruits. Taste has ham and banana to start with a smoky clove finish.

Pours dark brown with a coffee head that leaves some lacing.

Smell- Dark fruits and spices.

Tastes- Not to be dramatic here but this is probably one of the best tasting beers I have ever had. Fruity and spicy up front with some lingering spiciness. There is some banana/bubblegum sweetness that mixes really well with the spiciness. There is also a slight hint of vanilla on the backend. I have never had a beer that prominently features the warming sensation of alcohol but manages to not have it overtake the other flavors.

Mouthfeel- Creamy full body. 

Overall- Wow, this is a great beer. The first one I tried from this brewery but I will be back for more. A nice cold weather beer. Try it and then try it again.

Dark amber hazy color. Fruits and chocolate in aroma. Perfect balanced taste of chocolate , banana , caramel. Spicy finish. Great beer.

Bottle as "Schneider Weisse Tap 6 Unser Aventinus". Pours opaque brown with a lasting and fine lacing frothy medium head. Aroma is quite malty with toasted malt, dades, raisin, lots of clove, raspberry, strawberry, banana, 
Taste is moderate sweet and very light bitter. Body is medium texture is , carbonation is high. Finishes quite sweet and spicy with clove. This isnt bad at all. Paired great with hearty food as claimed.
Chocolate color. Bready aroma. Bread/cereal taste with floral or fruity notes. Wheat detectable. Alcohol taste is strong.

Bottle at home, cant quite believe I havent rated this before, must be my 10th bottle or something. Pours murky dark brown, even with a careful pour leaving lots of crap in the bottle. Thin white head, which goes quickly, From there on in though, its liquid bliss. Cinder toffee, banana, star anise, and bread and booze notes on the nose, bit of vanilla as it slips down. Quite sweet on the finish with touch of alcohol burn, but in warming cuddly way. Somehow both bold and understated. Majestic.

Ser lite skitig ut men det stör inte. Jästfällning. Otippat mörk. Vill nog hålla tap 4 som ett snäpp mer elegant. Jerker har haft en riktig skitdag och borrat 16 hål i taket i jakten på en regel.

Brown color with big beige head. Aroma is sweet with notes of banana. Strong and sweet flavor with dry finish. Great wheat beer.

500 ml bottle into weizen glass, bottled on 9/22/2012. Pours very hazy deep ruby red color with a 2 finger fluffy light khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with moderate streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of big caramel, banana, clove, toast, raisin, prune, toffee, brown bread, pepper, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Fantastic aromas with great balance and complexity of malt, hop, and yeast ester notes; with great strength. Taste of big caramel, toffee, banana, clove, toast, raisin, prune, pepper, brown bread, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Good amount of earthy pepper/clove spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of caramel, toffee, banana, clove, toast, raisin, prune, brown bread, pepper, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Absolutely incredible balance and complexity of malt, yeast ester, and hop flavors; with an awesome malt/spiciness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium-high carbonation and medium bodied; with a lightly slick, crisp, and smooth mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming after the finish. Overall this is an absolutely incredible Weizenbock! Big complexity and great balance of malt, yeast, and hop flavors; and super smooth to drink for 8.2%. Amazing.

Was floored to find out this was a 100/100 beer. As always, all German brews are only a few standard deviations away from a Hefeweizen. Pours light brown with light head. Scent is brown sugar with touch of citrus. Taste is sweeter version of Hefeweizen. Light medium body with feint carbonation. Bottle - Toco Giant - Decatur, GA

Dark amber with wonderful lacy white head. Banana, bubblegum aroma. Deep complex flavor in a medium body.

Bottle found in Yellowknife; whatzit2ya?!? As an aside - I cant believe how warm it is here. Like, its freaking warm! The sun has been searing through these little clouds and its totally not even close to setting at half past nine. But sadly its kinda raining, but the sun is still, like, out there, like Freddy Mercury! So anyways this thing pours sooper sweet with a huge head that actually stays around long enough for some beer rater to blab about where they are; the body is a nice foggy brown-gold, and if the head had stayed around a few more minutes it wouldve been perfect. The aroma is all coriander and orange, orange rind even, possibly even some shoe leather notes in there - high quality layering gives this one top marks. So, why cant some damned Vancouver brews do this? How do frikkin Germans from a million miles away manage to bottle this stuff? Food for the rain-soaked types, I tellz ya. The flavour is a soft mix of coriander and smoked barley; a bit of an odd mix, but its balanced well, and is a drinkable brew. And indeed caveat emptor: I just read that this thing is 8.2%, and its very rare to taste a beer with such high ABV that does not end up like watered down gasoline. Well done, indeed.

Opaque brown pour.   Big white head that stays.  Smells of Belgian banana yeast, raisins, apricots.  Big banana yeasty bready gingerbread (cloves) flavor with noticeable alcohol drying.   Moderate sweetness.  Good creamy mouthfeel.  The high alcohol level is sorta pushing the limit here on an otherwise subtle refined beer.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2013 Opaque brown coloured beer with huge beige head. The aroma is pretty hefeweizen type with some banana  and yeast aromas. The taste begins in a hefeweizen style but ends up resembling a dark trappist beer or a sahti in the sweetness and dark fruit aromas. Fuller than medium palate and high carbonation. Long bitter finish.

2004 vintage bottle. Dark brown pour with a good deal of sediment. Big dried fruit aromas on the nose with malt and yeast as well. I get a lot of raisin with this one. Nice malty flavor with the dried fruit coming through as well. Rich finish, respectable brew.
Tap. Caramel color, small white head. Dark fruit first, smooth late. Very tasty. Combines the taste of an unfiltered wheat with a dark belgian taste.

An absolutely delicious beer. There is a slight tinge of sour that just underlies the fruit notes of apricot and fig before mellowing out to the toasted nut finish. There is not much on the nose being a doppelbock and the appearance is also normal for style. A dark unfiltered beer with a slight hint of red at the edges. The palate is perfect, combining the crisp carbonation with a nice light mouth feel reminiscent of a porter to me. Overall one of my favorite beers.
Tap at Das Bierhaus in Burlington, VT. No doubt this is a big giant beer. Poured plub coloured, cloudy. Big fruity notes, lots of yeast as well. Sticky in the mouth amazing depth. Beauty!
Pours a brown muddish beer with a good white head.  Dont smell much. A bit lemon. Tastes like mild coffee and little choco. Palate is ok.

Im not sure what everyone sees in this. I have an overwhelming alcohol astringent note, I can get the raisins and fruits that are in the mix, theyre just waving from the background. Extremely tasty Weizenbock with almost concentrated foam banana and dried fruit flavor. The color is between dunkelweizen and hefeweizen and the sweetness is more pronounced than that of an ordinary weissbier.

Poured from bottle into weiss glass. Served at 48 degrees. Cloudy mahogany with five-finger, off-white head that is still thick ten minutes in! Clove, banana, and yeasty biscuit dominate the aroma. Sweet biscuity malt balanced by spicy clove make this one well crafted beer. Medium body with effervescent carbonation make it seem lighter than its 8% ABV. A magnificent beer that deserves its place amongst the finest in the world.
