Brown with small head, lots of floating stuff in the liquid. Citruses and some hays in the aroma. Taste is sweet with wheat and some fruits (like peach) too. Interesting, complex brew.

Head: beige, big, creamy with good retention. Color: mahogany, cloudy.

Aroma: banana, raisin, a bit vinous, alcohol/solvent-like when it gets warmer. Taste: starts fruity, then wheaty. The finish is phenolic clove spiciness.

Complex and special. Has to be served cold, otherwise the alcoholic/solvent component gets too strong in the aroma.
50cl bottle. Pours brown murdy and yeasty. slightly sweet and fruity bitternes with dry finish.  alcohol warm oily mouthfeel. my favourite weizen bock.

Brune rougeoyante totalement opaque, chapeautée dune forte et tenace mousse crème. Épaisse. Au nez, des bananes et des agrumes, ainsi que des céréales et des bleuets. Fruits (bananes, particulièrement), et pain aux citrons en bouche. Plutôt épaisse et intense ; on perçoit une pointe de limposante présence statistique de lalcool. Piquante par pétillement, et veloutée en fin de bouche. Très solide, elle mérite totalement dêtre découverte, en dépit de la présence dun très léger (mais pourtant indéniablement présent) goût dalcool. Elle est complexe, capiteuse, ferme, et sans compromis, un classique dans le genre.
Bottle.  This is ne of my favorite beers of all time.  Truly a classic.  A must try.

Bottle. Brown beer with a small head that is rather lively on the pour. Aroma of vanilla, banana and cloves. The taste is of cloves, banana, vanilla and sweet fruits. Not too sweet though. There is a warmth in this medium bodied beer. This is one of those beers that gets better the more you drink it. Very nice.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Great beer! Sweet smell and taste. Full body.  One of and maybe the best beer in Germany

Pours cloudy coffee brown with a big foamy head. Aroma is roasted wheat, citrus and some banana. Smooth roasted wheat flavor with some clove and banana. Fruity. Some citrus and a little caramel in the finish. Medium palate. An excellent beer.

Pours almost purple cloudy muddy brown with dissipating fizzy cream head. Aroma- heavy roasted wheat, raisin, slight banana. Wow. Sweet to fizz- to really spot on ripe banana. End is banana and clove and maybe some chocolate. The sweet beginning is really pure without being overly sweet or detrimental. Disparity between aroma and taste balances very well. Cant detect the higher alcohol.

Bottle: I  love this brew. Intensive fruity nose of raisins, dried rum plums, dark cherries, chocolate, caramel, candy, only hint of banana.  Dark cloudy color, creamy head. Flavor has a roasted malt base with cacao, lots of dark fruits, slightly alcohol, cloves, spices.
On tap (0.5 l) at Caveau, Marburg... Perfect dark clody color, perfect head... Strong alcohol, banana and roasty aromas... Perfect Weizen taste like a ripe banana...  Perfect well-balanced ending...

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2014 Huge, thick, creamy beige head, and a very hazy brown colour, really hazy.  Smells banana, as a weizen, but with more sweet notes, caramel, and little alcohol. Taste is quite sweet, fruity and spicey, and wheaty too, of course. Hops are not really detectable, but it is very balanced. Medium carbonation, and alcohol well hidden.
Great beer.

500ml bottle from Beer Hawk - A proper gusher this one!!!! Hazy, cloudy brown body, solid (when it settles) tan head, looks very much like a frappuccino fresh from the Gaggia. Nose is sweet, toffee, vanilla and a hint of banana. The taste is sweet, almost pure sugar, with an outward kick of cloves and other spices. After a heavy beer day, wins the beer of the day. A massive beer!

Pours an average creamy off-white head that mostly lasts. Body is hazy amber, sparkles are visible. Aroma contains dark bread, straw, roasted malts, molasses, flowers, orange, lemon, dough, leather, soap, banana, grape, raisin, pear, peach, cherry, white wine, ruby port, vanilla, alcohol and spices. It's moderate on the malts, light on hops and yeast and quote strong in fruity aroma's. Flavor starts off light acidic, then goes to light sweet and light bitter. Finish is a bit boozy. Body is medium, texture creamy and carbonation soft. This beer is fresh and fruity, with a million things going on in its aroma's and flavors which mostly contain sweet and sour fruits. There's also some white beer taste in there. Yihaa! I want another!

Unclear dark brown copper, nice creamy tan head settles and lasts. Fresh ripe fruity aroma, some wit and spice. Sweet dark malts, fruity yeasty taste, some clove and spice. Lively carbonation, medium bodied, low hopped. Caramel, chocolate and a vionous booziness emerges as it warms. Very good. LBW (Lagerboys Be Wary)

Pours a cloudy chesnut brown with nice head and great lacing. Aroma is nutty, brown sugar, a bit of raisins. Taste has some light caramel, a bit of banana, brown sugar. Mouthfeel is medium with good carbonation and a very good drinkability.
Absolutely amazing.  We got our bottle(s) from an importer in Singapore.  Pours a thick creamy head.  Cloudy chestnut color.  Slight bananas on the nose, even more clove.  Goes down smooth.
Outstanding beer.  Dark brown color, excellent carbonation.  Sweet and malty aroma.  Smooth, full bodied, perfect blend of tastes!!!

500ml bottle into a tall pilsner glass. Not sure how to figure out the vintage but there is a solid yeast cake on the bottom of the bottle. Opened up with a very slow gush over.

A - Pours a faintly hazy dark brown/purple color. Tons of light tan foam forms but settles down quickly. Sticky lacing. Some floating bits of yeast.

S - Huge fruit notes of cherries and raisins, brown sugar, caramel, doughy bread, and a strong banana yeast aroma. Really amazing aroma, smells like a rich and decadent dessert. 

T - Follows the nose with sweet raisins and a bit of tart cherry juice balanced out by a hearty bread and caramel back bone. A bit of that banana yeast thing on the end with a quick fading bitterness. Crazy smooth and way too drinkable given the levels of flavors and the abv. Mouth feel is medium to light bodied and creamy. 

O - This is a world class beer, I cant imagine a better weizenbock. Just so rich, sweet, and creamy but somehow its beyond drinkable. Man I love this beer!

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2013 birra dallaspetto scuro,rossastro con schiuma intensa e persistente.. frutta dolce e caramellata,banana,sapore da weisse più deciso e bilanciato col malto tostato,finale dolce e poco luppolato..riconosco una buona birra sicuramente, ma probabilmente non ci sono ancora entrato nella mentalità di birra tedesca appieno..se questa birra merita 100/100 su ratebeer significa per me che in germania non funziona qualcosa..daccordo è una buona birra,probabilmente la migliore tedesca visti i voti ma una semplice chouffe è di gran lunga migliore per me..le birre belghe presentano complessità maggiore e mi danno una soddisfazione molto più alta rispetto ad una lager,pils,weisse,kolsch,alt,rauch..mi sbaglierò oppure no,questo non lo so e comunque resta sempre la mia e solo la mia opinione..in ogni caso questa è sicuro la birra dellerasmus..compagna di tante tante tante serata,quindi prosit!!
Bottle. Pours a bronze brown with smallish tan coloured head. Sweet spicey aroma with some hefe yeast character coming through. Flavours are sweet with some alcohol and spice on the finish.
500 ml bottle from th LCBO.  Pours deep ruby in colour, lots of tan head.  Taste and aroma of raisons, alcohol well hidden.  Sweet bomb!

Pours a dark cola color with a moderately thin head.  Smell is of raisin and molasses.  In addition to the aroma, there is a taste of banana, roasted malt and earthiness.  The alcohol is a present as one would expect at 8.2%.  Very, very good.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines;  chestnut brown pour with creamy off white head, wheat aroma, banana wheat creamy goodness, raisins viscous mouthfeel, quite boozy delightful.

500ml bottle. Cloudy dark brown with beige foamy head. Wheat, plum, dark cherry, toffee, yeast, cloves, some banana, soft chocolate. Mildly sweet with a slow, strong alcohol burn. Medium-bodied, complex and has a full-palate mouthfeel. Finishes with a drawn-out fruity sweetness.

A good beer. Pours a muddy red-brown-black with a light white head. Smells of lemon, thyme and herbs. Taste is similar, citrus and lemon, herby. Very malty. Good, not great. Had in the bottle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Banana, clove, caramel/sweet aroma. Nice amount of banana and clove character; one doesnt overpower the other. Brown sugar and light caramel malt flavor, with some dough/biscuit flavor. Great balance between malt and yeast--they complement each other really well. A little alcohol in aroma and flavor--which isnt unpleasant, but thats about the only thing keeping me from giving this a 5.

Light brown, cloudy, fluffy off-white head.  Aroma is malty (Munich) with a little toffee, dark fruit, moderate spicy clove and light banana.  Flavor features a soft spicy wheat maltiness with high carbonation, clove phenols, raisins, some banana esters, with a fairly dry but malty finish.  Lightly warming alcohol.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2013 Aug 2012 - warm bottle, really good aftertaste, slightly sour start.  A great balance between belgian and german style beer - would have again, really interesting. 4.1   Nov 2012 Warm bottle.  Didnt like as much as the last.  Tastes like a standard dunkel wheatbeer.  Quite different to the last bottle.    3.7  Average becomes 3.9
Caramel floral fragrant, dark cloudy brown with less bubble, sweet smooth complex wine-liked, thick slightly slimy, very good taste with reasonable price

the color is very dark brown/reddish. Pours a huge head. The aroma is distinct. Yeast and banana. The flavor is heavenly. A palate of flavors just hits your mouth while drinking it. As others I can highly recommend this beer.

500ml bottle at Porterhouse Cork. Pours lovely cloudy deep amber with a pillowy off-white head. Spicy aroma of orange, nutmeg, straw, pretty boozy. Taste medium sweetness, lightly sour, with a strong bitter aftertaste - hints of banana, grass, spice. Full body, with a light carbonation. Not a huge fan of weiss usually, but this is a great beer.
Beautiful aroma of raisins and licorice. Spicy dark fruits, yeast, and bread in the flavor. Very complex and flavorful.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2013 For me its rye ipa but with not so malty profile, more candy, berries in aroma. In taste plus extra mild bitter from toasted like malt. Complex flavor,  sweetish pattern. Medium body. This brew was very nice but after TAP 5 it is just not enough.
Update: apricots, plums, earthy notes in aroma, middle dry finish, thick texture, sour-sweet taste. Nice wheat dark bock with good hopping too, bitter is above medium but not out of balance, thick texture. Pours with white to beige small top, color is muddy brown. Two main things about this brew which I prefer the most - very well balance and earthy tones in flavor. But to me it could be more malty and without tones of sweet-sour.
Very refreching for a 8,2ABV. Nice, but a bit to strong. A very, very good bock. The aroma of this beer is fantastic,
500 ml. bottle.  Pours a medium brown with a nice off-white head.  Aroma of malt, yeast, fruit, and spices.  Taste is yeast, caramel, bananas, wheat, spices, and dark fruits.  Very, very nice.

Cloudy brown color, fluffy head lasting very long, but not the end. Very nice sweet aroma with banana, malts and raisins. Taste is very complex, includes sweety banana, malts, some fruits and quite nice bitterness. After all, there is some warming alcohol. Really strong weizen, but definitely must to try.

Malty banana bread covered in dark fruits (raisin and prune) and sprinkled with alcohol. Cloudy and dark, with long lasting head. Aroma has ripe banana with some clove notes and yeasty, and follows in to the flavor. Full bodied but clean, and finishes malty sweet

UPDATED: APR 30, 2013 Danke herr Schneider for a such a nice product. There are simply no weaknesses in this beer - one piece less sugar and it would be a full FIVE. Very full bodied and creamy. Full of wonderful tastes - all in balance. Licorice, chocolate, fruits - all in very nice balance with slight smoke flavor extra. Delicious! One important issue is that taste of alcohol is not hitting through. Best weizen bock for time being.

Really nicely done. Pours a beautiful amber with a lasting head. Aroma of fruit and yeast. Really pleasant in the palate. Lots of booze (8%) and you can tell. Long pleasant finish. Highly recommended. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Junto con la Vitus es la mejor triguera que se pude beber uno ahora mismo. Especial por sus 8,2 de alcohol que no se notan al beber.

A wonderful beer. Pours a ruby red amber with a pillowy white head. The aroma has banana, clove, root beer, some grass, clean and delightful. The flavor has the same components, perfectly balanced and so easy drinking you forget the big alcohol content. Drink it while at home and stagger to bed

Wonderful fruit notes both in smell and taste. Carbonated and appearance like a dunkel weisen but you can taste the powerful alcohol undertones but they dont overwhelm. Almost candy like aftertaste as it warms up on your palate.
Dark ruby hazy color with ivory head. Caramel, roasted and alchol aroma. At taste is sweet and bodied, with lot of warming.

Nice malty, caramel, and slightly floral smell. The appearance is that of dirty water, leaves something to be desired. Delicious beer, slight sweet, slightly bitter. The beer has a nice creaminess on the tongue and is very refreshing. Overall it is a Dopplebock done well.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2014 Pours ruby red with a large foamy lasting head. Aroma of sweet caramel and toffee malt,  cherries, plums, banana, rich and fruity to finish with a nice balance. Average carbonation.

bottle. Pours a dark, hazy copper with two fingers of coarse, light tan head. Settles quickly to fine cap. Aroma is malty, caramel, sweet, wheat, and alcohol. Flavor is sweet and malty and wheat up front, finishes with mild wheat, slight fruitiness, some alcohol. Mild bitter aftertaste that lingers. Alcohol is more detectable than I recall. moderate carbonation and medium-light body. A tasty, sweet, mildly boozy, wheaty and malty beer.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2013 Big beer, stronger than i expected. Aroma is fantastic. Size and complexity reminds me of a dubble. Wheat/yeast flavor is a little lost in all the flavor but it finishes it nice. Excellent. Great flavors, raisons, malt, fruit and some cloves. Would be an excellent holiday beer. Extremely impressed. Will be getting one next christmas with chocolate and cookies.

Un equilibrio sopraffino x una birra di ottima fattura tedesca. Classica doublebock con sentori di frutti rossi e caramello al naso e al gusto un misto tra dolce fruttato e un retrogusto leggermente amaricante. 

---Rated BY Italianbeer85

2006 vintage at cellar temp.  Prune colored with a redish tint, 1 finger dense off-white head.  Aroma is all dark fruits, figs and dates, just a hint of red fruits as well.  Flavor has the same dark fruits, but with some cardboard flavor as well.  Its not bad, its just a bit hollow at this point, a shadow of its former self.
Aroma of sweet bananas, ripe fruits and a foamy head. Taste of sweet banana, caramel malts. Soft medium palate. Pretty damn awesome this is.
Really exceptional...pours brown/purple with huge white head, lots of lacing.  Its super easy to drink, slightly sweet, well balanced.  Fruit notes and a really good finish.  Damn tasty!
Complex aroma, appealing appearance and a wonderful taste! [short review due to it coming from my backlog]

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2014 Brown coloured beer with good looking thick foamy head on top. Aroma has ripe bananas, some berries and wheat malts. Taste continues with bananas, slight roast, berries and in the end slight alcohol punch. Body is creamy soft with medium-to-high carbonation. A weizen for late night enjoying, still Id rather have a crispy and fresh cold hefeweizen.

À loeil : 
Dun brun foncé et brouillé, elle laisse une légère mousse sur les abords du verre. Très peu deffervescence présente.
Au nez :
Ça sent le blé, le sucre, les fruits séchés et la banane très mure. Assez complexe on va se le dire !
Au goût : 
Banane, réglisse et caramel sy mélange à chaque gorgée. LAventinus est juste assez sucrée et pétillante, se laissant mourir sur une finale rôtie. Juste wow !
50cl bottle. Liquorice and roasted aroma. Muddy brown color with smooth head. Very balanced taste with bit of banana taste and warm finish.

Muddy medium brown. Full fluffy white head - reduces but stays. Aroma of wheat, banana, spices/clove, dark fruits, some alcohol. Flavor matches. Medium body, full flavorful mouthfeel. Smooth, soft, creamy, delicious. The kind of beer I could drink all night.
dark color, large, long lasting head.  Scents of raisin, wheat, banana.  very smooth and sweet taste.  raisin, wheat, dried fruit.

2013/02/05 - Pours a cloudy caramel brown. With a massive, frothy, off white head that stays. Aroma is mainly yeast and banana with hints of coffee and dark fruits. Taste is similar to nose. Medium mouthfeel with a good amount of carbonation.Complex and creamy smooth with a warming, boozy finish. Awesome wheat beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark rubt brown, aroma of fruity caramel, somewhat sweet smelling.  Tastes as it smells.....interesting.  Smooth, not too fizzy.....very tasty.

roasty, caramel, grass, banana, alcohol, raisin, red, brown, clear, frothy, tan foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, umami, light body, slick feel, soft carbonation, bitter
500 ml bottle pours ruby brown. High rising tan foam fills stein quickly, and lingers. Roasted grain, pine, and banana aromas on the pour, with dried dark fruit remaining. Some alcohol noticed as well. Taste is banana sharpened with alcohol heat, with sweet raisins. Carbonation is mild and a thin, slick mouthfeel. Bitterness is mild in the after taste with some sourness - neither last long. A warming alcohol feel afterward. A very nice sipping beer.

500ml bottle at David Copperfield's in NYC. Pours clear ruby/brown with thick creamy white head. Aromas and tastes of bananas, dark fruits, roastiness. Well balanced but complex. Lovely beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Excellent for the style, although I am not a huge fan of the type. Very Belgian trappist tasting, which is strange since it is named after a German historian who disliked monks!

Bottle. Pours cloudy khaki-brown with airy off-white head. Complex aroma of roasted malt, caramel, raisins and cinnamon. Soft, creamy, sweetish flavour of malt, cinnamon, roasted coffee and dried fruit.  Really, really good. Want more! Just like a small child wants more candies!
Bottle 0.5l at home. Colour is light brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours are wheat, banana, fruits and malts.
Pours hazy maroon. Aroma of caramel and fruit (banana). Taste is malt, wheat, yeast and some chocolate notes as well.

Pours a clear brown colour with some slightly off white head. Aromas of dark fruits, cloves, banana and very faint alcohol. Flavours are dark fruits, cloves, wheat, mild vanilla, moderate sweetness, and moderate alcohol,

Pours a clear brown with a red hue and an off white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma od dried fruits, cloves, bready malts and light banana. Taste is dark dried fruits, clove phenols, wheat & some banana. The high abv balances this full bodied beer and has a nice alcohol warming on the finish. Great example of a weizenbock.
Pours a nice ruby with creamy head. Aroma is fruit, banana, very complex. Taste is same, and smooth for its 8.5%
Top beer, great taste, sweet, drinkable beverage for special occasion. Should try it at least once

Bottle.
MMMmmmmm...  Malty banana bread covered in dark fruits (raisin and prune) and sprinkled with alcohol.  Cloudy and dark, with long lasting head. Aroma has ripe banana with some clove notes and yeasty, and follows in to the flavor.  Full bodied but clean, and finishes malty sweet, but not cloying.  No alcohol apparent - hidden well and very dangerous.  Can I say again? - MMMmmmmmm.
Pours dark gold with red tint.  Aroma of prunes, bananas, and fruit cake.  Taste is the same with liquor aftertaste.  Im not a bock fan, but that was awesome.

From a 50 cl bottle. Very dark brown, slightly translucent, with a light tan head. The nose evokes raisins. Taste is evocative of dried fruits and fruitcake. Almost like a liquid dessert, but lighter in body than, say, an impy stout. Wow!

Very thick, lots and lots of malts. fruity notes,very strong. Pours a  dark brown cloudy head. Hefe drinkers will love it


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown cola looking color, very nicely balanced carbonation. Tastes of banana, caramel, and light chocolate. Goes down great and doesnt leave you hung over the next morning.... One of my favorites!

Bottle.  Very nice mahogany colour with a big head. Aroma is ripe (perhaps even slightly overripe) fruit like banana, plums, some apples and pears), raisins and spices - clove, nutmeg and licorice. Unfortunately the taste is too evidently alcoholic, making the caramel and plum finish a tad astringent. Gets better as it warms, though in my opinion it lack somewhat flavour depth.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2013 50cl bottle from Edeka, pours a murky red-brown with a clingy beige head and aromas of wet wood, strawberry, toffee, and faintly of banana. Body is oaky, yeasty, sweetish and slightly tart, with hints of orange juice and brandy. 
Earlier Rating: 1/16/2013 Total Score: 3.6
50cl bottle, pours a murky red-brown with a clingy beige head and aromas of wet wood, strawberry, toffee and faintly of banana. Body is oaky, yeasty, sweetish and slightly tart, with hints of orange juice and brandy.

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2014 50cl bottles, Maruhn. - Delicate but heavy, complex but drinkable, Dunkelweizen-style one-off brew that obviously hugely profits from its open cask ripening process. Hints of everything found in Dunkelweizen plus vanilla, plums, faint tartness and slight roasted notes. Hosp are in there somewhere, but they seem to blend in anonymously. Very cloudy, filling drink - hard to have 2 of these in a row. // Rerate aged bottle, sampled 6months past its 11/2013: pours flatter, immediate plum tartness in the aroma and plum wine sweetness in taste. Speculoos, milk chocolate, sticky: open fermentation wheat tartness is only in the nose. Still too heavy for me to empty a full 50cl bottle.

Kaatuu lasiin ruskeana, sameana ja vehniksen tapaan muhkealla tiiviin näköisellä vaahdolla, jonka laskua saa hetken odotella. Haju on vahvan banaaninen, yrttinen, ruohoinen, sitruksinen, mausteinen ja ehkä hieman korianterinen. Maku on banaaninen (muttei niin vahvasti kuin odotin), kuivatun hedelmäinen, suklainen (tummaa), yrttinen, ruohoinen ja maltainen. Hieman alkoholiakin on joukossa. Suutuntuma on pistävän täyteläinen ja kirpeä. Kokonaisuutena mielenkiintoinen vehnis, jossa on särmää ja makua. Sopii omaan makuun oikein hyvin.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2013 Erg lekker bier. Halve liter, in een eigenzinnig glas. Mooie donkere kleur. Heeft tonen van vanille, rijpe bananen en rozijnen. Middel zoet met een lichte bitter. Eindigt in een makkelijk drinkbare karamel nadronk. Redelijk vol en een fijne nasmaak.

Rich aroma. Quite fruity and caramely, faint herbal notes. Very dark hazy amber colour, foamy head. Strong wheat note. Sweet malt. Low bitterness. Full bodied. Oily and dense texture. Medium carbonated. Alcohol is strong. Too much wheat for my taste.

Pours hazy medium-brown with a frothy butterscotch head. The aroma is of biscuity malt, vanilla and dried fruit. The taste is of roasted malt, with distinct lightness and cleanness for the abv. Medium bodied and nicely balanced all around.
Good wheat beer. Sweet to taste, banana and raisins are notable. Very much like it but, prefer hefewiesen style more but they are really similar and both good.
Bottle->SA. Medium brown with one finger offwhite head.  Aroma: bread, banana, yeast.  Taste: wheat, banana, raisin.  Bitter and disappointing. Not my style, evidently.

Pours deep brown, with red highlights. Fizzy eggshell white head, medium lasting. Lovely aroma - plum, raisin, rhubarb and banana, hint of port and some liquorice. Flavour is a heavy, syrupy sweetness followed by warming alcohol and more lush dark fruits. Big bodied but the fizzy carbonation keeps things from getting overly heavy. A lovely winter beer.
Eccezionalmente corposa e scura per essere una weisse, profuma di caramello e frutta. Quasi vellutata al palato è un piacere da bere.
Really nice beer got a couple for Christ mas enjoyed with Dinnir loved the smell of it

Bouteille 500ml. Nez de levures fruitées sucrées (bananes, léger dagrumes, notes de cerises noires et de prunes), épicé (clou de girofle, traces de cannelle), de blé, de caramel toffee sucré et légèrement rôti avec des notes dalcool doux. Assez ronde en bouche et moyennement pétillante. Goût de levures fruitées sucrées (bananes, agrumes, notes de prunes, léger de pommes et de raisins rouges), moyennement épicé piquant (clou de girofle, léger de cannelle) avec des notes de gomme balloune suivi dun goût de caramel toffee, moyen de blé, léger de sucre brun et légèrement rôti puis ensuite, lon retrouve une légère amertume dalcool moyen réchauffant et léger de houblon herbeux. Post-goût moyen-long, légèrement amer de rôti et dalcool avec un goût fruité (pelure de bananes et de raisins, léger zeste citronné) et des notes de blé.

Color: dark brown with a purple tint
Nose: sweet barley with a grapefruit heavy fruit salad
Taste: barley bread on the front-palate, grapefruit with barley in the background on the mid-palate, and earthy malt flavors with hints of grapefruit on the finish
Mouthfeel: smooth and velvety
Comments: very rich and flavorful, there is also good complexity and integration as the flavors flow across the palate, shows a polish that most beers lack

#60
Fruchtig-hefig mit Nelkenaroma. Die Vielfalt ist kaum zu beschreiben; ein Potpourri verschiedenster Aromen: Gewürze, Frucht, Hefe...unglaublich schön komponiert! Im Antrank wie ein wuchtiges, dunkles Hefe-Weissbier mit starken Malzaromen im Abgang. Die 8% Alk. werden durch die malzige Süße wunderbar abgepuffert und sind tückischerweise kaum auszumachen! Aber Vorsicht, dieser Stoff hat es in sich, denn die Süffigkeit ist stark ausgeprägt und kann fatal enden..
Einziger Schwachpunkt ist dieses dominant klerikal-violette Label mit dem dumm aus der Wäsche guckenden Pfaffen, aber das kann das sehr gute Ergebnis kaum trüben!
	
Test vom 17.11.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 12,14,14,12,10,13 - 12,90

Pint9 bottle labeled tap 6. Pours brownish red with off white head. Aroma of sweet malt and wheat. A very sweet aroma that is as enticing as one would want. Also i get a small whiff of banana.The flavor is about the same nice wheat flavor with the malt backbone. A very smooth dopplebock

Pours murky brown. Lively with thin head and minimal lacing. Banana, raisen,plum and chocolate on the aroma, lots of alcohol and dark fruit with a touch of liquorice. Chewy body. Lots of yeast character all the way through. Interesting and complex.

Aroma:  clove, spices, subtle banana and apple.  Appearance:  dark ruby with pillowy off-white head.  Taste:  spice, fruity esters, cocoa undertones.  Palate:  dense and malty, smooth and creamy, and fresh bubbly carbonation.

Pours a lovely medium brown, very hazy, with a low light tan head. Aroma of wheat,  coriander and winter spices, cloves perhaps? Also typical deep sweet aromas, raisin and maybe a hint of cherry. In any case, it smells delicious, and the taste doesnt let it down. At first sweetish with a clear taste of Belgian yeast and maybe brown sugar, then a more boozy, port-like sweetness through to the finish, which is long, rounded and sweet. Body is light to medium with a fair but not overbearing amount of carbonation. Very refreshing for the style and ABV.

Bottle thanks to Rian !! 
Head: small; white 
Colour: dark amber/brown 
Smell: some wheats and malts, unripe banana, mashed potatoes 
Taste: touch of anise, quite allot of herbs, banana, malty semi sweet undernote, slight booze, sweet dry end with almunds in the aftertaste, quite nice !

The Wheat Doppelbock is a bit of an obscure style but Aventinus is definitely the defining example of the style. A richness of flavours in which the Bavarian wheat beer taste is present but not overpowering revealing a variety of subtle flavours of which banana is the most pronounced. The 8.2 percent alcohol is well hidden.

Strong clove, banana nose with hnts of spice. Pours a cloudy dark amber with a mostly lasting tan head and considerable fine lacing.  The taste is primarily sweet but not overpoweringly so. Cloves and banana flavors up front, followed by malt notes and a slightest hint of bitterness in the finish. Medium body with soft carbonation. Creamy. Overall, this is an excellant beer.  Well balanced, tasty, and extremely enjoyable. Want to have again.
Pours with nice, one finger head. Smooth, spicy, raisins, clove, light hops. Perfect in my opinion. I forgot it was beer, as theres virtually no aftertaste. I could drink a gallon.

Pours foggy brown with high off white head which quite quickly disappears.
Aromas of banana, candy, some honey, caramel malts
Nice creamy, low bitter and quite sweet taste. Very nice round finish. Taste is wheat but a very sweet wheat beer and its lovely!
Looks great, smells great,  feels great, is great. Just keep it cool and dont refrigerate. Youll figure out the rest.

Had at Andreas Keller in Leavenworth, WA. Pours a dark amber brown with a huge foamy tan head. Fruity aroma with slight smell of banana perhaps, was hard to place. Surprised by the tartness of this beer though I enjoyed it. Slight sour apple notes. Full body, a lot of carbonation and very warming. Great beer.

Tap. Pours dark brown with thick, creamy off-white head; good retention and lacing. Aroma is caramel and bread malts, figs, spice, floral hops, dates, and sugar. Flavor is rich, sweet malt forward with a heavy dose of dark fruit esters and some floral notes and spice; lightly sweet finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

Draft at craft ale house. Pours hazy brown with a thick off white head. The aroma has brown sugar, dark fruit, quad like. The taste is medium sweet with plum, fig, raisin, and a dry finish. There is a little hoppy finish.

500 ml bottle. Pours chocolate brown with a medium light-brown head. Sweet caramel-coffee aroma. Hard to describe. Tastes spicy, fruity and chocolate-y. Pretty heavy. Mild, spicy, fruitty, chocolate finish.

Medium light-brownish head. Cloudy milk chocolate colour. Roasty wheat aroma with strong banana notes and some raisin flavour. Likewise roasty taste with coffee and caramel notes. Lightly bitter and wheaty finish. Fantastic beer.

Bottle. Pours cloudy muddy brown with a quick dissolving pinkish white head. Banana, raisins and apple puree aroma, sweet, yeasty, a little plastic taste. Full body, smooth texture, long phenoly aftertaste. Very Good.

Aroma: raisins, banana and grain
Taste: toasty, sweet malt and just a little hops to balance. Like a wheat beer made by Chimay.
Mouthfeel: Light, no real aftertaste, slight alcohol at the end.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draught at Ølbaren. Murkey brown - very big head. Ryebread. High banana. Rotten banana. Sweetness. Fruity. Candy bbrown sugar. Herbal. Thanks Jacob.

Bottle 500ml.
Pours hazy dirty brown with huge creamy beige head. Very nice lacing. Aroma is of bananas, yeast, sligth soap. Taste is of bananas, yeast, wheat, fruits, sligth acidity, sligth bitterness. Palate: Ligth-medium body. Overall: Good, but Im not a huge fan.

Dark brown colour with a large creamy head. Aroma of wheat and yeast with small hints of some tar and smoke. Also some tones of banana. Tate of yeast with som banana and red dried fruits (as raisins and plums). Some taste of spicies and a hint of alcohol. Round, creamy mouth feel. Complex feeling.

Pours cloudy brownish with small white head. Smells of bannana, yeast funk, pears. Taste is like pear juice and cinnamon spice. Sweet but subdued. Nice wheat flavor with a bit of spice. Very nice beer, and my first of the style. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home from drinkstore 
Pours hazy amber with toffee and bananas on the nose. Thick sweet and warming.

Color marrón turbio con una corona beige poco persistente, aroma a almibar de plátano y caramelo con matices especiados. Bastante cargada  de CO2, el trago es muy refrescante pese a sus 8%. En su estilo de lo mejor que he probado.

Jesus? Allah? Budda?  
not at all!   
There is one God only on earth:        He lives at Kelheim,  
and his name is:       
Georg Schneider.

This is one of my go to beers.  Its rich and dark without tasting burnt. Its powerful without having a strong alcohol taste.  If you like a strong beer that doesnt taste like burnt tar, then this is it.

On tap half pint at Gilly's Craft Beer & Wine in Rockville, MD. 

Cloudy, nearly opaque, translucent medium-dark brown with a large off-white  head and excellent lacing. 

Aroma of yeast, spice, wheat, banana and raisins.

Taste of yeast, spice, wheat, banana, raisins and caramel.

Medium/light body and high/medium carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Classic German wheat beer.  This is the one that got me excited about wheat beers when I went through that phase.  Lots of banana and wheat coming through.  Dark and murky, with yeast sediment.  Love this beer.

Location/Date:Bottle on November 19th, 2012.
Appearance: Pours a nice dark brownish red.
Aroma: Aroma of raisins, banana, faint licorice, faint yeast.
Taste: Wheat, raisin, faint licorice, banana.
Palate:Light body, creamy, hides alcohol well.
Summary: My 50th Germany rating!  The second most rated beer from Germany on RB, and the second highest rated beer from Germany on RB. A really nice tasting beer, and I think I could chug it if I wanted to as it doesnt taste boozy at all.

Color rubino scuro sl naso non entusiasma con note fruttate e maltatate. E in bocca che esce fuori una complessitá ed un equilibrio che riempiono il palato ed entusiasmano. Pane, caramello, liquirizia,prugna,vaniglia ecc...Assolutamente imperdibile!
from the nose to finish fantastic. fresh it is full of bananas and cloves as it ages it turns to a wonderful dark fruit

Wow.  If I had been given a glass and told it was a Belgian strong ale I would not have disagreed.  Big flavor, perfectly balanced fruity sweetness with a hint of tart. Hides its ABV well.  Based on the 2006 vintage.
This beer has strong aromatic and flavor notes of raisins and bananas while avoiding any sweetness and maintaining its hoppy beer roots. This is a huge plus for me.

This is as close as youll get to a Belgian in Germany. Dark brown color with thick, fluffy beige foam. Tastes of dried fruit (raisins, prunes, etc.) and some residual sweetness. Aromas of same with a little dark chocolate thrown in. Absolutely fabulous!

Murky reddish brown, dense white head; aroma of sweet malt, candy fruits and booze; taste of caramel, Christmas cake, marmalade with a hint of the usual banana and clove wheat beer staples, perhaps some cherries in there too; a full mouthfeel and a boozy finish; a somewhat decadent, complex winter wheat treat.
Pours cloudy dark brown, 1cm white head. Aroma - coffee, wheat, dried fruit, smoke. Slightly-sour-sweet taste, bananas, dried fruit. Finishes a little drier, a little smoky. Very complex, great beer
Just one of the best beers ever. If you like beer with character, you will love this. It has one of the best carbonation levels Ive ever seen. Absolutely first class beer.
Bottle. Pours very hazy brown color with nice white head. Aroma is wheat, banana, raisin, caramel, hint of alcohol. Flavor is wheat, banana, licorice, raisin, alcohol and even some vanilla maybe.

Tap @ the wharf. 
Pour deep murky brown, with a small dense white head. 
Aroma of prunes, dates, old hops, rasberries, slight coffee(?), weak spices. 
The taste is a little sweet upfront, with a slight bitter finish to it. Medium bodied, with an average carbonation.

Bottle to pint. Looks good; a semi-transparent brown with thin white lacing. Smells solid; of figs and other dark fruit, almost like a deep Quad. A little doughy too. Tastes like it smells with an average mouthfeel. Solid, but intense.

Bottle.  Pours a clear, deep brown with a good head that lingers for awhile.  It feels and tastes a little thin.  It has an overripe fruit kind of flavor that isnt as bad as it sounds.  Not as good as their eisbock.
One of my all time favorites! If you dont no, you better ask somebody!!! LOL! Fruity, banana, and chocolate; with dark malts!!!!!

50cl. Bottle. 
Poors cloudy ruby brown. with tan head. 
Aroma vanilla, dark fruits, dough, yeast, banana, roasted malts. 
Taste awesome mix of bitters and sweets, smooth, 
Mouth-feel creamy/dry. 
Wow this is a complex tasty beer. Loving it.

They say it only takes one hit to get you hooked. This is a lie. They neglect to tell you about the journey you took to get you there. The inferior, watered down crap they peddle in the mainstream. But you need to dig deeper, find the underground, search it out. You need a guide. My guide was called The Bish. There may have been stormy clouds overhead, I dont recall. I know there was a blockage that needed fixing, and bets were taken. The stakes were high. The winner got to sample the German. We waited nervously for news. I was probably hanging with the Dutch or the slutty Belgian, again, the details are hazy. Then came the call. The news was good. Fast forward several days and I found myself in a dingy office with The Bish. The underground was beckoning, a shady cartel going by the name of Cherry Reds may have been mentioned. The German was delivered. I rushed her home and suckled on her nipple. The hit was a game changer, life never to be the same again. Ive since found myself sweating over when and where the next hit is coming from. Poring over obscure names, words I dont understand, places I didnt know existed. All in the search of a kick, started by the German. Im being nostalgic tonight, thinking back over those 60 odd days. Ive had some fun but I know Ive only just begun my descent into the darkness. I resisted a Diabolus today, but I know Ill be back. Ive got the taste, and the itch needs scratching.
Bottle at tuulensuu, tampere. Dark brown color with white head. Nice aroma of rye bread, sweetness, wheat. Taste of wheat, nice sweetness but hops at the end. Balanced. Improved wheat taste.

Hazy darker brown with beige foam head, lacing to glass. Aroma is malty with fruit tone, raisin, banana. Taste is mixture of a bock and a weisse, interesting. Tones of caramel, fruits, but not too sweet. Dry aftertaste, littel bitter, little roasted nuts.

Pours a murky brown colour with a beige head, had to wait a bit for it to die down as it was huge at first. Nice banana smell, with some malt and slight yeasty smell, mostly banana though. Taste is quite strongly of banana, plenty of toffee too, lovely malty flavours, quite a sweet, desserty taste at the back of the mouth, extremely pleasant. Whilst you can tell its quite a big beer, the alcohol is hidden pretty well. Full bodied and thick, lovely sweet aftertaste. Shall have to get more of this!

It looks dark brown with a bit red something like chessnut. Aroma of bread,  rape bananas. Taste is perfectly balanced the alcohol is very well hidden is the back.. Probably the best doppelbock Ive had
Sweet, fruit, bready aroma. Plums, raisins, and a little boozy. Looks like dark iced tea with a thick off white head. Good medium bodied beer with fruity flavors and a hint of baked bean flavor.

Into a weizen glass. Two finger of tan head on a deep brown body.
Smells like bread, hay and a little licorice. 
Great balance of the bitter and sweet. Slightly more sweet with a touch of sour at the end.
Bubbly texture, moderate carbonation, slightly sticky.
Delicious.
Poured a watery brown with a large tan head. Aroma of banana, dark fruit and roast malt. Flavour of banana and some citrus fruit. medium to heavy mouthfeel with a lingering dry finish.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2015 Nebuloso color legno scuro con una schiuma pannosa di medio spessore. Aroma dominato da sentori di banana, nocciole, mele cotte, lievito e toffee; gusto molto simile, mediamente dolce e zuccheroso allinizio e acidulo verso il finale, compaiono anche note di zucchero caramellato. Corpo medio, effervescenza vivace e struttura setosa.

Poured from draught a hazy brown color with a 1-inch head.  It has a caramel aroma and taste with citrus overtones.  All around a great drinking beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Deliciosa, un sabor achocolatado, caramelo y plátano de las cerveza mas deliciosas que he probado

0.5l bottle. Brown body and beige head. Lots of banana in the aroma with caramel and some spicyness. Flavor is a bit more complex then the nose. Banana, caramel, reisins and spices. Warming alcohol. Very nice beer.
Det här var en helt okej öl, lite för mycket alkohol i smaken kanske. Utöver alkoholen så präglades smaken främst av jäst och malt.

Bottle. Pours cloudy brown with a large beige head, creamy that slowly dissipates with nice lacing. Aroma is wheat, caramel, banana, and grass. Flavor is lightly spicy wheat, sweet bready caramel malts, with notes of banana and grass. Lightly warming alcoholic finish, but otherwise the ABV is well masked. Body is full, carbonation is lightly prickly on the palate.
Pours hazy Brown with red hints. Boring banana & caramel with no soul. One more
Brown cloudy pour with a very thin head.  Taste is full of wheat, bread & bananas.  Aroma of yeasty bananas.  Mouth is heavy and chewy.  Very sweet.

From tap in Sörmanufaktúra (Budapest). Colour is dark-bornze and seems like a clouded must. Flacour is full with fruits. Quiete hard body but very low carbonation. The taste has a lots of falvours "heavy fruits" (mainly orange and banan). It means that its not the citrus style like a belgian wit. The weizen man can taste juts in the foul mouth. 
I ate a cooke to this beer. It was filtered in tea and hop and was a little bit spieced. The body was fixed with a lots of mascaarpone. This cooke was made directly to this beer from Sörmanufaktúra. After the pieces of cooke I tast much stronger the weizen, not only in the full mouth but in the whole lap and I taste a little bit hop too.

Bottle. Pours a murky brown, with a thin white head. Nose is unimpressive, but the mouth is a rich mix of malt, cidery notes and pumpernickel bread. Had this one in Seattle about a month ago and saw it again in Chicago, so I gave it another go. Nice.
Pours a weird murky brown with an odd green tinge. Aroma is spicy weird. Taste is also spicy weird. How on earth this monstrosity is rated so high evades me. Horrible.

Awesome beer!  Deep color and great taste!  One of my favorites of this style!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 7, 2014 Pours hazy brown with a big, frothy white head. The aroma is very rich and varied; it features ripe bananas and dark fruits with wheaty maltiness and strong spiciness. Taste is very sweet with flavours of banana, wheaty maltiness and spicy yeastiness prominent. Elements like raisin and plum add character. Hoppiness is mild. The palate is full bodied, the carbonation low. Alcohol warms but is well hidden in the taste. Long, sweet finish. Spiciness and the strong presence of banana are similar to Finnish sahti. Wonderfully balanced and drinkable despite the intensity of the taste, the sign of a classy beer if anything. Simply excellent - a wheat beer at its very best.

Dark brown with a huge head. Banana aroma. Lots of tasty dark malts and good carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very nice colour and a tasty smell of banana and a little bit of maracuja. Also very stable foam on top. A perfect taste until.the last drop was gone done into my throat ;-)

500ml bottle. The aroma is sweet and bocky, with a strong hefe yeast smell. Has a big, light tan head. The taste is of a strong, smooth bock flavor that finishes very sweet and dry. The mouth feel is very fizzy, so much so that it stings the inside of your cheeks. Overall, this is a decent beer, but mothing spectacular fo sho. I personally wish it would have a roastier dark malt flavor to balance out all the sweetness, but that is just me.
Reddish brown with a heavy off-white head. malty with fruity tones. Malt, fruit, roasted and bitter. Full body with a very nice bitter sweet finish.
Bottle. Pours a golden color with white head. Strong wheat aroma. Alcohol, wheat, dark fruit flavor.

500ml bottle of tap 6 aventinus. Pours black with some red tint, and a thick slightly off white head and plenty of carbonation. Smells of resin and herby hops with a small amount of doughy yeast. On the taste there is alcohol, slight buttery taste, nice long finish. some raisiny alcohol, slight vanilla

500 ml bottle. Creamy and heavy body, and quite lively in the beginning. Aroma of currant and blackcurrant, and honey among the different tasty flavours. The qualities are at their finest at around 7-8 degrees Celsius.
On my foray through four german beers in a day, this was the best of them. A really well rounded beer which was a little heavier than the other wheat beers of the day. Richer flavours. Good stuff
500ml bottle. Very fine, creamy beige foam, unclear, ruby, medium body. This beer has the tropical citruses and the sweet malty taste of a bock. Hop is only tracks. Good work!

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2012 Fra fat (og senere også fra flaske) på Cardinaltreff: et herlig, krydret hvetebock hvor nellik dominerer sammen med sødmen. Banan og sviskeplommer. En blomsteraktig smak og aroma når temepraturen stiger. Nam! Minst like god fra fat på Charlies Bar i København.
Dark copper, slightly unclear. Aroma of orange peel and ripe bananas with some vanilla. Refreshing taste, and pleasing aftertaste (which is perhaps not equally refreshing).

50 cl. bottle @ home // obtained thx. to drunkenaim in a trade // wow this is indeed deep and complex stuff // murky pomegranate brown copper, instantly gone cola head // smell is raisins, rum cake, lager-thing and lots of spices // sweet, dark fruits, lots of prunes, raisins, biscuit, lots of rum cake, heavy caramel, hint of banana, lots of brown bread, heavy on winter spices, tad bitter in the back, dried fruits, booze, like a meal, bread like with not much carb. almost hard drink, some damn fine stuff
Bottle from Alko. Dark color, beige head. Strong malty taste with plum, raisins, barnyard aroma and toffee. Strong finish with alcohol. Great brew.

Butterscotch, sugar and strawberry came through really strongly in this. Really good beer. Sweet, the alcohol was quite well hidden. Forgot to specify that I only wanted a half of it though, a pint at the end of a beer festival didnt end too well.

500 ml bottle. Pours a murky dark brown with surprisingly little head. Aromas of dark fruit, wood, roasted malt, and banana. Spicy flavor up front, (nutmeg and cloves), with roast malts, and a little licorice. Very interesting.

Pretty much beer perfection. Only thing it could do with is being a little less full and well flavoured as it can be a little hard to drink in great quantities. Wonderfully dark appearance, lovely taste...I salivate just thinking about it.

Pours a murky dull brown color with a finger or two fo ff white foam that settles out but maintains a solid ring around the glass. Aromas are wheaty, bubblegum, roasted malt and some spicy herbalness as well.  On the palate its well balanced with ripe dark fruit plums, raisins and banana.  Good carbonation keeps this beer interesting and lively.

La cerveza con la apariencia más bonita de todas las que he probado; pero no se queda en solo eso, su olor y su sabor son extraordinarios. Una de mis favoritas. Es tan grata que aun siendo una Bock, encima de fuerte graduación, tras varias tomas no se aprecia ni cansancio ni rechazo. Es genial...brutal!

A: Pours an extremely hazy dark brown color with an incredible yeast haze. Didnt pour any head whatsoever, unfortunately, so Im docking points.

After much agitation, I was able to get a one-finger offwhite color head with poor retention and lacing.

S: Plenty of banana, cloves, and bubblegum with an additional twist of caramel/toffee and some dark fruit. Unique, to say the least.

T: Aside from the typical weizen-esque ester flavors (banana, clove, green apple), this blends in a darker malt note, giving it a more savory feel and taste over a hefe or even a dunkel. The finish is crisp and very fruity, without being exceedingly sweet or tart. Decent complexity and balance, with excellent drinkability and no palpable alcohol taste.

M: Very well carbonated. The yeast gives the body some heft but never weighs the tongue down with excessive astringency, which is exactly what this kind of beer should do. Slight finishing dryness.

O: I expected this to be excellent...and it is. I tend to prefer my weizens to have a lighter malt profile, but the fact that I still enjoyed this immensely is a testament to its quality.

500ml bottle poured into a large wheat glass. Pours a shade lighter than most colas with a live two finger head and no lacing. Aroma and taste are banana, brown sugar, spices, and roasted malts. Finish is clean and drying due to the carbonation. Surprisingly, no alcohol burn even though its 8% abv.
Quite a rich fruity aroma with sweetness of dark fruits. Flavour has some dark fruits and also a bit of spicy yeastiness. Warming finish.
---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of banana, chocolate, spicy. Good flavor, banana dominates. For 8.0% beer, it seems fairly light. Very good!!!

Bottle on train from Nuremburg to Hirschaid, poured into glass - 27/04/12.
Pours a dark mahogony murky brown.
Wheat, banana, caramel, clove and a little hint of citrus on the nose.
Yeasty malty flavour with a dusting of choclate and then backed up all the way by banana, clove and little spice.
Great creamy mouthfeel, sightly chewy but the alcohol is well disguised.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: A nice marbled, cloudy kind of copper color with an average head, and a spicy, fruity aroma. Bananas, citrus, and malt in the flavor.  Crisp and fruity but not overly sweet, nice for a  hot day.
pours a dark ruby colour with slim head. aroma is caramel banana white flavour is banana light caramel and plum finish, very easy to drink almost no alcohol notes.
Solid. Definitely on the heavy end, not your typical summer quaffer. Still, the wheat flavors, especially the banana.

50 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20090315.
Pours murky yellow color with medium head. Aroma of wheat, spices and toffee. Flavor of banana, wheat, spices and some fruits.
Quite good hop and wheat aroma but in regard of its price not  better than other wheat beers
Durchschnittlicher Bock in der 0,5 Liter-Flasche. Kaum spezielles Weizen herauszuschmecken und auch die alkoholnote ist durchaus weniger wahrnehmbar. Ordentlicher Bock ohne große Überraschungen.

500ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy chestnut brown with very little light penetration, and a creamy off-white head.  Huge complex nose, with aromas of brown sugars, red fruits, dried fruit, yeast, banana, clove, pink bubblegum.  As for taste, much different than the nose would lead you to believe.  Coffee, and earthy notes, with a mild sourness, woodyness, red wine, and some citrus bitterness in the finish.  Not nearly as sweet as I was expecting.  Good stuff.
Very good weizen bock.  The raisin and banana mingle in an odd, but very tasty manner.  Smooth mouthfeel, medium body. Tried at the Cunigans tasting party in 2012.

A: Aventinus is a hazy brown with hints of rust orange, reminiscent of muddy water.

S: Wonderful aromas of banana muffins and wheat, with a faint trace of alcohol.

T: A really awesome beer. Perhaps the benchmark for this style. Its wonderfully easy to consume. It starts off similar to a dunkel weizen, but the bock character asserts itself, making this beer a very different animal. Earthy and bready, this brew has a fair amount of complexity. Banana flavors are prominent throughout.

M: Smooth, creamy feel. This beer goes down so easily. Theres a nice, very slight hint of heat in the finish.

D: My favorite weizen bock. If you havent had this before, you should try it ASAP. Very drinkable and enjoyable. Good for gulping or sipping :)
Best Beer tried to date. very diverse, root beer, yeast and licorice super present.
Malt bomb.  Banana, candy-sugar, sweet bread-dough, a trace of spice.  Dark brown color.  Taste is sweet.  Overall unbelievable.  I cant describe it in terms of words.
Good brew. Not a strong taste. The head is quite small whwn poured and when settled no to.little head. very enjoyable brew.

Dark amber with scant, creamy, beige head / Sweet, old nose  of banana, sour malt, raisin, and chocolate / Medium to full body, a touch watery with very light carbonation, sweet and moderately syrupy, and fair finish / Mellow, aged, slightly cooked flavors of raisin, date, banana, plum, chocolate, nut, and biscuit / This sample tastes of having some bottle age.  Just speculation but very soft and mellow.
Excellent doppelbock.  Sweet balanced caramel roasty fireside brew.  German alps basking on a bearskin rug.
Licorice and caramel aromas. Some enjoyable sour flavour. A bit fruity, like unripe bananas.

500 ml bottle from Whole Foods Market, SoMa, San Francisco, CA. Pours a murky dark brown color with a medium off-white head that decreases rather quickly. Aroma is very special, richly malty and yeasty. Clear notes of caramel, banana vanilla, clove, brown sugar, sultanas, nutmeg, Lapsang Souchong tea and christmas cake. Complex and layered, offering something new with every sniff. Taste is massive, sweet and spiced, complex and refined. In Belgium this one would be a Noël beer. I can taste all of the Weizen fruitiness with clear banana hints on parallel with the monstrous combination of caramel malts and christmas spices. Surprisingly light bodied, smooth with an oily texture. Finish is long and gives a lingering and sticky aftertaste. Incredible wheat beer!
Poured on draft.  Lovely hazy, deep copper color.  Not typically what I think of as a German beer, but if you see one, dont hesitate to try it.

Dark-ruby colored wheat doppelbock with a creamy fine head. Strong notes of ripe bananas, raisins and plums meet liquorice and roasty aromes. Full-bodied and warming, with a well-balanced and smooth finish.

0,5l bottle, shared by FatPhil & Anna. Soggy dark copper color. Medium thick head, stays. Yeasty, fruits, mild banana and spicy aroma. Quite lively brew. Thick body. Wheat, fruits, some sourness in flavor.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2012 Aroma has lots of fruits; ripe banana. Also herbs. Murky dark brown, almost black. Big frothy head is beige and medium lenght, only bit lacing. Taste is strong and lively. Herbs and fruits on top and underneath caramel malting that gets stronger as beer gets warmer. Medium to full bodied. Fizzy carbonation. Finish is sweet sour. A beer with strong character; lots of aroma and flavor. Nice body also, good balance and nicely nuanced.

Bottle at home. Has a slightly hazy brown colour with a large beige head. The head turns into a cappuccino-like one after a couple of minutes. The aroma is sweet with banana, dried fruit, wood, tar and chocolate. The flavour is also sweet and delicious with more banana, chocolate and vanilla, wood, dried fruit, leather and some alcohol. The mouth feel is incredibly soft, and with a light bitterness. A joyful beer but maybe a bit sweet, and the touch of alcohol increases with temperature.

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2012 This beer presents itself as a thick brown liquid with a long lasting tan head.  and noticeable bubbles that rise slowly through the glass. It smells beautifully of malty chocolate and caramel, perhaps some butterscotch and wheat. The taste is gently bitter with equal parts sourness. It produces a softly smoky, sour after-taste. I?d consider this a medium to full bodied beer. It has a creamy, thick and slightly oily texture, lots of carbonation and a long softly bitter finish. Overall I loved this beer. My bottle was differently labelled to that on this page, so initially I didn?t realise it was so highly rated, but I really like it.  This beer looks, smells and tastes great. It?s friendly with no hint of its alcohol content, and made for great company on a cold evening.

Malt aroma. Pours hazy orange-brown color with thick frothy light brown head that lasts long. Taste is fruity and light sour while finish is abrupt sour and oily. Body is light-medium, texture is oily. Carbonation is lively. Overall its an above average beer but I dont generally enjoy oily textures.

500ml bottle. Pours a dirty, opaque brown with fairly minimal head that sticks around. Dark fruit, nuts, spice and molasses on the nose with a grainy note. Lots of dark fruit on the palate and maybe some berries, raisins. Theres something candy-like in there...caramel maybe.

Bottle. Ruby brown with haze a little heed and think fleeting lace.  full sweet malty clove and dark fruit Esters.  Intense over type fruit at first followed by some nut and spice. It warms as it goes though it is cool and silky smooth with a oily spicy finish.  Just what I wanted. Awesome beer and a standby
Tasted:  bottle. Dark red- brown. Very thin head that lasts, streaks well. Sweet aroma lots of dark german wheats, hint of clove. Tastes light but very full.

The pour: one of the most enticing beers Ive seen with a deep mahogany-red and slight white head. The aroma: strong notes of banana with a bit of vanilla and clove, a bit of woodiness and something very fresh yet sweet not unlike mint. Sweet malts, a subtle caramel note can be found. The taste: on the palate it feels slick from the malts but very smooth. Starts off with an almost candy sweetness, followed by a dry bitterness and finishes with a well rounded sourness. The verdict: well crafted and brewed, the standard of greatness.

I believe this to be the best beer I have ever had.  Great in bottle if the bottle has been handled well (but i have had several mishandled bottles and they were bad).  On draft...this is simply heaven.  Well balanced and full in the mouth.  Great floral and citrus.  A fabulous dopplebock in every regard.  I drink it every chance I get

A delightful beer.  Pours mahogany with a flirty pale head.  Nose is subtle and moist with hints of apple.  On the tongue surprisingly light and airy.  Sparkling in consistency with immediate tart cherry followed by a flavorful apple cider.  Finishes with light toasty malt and a hint of alcohol.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2012 I purchased this based on a recommendation by an employee at the market. Overall, I was a fan. It poured brown, not much head. It smelled sweet and fruity, much like some Belgians. Tasted similarly, but surprisingly dry given its sweetness. It wasn?t very complex, but it did what it did well. At 8.2%, it was strong, but it hid it well. I?d have it again.

Could have sworn Ive rated this. Muddy, light brown pour with a dense tan head. Aroma is toffee, phenolics, and banana bread. Sweet breadiness up front with a touch of nuts that ends on spicy, fruity yeast notes. Medium bodied and not over the top yeast. Pretty tasty beer and exactly what I was in the mood for tonight.

Pours a mahogany amber color from the bottle with a nice tan head that dissipates and decent lacing. Aroma of german yeast, fruity esters, and maltiness. Taste is of the fruity esters and yeast more than the malts. Great for a german beer.

Aroma of alcohol, wheat, and perhaps some yeasty and fruit.  Dullish dark brown.  Surprisingly smooth and light for the abv.  A heavy dark beer that goes down smooth that reminds of summer.  Not very compex.

Botella de 500ml. Vaso Weizen. Saboreada en jun´12. Color ambar y apariencia nublada. Espuma beige claro y corona tupida y persistente. Aromas de levadura, pan tostado, sutil chocolate, fruta madura y maltas tostadas con fragancia que evoca al ron. Entrada de té dulce con trazos de banana. Textura de achicoria. Cuerpo medio y carbonatación moderada. Melón maduro en el intermedio con toque de toffee. Final de notas herbales dulces y matices anaranjados en el retrogusto. El ABV se percibe como una sensación cálida subyacente al primer sorbo. Una de aquellas cervezas que añoras incluso antes de acabártela.
500ml bottle. Weizen glass. Enjoyed on jun´12. Amber color, foggy appearance. Light beige froth. Close, lasting crown. Yeast, toasted bread, subtle chocolate, ripe fruit, toasted malt aromas & rum-like fragancy. Sweet tea-like upfront, hints of banana. Chicory texture. Medium body, moderate carbonation. Ripe melon in the middle, toffee touch. Sweet herbal note finish. Orangish hues on the aftertaste. ABV is perceived as underlying warming sensation at first sip & subtle spicy touch in the middle. One of those beers missed even before finish it.

500ml bottle. I got very little head off the pour, but some friends who got other bottles in this region this Spring are reporting the same thing. That notwithstanding this was a very nice dark beer, rather reminded me of a Belgian strong with the dark fruits and a little spice, but lighter and a bit more balanced. Slight earthy bitterness on the finish. Full bodied. Overall, a strange but enjoyable brew.

Thanks to Chipalsa for opening this up. Nose was full of fruit/fruit cake aromas and belgian style yeast and spices. Taste was sweet and full of fruity flavors. Easy to drink for the ABV. Some nutty flavors in the mix too, but more in the background. A nice brew for sure.

Through trial-and-error I finally got the right beer! The aroma was fruity and yeasty, like a fine Belgian style but with the fresh bread aroma of a Weizen. Incredibly drinkable, the flavors are full of spices, yeast and orange peel with a mellow boozy aftertaste. Only a tad bitter in the finish - this great beer is filling and delicious!!!

pours well with great viscosity, lovely little bubbles in the head. swilling/rolling the bottle picks up the sediment leaving a noticeable tract in the head. aroma is excellent and complex leading to a very complex but well balanced taste, a stunning beer and an absolute master class in its style.

S: hazy brown, white head, thick lacing, decent collar, tight carbonation

A: clove, spice, a little funky banana, light, sweet, enticing

T: almost sweet, mild, a little dry, refreshing, medium to long finish

O: really nice, balanced, yummy, very good, a must try

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smak och doft av karamell, bubbelgum, banan, vete och jäst. Lite för söt för min smak men frisk och syrlig.

Pours a dark copper color with a thick foamy head that lingers a long time.  Big aroma of plums, cherries, berries, oranges, and wheat.  Taste starts moderately sweet with the fruitiness, turns pretty tart by the finish.  High carbonation helps the flavor come through even more.  This all adds up to an amazingly smooth tasty beer.  This is a must try!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: SEP 20, 2012 BBE 3/12. Bottle from bierzwerg. Dark amberish hazy colour with medium head. Banana, wheat, yeast, sweet. Simply great beer.

Almost a perfect beer. Exquisite. The nose is full of bananas, clove, a touch of bubble gum. There is a lot of caramel with some wheat bread. The beer is   a deep clear brown until the yeast is poured in which leaves the beer a deep  hazy brown with a fizzy tan head that has some viscosity to it, but doesnt leave much lacing. The taste is again full of banana, clove, and caramel. The beer is full bodied and has a  velvet smoothness in the finish.

pours a dark amber from bottle.  little head and light carbonation - almost flat.  bad bottle maybe?  aromas of toffee and molasses.  taste of caramel, burnt toffee and some subtle fruit (banana, melon, possibly apple?)  burnt flavour stays on the palate with some metal.  Due to the apparent complexity, it turns out to be an ok beer, but lack of carbonation is unsettling making it somewhat unpalatable.  will have to try another bottle another time

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2012 Ottima birra. Colore ambra scuro, schiuma cremosa. Fruttata allolfatto e molto saporita in bocca dove appare molto bilanciata. Amaro non troppo persistente ma di facile beva nonostante il grado alcolico non basso.
chewing gum, banana, spices with caramel, short finish. sweet and spicey. nice.

Schneider Aventinus has a thick, fizzy, light-beige head and an initially clear, brown, bubbly appearance, that becomes cloudy brown upon swishing and pouring in the bottom third of the bottle. Not much lacing is seen with this one. Aroma is unique- cinnamon powder, wheat bread, molasses, spices, and fruit cake. Taste is of cinnamon, spices, nutmeg, yeast, pepper, monkey bread, nuts, and other things I cant pinpoint. Mouthfeel is light to medium, and Aventinus finishes refreshing, crisp, and surprisingly drinkable. Overall, this is an epic, world-class beer. I beg you to try it. RJT
deep amber with one finger head. nice sweetness, slightly fruity, maybe raisin or plum? quite complex and interesting. excellent unique beer.

Pours a wonderful dark amber with a light tan head.  Good aroma of raisin, plum, toffee, and vanilla.  Very bubblegum.  Taste is a touch lesser.  Vanilla stands out, the dark fruits are very apparent, and has a sour side as well.  Medium body, lots of acidity, with a sour aftertaste.  Pretty good recommendation from the bartender.
i was worried this had gone bad as it had a somewhat metallic aroma, but actually turned out to be ok. was tad sweet for my tastes, but a solid example of the style.

Bière brune trouble aux reflets ambrés, coiffée dune mousse comme on les veut. Au nez, des arômes de de caramel, de purée de bananes, de vanille et dépices bien dosées sen dégagent. En bouche, les fruits séchés, tels que les raisins (secs), les figues, les dattes étalent leur palette, avec une touche acidulé, qui sapparente au levain. Les saveurs restent longtemps en place pour un grand plaisir gustatif. Belle surprise. (230-130512)

Co-worker brought this beer over.  He had found it overseas while in the service.  This is one of his favorites and I see why.  Poors reddish with a creamy head.  Taste is of raisons which is sweet with a bit of bitter, spice, fruity finish.  Pretty smooth on the palate.  This is a really good beer.

This is hands down my favorite beer in the world.  It was when I first had this beer sitting in a beer hall in Zurich that I realized how amazing beer could be and the potential beer had.  It is smooth, and very flavorful.  Very unique if you are used to American style beers.  On the sweet side of the spectrum for sure but not as much as a pure weissbier.
Reddish brown. Some yeast, ripe banana, toffee caramel. Thick mouthfeel. Tasty. The ripe banana continues.-- rated with lankku
This one is very similar to the Weizen -Eisbock, but just not as thick and fulfilling. Same profiles, just a lighter taste with more raisins than caramel. We have to try side by side.

10/05/2012 Open Baladin Roma (tap). Ambrata carica, riflessi bruni, molto torbida, schiuma bianco sporca con venature giallognole, poco abbondante, abbastanza persistente. Al naso è un frullato di banana, con note di cereali, cacao, lieviti e spezie. In bocca è decisamente dolce, note di grano, frutta secca, cacao, banana, biscotti, caramella mou, un po stucchevole alla lunga. Corpo medio-pieno, carbonazione moderata. Buona, ma abbastanza deludente rispetto alle attese. Una birra decisamente sopravvalutata.
500ml bootle- A well rounded beer, with enough malt sweetness and hop bitterness to keep you interested. A nice sipping beer.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2014 500ml bottle. A murky reddish-brown with a decent creamy head, lots of small bubbles, medium retention. Sweet aroma of chocolate, plums, raisins, some mixed spices, toffee, a little alcohol. Taste dominated by alcohol and spices, pears and plums. Light for ABV. . 
2012 - 2.5/5*
2014 - 3.5/5*

Bière brune de 8.2 %. Beau col au versement, Texture de liqueur brune style Pepsi. Goût de sucre en bouche. Léger goût céréalier. Goût de réglisse noire diminué et aussi un goût de vanille (légèrement). Très bonne.

500ml bottle. Hazy dark amber with huge stable creamy lacing off-white to tan head. Wheaty, yeasty, spicy, decently hoppy aroma, dark berry bubblegum background. Smooth palate, malty and spicy taste, sweet, sourish and dry hoppy. Good, but without the "ultimate kick".
For a dopple bock it has a nice fruit laden aroma and a taste to match with a hint of caramel.

Ah, thats a fantastic brew. Perfect on a cold winter day, but in summer as well. Aroma of sweet caramel, nuts, ripe bananas and dark fruits. Medium sweet taste and average carbonation. Long sweet but not too sweet finish. Excellent stuff!

Bottle 0,5l - La 100 de beri
Appearance:Cloudy brown color, large tan head. 
Aroma: yeast, banana, cloves, caramel, flowers, alcohol
Taste: moderate to high sweetness, finished with a very lightly bitter sour finish. 
Palate: full body, creamy-thick texture, average carbonation, long finish
Overall: i would rather have a TAP 4 or 5 than this.
500ml bottle. Wheat and spicy aromas. Pours dark copper, very hazy. Medium body and average carbonation. Creamy texture. Sweet and roast and bread flavors, so much yeast. Quite enjoyable.

From the Bottle. Spice and hay on the nose with some esters. Pours with a  large lasting head. Smooth mouth feel, really nice sweetness coming from the malts and well balanced clove banana like qualities. Alcohol is well hidden. Very good. Has real bite and balance.
UPDATED: APR 28, 2012 Bottle at the Blue Nile. Amber pour with a big foamy head. Nose is malty, caramel, and dark fruit. Taste is banana and clove. Palate is moderate to full. Delicious.
500 ml bottle from Alko. Pours dark brown with off-white head. Plum, caramel, banana, flowers and toffee in the aroma. Very soft palate. Same components in the flavour as in the aroma. Really good.
UPDATED: APR 29, 2012 Cheers JoeMcPhee. spice, herb berry, banana malt flavour. Thin white head and lace. Refreshingly crisp beer. Tangy finish.

April 2010: The new style (TAP 6) bottle.

Poured into a Franziskaner Weissbier glass.

A deep off-white head sat on top of a moody reddy/browny coloured body, lots going on as bubbles rise through the beer to replenish the head.

Sweet malty/yeasty/banana/vanilla smells.

The taste is a toxic, vibrant, fizzy mix of the aforementioned aromas, a little too sweet in my opinion with the vanilla and banana flavours coming through the most. Add a large hunk of treacle toffee into the taste arena and youve got the right amount of sweetness I found.

The alcohol is well hidden and only arrives as you finish the beer, warming the mouth nicely. I expected more from this well respected and thought of beer, too sweet for me.

Bomb.com - clove and spices. Very complex, full bodied and pleasant. 

Bottle from bev warehouse. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown with a ruby tint. Malts and caramel nose. Layered, complex palate showing grain, sweetness and some candied fruit. Almost like drinking a Barleywine. Endless finish.

Very aromatic, with lots of floral hops and slightly yeasty.  Dark hazy caramel with a nice head.  Sweet, slightly sour finish with a tiny hint of bitterness if you look for it.  Very yeasty and heavy.
Little head, dark brown.bready nose with some caramel. Heavy. Some carbon. Medium body and length. Sweet and caramel.

This brew is about pleasure.
Poured a thick snow white head .. still the beer itself is quite dark, like mossy dark with some green colour, the appearence is beautiful .... mouthwatering.
Perfectly masked .. there is a smooth tiny wee tingle of alcohol .. just perfect.
Quite complex, but the palate gets the lowest score .. cause it faints rather fast .. 
I would be very happy host this brew to any guest .... This is only wonderful.
Bottle at the Fiddler.  Hazy amber brown pour with off white head.  Aroma of caramel and banana.  Big fruit flavour with malt, citrus, Yeast and a little licorice.  Very complex
This was a big beer for me. Made me see how interesting they could be. Dark and rich for a wheat. Chocolate and banana. Lovely.
500ml bottle. Aroma is fruity, toffee and caramel. Appearance is brown almost black with a two finger head. Taste is yeast, slight banana with soft carbination. Overall a very good beer.

Draft at Bierstube. Poured a murky brown with a thick head that reduced but never left. Full body. Nice mouthfeel. Medium-dark toasted wheat. Light spicy flavors. Allspice. Cinnamon. Clove. Nutmeg. Hints of dark fruit. Everything blends well. Slight bite on the tongue. Bit of malty sweetness but reads dry overall.

Bottle from BevMo, on sale. Aroma and flavor of caramel malts. Lots of head, German yeast, not much else to add...a classic. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap, Weisses Brauhaus, Munich. And Bottle, home, from sorspecialista.hu. 
Aroma of fresh rice and citrus, later everything is lost. Light brown head which is diminishing very early. Muddy, hazy silky viscousness, and a lightly soft carbonation. Taste is incredible complex: firstly mix of yeast and earth, then malty, citruses, fruits. Alcohol is very well-hidden in the thick body. I think is the main force of this beer is the very well-balanced, still complex tasta. Good one, keep on brewing Georg!

Cloudy copper body with a thin off white head. Sweet, strong aroma including notes of banana and hay. Sweet, refreshing flavor of banana, cloves, dark fruit and yeast. Finishes smooth with lingering touch of banana and wheat. Palate is medium bodied, smooth and just a little fizzy.
A refreshingly unique beer. You will be hard pressed to find another brew that tastes like this one

Pours a hazy brown colour. Big aroma, unfiltered, malted, brown sugar, slight bit of alcohol in aroma but it is mostly about the esters banana and cloves. the palate is rich, malted and has a certain banana bread flavour. rich and tasty brew!

Herber, weicher und vollmundig malziger Beginn. Die vorhandenen Hefenoten werden in den Hintergrund gedrückt, vor allem die Herbe steht ihr im Weg. Gering alkoholisch, ab dem Mittelteil stark bananig. Weiterhin weich, neben der nun stärkeren Hefe tritt nun das Malz aktiver hervor und schafft röstige Noten. Dann kommt die bananige Hefigkeit noch deutlicher zum Vorschein, kurz ist auch der Alkohol erkennbar. Langer dunkler, süß malziger Ausklang. Spitzenbier! 12/13/12/13/11/13

One of my favourite beers. Awesome mouthfeel, nice taste with some bitter and sour after notes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Stunning, stunning beer.  So much flavour, manages to deliver without being overpowering.
Excellent beer. Nice fruitness of vanilla,  banana and clove. Drank a 500 ml.....never made it out the bottle...tasty. This wheat beer is a keeper.

500ml bottle poured into a weizen glass.

Pours a hazy dark brown making sure to get the yeast sediment out of the bottom of the bottle.

Smells of banana, clove, and bubblegum. Wonderful yeasty character. Little bit of grass in there as well and maybe just a faint hint of alcohol.

Taste begins with strong clove and banana changing to some dark fruit; plums and a pretty strong cherry flavor. A little bit of pipe tobacco comes towards the end finishing up with a passing taste of alcohol. Mouthfeel is smooth and a little sticky at the end.

Wow, this is an amazing beer. It really surprised me in that the alcohol is very well hidden and it is a truly refreshing beer. Wonderful combination of flavors going on. Ill have to pick up another bottle very soon.

16.9 oz bottle pours brown with a tan head.  Aroma of spices and malt.  Taste is sweet, spicy and good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shared 0,5 l bottle at Cardinal as Schneider Weisse Unser Aventinus Tap 6. Murky muddy brown body covered by a creamy, light brown head. Ripe banana, honey and malts on the nose. Sweet, light bitter, light spicy flavors. Sharp carbonation, light metallic mouthfeel. Full body.

Appearance: Deep unfiltered reddish brown. The body has a nice sheen. Long lasting khaki head.

Aroma: Yeast is the major player in this bottle fermented bock. Clove, vanilla and big fruity esters come to play. Plum and pear. Bouquet of Candied sugar, light caramel and bread from delicately roasted malts. I also pick up aromas of scotch and rum. 

Taste: Sweet and soothing. Cola-like. Tart fruitiness. , orange and cherry. Finishes dry and grainy with notes of cocoa. Spicy. 

Palate: This feels great in my mouth. It is much finer than other weizenbocks. It is almost liquer like. Silky and and smooth. Touch of grain and long finish. Spicy and tingly, slight touch of alcohol.

Overall: A phenomenal beer for a cold spring night. Would pair amazing with German cuisine.

0,5 l bottle from Systembolaget. Dark red beer, thin, but lasting head. Aroma: banana, clove, spices, caramell and sweet malt. Youll find all the aromas in the taste plus extra malt sweetness. Smooth mouthfeel. No taste of alcohol what so ever. Great beer.

500mL bottle from the LCBO. Pours a hazy brown with a thin head that dissipates slowly. Smells like malts, banana, and maybe a tiny bit of alcohol and grains. Palate is a bit watery with some fairly active carbonation. Taste is pretty good, some cinnamon and spice mixed with malts, and a slight alcohol aftertaste. Pretty good, but not the best.

500mL bottle from LCBO. Poured slightly cool, a deep murky reddish chestnut with a large fluffy off-white head that left no lacing.  Aroma is rich in banana, clove, cinnamon and allspice, sweet caramel malts, bready yeast and plummy fruit. Flavour strong in caramel malt but with nice spices, some banana, breadiness and something almost like vanilla (wood?). Finishes fairly dry but with light bitterness and a little booze, and lingering flavours. Mouthfeel is full and creamy with fairly high but smooth carbonation. Like a doppelbock crossed with a dunkelweizen, a great sipping wheat beer.

From notes.
Pours a dark ruby brown, off-white head disappears pretty fast and leaves a thin film.Nose is spicey, yeasty, bready, a hint of banana.
Big rich flavors. Clove, lots of spice bread, tobacco, a tiny bit of metallic taste, some fruit.
Nice mouthfeel. Medium carbonation, medium body, pretty clean finish with a nice lingering after taste.
This is one of my favorite wheat beers.

500ml bottle. This is a whole days supply of calories in a bottle. One or two of these and you dont have to eat any more the rest of the day...
Murky chestnut brown in color, with a nice little off-white head. Aromas packed with cloves, caramel, sweet malts, plums, some banana, and lots of good yeast. More full than medium body. Faint bitterness, as the malt is in the high seat. Medium sweetness. Well masked alcohol. One of my favorites.

I tried this one again tonight and said WOW for this first time in 2 weeks and 30 different beers.  500ml bottle pours a murky chestnut brown with a small off-white head and practically no lacing.
