Nose is full of cloves. caramel, and barley malts.  Aroma also includes plums, cherries, and -as expected from a doppelbock - lots of yeasty bread.  Ive never tasted anything else similar to this one.  Has a medium to full body, lots of carbonation, and an initial sweet taste.  This one is a sipper.    My all-time favorite beer is the same brewerys Eisbock version of this, but their regular wheat doppelbock comes close.

Brown pour with lots of red underneath,mild foamy head.
Sweet malt aroma,spice-clove,candy fruit.
 Same in taste  but bready,creamy,smooth/slick with fruit plum very slight chocolate but more of a carmel .maybe  a bit of cherry.
Slightly peppery finish turning mildly tart but is very smooth,more cherry /plum in the finish also.Nice beer

Wow, what a great beer! One or the strongest weissbeers, with a nice aroma (winy, spicy). Hints of cinammon, cloves, within a flavor reminiscent of prunes and grapes. Alcohol is noticeable, but it has some sweetness. Aftertaste with spices present. A truly enjoyment, better drik it with patience, because it goes up the head pretty fast

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2013 Bottle (500 ml). 1+ year old. Hazy reddish brown with a medium creamy off-white/beige head that diminish to leave a fully lasting ring of foam. Aroma of banana, spices, fruits, chocolate, alcohol, liquorice and light caramel. Taste is slightly to moderately sweet with wheat, banana, spices, chocolate, liquorice, dark fruits and light alcohol warming. Medium to full body. Good carbonation. Mouthfeel is liquor-like. Very good Weizen Bock. Complex. Really well made. Glad its widely available.
I definitely picked up on the clove aroma with this beer. It has a gorgeous dark color and slightly sweet beginning to the beer. It tastes light, but has a heavier, but pleasant feel to it.
The aroma is very spiced with a toffee note. Flavor is more of the same. I am not experienced with this style, so I dont have much to compare this to. I liked it and will try more for comparison.
Bottle thanks to mar, pour is a brown, with white head..nose is caramel, wheat, toffee,bananna, clove...Taste is caramel, malts, dark fruits, sugar..sweetness on the palate.

Aroma is floral, with a smoky, sour finish.  Appearance is a murky, chestnut brown - off-white head that dissipates fairly quickly.  Then the fun begins - the taste is unlike anything Ive had before and I may need to re-rate after I try again.  Bready, sweet, malt taste slightly woody.  The finish is outstanding.  Little to no bitterness, just slightly sour, malty, and rich.

Appearance- Pours a cloudy reddish brown brew with a 2 finger brown head with good retention.

Aroma- clove, banana, caramel; medium to high intensity, medium to high sweetness, low sourness.

Taste- clove, banana, cider ; medium to high sweetness, medium sourness; great balance.

Palate- medium bodied, well hidden abv, starts sweet ends sweet and sour;

16.9 oz bottle poured into a weizen. Pours dark reddish brown with ruby highlights. Huge, rocky off white head that slowly settles into a thin cap. A bit of lace. Rich, clove aroma with secondary wheat and dark fruit aromas. Enticing. Flavor is sweet, rich with dark malt and wheat. A hinto of spice may be found. Moderate in body with prickly carbonation. Flavor was much more complex than I am able to describe. This was delicious.

10/25/2011 Comes on like a floral abbey dubbel then leaves with a soft weize kind of taste.  Smells sweet and inviting.  Rated this as the wrong one at first, had to switch my rating over. Confused this rating with another beer earlier, just switched it over to the right one.

E un monumento alle Weizenbock!  Qualcosa di fenomenale! Un ottimo equilibrio di sentori dolci e fruttati (prugne, banane) con qualcosa di cannella. Finale vellutato, persistente e alcolico, leggermente dolce.

Bought in a bottle. Pours a lovely, thick, warm brown colour. A satisfying, dense and lasting head is bettered only by a beautiful aroma of milk chocolate and caramel. A brilliant balance of sweet and sour flavours make it an excellent, well rounded beer. Medium to high carbonation and a lasting finish, like a good Dandelion and Burdock with a hint of banana!

Pours a deep, opaque black-brown with a tall, persistent head. Aroma of bananas, coffee, cloves, and chocolate, with some raisin or plum on the back side. Heavy across the palate, slightly earthy taste with the yeast notable at times, and finishes with dry bitterness balanced by the sweetness of the next sip. Certainly should be served on the warmer side to mute the esters that rise when cold. Overall excellent balance of sweetness and strength.

Bottle 0.5l as "TAP6 unser Aventinus". Pours murky dirty brown, cloudy , yeasty with beige creamy lasting head, with some lacing. Nose is vague cholocate, raw cacao beans, apricot, honey melon, berries, licorice. Palate is medium full-bodied, little tart crispy, watery. Carbonation lively medium mouthfeel. Taste is wheat malty, sweet, caramel. Aftertaste is sweetish little dry, yeasty. Finish little dry and flavours of tiramisu, ABV well hidden. Overall nice, very smooth Weizen bock, however not that special more of  an average Weizenbock. Not up  e.g. to comparison with the Weizen-Eisbock Aventinus.

aroma, dark fruits, mingles with yeast esters, 
color, dark meduim anber, good head retention, 
taste, fruity clove esters on the front, slight sourness, balanced well with the malt profile, some carmel sugars
overall, standout brew, want to try their weizebock!
user_location: @RED BHUT JOIKIAS!, Paulsboro, New Jersey, USA

text: 500 to pint, beige lilting head atop muddy red belly encapsulating mulled spice cider with weaving roasty malts. Lively fizz lends to pleasant creamy mouthfeel as sweet sour dimension carries it all to refreshingly dry finish. Ever unfolding range of flavors with  time in glass.

Bottle. Pours dark brown, with a thick creamy head. Aroma is burned malts and peat, with some caramel and chocolate. Flavour is chocolate malts, cocoa and caramel. Sweet, and very heavy, with a lightly burned finish.

Pours a murky medium dark brown with orange hue, thick off-white head, little lacing.  Aroma obvious of wheat, hay, lightly roasted malt, and spices.  Flavor matches well and makes for an extremely solid beer that I associate well with Frankenmuth and german dinners.

Keg in Euston Tap. Colour is cloudy brown, white foam head. Nose is very fruity. Ripe fruit, banana, some sour yeast, like touch of Belgian sour, spices, clove. Taste is very ripe fruity, burnt caramel, stewed apple, sour Belgian yeast, sweet brown sugar. Lots going on in this and its strong stuff. Bit of a sipper but nice.

This is the first beer that I can honestly say I feel in love with.  The long lingering crisp head contrasts wonderfully with its complex brown color with swirls of caramel.  The flavor is complex and full bodied yet is still light on the tongue because of he type of fermentation and carbonization.  Drink it whenever you get a chance.

From notes.  First reviewed 2/3/2011. "Poured from a 500 mL bottle into a pint glass.

Aventinus comes out of a classic German bottle. The pour is a plum / brown color, with resplendent carbonation rising, presumably throughout the glass, but only visible right at the edges. These bubbles nobly rejuvenate the eggshell foam cap. Originally enormous, the head becomes manageable after a few minutes, and a sheet of lace is left down the side of the glass.

The smell is toffee, brown sugar, raisins, apple cider, and a bit of vinegar. 

I get some more spice elements in the flavor as this warms, which helps it out. It starts with a brown sugar sweetness, bringing some raisins with it. A spice variety comes up next, with the cloves coming through more as it warms. It turns almost cidery toward the end, with fermented apple dominating. The finish is spiced apple, a touch of vinegar, and a dash of brown sugar.

Crisp, tingly carbonation is obvious. It gets creamier as it warms up a little bit. It starts a bit dry then gets slightly acidic, finally finishing fully dry. Above average carbonation and a medium to full body.

Maybe I need to give this another try, but it really just is not as good as I was expecting. The aroma is interesting, but the flavor just comes up a bit short.

Bottle from Hyvee in West Omaha, NE, USA
Poured into a Weihenstephaner weizen glass
11.340 stamped on label.

Pours a big, fluffy, hefeweizen-style off-white head that bubbles down to a centimeter-thick layer of tiny bubbles for the duration of the drinking session. As the foam descends, it leads to modest lacing on the sides of glass, giving one a clear view of beers deep mahogany color under normal lighting and light amber or garnet colors when held up to the bulb. Smoky and hazy in appearance due to the yeast, allowing just enough light through to see shadow imprints of my hand on the glass. Nearly perfect.

Aroma opens with musty yeastiness, bananas, and mild wheat malt.  This is followed by a solid brown sugar scent, concluding with dark, dried fruit aromas, such as prunes, with added mild alcohol.

Taste opens with strong, dark wheat malt joined closely to flavors of vanilla, brown sugar, and prunes or figs.  General pie spice spiciness is present, a bit of nutmeg joined to the heat of cloves.  Closes with slightly tart wheat malt and caramelized sugar sweetness joined to modestly detectable ethanol.  Aftertaste is of wheat malt twang with caramelized sugar and mild yeast.

Medium to medium-heavy body with modest carbonation that leads to a pillowy, comfortingly smooth mouthfeel. Mildly bitter, dry aftertaste that leaves one wanting more.
Pours a hazy dark ruby-brown.  Smells of banana, clove.  Taste is sweet-wheat, notes of banana, mildly fruit cocktail like but without the syrupy sweetness.  Almost no note of hops.
What else is there to say? One FINE World Class beer that others will be judged by.

Pours a dark ruby.  Has an impressive foamy bleach white head.  The aroma is slight indistinguishable tropical fruit and mild bread.  The weizen yeast deffinately shows through.  Their is a slight warming end note.
UPDATED: FEB 28, 2012 Gorgeous, unfiltered chestnut brown color. Sweet yeasty after notes. Toasted malts and floral hops. I saw someone drinking it an ordered it on appearance alone. Im glad I did.
Pours cloudy brown with a small head. Aroma weisse, banana citrus. Very balanced weisse bock all the way. Awesome stuff. Not Bad.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2013 Keg at Euston Tap. Chocolate brown colour with tiny golden head. Aroma is cream, wheat, caramel, bubblegum. Bit of spice. Taste is sweet, appley, caramel and toffee, slightly floral and lots of booze. Initially a bit prickly and then very smooth. Some fruitiness in there too, berries and something sweet. Quite thick, and very nice. 9,3,8,3,15. Re-rate at Lush Life on tap. Golden brown, thick creamy golden head. Aroma is spicy bananas, slight smoke, cream, wheat. Taste is banana again, rich fruitiness, cherry maybe. Full bodied but easy to drink. Something herbal later on. Hides the alcohol well.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2013 Uit de fles.Amberkleurig. Ruikt wat azijnerig. Smaakt bitterzuur , kauwgomsmaak, wat banaan - citroen en kruidnagel. Fruitig met de  wat typische weizensmaak. Niet te koud drinken,dan komt de fruitige smaak beter naar voren.

Vintage 2011. Tap @ Bierfestival Horst. Ruikt en smaakt zurig, banaan, rozijnen. Ik vind de flessen versie beter.

At Alquitara, 50cl bottle. Brown with an off-white head, good lasting, perfect lacing, creamy, large and frothy. Aroma has toasty malts notes, slightly sweet and hoppy. Flavour to dry fruits, mild citrus notes, dense on palate and a final slightly bittery with an average duration. Carbonation is low to medium. Texture is oily. Body is medium to high.

From the bottle poured a cloudy brown brew that smelled of bubble gum and a hint of sour. Head reminded me of a parfait, thick and light brown. Tastes of malt, a hint of bubble gum, and barely hopped- like I like it.
Bottle. Medium brown with voluminous head. Smells like sour cherry. Tastes a little sour and then sweet. Bit of a clingy sweet after taste.
Dark brown colour. Bubblegum aroma. Taste of caramel and dark malts. Hides its alcohol level well
Appearance is small white head with deep brown. Aroma was a sweet citrus. Taste is a nice wheat citrus with a strong alcohol kick. Overall very good.

oooh  bottle   dark ruby brown with thick beige lingering head . yeasty banana clove raisin aroma .medium carbonation  . smooth medium body  luscious mouthfeel . sweet bready spicy taste which lulls then comes back marvellously with a little bitterness, sharp apple and spicy juicy long finish . A satisfying alcohol warmth appears in the throat long after the swallow .Evil  - it is far too easy to drink  !
Dont remember the exact taste, but it was definitely a great beer to taste! Ill update this ratin if I have the chance to drink it again.
En rigtig god øl fra det München, hvor jeg har så mange gode minder fra. Det fås tilmed også enkelte steder i DK
BOTTLE. Full aroma of clove, banana, smoke, vanilla. Taste is fruit, wheat, caramel, scotch, and earth. Medium bodied.

Brown with amber hues and thick creamy off-white head.  Aroma of sticky, fruity malt, gingerbread, light spice, banana, brown sugar, candy and clove.  Lightly bready and spiced with biscuit and refined malt sweetness.  Fairly well-attenuated with a slightly dry prickly carbonation.  Some alcohol warmth on the finish.  Trailing sweet biscuit and toasted malt.  Classic, classic weizenbock that is far too drinkable and will sneak up on you quickly.

Dark caramel color.
Strong tastes of syrup,caramel, brown sugar.
Super intense beer with a really nice alcohol level.
Not for everyday use, but really worth trying.
bottle.  brown, copper pour with little head.  banana, brown sugar, spice,.  smooth. nice beer

Pours hazy brown with a very small brown head.  Nose is caramel, raisins and figs.  Flavor is sweet, with a very small hop bitterness and a tinge of sour at the back.  Mouthfeel is soft and creamy, good long aftertaste.  One of Germanys best high production beers.

Bottle at Håndtverkerstuene. Pours hazy dark amber with a white head. Aroma of banana, wheat, yeast and spices. Very rich, sweet taste. Not much bitterness, but not too sweet either. The alcohol is very well integrated and hardly noticable. This is one of my favourite beers and it is dangerously easy to drink.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2013 (Flasche) Es hat eine dunkelbraune, fast undurchsichtige Farbe, eine starke Hefetrübung und eine fast weiße Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist stark malzig, schwer, ein bisschen erdig, süßlich und etwas alkoholisch. Der Geschmack ist vollmundig, schwer, süßlich und ein bisschen säuerlich. Bittere ist nicht vorhanden. Die Karbonisierung ist gut. Zusammengefasst; lecker und ein bisschen hinterfotzig.

Pours a n opaque brown with big frothy head. Nose is banana esters with slight clove and smoke. First sip is malty deliciousness with huge brown malty and strong yeasty tang. Finish lingersbwith clove and nutty qualities.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, one of the greatest beers in the world.. banana, mango, tropic fruity aromas, nice flavors, smells like a dream, wonderful beer..

Pours a ruddy brown with a decent creamyish foam head. Nose is cherry and chocolate and bananas. Taste is fruit and nutty chocolate with a nicely balanced caramel malt and recessed hops on a medium tongue. Nice.

chocolate, coffee, herbs, barnyard, leather, alcohol, soy sauce, woody, smoke, vanilla, brown, sparkling, frothy, rocky head, heavy cloying sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, creamy, flat, long finish,

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2012 Vorausschickend: Ich bin kein Starkbier-Freund. Dieses jedoch ist außergewöhnlich. Große Klasse in jeder Hinsicht, technisch sowieso. Aber auch beim Trinken, selbst für wenig geübte Gaumen, erschließen sich einem Geruchs- und Geschmacksaromen, die einen verwirren, einem neu vorkommen, ja nachdenken lassen, daß Bier nicht einfach nur gebraut wird. Daß Braumeister Ideen haben. Komplex, aber nicht unzugänglich, alkoholisch, aber niemals störend, dennoch ist diese Kraft durchaus wahrnehmbar, trotzdem fordert der Aventinus noch mehr von ihm zu trinken. Erscheint nicht nur in illuminierten Momenten wie eine Quadratur des Kreises. Masterpiece.
Poured a cloudy brown color with aroma of wheat, clove, bubblegum, and banana.  Flavor is the same with a touch of spicey yeast comming through.  Real drinkable for the abv in the beer.
Cloudy Golden Brown, clover and banana. Good rounding. Alcohol flavour. Fruity and sweet.

Doftar aprikos, banan, skumgummigodis (sockerbitar) och lite kardemumma. Smakar åt hållet som den doftar med maltiga toner. Lång eftersmak med lätt beska. Slutsats: God, komplex och den höga alkoholhalten avslöjar sig själv genom att endast värma lite på slutet.

Mörkt brun med viss grumlighet. Beige klassiskt kraftigt weissbierskum. Doften är komplex med jäst, bröd, lätt citrus, kryddor, fikon och torkad frukt. I smaken försvinner en del av detta och citrus och banan tar över. Dock en god och välbalanserad öl. Ett utmärkt weissbieralternativ när sommaren övergår i höst.

Bottle (500ml from Peckhams, Glasgow):
This one is much like a traditional hefeweizen in smell to begin with, there is a lot of clove and banana along with some nice spice and a hint of bubblegum. In addition to this there is also a light caramel aroma.

Light brown colour with a large, three -finger sized head that is a brownish white in appearance, foamy in texture and has very good retention.

Banana & clove flavours with some bubblegum. There is a bit of grain & alcohol in the taste too as a result of the 8.2% abv. but this doesnt negatively affect the beer too much. There is a hint of caramel and a mild bitter end.

Smooth and well carbonated with a creamy, sweet feel to the drink and that it went down rather well.

This one had a good wheat taste with the caramel complimenting the banana, clove and bubblegum flavours very well in both taste and smell. It was a great beer and the huge 8.2% abv. was mostly very well hidden.

1001 Beers to try before you die:

Bottle from Peckhams Union Square, Aberdeen. It pours cloudy dark brown, with a thin tan head. The nose is fruit cake, spice, banana and currant. The taste is caramel, toffee, Scottish tablet, spice, banana, currant, plum, fruit cake, molasses and wood, with a fruity finish. Full body, fine carbonation and sticky mouth-feel. Tasty stuff.

Poured from a 500ml bottle from the LCBO. Cloudy dark amber color with tall, but not long lasting foamy head.  Aroma is sweet, wheat, bananas, toffee and spice. Flavor follows the aroma, with noticeable dried fruit, figs, alcohol and fizzy carbonation. Nice lingering slightly sweet aftertaste.
Mahogany red in color... Aroma of cloves, toasted bread... Flavor is bready and wheaty, with sweet notes of banana and caramel... Very easy to drink, very enjoyable....

Bottle (past its shelflife unfortunately). Dark brown pour with a good white head. Caramel, bread and brown sugar in the aroma. Pretty carbonated. Mostly caramel, brown sugar and weizen hints. Good combo between a Dubbelbock and a Weizen. Alcohol well hidden. Expected a bit more from this one. Perhaps I  must try a fresh bottle. But overall, nice beer!

Dark-brown color.  Medium white head.  Has a creamy texture and feel.  Has very evident bread and banana notes with a dry semi-dry finish.  A sweet beer but not too sweet and it hides the alcohol well.  Overall an excellent weizenbock.

Pours a cloudy raisin brown with a 2 finger thick white head.  Smell starts very yeasty and bready with hints of dark fruit, figs, and banana.  Noticeable alcohol on the first sip.  Lots of good spiciness, with banana, bubblegum, and dark chocolate. Mouthfeel is creamy and smooth, but gets sticky.    Medium bodied. Pretty complex but very well balanced.  A great beer and enjoyable to drink.
Pours a dark brown, with a soft creamy head.  Nice aroma, banana, cloves with chocolate malts.  High alcohol, yet its lost in the full robust flavour of the beer itself.
Tap - big foamy head, very dark amber color, sweet malty, spice, complex flavor and aroma, almost reminds me of a belgian type of beer

Från start till mål en helt fantastisk öl. Grumligt mörkbrun kropp med ett evighetslångt krämigt skum. Stora vackra dofter av en blomsteräng där någon placerat ut ett antal väldoftande frukter. Smakar melon och citrus och aningen av honung och vanilj. Lite lagom sur eftersmak. Ljuvligt helt enkelt.

Bottle at Rockaway Seafood Co. Poured into an Aventinus glass. Very unique glass, perfect for the style. The aroma is awesome. Freshly baked banana bread with a pinch of clove. Full bodied, sweet, wheaty, spicy, rather high carbonation. The finish is very long and complex, with more banana, vanilla, and fresh berry flavors. Very smooth wheaty palate. Alcohol well hidden. The 16.9 oz. bottle gets a bit cloying at the end.
Généreuse, onctueuse, effervescente à souhait, brune rougeâtre opaque, pas trop damertume, arômes complexes et subtils.  Bonne bière.

Pours a brown opaque color with a nice off-white head. Aroma is sour bananas, cherries, and bread. The taste has a slight lactic actic Brett characteristic to it, some banana, bread, raisins, and a touch of alcohol thats very well hidden. This is a fantastic beer, Im really pleasantly surprised.

On tap at Flipdaddys. Menu had it labeled as a doppelbock, but the weizen bock label here does indeed make more sense.. No head on this sample, but really a really nice varied brown-red-tan color. Very hazy to the point of being opaque. Light carbonation, very drinkable. Good, fresh tropical fruit taste, some wheat / orange peel aftertaste. No obvious alcohol.

0,5l bottle from Sörspecialista, Budapest. Beautiful hazy brown color with beige frothy head. Fruity, banana, mango, citrus aroma with some unripeness. Medium sweet taste with a little bitterness. Full body with oily creamy texture. Lively carbonation and long bitter-sweet finish. Its a nice beer. I recommend it for everybody, who like German wheatbeers.
Chestnut with beautiful creamy off-white (cream) head. Spice and meadow aromas. Mouthfeel is like eating bread. Alcohol really pronounced with malt finish.
With the trademark malts (banana-hay-sweetness), Schneiders beer is really great. It resembles their weisen but with more malts and body.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy dark brown, with an offwhite head. Smells of alcohol, malt, and mild banana. Tastes are similar, but with a mild fruity tartness. Medium bodied, high carbonation, texture is chewy.  Wonderful, but hard-hitting beer.

Wow-sers trousers is what isay to this one.  It has very similar notes to a hefeweizen but also packs a wicked punch, at 8.2%. I dig it a lot.  The flavours and the aroma are very similar, cloves, spices, vanilla, banana, doughy.  This beer is great!

500 ml bottle poured into a mug. Pours a foggy brown with a very thick, very persistent white head. Smells of fruits, mostly bananas. Tastes of bananas, berries, vanilla, pie/cake spices and a hint of milk chocolate. Basically, its somewhat of a mouthgasm. Alcohol is almost imperceptible with this extremely easy-drinking beer. Almost no aftertaste. Feels slightly creamy, a bit oily, with a nice level of carbonation. Simply delicious.
While I appreciate that this beer stands out in this style - its a style that I dont gravitate toward. Good beer - just not one that I would regularly drink.

Tasted from bottle into nucleated tulip glass. Poured a beautiful, hazy reddish-brown with a lively off-white head, long-lasting with fine Belgian lace. Reminiscent of Trappist ale: rich complex grainbill, brown bread, and every type of cooked sugar youve ever tasted: toffee, chocolate, coffee with sugar and cream, caramelized brown sugar, molasses, boiled maple sugar, candied nuts. There must be some bitterness balancing this beer, because otherwise it would be cloyingly malty-sweet, but very little flavor or aroma hops stand out. High alcohol percentage is perfectly hidden until you feel it hit your blood stream. Masterfully crafted and utterly delicious.
This is possibly the best beer I have ever had. It is simply amazing and I agree with most comments, except words simply cannot do this beer justice. Truly an incredible beer.
bottle. Pours a darker brown. Nice large head.hay, dough, banana,.medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, slick feel, fizzy, lively, bitter. Nice beer has many layers.

Special edition from 2004 opened for a special occasion yesterday. Wheaty and cocoa aromas present. Age has blunted the vanilla/banana scent and taste usually associated with this beer, replacing them with a more chocolate and caramel feel. Carbonation is also muted, but the body is rich enough to make up for it.

Bottle. Poured out into original Aventinus glass. Looks great, darker then I expected. Nice, big head on top. Aroma of yeast, hops, apple, banana and some light fruits. Flavour is round, well balanced and little to no alcohol or maltiness. Really great beer. Cant wait to drink it again.

Black, large head.
Typical wheat smell, fruity.
Starts wheaty with a dark fruit dubbel like bitterness, sour. Touch of alcohol, sharp tasting.
Medium bodied.
A beauty hard to categorise.

Apparence: Belle robe brune alléchante. 
Une odeur de banane. 
Goût incroyable de malt caramélisé, dépice et de banane.  Très complexe et satisfaisant. 
Arrière Goût; un peu plus ordinaire, dur à identifier mais assez similaire au goût mais atténué.  
Une bière assez sucrée, alors ce nest pas pour tout le monde, mais elle est vraiment excellente!

mostly clear to lightly hazy dark dark brown, with a big big white head lingers forever, great lacing... big aroma, dark fruits, some spices, clove, some light banana, choc, some alc... lively up front, some big clove spice, alc, cherry, that might be the smoothly rounded sour impresssion... kinda has a sugary flavor.... way more cherry than i would expect in a weizenbock... still, top notch, medium to medium full bodied, great flavor, great aroma, great presentation...

0,5l bottle, From Alko kokkola

Big white and thick head, beige/white.

Sweet and tasty thick flavour
 
Medium sized body with a perfect mixín the head in it.
 
This is truly a tasty and "big" beer, a nice one!
500 ml bottle a dark brown colored beer with a white head aroma malts caramel dark fruit sweet spicy and hops flavor malts caramel dark fruits sweet spicy oranges some bitters and hops nice balanced
Bottle. Mild floral aroma. Quite full taste. A hint of banana, chocolate and coffee on after taste.

beautiful banana, candied pineapple/papaya, honey-malt flavors.  big mouthfeel, tons of tangy spice hinting from the fruits.  beautiful ruddy copper/brown/deep ruby color with bigh fizzy head that comes across more Belgian than German.  Nice freshness that a Dubbel or Quad will always be lacking.

Bottle from Bierzwerg web shop. Dark brown color with huge beige head. Aroma plums, aroma and alcohol. Taste, rich malty, with plums, raisins, wheat, hints of banana. Wood and alcohol in finish. Excellent.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2014 22oz bottle.  Wow, amazing aroma of wheat and malt. Yeasty as well. Gorgeous brown when poured, very nice head. Flavor is sweet and  wheaty, very yeasty too. Has a nice, fruity and flavorful value with some caramel and other flavors. Im very surprised by how good this is...I see currently it has a 100 on here, and I think thats well deserved.  In these parts, its basically 2 bucks a 12oz for it...for that price, this is definitely one of the best buys in the NW Arkansas area! 8.2% alcohol.

Location: 500 ml bottle from Colonial Wine and Spirits, 10/19/11


Aroma: The nose is sweet, with some wheat, banana, a little caramel, and some spice

Appearance: Pours a cloudy mahogany color with a large, fizzy beige head, and drippy lace

Flavor: Tastes rather sweet, there isnt much bitterness, and the components are similar to the nose

Palate: It feels rather fizzy and a touch sticky, has a medium body, and you can feel the heat just the right amount

Overall Impression: 
I was pretty impressed by this one.  I cant say Im surprised though, I had a vague recollection that this was a really solid beer, but I just couldnt fully recall.  Then again, thats why rating is so useful, isnt it!
Bottle, pours cloudy brown with off white head. aroma is caramel, banana, spicy, fruity. Full bodied.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2011 La mejor weizenbock del mundo,destapandola sale el tipico aroma de una weizen el olor a platano es muy agradable,intenso, al paladar es bien intensa,casi ausente el lupulo, el alchool no interfiere en el bouquet de sabores y no cansa el paladar asi que se pueden tomar varias,en fin si eres amante de la cerveza de trigo no hay mejor que esta,salut!!
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text: A nice and intense aroma, probably the best wheat beer ive ever drink !
Wow this beer was good, very full mouth feel with a nice caramel finish, this is well balanced with other bitter hop flavors and spice tastes
Persistent chocolaty foam. Toned down aromas, yeast and spices, no bananas like nost weissens. Wonderful palate of sweet, sour,  and malts. A wonderful classic.
50cl bottle. Pours hazy brown with a big light brown head. Smells bread, fruity and abit sweet. Tastes honey fruity, bread and abit hoppy with a bread malty finish. Slight taste of alcohol.

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget and consumed on October 7. Pours hazy brown with a huge gray head that slowly dissipates without leaving much of a trace on the glass. Smell is very yeasty and spicy. Theres the normal cilantro and lemon zest smell youd expect from a weissbier but there are also hints of roasted malts and dried fruits. Taste is quite dry and sweet with a nice tartness to it. Its very vinous. Taste i dominated by lemon and spices with some sweet fruits like banana in the finish. Very drinkable and goes well with food!

Ported from BA.

Appearance:
Pours a hazy brown that you cant quite see through. About a finger of head that dissipates like soda foam, into a few thin white islands sitting around the top.

Smell:
Very very wheaty, basically exactly what I imagine an unfiltered wheat to taste like. Strong banana notes come through the initial scent, with just a touch of lemony zest in the background.

Taste:
Semi-sweet, wheaty, and boozy. The banana scent is present in the flavor, as well as some very subtle chocolate notes under the immediate flavors. Little to no notable bitterness. Not quite like anything else Ive ever tasted.

Mouthfeel:
Full and thick. This almost feels heavier than a normal liquid on my tongue. Low carbonation and very smooth.

Drinkability:
After just a few mouthfuls I can feel the alcohol bearing down on me, which is fair enough at 8.2%, though I feel like its still hitting me very fast. That being said, Id have another. The fact is this is a delicious beer that I wouldnt possibly pass up at a liquor store if I could get it in my area. It exemplifies great beer that toes the line of the "dark beer" category.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy milk chocolate with lasting off-white head.  Aroma is dark and sweet with banana and spice.  Sweet flavor: caramel, dark fruit, fruity yeast.  Full bodied, light carbonation with lightly sour finish.

On tap at the Brick Store Pub. Pours a hazy, ruddy brown with massive white head that really sticks around. Huge clove, fresh bread, apricots, lemon peel and banana on the nose. Earthy, slightly sweet malts on the tongue, with more clove, banana, lemon, herbal grassiness, brown sugar, dark candied fruit. Lively, coating mouthfeel. Massively drinkable and absurdly good.

Bottle from The Cask, Glasgow.
Appearance - Muddy brown, very hazy, huge off-white frothy head, moderate lacing.
Aroma - Complex aroma - a darker, stronger maltier version of a hefeweizen. Spicy aromatic cloves and fruity - typical banana with bubblegum. Caramel and bready malts, bit of roast malt, sweet dark malts, yeasty, hint of toffee. Lots going on here.
Taste - Complex mix of sweetish dark malts, fairly strong cloves, spicy hops, yeasty, wheat, molasses, raisin, bit medicinal. Alcohol not noticeable, initially, but becomes more so afterwards.
Palate - Full bodied, smooth. Finish a continuation of the main flavours, but there is a bit of cinnamon and warming alcohol.
Overall - Its a very well made beer, but this style of beer isnt my favourite - the bananary cloves and aromatic nature of these brews can get a bit cloying for me after a while. The darker malts do offset this a bit in this beer, but the alcohol gets more noticeable while drinking down the glass. Perhaps, Ill like these beers more in time. Its probably worth an 18/20, but for me personally its a 15/20.
Blurry but beautiful ruby ​​colored strong Weizen Bock, with a slightly dull foam - Fruit aromas with a touch of banana, the taste is ok but a little strong of alcohol team.

OOOOOH MY!!  Yet another excellent brew to be added to my own personal hall of fame!!!! This brew pours up a rich dark mahogany body and sports an enormously thick, foamy head.  Scents and flavors of chocolate, clove, caramel and so many others youll delight in each savoring trying to determine what wonderful scent or flavor you are being enticed by!!  The body is heavy yet smooth and very creamy and oh so refreshing.  Although most say that this brew is to be enjoyed during the wintry months, this brew is (in my opinion) made to be enjoyed all throughout the year!

Dark tan brown, medium off-white head. Fruity aroma with dominant banana notes, some alcohol and malt. The taste reminds me of bananas with caramel sauce (the sweetness and caramel), with some more sweetness and more bananas with warming alcohol in the finish. Exellent brew.

0.5l bottle from CrackedKettle. This one pours a murkybrown body with a small fading and sidesticking lightly tanned head. Aroma is malty and caramel-sweet with notes of fudge, hops and candle wax. Lively carbonation, medium-bodied and it has a nice and light oily mouthfeel. Flavors are light sweet, nice caramel with nuts, some thin licorice and hints of spices and wheat in the some what watery finish. Absolutely a good beer and a fine weizenbock, but in my opinion perhaps a bit overrated? Think I have to have this again to truly make up my mind.
Absolutely wonderful! Aroma is of wheat and light hops. Smooth on the tongue and a delight to drink.
Bottle at the Pond. Tap 6. Pours muddy brown. Bloody delicious. Banana wheat beer vibe with a thinly concealed alcohol punch. Bocky.
UPDATED: SEP 29, 2012 Bottle in tulip glass. Strong aroma of yeast, dried fruit, wheat. Beautiful large off white head, dark brown colour. Taste is sweet, some dried fruit, wheat. Awesome beer!

Bottle at Schneider bar. Definitaley a cut above the rest but lets notnget too carried away, it is still a Bavarian wheat beer. Banana and cloves still present on the aroma and taste but not as prominent as in other wheat beers. More fruity flavours come through in this one with some caramel. The palate is where it really shines, light and delicate, finishes well leaving light fruity notes.

caramel, chocolate, roasty, dough, banana, alcohol, vanilla

Big hefeweizen body, lots of dark malt flavors, almost candy like.  One of the best beers in the world, IMHO.

Really big and fruity aroma with notes of yeast. The taste is extremely fruity, and in the taste there tones of wheat, citrus and yeast. Wow! This beer does not change the world but damn it is really good!

500 mL bottle. Murky brown with a large off-white head. The aroma is caramel, molasses, grapefruit, cloves, and bready yeast. The flavor is citrus sweetness, with just a little bitterness. The palate is medium to heavy, smooth, and a little acidic. The aftertaste is mild and bitter. Overall, this is an intense and delicious beer, but very smooth and drinkable.
First had this beer at JR. I am rating this from memory since I forgot to rate it then. This beer has a nice weight to it with a medium to heavy sweetness. Goes well with a nice cigar.

On tap in the custom glassware. Beautiful beer, nice amount of head, with a perfectly hazy appearance. Smells of cloves, tastes of banana, cloves, with some dark maltiness. No hint of alcohol, very pleasant to drink.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2012 Dark Brown with a caramel touch and an offwhite head. Smell of caramel, malt, nuts and chocolate. Some roast elements and flowery. Taste of caramel, malt, roasted coffee, flowery, banana, clove, vanilla, plum. Very enjoyable to drink.
A classic (perhaps The Classic) "dark" beer from which all darks are compared to. Spicy-banana-wheat.

Great aroma, with banana, clove, spice, bready malt, and yeast.  Sweet flavor with yeast, banana, and some caramel.  Finish is smooth, especially for something with 8% alcohol.  Probably my favorite German beer.

Dark mahogany pour with crimson/garnet highlights and a thick towering eggshell head.  Aroma of banana, clove, caramel, and white pepper.  Flavor similar with some dark fruit (plum, raisin, fig), Belgian yeast, and toffee.  Medium mouthfeel.  Not bad.

This poured a somewhat hazy medium brown color with a beige head. Aroma was caramel, dark fruits, light toast, yeast, and banana. Flavor was wheat, good amount of spices, mainly clove, banana and light fig. interesting stuff.

Bottle at Cafe Buitenlust, Oirschot. Pretty dark, amber color. Smell and taste are ok but not great, even for a weizen bock its not that good in my opinion. Carbonation, alcohol-percentage and body are good but overall nothing more than a decent beer.

Pours hazy ruby brown with a large, fluffy, khaki head. Smells strongly malted, wheat and hints of chocolate. Tastes like a chocolate wheat ale with some doppelbock characteristics; big chocolate notes with some banana and then some vanilla with a touch of clover, peculiar and certainly interesting. Medium to full-bodied with a slick, almost smooth texture and almost no mouth-carbonation, Aventinus Wheat-Doppelbock finishes with hints of banana and vanilla.

Dark ruby with medium, foamy light tan head. Strawberry jam, hay, nutty, raisins and caramel. Rich and complex. Smooth body thats balanced but with a sweet fruity focus from start to finish. Quite a bit of alcohol shining through, but thats okay. Loads of flavour
50 cl bottle, Sheffield, UK via The Dram Shop. Hazy iced tea colour, clove and banana aroma. Sweet caramel flavour, some savouriness in the background, then a long alcohol infused finish.

A really nice beef from G. Schneider & Sohn.  Very smooth for 8.2%.  A nice malty taste.  It tastes like a more malty version of a hefeweizen.  I highly recommend to anyone who is a fan of German styles.  Surprisingly refreshing for a beer so dark.

Vid ett blindtest hade jag definitivt gissat Belgisk brun. Styrkan, sötman och kryddning drar ju åt det hållet. Låt oss börja bakifrån. Eftersmaken är fantastisk, som ett nybakt vörtbröd, smak och doft är jästig, fruktigt marmedladsöt utan att bli för mycket eftersom alkoholen matchar så väl. Mycket välbalanserat.

Deep brown body, translucent, with a tall white head that displays a lot of motion and excitement as it settles to a skiff of foam. Potent spicy aroma, with clove, nutmeg, and sour bread notes. Incredibly complex and mature flavor, presenting a full spectrum of beer possibilities, from herbal hops bitterness to milk chocolate malt sweetness, in addition to yeasty funk.
Thick, creamy texture. Delicate carbonation. Amazing!

Bottle shared with esp0r.
Dark brown color with a big white head.
Grainy aroma with good amounts of banana and wheat.
Fruity taste with malts, yeast notes and a very good dry ending. While the alcohol absolutely is noticed, the beer does a pretty good job of hiding the high abv.

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2011 Bottle poured into a New Belgium Globe.

A - Pours dark, cloudy, brown with a big two finger tall white head with great head retention leaving spotty lacing down the glass.

S - Smells of spicy yeast, banana, dark fruits, caramel, toffee, clove, and the ever present wheat. This nose has quite a bit going on, great stuff.

T - Starts off with some spicy yeast and clove quickly giving way to a mix of chewy wheat, banana, caramel, and some dark fruits. As it warms, it seems to get a bit sweeter and more and more of the booze comes through. The finish is a mix of spicy yeast and banana, lingering for some time after the finish.

M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Fairly smooth with a spicy, chewy, feel with a touch of sweetness toward the end, lingering through the finish.

O - This is one awesome beer and it deserves all the acclaim it gets. It has a ton of flavor without getting to the point of being overpowering. If you have the chance to try this one you really should.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2011 Pours a dark-brown/red with a  stable head. Aroma of fruits (a bit of banana, berries and clove) with a nice sweetness and full body which leaves a nice, warm feeling in your mouth. The taste of alcohol is not noticable.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2011 Aroma of wheat, clove, and some dark fruits.  Pours thick and dark with a big pancake head.  Tastes of.clove, dark banana, apple, and wheat.  Bold and spicy and sits well in the mouth.
Re tried with a 2005 bottle.  Much smoother and fortieth than the initial.  Quite worth picking up the bagged version.

1/2 liter bottle from local liquor store. Out of the bottle with a loud, hissing pour, this brew has a cloudy, opaque iced tea colored body with a long lasting tan head. While pouring, I noticed an immediate, complex aroma featuring coffee, cherry, floral, licorice, lime scents. At first sip, this surprisingly light, almost watery texture is paired with flavors of root beer, ice cream malt and tootsie roll with the lingering, tangy aftertaste of tangerine. My only issue of this beer is the imperceptible hop flavor.
The perfect beer.  Beautiful pour.  Great flavors.  Note the banana flavor.  Well worth the typically high cost.

From the bottle stamped: 10.315-0685-2822.  The pour is a handsome looking dark amber to ruby red with an immense amount of fluffy off-white head the gently settles down after a few minutes.  The aroma is full of wheat and sweetness with a slight  hop bite taking up the rear.  The body is thinnish like wine.  Sweet caramel malts and yeast along with something similar to grape first tickles the tongue but there is a potent dry hop bite at the end.  Very smooth.
UPDATED: DEC 17, 2011 Bottle pour.  Poured a dark amberish brown color with a white head.  Caramel sweet and dark fruit notes.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2016 (*Vintage 2003 (Wheat Doppelbock)): Beaucoup plus darôme avec lage, cerise noire, prunes. Cest ridiculement bien balancé. Jai une 2004 en attente et avec le yeast cake au fond de la 2003, cest clairement une bière vivante que jai aucun problème à laisseer vieillir.

Bouteille fraiche: Impressionnant du début à la fin. Les pruneaux, dattes, figues, raisins en arôme, rien de subtil, des grosses notes puissantes bien fusionnées. Au goût, on a un peu tout ça qui se bouscule avec lacidité du raisin au fini. Très onctueux avec une bon clean-up deffervescence...et on recommence.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2012 Farblich ist es ziemlich dunkel, die Schaumkrone hält leider nur mittelmäßig gut. Geschmacklich ist es fruchtig, alkoholisch und schön Süffig. Der Alkoholgeschmack wird zwischen durch stärker, bleibt aber angenehm. Obwohl es mein erster Weizenbock ist, kann ich leicht herrauschmecken das es ein Weizenbock ist. Fazit: Süffig, lecker, nice! Allerdings wären noch bessere Noten bei einem vielfältigeren Geschmack möglich gewesen.
	
Test vom 13.6.2009, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 11,11,12,12,13,12 - 11,80

on opening a gush of head shot forth.  poured a rich reddy brown like prune juice with a lovely foamy head tinged with brown.  This recedded quickly though.  smell was very sweet bananas and treacle.  obviously a lot of carbonation in the mouth and it left the tip of my tongue numb!  One to try again as I really cant make my mind up. definite potential to be a cracker.
Pours a dark caramel with a lasting head. Aroma of a fruit medley. Sweet flavors constantly changing. I really would expect to like this but it feels like it betrays me every time.

Bottle at The Caley Sample Rooms. Pours a dark brown colour with a thick tan head. Aroma of banana, cloves and coffee. Flavours of coffee, malt, banana and caramel. Some chocolate notes also. Alcohol is quite present, Foamy mouth-feel and a banana caramel - linger. Great : )

Tasted on 7/17/11 from a 500mL bottle purchased at Binnys Lincoln Park, 2005 vintage.  Pours clear, deep ruby amber with an average, fizzy beige head that recedes very quickly to nothing at all.  The nose is sweet clover honey, molasses, tons of caramel malt, malty wheat cereal, and sweet grape juice.  The flavor is sweet Concord grape juice up front, moving to clover honey, dark cereal and caramel malt, molasses, and a bit of alcoholic heat.  The body is medium with tongue-numbingly stinging carbonation and a long grape juice, honey, and burnt caramel malt finish with a nice blast of alcoholic heat.  This beer is interesting, but I think that I prefer the younger vintages.

500 mL at Schneider Weiss Brauhaus in Munich.  Dark brown in a nice glass, good foamy head.  Hint of caramel in the aroma, but mainly wheat.  Surprisingly sweet but also typical of a wheat beer.  Really nice.

Bottle shared with Daje
Dark brown, thick white head. Smells of banana, hints of citrus and yeast esters. Taste is super malty, much wheat here, good sweetness and fruityness. Also a bit dry, but that is just another nice aspect. Finish has some hop bitterness. A descent beer from Schneiderweisse

Bottle as TAP 6 Unser Aventinus"
Pours a very dark cloudy brown with an off-white head. Aroma is quite wheaty with cloves, malty notes, banana and caramel. Taste is very heavy on the wheat, lightly caramel with hints of dried fruit. Surprisingly lacking a real alcohol flavour considering the strength. Nicely fizzy. Fantastic Weizen Bock.

50 cl bottle as TAP 6 Unser Aventinus, BBE 16.5.2012
Aroma has some sweet, ripe banana. Flavour has also some banana and hints of alcohol. Some other aged fruits and spiciness does also appear. This is like sahti, but with CO2 added. My favourite beer from Germany!

Bottle. Pours hazy reddish brown colour with a huge white head.  Aromas of clove, banana, caramel, spices, and molasses.  Taste of big banana, clove, wheat, caramel, dark fruits, and spices. No bitterness noticed on the finish, but big notes of banana, clove, caramel, and spices on the finish that linger for a decent amount of time. Nice and smooth drinking with medium-high carbonation and medium-full body.

23.07.2011. 0,5l Bottle. Labeled Schneider weisse Unser Aventinus TAP 6. This really is one of the best beers I have had for a long time! There is an intense smell of wheat and banana. Aroma is the same; Wheat, yeast and notes of banana. There is wheaty maltyness that is rather rich, sweetness, strong alcohol, rich body and some very good aromatic hop flavours that really gives this beer some good flavours. Very good beer!!

Pours deep amber, slightly cloudy, with big head and some lacing. Nose is cloves, toasty, malts, fruits. Carbonation is obvious, above average, tingly on the tongue and back of the throat, otherwise very smooth with some bitterness (not too hoppy) to balance the sweetness.

Nice brown color with a decent head on it when poured into a Weiss glass. Best after it warms a few degrees and is not ice cold in my opinion. Flavors really come out with all the tasty notes at this time. Being a huge fan of weiss and belgian blondes this one fits in nicely in my beerofile.
UPDATED: JUL 20, 2011 Bottle - Cloudy redish brown. Off white head. Low carbonation. Medium to full bodied.  Smooth. Quite sweet. Dark fruits. Banana.. Musty, spicy.  Low bitterness.
Exageradament alcohòlica pel meu gust. La que jo he provat tenia 12%vol. Tot i això es tracta duna cervesa prou correcte.

Pours slightly reddish-brown with a big honkin head. (Note to self: dont pour this in a tulip glass because youre too lazy to wash the dirty weizen glass in the sink.)

Aroma is yeast, banana, dried fruit, and spices. Taste is bubblegum, banana, clove, cinnamon, coriander. Perfect amount sweetness. Very mild finish. Taste of alcohol barely detectable. Mouthfeel is medium to full, with a slight warming feeling as it does down. Wonderful beer.
Spice, bubblegum and banana aromas. Flavors of cinnamon, banana, clove and dark fruits.  Finishes light and foamy.  Overall an excellent brew.

Dark caramel color topped with a long lasting beige foam. Strong clover/ pepper smells added of toffey hint. Very well balanced. You have light bananas taste combined with spices and coffey. A bit of a sour impression at last.Very good beer.

Colour of dark red-amber and a creamy thick foam. Aromas or fresh grass, wet earth, a touch of smoke and banana. Tastes kind of sweet with very low bitterness. Explosion of aromas in the mouth. Although it has a high alcohol level, you dont feel it and it drinks easily. Wonderfull beer!

Thick beige head. Mid-brown and cloudy. Heavy sweetness and light bitterness. Aroma of banana and alcohol, faint chocolate and roasty aromas also. Full body and long finish. Except for a bit too much sweetness, this is truly an excellent beer.

From notes: poured a cloudy, caramelly brown with a thick ivory head.  Aroma was caramel mixed with some banana esters.  Palate was smooth, medium-thick with a slight crispness to it.  Caramelly flavor with an apple-y crispness mixed in.  Spice notes as it warms.  Excellent.

AROMA: chocolate, coffee, nuts, roasty

APPEARANCE: brown, cloudy, frothy, white foam

TASTE: light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour

PALATE: medium body, oily feel, lively, bitter, long finish
Rich ruby amber colour, very thick tight head. Sweet and spicey aromas and tastes of nutmeg, clove, cinnamon, fresh bread and banana. Wonderfully smooth lengthy sweet finish.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2011 This is the perfect beer to look atit is a beautiful brown with a massive head, very hazy, but still lets light through. The aroma is very complex and elegant, with lots of dark fruits and ripe banana, some cloves, some caramel, some ethanol, some licorice, and wheat. I would definitely say theres some overripe fruits to it, too, but in the best possible way. Really, if you want to find out how in the world one could characterize anything as smelling "overripe" and mean it in a good way, sniff the **** out of this beer.  The taste mostly reflects the aroma; to the tongue this beer is sweet, a bit sour, a bit bitter, and has a good aftertaste. The body is medium, nearly perfect, and very wheaty. Overall, this beer does not disappoint one bit; perhaps if its sweetness didnt get a bit cloying toward the end it would be the perfect wheat beer.
Great colour, wonderful aromas with hints of chocolate, coffee and caramel. Slightly sweet taste and surprisingly smooth finish for a heavier beer.
Dark ruby-red to amber colour. Taste and smell were pretty average, didnt like the mouthfeel much.

Bottle brewed in 2004 ... Deep amber/ruby pour thin off white head lively ... aroma of sweet caramel and wheat light fruity yeast and banana little abv in the aroma  .... taste of wheat, sweet caramel malt and fruity yeast with a hint of banana ....  no trace of abv whatsoever .... smell and taste are not the same sadly ... great looking and tasting brew
Lovely beer, was expecting a strong taste but it went down like a charm. Chocolate and dried fruit aromas, very nice.

Pours a hazy, muddy brown with a huge four finger head.  Aroma is just as advertised-- dominated by banana clove and with hints of chocolate and yeast.  Taste is chocolate pudding, banana, spice, and a woody hop finish.  8.2%abv is INCREDBILY well-hidden, this brew is extremely smooth.  Though it has a sticky body, the high level of carbonation cuts the viscosity of this brew and it leads to a mildly cloying, yet wholly enjoyable finish.  This is hefeweizen perfectly amplified.  Great beer for the price, tons of flavor.
Even better than tap 5. Dark, rich, unique, really pleasant white beer. There is something special in this beer.

Strong beer. Good taste. Not recomended to drink more than two ;)
The best  doppelbock beer in Germany. Sometimes is not easy to buy it in supermakts or bars, including Germany.

Cerveza fuerte con buen sabor. No es recomendable beber más de dos seguidas ;)
La mejor cerveza doppelbock de Alemania. La única pega es que a veces es dificil de encontrarla incluso en Alemania.

Pours dark amber, finger thick head. Nose: massive banana, a bit dusty, nutmeg. Taste: banana again, solventy alcohol, stonefruit, bready notes. A bit sherry like due to alcohol. Some balanced bitterness, dry finish. Overrated to my taste.

Poured from bottle, pours a murky brown with a nice off white head and spotty lacing, aroma has great touches of banana with spices and some sweetness, the flavor has great touches of clove in the finish with a hint of chocolate mixed in, interesting brew.

Bottle @ Home. pours hazy dark brown ( like coke ) with a tan head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, sweet fruit, raisins, sugar, slight tart tone. Taste is yeast, caramel, fruit, candy, light lemonlike tartness. Medium to full body, lively carbonation. Very good. 160611

Poured from a bottle. Appearance is a dense dark brown with a billowing khaki colored head of about two inches. Aroma is figs, raisins, dried and candied fruits, and then some yeasty, bready influence. Taste is very much the same as the aroma, just slightly more impressive. Full and heavy mouthfeel. This would be a great dessert beer.

A great beer. Not really a fan of wheat beers but this one is almost perfect. Nice head that lasts and lasts...Poured it into a long glass (narrow bottom - wide top). Coca cola like colour is not the thing I am looking for but everything else is excellent.
Little bit of bitterness leaves a "manly" touch.
Dark brown with a little red and a average head. A sweet aroma. Taste is bread and some spice with a bit of alcohol.

Having one now, and wondering how it is Ive never rated this wonderful beer! Love the gentle toffee and banana notes with an underlying clove flavour dominating the "long taste". Seriously full bodied, but perfectly balanced. The head fades quickly, which is the only downer for this marvellous beer.

Pours a deep amber with a thick head will of 2mm bubbles that last a while. Smells of malt and fruits I couldnt put my finger on. Complicated with a hint of sweet. It tasted too of medium to dark malts with a hint of caramel. Just a bit of blunted hops in the finish. Surprisingly clear for a wheat. Lively carbonation. Had a pint with some bangers and mash I cooked up. Was a treat.

Dark brown colour, reminding indeed of coca cola. Big, fluffy, white head. Aroma keynotes are banana and cloves, with a good malt background and some sweets. Flavour rather sweet, malts, spices, toffee, banana, dried fruits, cloves, wheat and quite a yeasty tone. Would say it is a bit sweet, but this is well compensated by all the other flavours. I like this one.
(from 0,5L bottle @ Café Jos, Nijmegen)
Pours coca-cola brown from bottle. Big banana and clove notes on the nose. Nice caramel malt taste blending in with the spice notes. Finishes clean. This hide its 8.5% very well.

Bottle. Very cloudy dark muddy brown with a blooming eggshell head.  Toffee, apples, light fruit, banana, faint citrus, and toffee in the aroma.  Spicy, caramelized apples, dark fruit, raisins, toffee, slight hay, banana, and a good deal of clove.  Medium, soft body with soft carbonation.  Always awesome.

This is one of those beers that I have from time to time and really enjoy. Dark brown with a little red and a head that is unmatched. A nice sweet aroma. Taste is banana and some spice with a bit of alcohol.

500ml bottle sample from distributor rep. Pours a golden tan color from bottle and dark brown in glass. Produces a thick frothy white head and lively carbonation. Immediate aromas of bananas and clove with the faintness of chocolate in the background. Pleasant taste of the bananas and some citrus accompanying the fizziness...a delicious amount of roasted sweetness. A great German beer...would/will recommend to dark wheat fans...if youre thinking about getting it, its worth the try.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2013 50cl bottle at a Homebrewing meeting.
Thick white head.  Dark amber colour.  Very drinkable

Huge lasting creamy white head and a hazy dark brown body. Fruity aroma, banana, alcohol, brown sugar, caramel, lots of malt. The taste is medium to heavy sweet balanced with a light bitterness and a light sour touch. Full body and a creamy texture.

500 ml bottle Aroma-Rich malty, little toast, lots of dark fruit. Maybe a little bana. Appearance- Dark brown, cloudy plenty of yeast in suspension, big foam off-white head that lasts a bit.Flavor-Lots of malt but quite as sweet as aroma would sugest as it has medium dry finish. Some toast or bready qualities. Plenty of dark fruit quality. Slight alcohol but not too strong. Medium body, lots of carbonation, a little alcohol warming. Overall- Enjoyed this very much after a hard day of yardwork

Geruch fruchtig-hefig, deutlich nelkenlastig. 
Fruchtig und prickelnd im Antrunk. Im Mittelteil viele nelkenartige Nuancen, Feige, Passionsfrucht mit einigen alkoholischen Anklängen, welche das Geschmacksbild jedoch nicht beeinträchtigen. Fließender Wechsel in einen reichen malz-hefefruchtigen Abgang. 
Referenzklasse.
Bottle, pours dark brown, yeasty, tastes like a wheat beer with a bit of your bock flavour in the back end, interesting stuff. good offering

500ml bottle from Alko
Note: Bottle says Schneider Weisse Tap 6 Unser Aventinus - Pours dark brown with a white head. Aroma has hints of banana and malts. Carbonated and slightly sour taste has a lot of banana and malts. Medium body, nice sweet finish. Nice beer, but not as good as I remembered it from a few years ago.

Fra flaske, dufter dejligt af karamel, mørke frugter. flot mørk rødbrun med flot svagt lysebrunt skum...smager dejligt frisk af mørke frugter, karamel...blød fylde ...... eftersmagen er svagt sprittet...... men dejlig! super lækker!

500 ml bottle pours a deep, dark reddish brown with fizzy, foamy finger of grey head.  From the first whiff the quality of this brew is clear.  Aroma imparts notes of roasted bananas, fresh clove, a hint of wood smoke, vanilla bean, whipped cream, and hickory.  Medium bodied, pretty smooth and sessionable, holding an outstanding level of complexity in proportion to the lightness of the body.  This is one of those beers where I feel like I get something new from it with each and every whiff and sip.  Flavor is big and fruity, with pleasant esters, plenty of banana but more fruity than just that, also notes of wheat, caramel, scotch, and fresh mulch.  Took me awhile to get around to this one and I knew it would be good, but it exceeded my expectations.  And for the price, well, this is a knockout.

Wow! and wow again. In the beer dictionary a picture of this is filed under wheat dopplebock.

Poured a nice dark brown with a lively tan head of 3 fingers, laced well as the head left slightly cloudy as you would expect a wheat, bottle conditioned beer to be..

The Aromna was nice and yeasty, malts and fruits, clove and bannana.

The taste was very well balanced between the spiceiness of the clove and a hint of bannana, a wee bit of hoppiness but not so much as to linger very long.

Mouthfeel was medium with a cleaniness that was outstanding (I even poured the  bottom into the glass to get the full yeast flavors after I finished my glassfull)Just a lingering of fruit but not too sweet, not too tart, just right for me!

Overall BUY THIS ONE! Cross statelines to find it if you have to. This will be in my fridge almost constantly. At $3.99 for a 500 ml bottle it is a great buy.
Amazing dopplebock. Was on clearance at top foods for 2.01 would compare to celebrator. And salvator. Great beer

Bottle 0.5 L.
Hazy, brown body, with a huge, creamy, off-white head, fully lasting with an excellent lacing.
Heavy malty and yeasty aroma: ripe banana as well as red fruits, prune, raisins and some caramel; spicy character is also present.
Intense sweet flavour with some harsh feeling due to alcohol that howeverdoes not dominate the flavour; maybe some acidic note is also present.
Medium-to full body with an oily texture; soft carbonation; light alcoholic feeling in the finish.
Very satisfactory.

Pour hazy dark amber creamy beige head great lace. Aroma sweet, Belgian candy sugar, spicy, banana, clove, pepper, dark fruits, raisins. Taste quite sweet, banana, bubble gum, clove, pepper, slight dark fruit, MF medium to full body medium carb. Great brew super well balanced abcv well hidden good summer beer.
Bottiglia. Colore marrone scuro con riflessi ramati, gran schiuma ben persistente. Molto beverina nonostante lelevata alcolicità con un finale semi secco.

From bottle to weizen glass April 30, 2011.  Pours a hazy, medium brown with a heavy, bubbly beige head.  Aroma reminds me more of an abbey dubbel or trippel than a wheat beer.  Cloves, cinnamon, other spices on the nose with toffee and caramel malts as well.  Definitely sweetness in the taste - toffee, dark fruits, then just the right amount of bitterness at the finish.  Very nice - Prost!

I tried this at the beerfest in peoria. 2007 vintage.I couldnt ask for a better wheat doppelbock. Typical wheat taste. Spices, clove and yeasty deliciousness. Really nicely balanced. This had a sugary molasses quality. Bright, clean, strong and perfect.

500 ml bottle.  Pours hazy dark amber with a thick, off-white, never ending, foamy head and a lot of lacing.
Aroma is of yeast, banana, cloves, cinnamon, wheat and brown sugar.  Full, slightly crisp body.  Wheat malt, spices, banana, some apple and some alcohol fill the palate.  Long, pleasant, semi-dry finish.  Wonderful brew, I could drink it a whole day.

26 April 2011, bottle. dark, nutty brown, hazy w/ frothy head. nose is alcohol and mushy bananas and yeast. great! full body and moderately fizzy. tastes of warm raisins, soft bananas and a sweet, alcohol malt. very nice.
Bottle pours brown with an off-white head.  Aroma is sweet with notes of banana bread, milk chocolate, and apple pie.  Flavor shows the same with additional notes of wheat and toffee.

Pours dark brown with a big rocky head.  Looks great in a wheat glass.  Loads of clove and yeast, bananas, bread, and apple.  Very nice aroma.  Nice spice presence with clove, coriander, and nutmeg but banana also on the palate with apples and caramel.  A bit lively on the palate.  The finish is medium with a spicey note.  The spice really stands out nicely in this.

Banana, caramel and light corn aromas rise off this crystal clear copper/tan beer with a light tan head.  More banana and caramel flavors on the first sip, but the banana is not overwhelming.  Some light molasses in there too with cloves and nutmeg and even a little licorice.  Slightly creamy texture and a mild hop bite.  The spices are left behind in the aftertaste with some cream.   Just noticed that there is a decent layer of sediment in the bottle but its settled out so firmly that you can pour out the last drop without any noticeable residue which is incredible for a wheat beer!   An outstanding Weizen bock and very easy drinking for a beer over 8% ABV.  Happy German Beer Day!!

500ml Bottle - Dark brown with a foamy head. Banana, marzipan, toffee and sponge cake in the aroma. Fruity and malty taste with a hint of spice and notes of banoffee, yeast, dried fruit and nuts. The finish has more banana notes and is also slightly tart.
Prodotti di punta del le bon bock, questa weisse tanto decantata è forse troppo elaborata e forte per i miei gusti.

Somehow thin yet a little bit creamy, quite sour with a banana flavour - which I didnt notice at first, but after being told theres banana present, its all I taste.  Smooth finish.  A very nice beer, tastes like a Belgian even though its not.  Lots of sediment, but you expect that from a wheat beer.

Cloudy medium brown with a modest off-white head that left a thin film and nice lace. Dark ripe fruit, yeast and cloves are highlighted on the nose. Complex flavor profile includes all that, plus a healthy dose of caramel and doughy bread. Medium body and carbonation, smooth on the palate, and finishes with strong wheat

Wonderful.  Pours a murky mahogany with pillowy head.  Aromas of bananas (slightly overripe?) clove, raisin, plum, bread, funky yeasts.  Maybe some caramel underneath.  Alcohol is completely (and dangerously? hidden).  Rich, smooth mouthfeel but still light and drinkable.  Crisp lingering finish.  Its combines the light crisp fruitiness of a weiss with the richness and complexity of a doppelbock or something.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2012 Pours dark brown with a huge off white head. Extraordinary aroma of banana, valilla and wheat. Perfect palate. Sweet, malty, chocolate, banana, vanilla and alcohol in the flavour. Amazing. (10/5/9/5/19)
Dark copper colour with a big off white head. Great aroma with banana, vanilla, wheat, alcohol. Perfectly smooth and easy drinking palate. Sweet flavour with cereal, banana, brown sugar. A really great beer.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2012 Re-rate at the Schneider Weisse Brauhaus - much happier with the palate and the overall affect this time - the best beer during my 3 days in Munich.  

50cl bottle. Pours a dark brown colour with gold where the light gets in. The head is enormous, it cant all be poured at once even into the Scheider Weisse glass. It looks tremendous. The nose is of black bananas, alcohol and cream. On the taste, there are more bananas, ginger biscuits and cream. The palate is rich and creamy but it is a little cloying on the end. Overall, a lovely beer, but the end could have been better.

Bottle. Pours dark and hazy with a lasting off white head.Sweet smell of brown banana and a hint of alcohol. Medium bodied with a smooth wheat-sweetness. Taste of sweet banana, clove and vanilla. Intense but refreshing.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2015 50 cl, bottled. Pours hazy rust coloured beer with an irregular white head. Aroma: Banana, fruits, candyfloss, citrus, yeast. Taste: Moderate sweetness, mildly bitter. Palate: Soft bodied, creamy texture, average carbonation. Very pleasant mild bitter finish. (9-4-9-5-17, 9.4.2011)

-----

Rera (8.10.2015): Pours cloudy rust with a very fine white head. Aroma: Wheat, yeast. Spices. Taste: Medium sweet, spice in flavour. Some bitterness. More sweetness, get pretty sweet actually. Banana. Some roasted aromas. Palate: Medium-full body, fluffy. Very good at filling the stomach. Average carbonation. Very nice wheat bock. (No score changes)
laroma netto di banana è incredibile. Corposa e gustosa, calda e avvolgente. Un prodotto davvero super...

Last bottle at Mane Liquor. Pours a deep brown to ruby red. Has an off white head that quickly fades. Aroma is full of chocolate, banana and toasted bread. Taste brings out the dark caramel malts. Banana bread and chocolate seem to mix quite well in this one. Too easy to drink !
2011 - 04 - 04 500ml bottle. light brown colour. medium, off-white fading head. taste is a smooth combo of weissen and herbale bock.

Bottled poured into pint glass. Aroma is lighter than flavor, kinda of soft yeast and slight clove. Appearance is dark brown with a huge head and needed to be poured slowly. Taste is rich of sweet malts with dark almost squaw bread like. Great creamy texture and all around enjoyable beer.

Appearance:  dark, like milk chocolate, with rich cream highlights and a thick foamy head.  Aroma: cloves, banana, chocolate, dark toasted bread and nuts, wheat and sweet malty wheat.   Taste:  warm banana bread, cloves, wheat and dark caramel malts, with some chocolate.   Finish: 	medium, crisp and lightly sweet, with a bit of a sour tang remaining beyond everything else.  Notes: 	Rich and creamy, yet somehow light and refreshing.  Very nice.  Like a dunkelweizen (75%) meets a doppelbock (25%).  First tried this about a year ago, so these notes are old. Will have to try again to see if I like it even better now.
(Bottle 2/4-2011) [Schneider Weisse Tap 6 Unser Aventinus] Head fade very quickly. Yeast taste is very dominant, but the taste is well rounded.

Dark brown, ruby red with a good layer of off-white foam head. 
Fruitcake aroma, banana, yeast  and spice like clove. Amazing taste, every sip or gulp is smooth. Sweet malt, wheat, banana, chocolate, some ripe dark fruit taste, nice little alcohol edge. Love this.

500 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy, medium amber, with a big off-white head. Spicy, fruity, phenolic nose, banana, cloves yeast, wheat. Off-dry, medium bodied (quite full bodied in relation to the style), low bitterness. Spicy, fruity taste, yeast, cloves, banana, wheat, phenols.(2011-01-23)

500ml bottle, poured into tulip glass with a light frothy head.  Very Sweet, a bit of that hefeweizen bubblegum sweet flavor. Smooth, slightly sweet flavor aroma, the wheat does great to prevent this from becoming a sweet bomb... This is great.
Pours dark brown with a light, long-lasting head.  Strong banana aroma.  Sweet banana and wheat taste with a smooth finish.

I guess I just dont like Belgian beers.  This beer pours a dark amber color with a nice head and good fruity banana aroma.  Slight banana taste and a sour finish typical of Belgian beers.  Good smooth drinking beer with average carbonation and a bitter, sour finish.  Just not for me...

Oh man.  On a few special occasions, and a few not so special, Ive had this fantastic brew; now Im finally getting around to rating it.  Pours a thick, foamy off-white head from the half-liter bottle I bought at the bodega on Claremont avenue.  Spring came and went.  Winter returns.  I am wasting time here; might as well get wasted.

The beer pours a medium clear brown with a nice light tan head with good retention and lacing.
The aroma is light but good with lots of malt and some wheat.

The taste is great. Tons of sweet matliness on the front balanced by a smooth crisp finish with a hint of wheat.

THe feel is great and totally drinkable. A great beer.

500 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a hazy orangey brown colour with a large cream coloured head and steady smallish bubbles visible in the beer.  Aroma is quite clove-y with banana and yeast .  Flavour has fruity esters, caramel and clove.  Medium-full body, silky mouthfeel.  A nice beer.

Poured into an Aventinus glass...thank god. Aventinus pours a rich, hazey mahogany, with a slightly off-white head that leads to really nice lacing. Strong aromas of banana and clove, followed with a tailend of vanilla and confectioners sugar. The taste of Aventinus is uncanny. Bananas, vanilla and clove are on the front end of this beer. Sweet, malty, and almost tastes like a bananas foster. Mild to high carbonation, with a smooth and creamy mouthfeel, that finishes so nicely. I could drink this beer all day...literally. It is almost that perfect, great aroma, great flavor, and outstanding feeling while drinking.

Bottle 500ml @ home
[Trade by Dedollewaitor] Pours clear brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, cararmel, yeast and some banana. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter. Body is full, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

A light spicy aroma with some banana and malt overtones.  Color is an opaque brownish dark amber with bubbly off white head that starts tall and slowly dissapears with no retention.  Taste is lightly sweet and bitter and a nice creamy medium body.  Lively carbonation as bubbles arise for quite a long time.  Finish has a definite alchohol note.  I definitely like this beer but may not be my favorite in this category.

Drank the "alias", Tap 6 Schneider Weisse Unser Aventinus. Pours dark amber almost brown colour with a beige profuse head. Aroma has some notes of malts, yeast, some caramel tofee and herbs. Light to medium sweet in the taste, malty subtle but round flavour with the overwhelming presence of caramel notes again. Medium body, oily feel, average carbonation and very light bitter notes toguether with the round sweet notes in the after taste. Good one.

Old rating - drank this at Schneiders place in Munich out of their signature glass. Rich, dark brown color with a large white head with light lacing as it receded. 

Smells are predominantly spicy with a hint of banana

Taste is initially sweet with a mix of banana however middle and end are predominantly clove in nature.

Medium body, silky in nature. covers the mouth well without being sticky or too light. 

Good sipping beer which leaves you with a satisfied alcohol related warmth.

Cloudy dark brown with a nice light brown creamy head. The aroma is sweet banana, with a yeast touch. The flavour is the tipical wheat beer, but much more tastefull, a little liquorice, some of its notes reminds me of good dubbel belgian ales. Refreshing but tasty, great one.
weisse aroma,amber, cloudy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, medium body, creamy, long finish, very nice beer.

12/03/2011 - 50cl bottle @ home - BB: 3/2/11 (2011-113)  Thanks to Klaas for the bottle! 
Dark brown beer, off-white huge creamy head, dissipates fast, little adhesive. Aroma: caramel, fruity, jam. MF: ok carbon, full body. Taste: fruits (strawberries, forest fruit), citrus notes. Aftertaste: citrus, fruity, little hops, some chocolaty hint.

Bottle into 20 oz weizen glass. Very murky reddish-brown pour with a thick light-tan head. Im pretty sure its true to style for a bottle condition weizenbock, but the pour did look a little gross. Aroma is thick with sweet caramel and toffee, with a splash of dark berries. Flavor is about the same. On the sweet side, but not overpowering. Mainly caramel and toffee notes with some dark fruit esters. Slight wheat and yeast tang to it. Mouthfeel is velvety smooth. Really outstanding beer. Im really starting to enjoy weizenbocks as a whole, and I fear I may have set the bar too high for all other ones!
Pours orangish brown, with a light to medium tan head. Aroma is sweet and faintly spicy. Taste is smooth and rich, with notes of spice, fruit, and a bit of chocolate. Very nice blend. Thumbs up...

Shared bottle. Pours a dark, orange-amber with a large off-white head. Just gorgeous. Aroma is ripe bananas, some dark fruits, bit of raisin. Taste is more of ripe bananas, some plum, a bit of chocolate, quite sweet.  Full and fairly carbonated.
This is the weizen bock that defines the style. Bready, dark, and malty. Dark fruits, clove, overripe bananas, noble hops. Creamy body. A hint of boozy rum. Lovely.

Bottle served 2011-03-06. My first Wiessbier. 
Pours a bit cloudy oak in color with a large yellow/tan head.  
Smell is caramel, banana-candy with little or no trace of hops. 
Its creamy and softly carbonated and finish aint very bitter at all. (rather sweet) 

I cant compare it to other wiess since its my first. However this is a great tasting beer and the only thing I might regret is that I proberly served it too warm. This is proberly a killer served a bit cooler during the summer months. And I will surely try doing so this summer!

Pours cloudy brown with a yellow -brown spectrum at the base of the weizen glass. Big, dense off white head. Aromas of big banana and cloves -  so inviting. Noble hop aromas also on the back end. Medium-light body, medium-high carbonation. Dark malts balanced by the banana and complex clove flavours, a decent amount of bitterness works well with the carbonation, creamy body and just so good - finish is excellent, simple, but still the banana and cloves linger with a burnt toffee sweetness.
2nd time around rating this - got no problem with that - i get to drink this great beer again.
draft. great beer, strong,sweet and spicy but pleasant. good head and palate.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2011 500ml bottle pours big head that lingers for a few minutes over pretty, translucent copper body.  
Aroma is banana-flavored bubblegum, pine resin, clove, and vanilla.  medium sweetness, lightly sour / salty, finishes lightly bitter.
Palate is lively carbonation and lightly sticky.
A finely-crafted beer just not my style.

Hazy dark brown with a huge off-white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, banana, yeasty and spicy - cloves. Flavor is rather sweet and so is the finish. Full bodied, soft and very smooth. This is yummy. 280709
Hazy red-brown in the glass with an off-white head.  Aroma of yeasty spice, dried fruits, and roasted malt.  Rich and smooth mouthfeel.  Nice malty flavor profile.
UPDATED: APR 23, 2011 Awesome muddy brown color. Taste is wheaty with dark fruits; slight alcohol burn. Greatbeer.

E lAventinus, e cè poco da fare. Perfetta, weizenbock storica, unica. Aroma intenso, complesso con riflessi di banana. Gusto morbido, caldo e vellutato.
Si parte da qui, le altre weizenbock sono copie.

This beer pours dark brown with some ruby coloring on the edges and three-finger wide white head. Aroma is quite complex with notes of grass, wheat, some fruit, and yeast. Medium bodied and the taste is quite bready and fruity with a bitter aftertaste. I believe this one was only aged about six months, I would like to try it again after a few years.
Very complex malts on the body of this lager, best lager ive ever had, ages very well, with age (2004) the malts relax and gain complexity, bready notes rise, vey interesting

Pours a dark brown with big off white head.  Aroma of wheat, citrus, spice, ripe fruit, yeast, and an ending of clove. Taste is very good caramel strong sweetness, light spiciness, and light bitter. Ever so reminiscent of a good Belgian...  Full bodied yet a light creamy smoothness is exhibited alcohol is well hidden.  Excellent stuff!

Bottled. Pours clear, brown with a large, off-white head. Nose of wheat, yeast and with banana and clove notes. Lively carbonation. Sweet flavour with caramel, light malt, fruit, grain spicy notes. Light to medium bodied. Creamy texture. Ends up more dry. Enjoyable.

On tap at the Avenue Pub in New Orleans.  Powerfully great beer.  Color, head, aromas, and feel are just fantastic, especially so in light of the high alcohol content.  A new favorite, that I wont be able to sample very often.

Dark brown beer with orange hues, and a thin, off-white head. Weak aromas of citrus, spices, and caramel. Tastes like a traditional German hefe: citrus notes, and wheat, very zesty. Some spiciness. This is accompanied by nice hints of roasted chocolate, and caramel. Other flavors coming through are cloves, and bananas. Medium-bodied, easy drinking despite the high(nicely hidden) ABV.
