Slightly creamy mouth feel. Very tasty, cannot recommend this one enough.

Keg at Euston Tap. Hazy, dark brown pour with a white cream cap. Aroma is hugely fruity, mostly cherries, with hints of yeast and wheat. Flavor is pretty sweet with lightly tart cherries, wheat, other dark fruits like grapes or raisins. Medium in body with smooth carbonation. Sweet, fruity finish with really no hints of the ABV. A great beer, rich and very drinkable.

500 ml bottle, pours a dark, hazy copper color with copious mocha head. Aroma is complex with caramel sweetness, spicyness, and heavy toasty maltiness present. Aroma is very lively and strong- you can appreciate it from far away- and is not bitter or pungent at all. Taste reflects the aroma with sweetness more prominent at first and then fading more to toasty malt prevalence. Palate is nice and smooth and the beer sits very full in the mouth, No real aftertaste noted.  Great beer for sipping, especially if you are tired of excessively bitter overhopped beers.

Bottle. Poured a medium hazy brown with a very large off-white fizzy head that dissapated rapidly and had no poor lacing. The aroma was complex with a dark chocolate malt and a sweet earthy yeast that had notes of clove, banana, vanilla and a mild alcohol scent. It tasted sweet and acidic with a mild hint of banana and chocolate in the begining and the become mildly sweet with a yeasty-sour flavor that had a nice spiciness at the finish with the flavor lasting only a short time. Mouthfeel was light to medium in body and watery in texture with a lively carbonation. Overall an awesome wheat/bock beer, in fact I think I will just have to drink another.

Pours dark mahogany, tinting purple in certain light. Four finger, massive head full of miniscule bubbles creating a blanket resting on top of the beer.

Aroma is yeasty and malty, similar to a Belgian strong ale. Bread and fruit. Very complex aroma.

Yeast is present in the taste as well. Rich and deep malt flavor. Wheat sweetness is definitely present but its balanced by drier malts similar to oak and toast. Caramel and earthy flavors are there too.  Pretty sharply carbonated. Looks, smells, and drinks like a Belgian ale and dark lager hybrid. 

This is a really good beer.

Very rarely do I give that much extra for smell, but this smells amazing, and the pour is impressive, head is large and long lasting.  Not to mention the picture of the dude with a beard on the bottle is also cool.

Taste is very sweet, almost like a hefe with a different twist on it.  I dont usually have weizen bocks, so I dont have much of a frame of reference, but I like it, sweet, smooth, and a bit tart in the end, has that bready yeast flavor to it as well that adds a lot of flavor to it.  A slight bitterness in the end as well.  Pretty complex flavor.

All in all very nice, I like it, definitely deserves the high rating.  Definitely easy drinking as well which could be dangerous given the abv....which is well hidden.

Brown red liquid with pretty impressive head. Smell is a like a bit damp cellar. Taste is very weissen like, thou the colour is not at all in line. Theres nice citrus and fruit style aromas. Like usual, with weissens, I like this quite much.

Nice pour, big head as advertised.  Murky light brown. Pungent scent, there is a lot going on here. Smells stongly of cloves.  Sweet and tangy but not tart with a fairly thick feel.  Finish is dry and juicy at the same time with a toffee overtone. All the flavors leave your mouth watering. Dried apricots with raisons and cinnamon.  It does a good job of bringing on that beautiful body, and/or personality warming effect.  Very interesting brew, try one.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2012 Ahhh Aventinus, oe of my favorites, heres a proper review. 500ml bottle, with the old label (purple one, apparently its white now).

Pours with a nice active head, thank you bottle conditioning, the head is slightly darker than off-white and recedes pretty quickly leaving splotches of lace. The beer is one of my favorite looking ones of all time, especially with the tall creamy head. It is a vibrant amber/brown/rad, darker than your typical Weizenbock, of course its a Doppelweizenbock or Weizenstarkbier, but apparently its not distinct enough to BA to make it a style.

The smell is an intensified version of the normal weizen bock, thick dark fruits and banana are the main parts with the great yeast twang and alcoholic kiss following. There is also hints of apple skin, clove, and brown sugar.

THis is one bold tasting monster, the flavors smack you in the face, with heavy yeast in the flavor, banana, dark fruits, some spiciness, a faint kiss of hop, and the alcohol. The carbonation is a great tool to permeate your tongue with amazing flavor.

This beer kicks major, major ass.

4.55/5

Pours a deep mahogany into the glass with a big tinged white head.  Aroma is banana and gloves with a bit of malt sweetness.  Flavor is like a banana split.  Big fruity yeast esters combined with a great malt bill that adds some chocolate character to the beer.  Cant believe Ive never rated this one before.  Really an enjoyable and quaffable beer for 8.2%

Poured this from the bottle, probably too warm. The head disappeared within a minute to leave a cola brown fizzy liquid. Good, promising nose which reminded me of aniseed/weak licorice. Medium body and a fizziness that quickly disappears, along with an abrupt finish. Cant taste the 8.2% alcohol at all. Best thing about this beer is the aroma, but overall I was disappointed and cant understand what the hype is all about. It cant all be down to the temperature.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2011 Azt hittem édes lesz a sör de egyáltalán nem. Finom, harmónikus. Karamelles illat, finom intenzív koriander íz kevés komlóval.
Zavaros világosbarna szín.
Jó!

Aroma: Wheat malts, alcohol, coriander, spices, jam, acidic. 
Appearance: hazy ruby colour, big creamy dirty-white head, lacing. 
Flavour: Wheat malts, alcohol, coriander, spices, jam, low bitterness and sweet. 
Mouthfeel: Honestly it is almost flat. 
Total: Good, but I dont understand the hype.

Presentation: (Part of a 5 pack gift set with glass.) It was poured from a brown 500ml bottle into the Aventinus glass that came with the beer. The label on the bottle has the abv (8.2%) and a description of the beer on the back. There is no freshness date but there seems to be a batch number or bottle code on the back label.

Appearance: It produces a thick and tall head which is light tan in color and settles out quickly. This makes for just a little slick lacing on the glass. The body has a rich mahogany color and hazy flat look.

Smell: The aroma is fruity and yeasty. There are some big banana and bready yeast like notes with mild clove and sweet booze. There is only a faint trace of hops.

Taste/Palate: The flavor has a sweet and fruity, medium to full bodied character with all the wonderful notes picked up in the nose. Red banana, bready yeast, some caramel and light clove mingle with a touch of sweet booze and very mild hop bitterness. The feel is smooth and lightly carbonated. It drinks well and never gets too sweet or cloying despite its sweet overall character.

Notes: What else can I say? Its a great beer!!! The only thing I would like to have had with this beer is a little more head retention.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2011 Figured it was time for me to start rating beers, this is my first for whatever reason.

500ml bottle poured into a Weizen glass.  Very hazy, unclear brown with a thick white head, beautiful.

Aroma is very sweet, fruity, malty, a lot of banana, some caramel.

Taste is much like the aroma, very sweet.

Very nicely full-bodied, an excellent beer

500 ML Bottle.  Pours a deep rich amber color with a 1 1/2 finger head. Left little lacing. Aromas of plum and raisin. Mouthfeel is fantastic with partial sweetness fading to reveal cloves and a slight spice. This was an amazing beer. I really enjoyed it. Well priced too
Almost Perfect. An extremely amazing bier. I loved it in the first moment i touched it with my tongue. Amazing.
1/2 liter bottle-Poured a cloudy brown with a full head. Wow, fruit notes with clove and other spices. Smooth, well balanced, great brew.

Deep ruby pour, off white head that sits perfectly.  Aroma has big notes of banana, clove, some ginger, caramel, and dark fruit.  Taste is creamy and balanced, with notes of banana, clove, and caramel sweetness mixed perfectly together with some other spice and dark fruit.  Great, great beer.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2011 Cloudy dark amber, generous head, very little lacing.  Caramel malt, with mild spicy carbonation.  Great mouthfeel, blooms as it goes through to a nice beer bitter finish.  Superb balance.  Not complex, but who cares?  It is a great brew.

A 500 ml bottle with the renewed unappealing label and crown-cap saying Tap 6. BB date 28. July 2011, into tulip. Pours turbid ruby-brown body overlain by thick, long lasting beige head that clings to the walls and after finally subsides forms a permanent thick solid cloth. Weizenbock can be tought of as (Doppel)bock whose grist bill includes some wheat malt therefore its organoleptic qualities should be a mixture of (Doppel)bock and German wheat beer. So,...the aroma is bock-like melanoidins, bready malt, ripened plum, clove phenolics, banana esters and evident alcohol. The palate is on the sweet side with bock-like melanoidins, dark fruits (plums and raisins), wheat flavor, clove and spicy alcohol that helps to balance the malt and brings warming sensation. Full bodied and highly carbonated although not as prickly as expected considering the carbonation. A nice marriage of Bock and Weizen qualities albeit a bit to alcoholic.

The aroma strikes you with the claccic weizen banana yeast, sweetness and caramel. Aroma isnt very complex, but very pleasant. Taste has the same components, but also some bitterness from hops. Not hop taste, but mostly bitterness. Smooth carbonation and nice mouthfeel.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2011 My first Weizen Bock! Yes it is as tasty as beautiful. At first I didnt even want to drink it because its appearance is brilliant artistry at work. Seriously take the time to appreciate the mystic shades. I had to hold this one up to a light just to really see what was going on. My eyes were stimulated by the carbonation bubbles rising to the bottom of the head. If I could paint with any talent I would take the time necessary to capture this brews raw attraction. You will feel the alcohol quickly and taste the unmistakable clove. I feel it is a full bodied  with a pleasurably long finish. Overall the taste is deserving of accolades, but the view of this one is  incomparable. The head never leaves the beer. Lovely.

Amber and clear with light beige quite persistent and quite fine foam.
The aroma is the ipical one of weizen beers: banana and clove. But its not so fine. Also a little of roasted.
A good body and a good level of alcohol are mixed with the banana flavour.
Very sweet with low bitterness. So fine for the style but nothing of exceptional.
The high level of alcohol comes out soon and, with the consistent body, makes this beer not so drinkable.

Aroma of dried fruit, caramell and maybe some gingerbread. It is a tasty and well balanced beer with some sweetness and hints of dried fruit, herbs and toffee.
Unclear and brown-yellow in colour.
A really nice dark and strong weissbier.

Not really a huge weizen bock fan...but this could change anyones mind.  Fantastic aroma that makes the mouth water for clove, dark roast malt and even some caramel.  Dont be fooled by color as it is subtle yet refreshing in flavor.  Leaves a very smooth velvety texture with an impression hard to forget
Bottle, pours a. Dark brown black colkor. Smells of honey, and pine. TasTes of cloves, syrup and vanilla nuts

Poured into my Aventinus weizen glass.

5.0 A: Opaque dark brown color. Plenty of frothy head that wont quit and leaves lots of lacing.

4.0 S: Tons of banana followed by a spicy clove torrent.

3.5 T: Much, much more earthy than I was expecting. Esters in the nose are for the most part MIA. Theres still a bit of spiciness to it though. Crystal malt flavor apparent, but lacking the sweetness I usually get from a weizenbock.

4.0 M: Medium body. Bubbly carbonation with an otherwise creamy backbone.

4.5 D: Very drinkable for a weizenbock due to the low level of sweetness.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-26-2009 01:09:05

Hazy brown thick pour with decent white head.  Aroma dominated by citrus and banana with notes of malt and dried fruits.  Acidic flavor dominated by wheat and light malts.  Alcohol notes dominate the flavor, even though the beer feels light at the start.  Long aftertaste and strong alcohol finish.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2011 Bottle. Murky dirt brown colour with a beige fluffy head that falls and becomes a nice "lid". Aroma is sharp yeast with some caramel notes, marzipan and fruit, gingerbread. Mouthfeel is very smooth and low carbonated. Taste is caramel and fruit. banana, prunes, fudge. Alcohol is warming without disturbing. Its rich, warming and smooth. Im still not a fan of weizen though so Im a bit confused with this style, but its very drinkable.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2012 Eccola qua la capostipite delle weizenbock, mi ricordo la prima volta me la portò un carissimo amico dalla Germania. Ora la trovo sempre in splendida forma. Aspetto e aroma magnifico. In bocca sempre pungente.  Grande bere!!!
Bottled. Hazy dark brown beer with tall white foamy head. Sweet bananic malty aroma and taste. Nicely bodied, well balanced. A tasty classic.
Strong yeast and malt flavor, good nightcap.  Hard to find but good when can.
24th December 2007  Very dark wheat beer. Sweet and dry. A trace of toffee malt and fruit. Lots of banana and bubblegum.

Pours a big nice thick off-white  head, rather medium bubbles with a few bigger ones.
Banana nose, with slight fruity esters. You can smell the nice yeast.
After 1-2 minutes and twirling, some light caramel come out.
Color is dark red-brown, hazy/opaque.

Not too sweet, nice light bitterness and an almost salty quality, which is nice.
Body is light and fizzy, with a nice creamy aspect.
Banana comes through also taste wise.
Sweetness lingers, to a medium length finish.

This is an awesome beer!
Not to sweet, so it can be a night long affair.
Nice bitterness balance.

Actually-this is my first experience with this beer.

A- Body is a uniformly translucent rich chestnut brown hue. Pours with a 1-2 finger foamy slightly off-white head which eventually fades to a thick collar-very little lacing is left behind in the glass.

S- I understand that this is a weizenbock- but the nose is very BSDA in nature- dark fruit-plum, raisin- come out the most initially in the nose. There is a mild banana bread essence in the background.

T- Taste upfront is mild and offers dark fruit (as discribed above) with an accent of banana and clove- and a nice bready yeast backbone. The finish is a bit spicier and more typical for the style as the banana bread essence really comes through and the dark fruit disappears. What is left to linger is bready yeast and a bit of spice.

M- Medium to high carbonation and a smooth yeasty body.

D- This is a great, well put together Weizenbock. Im surprised that this is the first time I have tried it as it is clearly top notch for the style- and I like this style (despite its huge variation). A reminder why I love German beers so much-although I tend to overlook them.

I found this 500ml bottle for $4!! Its also always refreshing to see this brew in the top 100 (deviating form the IPA, stout, barrel aged, sour dominated list). Fantastic, classic example of the style to measure others to.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-02-2010 02:08:12

500mL bottle, pours dark brown with a thick off-white head. Excellent lacing. Aroma of dark roasted malts, caramel, clove and some sweetness. Flavor of wheat, chocolate malt, caramel, banana, clove, no bitterness. A truly great brew to warm up up during the winter. Well worth whatever you pay for it.

Tasted 2011-01-02. Pours cloudy, dark brown with beige head. Powerful banana aroma. Very sweet and cloying. No bitterness. Very heavy. The taste is perfect for the style, but it cant be stressed enough: Its HEAVY!!!

Murky brown in colour with a frothy white head; not the best looking beer in the world, but its got a great nose - full of grain and yeast, some honey and spices.  In the mouth a banana flavour comes out, along with the malty sweetness and bread character.  Full flavoured, but due to the wheat it remains refreshing throughout.  Mouth feel is medium with a lively carbonation; no alcohol heat.  Finishes dry and aromatic, with the spices and banana lingering.  Very nice.
Dark hazy body light brown head. Aroma of caramel, banana and slight notes of alcohol. Flavour adds wheaty bread and some cereals. Oily and nicely balanced. Great!

Served bottled with a Weizen glass. Initially poured it too quick, got a huge head out of it that took up 2/3 of the glass, but after allowing it to die down a little, finished off the rest of the glass.

AROMA: Strong aroma of alcohol and yeast, very pleasant opposite the burger I was having.

APPEARANCE: Difficult to tell because the place was so dark, but: dark mahogany brown with a light-brown head, leaves generous lacing on the glass as its drunk

TASTE: Wow. What an experience. The alcohol detected on the nose is almost invisible in the taste, a welcome sight for such a high ABV beer. Opens with a bready flavor that quickly progresses into a light, smooth berry flavor (blackberries and currants?) with the faintest hint of clove and banana. 

PALATE: Unlike other doppelbocks Ive tried, this one was extraordinarily light. It lacks the weight I would ordinarily expect, but this wasnt a bad thing - it complemented the heavier flavors I was getting from the food.

OVERALL: Probably one of the best beers Ive ever drunk - very complementary flavors and extraordinarily refreshing - a fine, fine offering.

Murkey amber-brown with a nice white head that settles to a thin film.  Alcohol and belgian yeast tones dominate the aroma.  Moderately sweet, a bit like a strong belgian dark ale. Abit of banana and clove (and nutmeg) on both the aroma and flavor, like a typical weiss beer.
On tap at Quotations 12 beers of Christmas event.  Very tasty and served in the same awesome glass that is pictured above.
Wonderful beer. Chocolate brown, round taste. I never had a beer like that before.

Moussante comme je les aime quand on la verse. Une belle Robe opaque brune rougatre passant par des tons dorangé. On goute dabort les fruits pour ensuite gouter les épices........... Bref je ne la connaissait pas jen suit maintenant un adepte, quelle bijou dAllemagne.

Ett koncentrat av den himmelska fröjden. I smakupplevelsen kan man stanna hur länge som helst och verkligen grotta ned sig i det fint vävda nät av nyanser som bara expanderar och djupnar ju mer man umgås med det. Ett av de bästa veteölen jag haft nöjet att avsmaka.

Cloudy brownish-red, good head.  My best description of the aroma is candy- apple, but dark (and not a caramel covered apple either -- the other kind of candy apple).  Good mouthfeel, the bubbles coat your tongue but the taste of bourbon ( without the alcohol burn) comes through, then blending into the candy (but not too sweet) flavor on the nose.  Very nice.

Pours cloudy amber with a pale foamy tan head.  Aroma of cloves and cinnamon. Spicy grape flavor with a full body and a slightly sharp bite on tje tongue. Warm spices linger.  Very tasty but reminds me a little of bubble gum.

50cl bottle. Pours a dark ruby-brown color with a huge beige head. A very strong yeast/bannana flavor seems to dominate accentuating the wheat aspects of the beer backed by a malty doppelbock backbone. Good carbonation.

Caramel brown in the glass with thick carbonation.  Aroma is round belgian yeast, cloves, bananas, and perhaps the slightest sweet malt underneath.  Smells very refreshing.  Oh wow - drinks like a dream.  Velvet in the mouth with the taste following the aroma plus some slight raisin and a touch of mild bitterness on the finish.  Exceptionally well made beer with every component of aroma and taste giving smoothly way to the next.

Pours a beautiful deep red.  Intense head, spicy aroma.
Fuller bodied than I expected...a great sweet caramelly flavor.
Just a touch of acidity/bitterness in the finish.
Wonderful beer.

One of my absolute favorite beers. Thick white head on top of a beautifully coloured dark red, almost purple (like the label) body. Fragrant nose of banana, spices, and hop. Palate is superb and it flows like silk. Tastes like dark chocolate and banana. High ABV ties all the flavors together to create a very well-rounded and exceptionally drinkable beer.

Una de mis favoritas alemanas y del mundo entero.Rica...fuerte...gran aroma afrutado que sabe esconder sus buenos grados de alcohol. Entra al cuerpo sin gran problema y delieta al paladar con gran alegria.
Mi cerveza favorita alemana hasta ahora

Ive had this beer several times, but it was drinking great last night at Broadway Brewhouse. Was served in an overfilled .5 L Aventinus glass like the one in the profile picture. I got a lot of ohhhs and ahhs from the crowd. The glass was impressive. Damn that thing holds a lot of beer. It took awhile to finish. The beer has a wonderful aroma full of fruit and malt. Notes of raisins, dates, raspberry, apricot, molasses, and plenty of others. German beers dont get much better than this. Wonderful mouthfeel. Awesome beer.
Good beer, It smell a little like bubble gum and banana a typical weizen. The taste is like clove, vanilla and banana. It is very interesting. I would probably suggest this beer to my friends.

G: Poured into a weizen glass.

A: Hazy light mahogany with almost purple/ruby streaks. Nice off-white head of at least two fingers. Good lacing and plenty of sediment.

S: Crisp yeast with banana, bubblegum, and clove. Some sweet/tart fruit as well--perhaps green apple. Various dried fruits.

T: Dried fruits and a little bit of that green apple taste. Not as much of the bubblegum/banana as in the nose. Some dried fruits, as well as some slight spices.

M: Creamy and tart. Medium bodied with a pretty hefty dose of carbonation. The alcohol lets its presence be known, even though this is only 8.2abv.

D: The carbonation is a little much and Im surprised by how prevalent the alcohol is given that the abv isnt that high.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-28-2009

Aventinus
Weizen Bock
Pours brown with a thin tan head and good retention. Kinda ugly appearance. Aroma is Belgian yeast (not German) with raisins, winter spices and a decent malt backbone. Flavor is distinctly Belgian, not German. Spicy funk with some sweet fruitness. Lacks something and only ok.

Huge pale beige coarseish head. Hazy deep red body with vigourous fine-bubbled carbonation. Strong fruity yoghurty banana aroma with cloves cinnamon oil and roasty notes. Complex and harmonic. Dry-sweet and faintly acidic yoghurty fruity banana taste with herbal roasty dusty notes. Full-bodied. Mild, delicately hot mouthfeel. Dry roasty alcohol and wheat aftertaste with toffee notes. A bit mild in flavour, but complex, harmonic, and well balanced. (0.5l bottle, Vika wine monopoly, Oslo.)

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2013 2010 Bottle @ home in 2010. Very cloudy, amber brown appearance with a light tan head. Very delicious and pretty strong aroma of wheat, dark malts, banana, cloves, and toastiness. Fairly spicy nose. Sweet wheat, roasted dark malty flavor with bananas, cloves, and especially yeast. Crisp, sweet, dark wheat malty finish. Maybe some fusel notes on the finish but not bad. One of my favorite beers of all-time. I compare all other Weizenbock beers to Aventinus.

2004 bottle (tasted 1/2013). Caramelized sugar, pear, plum, cinnamon aroma. Cinnamon donut flavor. (4.5)

2005 bottle (tasted 1/2013). Spicy yeasty, chocolate, caramel aroma. Pretty fresh, banana, caramel, coffee cake, poppy seed flavor. Carbonation was nice despite the rusted bottle cap. (4.4)

2006 bottle (tasted 1/2013). Light bready, pretty spicy, burnt sugar aroma. Chewy caramel, spicy malty, mild fruity, not as complex as 2004 or 2005 but way more drinkable. (4.4)

2007 bottle (tasted 1/2013). Very spicy, slightly oxidized, light fruity aroma. Chewy malty, caramel, spicy yeasty flavor, cool stuff. (4.2)

2008 bottle (tasted 1/2013). Spicy, a lot more toasty malty, light fruity, somewhat fresh aroma. Juicy, rich malty, sweet toasted malty, caramel flavor. (4.4)

Fantasztikus sör. Olyan a színe, mint a gesztenyeméz, és szintúgy tökéletesen átláthatatlan. Nagy és tartós habot ereszt. Élesztő, banán és aszalt gyümölcsök érződnek leginkább. Az íze mennyei, és nagyon egyben van, fűszerek(szegfűszeg, szerecsendió), jó érett banán, mazsola és egyéb aszalt gyümölcsök. A magas alkoholtartalma ellenére mégsem érzem annyira testesnek, és ez itt most jó pont. Az íze hosszan kitart, de nem olyan tolakodó, csak bizsergetően meghúzódik a háttérben egy jó darabig. Olyan könnyedén csúszik, és mámorítóan hat, felpezsdíti az agyat.
Bottle. Malt, caramel aroma, roasted, slight sugar. Nice flavor - raisin predominates, spices, cloves. Very nice.

This beer looks, smells, and tastes like just about everything - COMPLEX.  It even says so right on the bottle.  Unpastufilterized in the bottle, for real.  To say that this is a beer that does not suck would be the understatement of the millenium.  If you get the chance to have one on tap - take it now!
Good mix of flavors- sweet, yeasty, sour, hoppy- but nothing really blew me away.  Alcohol is high but barely noticeable.

In bottle, An off-white dense persistent foam with a clear ruby brown color. High aroma of malt, caramel, cloves, molasse and a hint of banana adds to fresh fruit, raisins and plums with vanilla notes. Strong full in the mouth malty flavor with raisins, plums and molasses. Bitterness is low with phenols of cloves and vanilla.  This makes it a strong malty wheat based beer with lots of phenols and a supporting alcool.

Dark, but not opaque, solid white head with legs, tasty aroma.  This has a full bodied flavor, a hint of dates or raisin, and caramel.  A very solid 8.2%, this is a beer that goes a long way.  Very nice.
500 mL bottle.  Medium brown, large head.  Mildly bitter.  Strong malty flavor.  Great Doppel.

[500ml bottle, The Bottle, York] Dark ruby reddish brown colour, pours with a voluminous peaky white head. Sweet, spicy aroma with dark stone fruit and some banana. There is an alcohol component on the palate, but not as hefty as youd expect from an 8%er. Malts, banana and caramel on the flavour, with raisins at the same time. Finish is quite sweet, with a complex mouthfeel  both of which increase at it warms [04122008]

Bottle:
Very big off white foamy head on top of a deep dark ruby brown beer.
Smell caramel, malts, sweets, spices, speculaas, grass, herbs and some darker fruits.
Taste is a soft silky mouthfeel, nice balanced mix of fruit, spices, sweets, cookies, speculaas, malts, grass and hops.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Awesome beer.  Pours a dark garnet with a big frothy white head.  Aroma is very malty and wheat.  Add in faint yeast and earthy floral.  Taste is wheat up front and malt in the back.  Mild hop bite but the complexities of the malt are amazing.  Ill definitely have again.

It just doesnt get any better than this. Tonight, probably my 6th bottle pour of Aventinus in the last 6 months, consistenly beautiful   Appealing hazy brown color, notes of caramel, vanilla, bananas, almost chocolatey.  Must find it on tap to compare to the bottle. Not quite a "chewy" palate but close.  Cannot believe the alcohol content based on the flavor, but then the effect is such that I know that "one is enough."

Pours a deep amber brown color with a thick off-white foam head.  Has a strong aroma of dark fruit.  Has a yeasty clove taste with dark fruit notes on the backend.  Has a thin to medium mouthfeel.  Tasty.
Hazy brown, nice head. Smell of caramel and banana. Spicy taste of cloves with a bitter finish. Very good warmer.

This one is just plain fun. The aroma is very fruity and very wheaty. Mostly banana, wheat and traces of vanilla. Very heady, wants to explode from the bottle after you open it. Head is thick and creamy while the body of the brew is almost mahogany. Taste is smooth and fruity while not being overly so. The wheat content in the taste is also just right and not overpowering. This is a brilliant brew that does not taste like it has an abv of 8.2%.

Notes from August 2010

Ar: Lots of banana and clove with a bit of burnt sugar.
Ap: Ruby brown opaque pour with a creamy weizen head.
F: Banana and clove follow suit, along with some toffee and a bit of alcohol on the finish.
P: Medium, somewhat sticky body, effervescent carbonation.

O: Great weizen-bock.

Aroma has heavy sweet ripe banana and caramel and biscuity malts
Appearance is murky stale coffee with a fizzy off white/beige head.
Taste has ripe banana, medium bitterness, lightly sour.
medium body, oily feel, fizzy, with a bitter lond end.
Den legendariske - alltid lika god. Trevliga toner av malt, välbalanserat och stabil.

Hazy maple syrup color with a fizzy beige head that settles to a thin layer. Caramel, dark fruit, and toffee with faint banana and clove in the aroma. Similar flavor with a crisp, citrusy, slightly alcoholic finish. Lot going in this one. Soft and foamy on the palate. Really tasty. Like the German version iv a dubbel.

Appearance is cloudy and dark caramel in color.  Aroma is predominantly dark fruits with caramel notes.  Initial taste is tangy - heavy dark malt flavor, fruity plum and cherry and alcohol esters.  Amazing beer.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2010 Bottle @ Henrik, Bergen. Dark, red-hued brown body with a large weissbier-creamy head. Looks good. Scents are sweet caramel, bubblegum, dark malts and hints of spices. Smooth tones hit my palate in a velvety fashion; dark malts, cherry, grassy hops, hints of pepper, figs and nutmeg - a core of sweet flavors pointing towards the Eisbock version; one can definitely feel that these beers come from the same source. Very full-bodied; this is a veritable beer dinner here! :-)  Rich, creamy and nice in every way, the Schneider Aventinus rightfully deserves its spot on top of the Weizen Bock list in my opinion. Prost! :-D
For a while, this was undoubtedly my benchmark beer. Simply delicious. Im currently aging some, and will rate this again in five years. See you then, Aventinus.
Murky brown with a big creamy head. Big fruity and spicy flavours in here. Banana, bubblegum, cloves, wheat and caramel. Deserves its classic status for sure.

2003 bottle.  Pours clear dark caramel color with off white head.  Aroma is clove, sherry, wheat, and caramel.  Medium mouthfeel.  Flavors follow the nose.  This has a great sherry like flavor, nutty, almost roasty, and is an overall great experience.  A damn fine brew.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Nice colour of the body and the head is quite creamy. Aroma and flavor is quite similar to the golden variant of this brew. This is even more heavy malty and the sweetens is more from syrup and brown sugar.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2016 Special release 2012 vintage bottle cons 2016-10-14, Göteborg 
AR: wee vinos, sweet yeastiness 
AP: dark amber, high frothy lively dark cream brown fluff
F: rich carbonation , sweet yeastiness, rasins, prunes, dadels, sweet sponge cake, new rating 3,8 old 3,5. Go with new

Bottle at home 2010-10-18, Göteborg
AR: sweet potato, banana foam, melas
AP:  hazy golden mahogny, 4 cm thik slowly diminishing light beige head
F: wheat, warm feeling, melas, plum flavored jenka chewing gum, vinos felling, vinos finish

Dark hazy purple/red with massive white head that settles quickly.  Yeast, spices, sweet malt and chewing gum in aroma. More of the same in the rich taste that is quite sweet and have noticeable warmth from the alcohol.
0,5 L bottle. Dark red with big foam. Aroma is dough, banana, clove, alcohol, raisin, vanilla, caramel, and cereal. Sweetness, full body, sticky texture, average carbonation. This is a tasty beer.
Light sour smell. Small head that does not last long. lightly sour with caramel aftertaste.

Bottle. Dark brown with large whitish head. Malt, banana and caramel. Yeast. Refreshing but dont have too much since it is a bit strong.Full body, especially if you pour entire bottle into the glass and gets some yeast?

500 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Pours big, thick, off-white head. Hazy, dark brown colour. Nice, complex aroma with notes of banana, cloves, yeast and dark fruits. Very fresh for a Hefe. Taste is well balanced with a small bitterness, some sweetness and hints of almonds, pepparkakor (swedish gingerbread) and spices. Truly delicious! Nice, round mouthfeel with some dryness because of the high ABV. Medium bodied. Nice, warm feeling from the alcohol. Recommended for everyone who likes a good weissbier.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2011 Bottle, as Tap 6 Unser Aventinus. Opaque, copper red with a large, creamy tan head. Aroma: wheat, yeast, roasted chick peas, fruit, spices. Taste: fruit, sweet malt, caramel, licorice, candy, slightly acidic, dry finish. Pretty full-bodied with a soft mouthfeel.
Aroma is rich, weat, caramel, clove, Taste is full body with banana and clove.

Bottle from Systembolaget.
Soft wheat malt giving the background for a complex beer. Plums, blackcurrants, sour cherries. Deceivingly easy drinking, you get new nuances in every sip.

Dark amber hew with a  fine head, this beer has an subtle kick yet also holds a stable and long-lasting taste. Gentle to begin with and very full-bodied.  The 2004 reserve has more personality is has a sweeter aftertaste than its younger sisters.  You cant lose with any vintage but if you can get your palate on a 04, 05 , or 06 they are well worth the money.

Brown with a medium head that colopases pretty quick to a small one. Smell is wheat, red fruits and spices. A bit watery sour-sweet, fruits spices, caramel and some wheat/yeast at the tast. Not bad, but not totally my style of beer.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Excellent, dark, hazy pour with a big head. Very rich in taste. A must try for those who like weissbier!

Dark mahogany in colour with thin head. Lovely rich red fruit aroma.  Wow, what a massively well constructed beer. Butterscotch, almond, red fruit (particularly red cherry), molasses, raisins. Great mouth feel too; smooth and viscous with carbonations thats not overpowering and which gives pleasant  light relief from the richness of the beer. Hides the alcohol well. Nice warming fruity finish. By the end of the beer (it took me about 1.5 hours to drink) it did start to remind me a bit of a old peculiar (although still better than that).

500 ml bottle from Princetons.  Deep caramel colored pour with a few fingers of foamy white head.  Beautiful aroma, almost dubel like with the dark fruit notes and the yeast and some banana notes like a hefe.  Sticky mouthfeel with the flavors being much like the aroma but in a bit of a toned down manner and some sweetness which stays around to give it a great finish.

The first dark wheat beer I tasted. Probably one of my favourite beers ever. Amazinc complexity - bananas, spices (cinnamon, cloves), fruits - great length. A good after-deinner beer. Highly recommended.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2011 Most recent bottle had a bit more mushy banana in the nose and the front of the palate was nicely sweet, but the clove in the finish was overwhelming.  Bumping down a few points.

Deep amber Hue with glowing brown and orange highlights. this one pours with a Huge fluffy head about three or more inches tall and off white. powerful aroma with lots of complex layers consisting of yeast and extremely fruity, and slightly spiced. banana, clove, a little raisin and some apricot are all in there. now thats wheat beer. Extremely smooth palate with lots of caramel and slightly sticky. strong banana and clove flavors with a nice spicy finish with just a touch of alcohol. This one makes me moan.

bottle. Poured opaque orange-brown, looks like iced-tea witha medium off-white head. The aroma of ripe banana peel and some alcohol. Medium bodied, smooth carbonation. Flavour is sweet with notes of raisens and clove. Finishes slightly dry and warm at the back of the mouth.

For the eyes: brown colour; murky, particulated body; the head is average sized, frothy, off-white. For the nose: sweet malts like caramel and cookie; heavy yeast; notes of banana and bubble gum. For the mouth: medium body; slick texture; metallic finish. For me: Excellent brew.

Wonderful aroma of wheat, spice and alcohol.  Big lasting off-white head that settles for the perfect amount through out.  Smells of wheat, honey caramel.  Woody and spicy (blended beautifully) on the nose with some roasted caramel/toffee notes. Slight burn taste of alcohol but never menacing.  Finishes stronger, with a lingering aftertaste that keeps its flavor all the way through.  Masterful.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2013 pours murky dark brown-burgundy with a dense light beige head, good retention and lacing. very fruity and yeasty, sugary - brown sugar, bananas and spices, pepper, hint of vanilla. moderate carbonation, medium to full body, nice grassy-spicy finish. excellent stuff..
Strong flavor hides the increased ABV very well.  Pours dark brown with a beige foamy head.  Great hefeweizen tatse with a little extra bite.  Great slow drinking beer for a cool fall day.

Qualities of both a wheat and a bock - very nice. Very fruity  sweet with some caramel. Nice and dark with a small head. Thick and buttery mouthfeel. Potent without being too boozy. Only points lost really were because it is a little too sweet.

500 ml bottle @ home. Rated @ 14.4.2009.
Pours a deep cloudy brown colour with a massive frothy white head. Very nice lacing. The nose is very wheaty with banana and alcohol notes. Very strong and classic Weizenbock flavour; wheat bodied with fruits, especially banana notes. Medium body with oily and creamy texture. Lively carbonation and a foam that fills the mouth. Very good for the upcoming winter season.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2011 Tap6 on ruskea ja samea olut. Tuoksussa on vehnää, banaania ja alkoa. Maussa on vehnää, banaania, hiivaa, mausteita, suolaa ja makeuttakin. Kohtalaisen paksua tavaraa. Tämä on Alkon parhaimpia hinta-laatusuhteeltaan ja on noussut itselleni jonkinlaiseksi vakio-olueksi. Tarttuu siis usein haaviin Alkossa.
Ruby brown. Sting white head. Sweet caramel and banana notes. Malty nice semisweet finish

~Strong aroma of dark fruits like prune and raisin, also some pear and raspberry. Bready and wheaty malts with some banana esters. 
~Pours a murky reddish brown color with thick lasting foamy off white head.
~Rich fruity flavor of plum and pear, some clovey spiciness, some chocolate, some tartness, bready and sweet. 
~Medium full body with medium CO2, slight warming and tingly sensation, Sweet and tart fruity finish.
~Damn this was a good brew! Im really starting to like this brewery alot. Fruity and malty. Delicious!
Pours deep amber with thick foamy head and lacing.  Notes of wheat and clove.  Balance is tipped toward the sweet side.

From the bottle, pours a clear lighter crimson with a thick white foamy head.  Aroma is of bananas and yeast, precipitating an expectedly good wheat beer.  Taste is initially sweetly spicy, immediately mellowing to a banana-clove-yeast flavor, with a sweet malty finish.  As it warms, some more banana and yeast come out in the aftertaste.  Light but beery, good beer.
Very dark brown, good head.  A definite wheat beer aroma with hints of spice.  Wheat beer taste, with with a sort of roasted malt and slightly sweet twist.  Its really very good.

Such a fantastic brew.  Pours a purpleish mahogany with a nice beige head.  Nose has ripe berries, banana, caramel, toffee and herbal yeast.  Taste is so perfectly well  balanced.  Crisp yet full body excites the palate.
Pours cloudy brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet fruity, caramel and breaddy malt. Flavour is breaddy malt, alcohol and fruity notes.
Roasted malt. Strong sweet taste. Long lasting head. Slightly fruity aroma. Full bodied.
Really nice. One of the best beers. Huge white head. Spicy aroma and mellow taste with small spicy bite with alcohol.

Bottle. Pours nearly opaque, murky brown with a yellow tint and a beige, fast setting head. Taste is sweet with a very light bitterness. Palate has a full body, thick mouhfeel, soft carbonation. Aroma has loads of banana, some spices and malts and a bit of alcohol.

Bottle. Deep amber color. Rich and complex. Notes of port or a full bodied wine. definatley sour in the finish but with a carmel and dried fruit. usually only available at christmas here, but thats ok.. very warming and hearty. This brew would be dificult if it were not for the alcohol in the finish

From bottle, 50 cl. Taste with friends @ Gents Beerfestival 21.08.2010. 
Dard redbrown color, with offwhite head.
Aroma complex, wheat, malts, fruits.
Medium body.
Taste fruits, soft-bitterness, spice.

Bottle from Cracked Kettle, Amsterdam. Pours almost clear brown/red with a small creamy off-white head. Aroma of wheaty malts, some floral hops as well. Taste is a nice fruity sweetness from the malts. Full bodied.Ends nice and fruity.
UPDATED: AUG 8, 2011 This was a great bottle of beer; perfect blend of wheat and barley, sweet, rich; wonderful smell and just pours beautifully. Great!
Pours red brown with large white head. Taste is sweet medium with some fruits. Medium body with light oily feeling. Very good.

Bottle: Pours a Ruby Red, with a Massive white fluffy head. Distinctive Yeast Spice Clove Banana smell, with flavors of the like as well as caramel and sugars. Lightly Carbonated, with a slight alcoholic finish. I enjoy it so much I had to get the branded glass.

500mL bottle, pours dark brown with a thick off-white head. Aroma of dark roasted malts, caramel, clove and some sweetness. Flavour of wheat, chocolate malt, caramel, banana, clove, no bitterness. Overrated but still great.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2013 Outstanding massive head. Gorgeous brown with hints of red. Wheat and funk aroma. Burnt sugar and brown ale notes. Lots of pungent malt. Alcohol burn on the way down; red hots candy. World class. ...... 2013 rerate: bottled 30 May 2012, consumed 13 December 2013. A perfect pour (if I do say so myself) into a Weizen glass.....

The appearance is brown/orange at the thin parts, russet and brick red at the thick parts. 

After aging 18 months, the profile is yeast-forward: bready, a touch of clove. And earthy, herbal aroma. The funk in the nose is quasi-Belgian, and actually tickles the nasal cavity. The aromatic perfume is intoxicating (figuratively speaking). Aroma of bubblegum.

The flavor is purple: Muscat grapes and flowery yeast. There are touches of sweet sugar, but any possibility of a cloying, saccharine sweetness is completely balanced by the tartness of the yeast. Whatever barnyard flavors might be there are immediately mitigated by the tart yeast and the sweet grape-like malts.

Feels a tad ashy on the palate, but quickly washed over with a slick exterior.

This is one of the best beers on planet Earth. It would not only be great for a beer geek, but would be a wonderful gateway beer to bring people into the world of Weizenbocks.

500ml bottle in a Weizen glass.  Pours dark brown with a thick, beige head.  Aroma of roasted malts and some dark fruits with a doughy/banana note from the wheat.  Flavor about the same with a nice smooth texture.  A little too much alcohol in the finish.  Definitely worth trying though.
caramel, bread, cereal, alcohol, banana, brown, tan foam, frothy, hazy, lightly bitter, light sweetness, light body, oily feel, fizzy,

I had an Aventinus that had been aged and was from 2003.  The beer was an amber hue.  I thought of wine when I smelled it.  The smell is similar to the taste; with was caramel, fig, and chocolate all combined into a sweet elixir.  The beer was cold upon first tasting, but as I let it warm, the grain showed up and added to the party in my mouth.

Have had this many times, both in draft, liter, and multiple vintages, so finally rating.

Pours a dark burgundy with some fluffy white head and solid lacing.

Aroma is some great plum and  spice, along with a strong molasses and caramel. 

Taste is similar to the smell with some rich dark fruit, but a ton of slightly burnt caramel leaving a little roasted bitter finish.

Very full bodied, but still super drinkable, as I have put down liters at a time.  Fantastic brew.

(bottle)  Pours a very deep brown with persistent head. Strong clove & spice aroma.  The flavor is also of clove, over-ripe fruits and caramel with some taste of alcohol.  This is not a style I prefer.  I was surprised about the perfect 100/100 score.  I was expecting a much better selection.
Bouteille 500 ml. 8.2%. Couleur rousse foncée. Arômes dalcool, de raisins, de blé. En bouche, notes de levure, blé et malt grillé et bananes.

Pours a deep, dark, clouded brown.  Rich aromas of clove, ginger, allspice, wood, with hints of dark fruit and caramel.  Medium sweet tastes of clove, other sweet spice, with plum/grapey mild tartness, and a floral, fruity finish.  Medium body with a slippery texture and prickly carbonation. Tasty fish.

Enjoyed from a 16.9oz bottle in an English pint glass.  The beer pours a hazy medium brown color, with a moderate off-white head.  The nose gives the classic profile of a hefeweizen, with nearly equal parts banana and spicy clove.  The palate is an interesting amalgamation of the esters of the yeast strain, and the addition of a more aggressive malt backbone.  The former seems to come out on top of the latter, in a way that is quite pleasing and drinkable.  Spicy notes, banana, a slight residual sweetness, and slight depth-adding alcohol flavors come through.  Carbonation is present enough to bring out flavor and mouthfeel, without whitewashing the entire palate with its own show.  Overall, easy to see why this is considered the styles benchmark.
UPDATED: OCT 27, 2010 Bière rousse très épicée et peu houblonné. Disponible à la SAQ. Très mousseuse...pas une bière à mon goût!
Bottle, 0.5 l. Toffee and raisins on the nose. Sweet and sour taste. Both sweet and sour tastes are quite acute/sharp. Minor hops in the finish. Wonderful.

Beer on tap.
caramel-dark ruby color. toasted notes for a very good and strong taste: unique and distinctive. fruity aroma.

500 ml bottle. Cloudy brown colour, thick and dense off-white head. Aroma of banana, wheat, yeast and spices. Sweet, syrupy malty flavour with banana, dark fruits, spices and yeast. The finish is warm and spicy. Full-bodied and smooth, very enjoyable.
dark, dense caramel color, the nose is sour with bitter hops and bread, heavy head, lots of carb (but still balanced), the taste is sweet malt with lemon.
Lots of fruity esters, mainly banana and some other dark fruits... with a slight sweetness. Finishes with minimal alcohol but mostly dark malts. Its a good beer, but not suited to my palate.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2015 In bottle; pours a brown/golden color. Aroma of spice and berries/plum. Taste mirrors the aroma of a hit of spice and a finish of fruit and plum. A very good beer ... even though the alc is 8.2%, it doesnt stand out ... Highly recommend.
UPDATED 1/11/15 - great as always. This is a fantastic weizen bock. Notes of berries, and plum .. quite syrupy and full bodied. For this category of beers, it is a top beer for sure

Tasted 7/18/10. 500ml bottle. Hazy with a murky brown hue. Thick ring of off-white head. Perfumy and floral aromas with notes of dried dark fruits. Raisins and anise. Full bodied and, once again, floral with a nice candy sweetness. Sticky palate. Toasty and caramel malts. Lotta dark esters. Typical banana yeast character mingles well with the sweet malts and tangy esters. The wheat aspect of the malt bill really adds a nice dimension to the palate. This is a cornerstone and its obvious why. Amazing and of an upper echelon!

Poured a dark hazy brown with a large off-white head.  Fantastic aroma of bananas, wheat, ester, and citrus.  Taste is full bodied with flavors of dark fruit, wheat, and some caramel malts.  Light sweetness with a slick texture.  Alcohol is slightly noticeable.  Great bold flavors and a good palate make a great beer.

500ml bottle. white head, dark brown color. Aromas of banana, raisin and some chalk, coffee. Rich fruity and sugared blackened malts flavour.  A tad too sweet for my taste. Also finish could be stronger. Alcohol is very well hidden.

Bottle - Poured murky reddish yellow color with good sized head, faded quickly.
Aroma - Initial cloves followed by wheat, yeast and other spices
Flavor - Cloves, banana, pears, wheat and booze.
Palate - medium bodied with above average carbonation. Finish is somewhat dry and has little aftertaste.
Overall - Probably a good beer but not really my style!!

Pour muddy dark brown and With a rich huge off white head leaving some lacing on the glass. Now thats a beer. Aroma is a some citrus, cereal, a bit spicy and dry hay with a yeasty undertone. Flavor is just great. Full bodied, fruity pears and bananas, alcohol, heavy malts and crispy acidy sour. How do they put all that together?  Great lean and full bodied palate of that flavor, just keeps going on. Finishes acidy sweet with malt and biitter hoppy tones. What an excellent Weissen.

Poured dark ruby, almost brown color with a tan head. Spicy, fruity aroma containing banana, caramel and yeast. Light body, but still somewhat oily that has plenty of carbonation to tingle the palate. Full bodied beer that is very pleasant overall.

Very much a good beer, with a beautiful color. Strong spice nose that gives way to an estery sweetness of the yeast. A great beer for a bock, and for a larger brewery as well. However just not my thing.

Bottle shared with coworkers.  Pours a slightly murky brown with nutty highlights and a medium sized beige head.  Nice toast and a bit of banana yeast.  A little bit of caramel and the faintest tinge of smoke.  Esters, banana.  Medium bodied, nice malt and caramel, not too sweet.  A bit of plum, slightly warming.  Slow warming alcohol, toast, and banana on the finish.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy deep amber/ muddy brown color with a big creamy off white/beige head. Aroma is of over ripe banana, clove, caramel, dark fruit and some vanilla. Flavor is again of the over ripe banana along with a tuch of cinnamon and some clove. I also get alot of caramel some dark fruit and even some chocolate and a bready, doughy yeast note. The body is medium to full and nice and creamy. Overall an excellent beer, from one of Germanys best brewers in my opinion!

500ml bottle from Central Market.  Pours a clear, inviting, dark umber body with a creamy tan head that leaves a little lacing.  Aromas of yeast, malted wheat, bananas, spices and a hint of bubblegum.  Flavors follows the aromas and adds a touch of floral hops and some alcohol in the finish.  Soft, active carbonation lends itself to a medium to full mouthfeel.  A consistent classic that never dissapoints!

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2013 To me, this was one of those truly eye opening beers... sure you got your beers that are hyped up and deliver... to me, this was a beer i expected to be solid (it is top 100), but it really blew me away... I have no idea how it took me so long to have one of these..

A: Rich reddish-brown body rests beneath a huge, frothy, bubbly off-white head which slowly dies down to a nice bubbly skim... could use a tad more lacing.

S: Delicate. Refined. Perfected. Bananas. Wheat. Yeast. Clove. Dried raisins. Figs. Cherries. A bit of caramel and an ever so slight alcohol.

T: The taste is intricate. Perfectly transitioning between the lighter banana and wheat notes to the richer raisin, fig, cherry and caramel notes. Alcohol is slight, and let you know you are drinking a big brew.

M: The light-medium body is remarkable for such a richly flavored creation. Great carbonation levels tingle the tongue and leave a refreshing, crisp finish.

O: Off the charts. Wish I had more than the one bottle in front of me right now. A truly great beer!

500 ml bottle from Jungle Jims.  Pours a cloudy chestnut brown with a finger-thick, creamy off-white head.  Aroma of caramel malts, banana, yeast, brown sugar, vanilla, clove, bread, chocolate, and nuts.  Flavor of bready and caramel malts, wheat, nuts, clove, raisins, and licorice.  Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a malty mouthfeel.  This isnt a style that normally does it for me, but this is a nice one.

Beautiful reddish amber with fluffy tanish head. Aroma is sweet with raisin and slight caramel. Taste is also sweet with fruit, raisin and a dash of clove.  Slight alcohol on the nose. Its almost like a dopplebock crossed with a Belgian...VERY good!

draught. poured a dark brown ruby color.  big aroma of western spices and some sweet caramel.  nice sweet smooth taste throughout the beer, nice boozy taste rolling throughout and takes something from every sense as it goes down.  great beer

Bottle. Aroma is molasses, caramel, and prunes. Appearance is a reddish nut brown color with a frothy layer of head. Taste begins with lots of fresh caramel and cloves followed by a blend of dried figs, raisins, brown sugar, spice bread and butterscotch. Mouthfeel is full-bodied and creamy with medium carbonation and a malty finish. The overall flavor is very smooth and delicate with lots of complex caramel malt and dark fruit flavors blending seamlessly together. The sweet malt flavors never overpower while the high ABV level is quite subtle. Its not hard to see why this is considered the gold standard of the Weizenbock style.
UPDATED: JAN 27, 2015 This is pure deliciousness.  I highly recommend this. Serving: Bottle and tap

From a twelve ouce bottle purchased at "Kellers IGA" in the gaslight Clifton area of Cincinnati - This is a great weiss dopplebock! Aventinus, the worlds classic top-fermenting wheat dopplebock, has recieved accolades for the perfect balance of fruity spiciness (banana, clove, and vanilla) and notes of chocolate (crystal and dark malts). Its a fine beer, unflitered, unpastuerized, and bottle-conditioned.
Draft. Pours brown with a big soapy white head. Flavor of banana, clove, caramel. Fantastic weizenbock, probably the best. How did I forgot to rate this? Ive had it probably a dozen times.

The beer pours a hazy red-brown color with a white head. The aroma is great with notes of bananas, cloves, toffee and vanilla. For the flavor I get caramel malt, bananas, cloves and toffee with a fair bit of alcohol. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. A great beer.

Bottle. Hazy cola brown colour with a wonderfully creamy brownish head. Fresh aroma of banana, citrus - orange, wheat, yeast, spice and a hint of chocolate. Sweet flavour of wheat and caramelised banana with peppery notes throughout. Slight bitterness throughout. Alcohol is well hidden. Quite a creamy palate even though there is a high amount of carbonation. Perfectly balanced and so easy to drink. Simply one of the best weizens that ive had. Its always a pleasure to sit down and enjoy this one.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2010 Okay, now I drank this one a week ago (and earlier as well), but stupidly lost my notes about it. For now, the only thing id say is that the only gripe I have against that one is that its a little too sweet for its own sake -- but thats nitpicking, really.

Easily the very best beer Ive ever had thus far. An amazing beer that I personally view as a standard to hold all others accountable to. I HOPE that one day I find a beer better than this but I seriously doubt I will.
Great appearance. Nice light brown color with a perfect head. Nice sweet aroma. Delicious dunkel/ Belgium taste.
Bottle. Dark brown, hazy with a nice withe head, lots of sparkling. Aroma; Chocolate, malt, hops and some yeast. Taste; Malty with again some yeast sences. Tested sometime in 2009, best b. 14.11.08.

On tap at Weisses Bräuhaus in München summer 2009. Brown colour with a creamy white head. Caramel and banana flavour and spices as well. Considering the alcohol strength it is really easy to drink, smooth could one say too. Just awesome.

Pint bottle. Pours a muddy caramel hue, with quickly diminishing head. Lovely nose: licorice, clove, herbal earthiness. Lively carbonation in the mouth, round and full-bodied.  Slightly sweet up front, light malty bitterness in the mid-palate, and finishes with just a little bit of funk. Damn, that pint went fast. Incredibly well-balanced, it is hard to find a flaw in this beer. But where is that long-lasting head theyre bragging about? Although I can get this beer any time, I wish I had more now. Delicious. Cheers!

Pour is a unclear brown color with a soapy tight head which dissipates quickly. Aroma wheat and malt with sweet molassas and sugar followed Taste is sweet wheat and brown sugar with a subtle sour in the end. Palate is medium feel with fizz and creamy dry finish. A well balanced drinkable beer.
Recommended by a bartender in Melbounre. 500ml bottle. Dark red, typical clove aromas, taste is well balanced, caramel, yeast and banana. Great finish, one of the best wheat beers ive had.
UPDATED: DEC 2, 2010 Bottle from Peckhams. Strong aroma & flavour of banana, resin & glue. Cloudy medium brown colour with big beige foamy head. A bit sickly & too strong for me but drinkable.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2015 On tap! Pours hazy orange amber with a white fluffy head. Aroma of banana, bubblegum, bread crust and some sweet east esters. Taste of banana, sweet yeast esters, caramel. dark ripe fruits and with a nice thick, yet fresh mouthfeel. Really good!
Bevuta alla spina allIrish Pub di Genova. Color mogano, schiuma solida e persistente, questa weizenbock di schneider è corposa ma bevibile nonostante 8,4°. Buona davvero.
from a 16.9 oz,dark fruit roll up color,white head,dark fruit in smell,Dark fruit and Matly"

Bottle.  Hazy dark born pour, plenty of ongoing carbonation and a huge head that was slow to settle.  Very welcoming sweet banana and bready aroma.  Flavor is effervscent banana, some caramel and finish with a solid (but not thick) body.  Dangerously drinkable for it being 8% Abv.

Bottle pours clear medium-dark brown with brief medium tan head.  Aroma sweet malts, yeasts.  Taste caramel, malts with a bit of a sour, bitter finish.  Alcohol evident with a bit of a burn at the end.  Overall a nice beer.

Pours a deep burgundy with a moderate head.  Nose is decidedly banana and malt with maybe just a bit of hops.  Flavor is banana and a mild taste of maple syrup.  A slight hop bite on the tail end.  Quite sweet, but not artificially so; rather, the smells and flavors that originate from this beer seem incredibly fresh and natural.  In fact, increasingly, I tend to gravitate toward beers, regardless of style, that impress me as being "fresh" or "natural."  I know this was shipped across the Atlantic, but, nevertheless, that is the impression with which Im left.
tap in a pint glass.  cloudy brown in color with little head.  Aroma was dough-y/bread and alcohol.  Tastes fine.  full body, long finish.  A fulfilling beer from beginning to end.
UPDATED: NOV 19, 2010 Bottle at Churchkey.  Murky brown, beige head.  Aroma of bubblegum and clove.  Taste is slightly tart with caramel and light spice.  Very nice.

Limited Edition Brewed in 2003, bottled in 2004, and consumed today. Bottle wrapped in white tissue paper with "brewed in 2003" print all over it.

Appearance: Dark brown, borderline black body with a good 2 finger head that is the slightest shade of almond. Decent head retention and some lacing which is impressive for a 5 year old brew.

Smell: Wheat, Clove, Dark Roasted Malts

Taste: Your standard wheat / clove / toasted malt Aventinus with an additional slightly vinous note. The vinous quality is quite minimal at this point and perfect in my opinion. Its also counterbalanced by a taste of chocolate.

Mouthfeel: full bodied yet thin. Ample carbonation.

Drinkability: Much more drinkable than a fresh Aventinus in my humble opinion. The wine/chocolate flavors that become more pronounced with age are creating a playful complexity that the fresh Aventinus lacks.

Im thinking that 5 years of aging this brew is ideal for my tastes. I still have a line on getting more of these 2003 limited editions and I think I will.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-08-2008

Appearance: 3/5

Brown reddish liquid with a small dirty white foam that very quickly dissapeared and didnt leave any lacing.
Smell: 7/10

Fresh bananas, a hint of brandy, yeast.
Taste: 7/10

Fresh bananas, caramell, yeast. Fairly mild.
Mouthfeel: 4/5

A very easy to drink beer and the ABV is very well hidden. Feels like I could take on a couple of pints of this but I bet I would have to pay for it in the morning.

I like this beer and Im really interested in trying more beers from the brewery. Ive had their Eisbock of this beer (12,2%) and I actually think that is a better beer. I ended up giving it a 4,2 which is an excellent score.

Even though its quite strong I think this would be a good companion with most kinds of food. Its thirst quenching yet has enough flavour to be interesting, but not enough to be overwhelming. If that makes any sense. Basically if you see it you should definitely try it.

Picked up a bottle at South Loop Binnys. Poured into flute.

A - Pours a caramel brown with a fingers-worth of off-white head. Theres a thick ring that remains along the side of the glass and a thin film on top of the beer.

S - Big candy and dark fruit notes, noticeable alcohol characteristics, burnt sugars, caramel, bananas, nice roasted notes.

T - Bananas, burnt sugars, dark fruits, boozy alcohol, sweet caramel finish.

M - Light to medium bodied, fizzy carbonation, semi-dry finish.

D - The alcohol needs to settle down a bit for me to really enjoy this one. That said, its 12.5% and it sure doesnt taste like that. The light body makes it easy going down...another year or so on this and I imagine it would smooth out nicely. Ill save my other bottle and review again in a year. Very nice.

An unattractive, cloudy brown/mahogany pour, topped with a two-finger white/off-white head from the 500ml bottle bought at Whole Foods: Sweet nose of malts, deep-set alcohol, vanilla, banana, clove and cracked pepper spices, woody, wheaty dough, cereal, bubblegum, and some milk chocolate. Soft to average carbonation, malty, slick, medium to full-bodied, and lasting bitter finish. Flavors notes of chocolate, licorice, banana, some heat in the undertone, raisins, and few herbs.  Not so much my style, but I do enjoy this very much. Drinkability: Easily out of the ordinary, yet still complements the true style of a dopplebock. Pairing: Roasted whole duck bought in Chinatown. Rebuy: Again not my style, so probably not. #449 on 16052010, DG.

brown amber with a nice head but not much lacing from the Bottle I found at Chandlers Restaurant in Maysville, Ky.  Bought the glass.  Really nice strong wheat bock, peppery and lemont with a lingering sweetness.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2010 Bottle 50cl. A fuzzy brown ale with nice head. Smell is very floral and spicy. Taste is very sweet, creamy, very perfumed wizen like, bit grassy-hay, notes of melon, citrus, cereal and cloves, caramel on aftertaste which is really great. Very refreshing and pleasant beer, body is deep and smooth, alcohol presence is low as well as bitterness. Very good beer nice to drink at any time.
Lovely dark ruby red pour with nice head. Nose and taste is chalk, sweetness, port wine and slight doughs. Rated 1/13/2000

500 mL bottle from the LCBO, served in a Weizen glass. Pours hazy caramel with a tall, dense tan head. Head has good retention and laces well. On the nose, aromas of clove and yeast along with banana, spice and vanilla. On the tongue, begins with a nice caramel sweetness. A slight hop bitterness enters midway and it closes on a subtle sour note. Finish is long and malty with yeast. On the palate, medium-full in body with a smooth, creamy texture and lively carbonation. Overall, an excellent example of a weizen bock. It elegantly combines sweet, roasted malts with fruit and spice. Easily one of my favourite wheat beers. 2010-05-11

1/2 liter bottle labeled as Schneiderweiss "Tap 6."  Dark red-brown color, pours tan head.  I was surprised by this beer.  Not knowing what it was,  I was expected a dunkelweiss - but it had many flavors and aromas of a bock.  Carmel, bittersweet, fruit.  Sticky palate.  Love the beer!

500 ml. bottle- Pours brownish with red hints and average head, aroma is all bananas and yeast with some spice thrown in there as well. The taste is a wheaty beer with a bit more sweetness than any Hefe, I really like this beer, probably the best Weizen Bock Ive had to date. Those Germans have sure perfected the wheat beer, too bad all their other styles are not as good.
Poured a hazy red-beige colour, with a fizzy-bubbly head, but no lacing. Aromas range from malty to fruity. Tastes sour-bitter, with hints of banana and spices. Lots of carbonation.
A very robust flavor with a great finish. The carbonation is powerful. lively, almost too lively and took away from the experience a bit. Other than that, a fantastic beer.

This is a great beer, I have always loved this beer but I just had the 2005 vintage last night and was blown away. Has a lovely aroma of cloves with hints of banana and vanilla. Pours a dark brown with beautiful clarity and a resilient white head. This beer has very good carbination. The complex blend of banana, clove, vanilla and caramel makes for a very smooth and tasty beer. Has a nice caramel flavor on the backend. This is a great tasting beer. One of the smoothest I have had. The 2005 really add another tier of balance to make an already great beer greater. The blend of malts and hops masks the 8.2% abv very well. Dont get too comfortable drinking this beer. It will sneak up on you.

Pours a dark slightly cloudy brown, like stained walnut.  Thick tan head, quick to fizzle to a finger.  Smells of wheat and toast.  Tastes like wheat, spice, sweet like sugar in your rice crispys.  Lingering hoppy alcohol on the breath.  Fun stuff!
On tap in NOLA.  Appearance is brown with a little head.  Mild banana aroma with some malt as well. Carbonation is powerful.  Taste has some banana flavor along with traditional bock elements.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2010 Dark brown with beige big head. Powerful aroma with honeysweet malt, fruit, nuts, caramel. Alcohol is notable but nice warming. Body full. Text is creamy and smooth. Finish bittersweet.
Bottle. Muddy brown colour with great head. Alcoholic aroma and falvour. Raisins and very strong, very powerfull, but not my style I see....

Cloudy brown/mahogany pour with a white head that slowly recedes to a thin film along the top of the beer, long retention, no lace.  A very complex aroma of banana, vanilla, clove, bubblegum, dough.  Medium-full body with pleasant initial carbonation on the palate that leads way to a nice chocolate and banana combination and finishes slightly sour.  Alcohol is barely noticeable. Very impressive.

Liquide brun rougeâtre à la mousse beige majestueuse et tenace.   Le nez est complexe et invitant : clou de girofle, vanille, blé, malt, fruits, levure.  En bouche et sous le palais, le liquide est plein de corpulence et équilibré : pointe chocolatée avec le malt rôti, étalement des épices et de la banane, douceur de lalcool, blé goûteux, levure.  La finale est tout aussi intense, une empreinte soyeuse et légèrement amère, un amalgame parfait des arômes et des saveurs qui se renforcent jusquà la dernière goutte.  Fascinante.
500ml bottle uner the Tap 6 name. Amber brown colour with an off white head. Superb lingering aftertaste that makes the mouth glow.
Bottle 0,5ltr: Sold under the TAp 6 name. Dark brown legend with an great fruity and caramel taste.

500 ml bottle into footed pilsner glass. Aroma is all clove and banana. Fantastic. Pours a dirty brown with a large pillowy head with long retention. Taste is sweet, bitter, then finishes sour. Medium-high carbonation and just a tad watery. This is a very delicious brew here. Im amazed at the quality on all levels.

Dark cloudy reddish amber color with a white thick long lasting head.  Full bodied, very wheaty and malty.  Spiced cloves and pepper?  Aromas are of wheat carmel, chocolate and bananas (banana split)!   Very bitter finsih and sour finish with med carbonation.    Rosted carmel and chocolate malts.  Nice alcohol balance with hops and malts.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2010 Brown, red glow, large brown head.
Aroma of banana, citrus, spices and some other fruits.
Flavour is a creamy bittersweet fruityness with banana and spices, hint of sour citrus. Nice beer.

Tap 6-bottle, thanks Hirigalzkar!

Pours brown red with a beige head.

Dark fruits, wheat and spices. Medium to big body.

Bottle from Beers of Europe (Tap 6 version). Cloudy brown pour with an off white head. Aromas of toffee, bananas, bubblegum, fresh herbs. Nice, sweet smell. Flavours of chocolate, caramel, sweet spices, licorice. Herby, hoppy finish.

The beer is a rich amber-brown with excellent lacing. Its a spiced fruit cocktail, cinnamon sticks and nutmeg stewed with pears, apples and ripe bananas. An extremely easy beer to like. It packs complexity and steadiness into an incredible wheat ale.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2013 500ml.  So Im not exactly rating this one blindly.  Ive had it dozens of times before and consider it a World Class beer all the way.  Thick, unfiltered cherry-brown, almost approaching purple.  Steady light beige head.  The aroma is awesome, mixing bananas, clove, and some dark malt as well.  Very clean and refreshing for the style, lots of banana taste, with some mild pungent yeast undertones.  The alcohol is perfectly masked.  Mild plum notes.  One of the best beers out there.  Awesome.

Bottle tap 6. Poured a dark brown color with a medium white head. Aroma is clove, banana, spices and yeast. Flavor was heavy on the yeast with clove, bread, caramel and light hops. Medium mouthfeel with good carbonation.
500 ml bottle like everyone else has tasted. A dark brown pour and tan head. Taste of caramel, chocolate and nuts. Yum.
500 ml bottle A dark murky brown pour- big three finger tan head -taste of caramel, chocolate, nuts, roasty, smooth finish

(500ml bottle - pint glass)  Pours a nearly opaque amber copper color.  Aroma is of caramel, chocolate, wheat and nutty malt with a considerable yeast componet.  Also has notes of banana, bubblegum, butterscotch, clove, licorice, raisin, vanilla, chocolate and toffee.  Medium to heavy sweetness, light bitterness and  light sourness.  Medium to full body, slick texture, average carbonation and a warm rum like finish.

Bottle at home.  Pours a very dark ruby that is relatively translucent.  Theres a slight haze to it which gives the appearance of depth.  The head is good and thick with mixed bubbles. Smells of sweet wheat.  Has a strong floral nose with a hint of hay in the background.  The taste is very smooth and mellow with no hint of bitterness.  There is a bit of sourness to it but it really enhances the feel of the beer.  The palate is medium to heavy with very light carbonation.  Its nice and creamy.

500mL bottle.  Pours a hazy, deep reddish-brown color with a small light brown head that fades pretty quickly.  Aromas are of sweet yeast, bubblegum, vanilla bean, cloves, and banana esters.  Flavor is sweet roasted chocolate malt and bubblegum yeast, vanilla, tart cherry and berry notes, and a warming alcohol finish.  Creamy and slick with low carbonation.  This is a tasty beer.
Brown hazy ale with short beige head. Malty sweet yet fresh aroma. Bread. Sweet flavour. Malty. Lots of wheat. Sugarsticky palate. Smooth. Hides the ABV very well.

Pours a lively, slightly unclear ruddy brown from the bottle with a gradually disappearing off-white head. Very wheaty and estery on the nose, bit of mid-dark fruits, some banana and a hint of alcohol in the background. Light notes of blackberry on the tongue, a good dose of wheat and darkish fruits, finishing with a delicate tartness. Nicely rounded on the palate with medium to full carbonation giving some dryness. Ends by subtley warming the throat.

500mL bottle.  Clear dark red with a fluffy ring.  Strong estery aroma, spicy and fruity, particularly banana but also acidic fruit, with some wheat, earthiness and alcohol and a vinous character coming in as it warms.  Less fruity in the flavour, but still acidic and spicy with some subtle roasty malt flavours and a little sourness.  Medium bodied, average carbonation becoming creamy on the palate with a bit of a dry, sour finish.

Bottle.

A - Deep brown with a large foamy ivory head. Very good retention and a good amount of lacing left over.

S - Dark malt and chocolate along with a good amount of fruit (both dark fruit and banana). Faint spices too.

T - Dark malt flavors provide a base, which includes, chocolate and caramel along with some wheat flavors. On top of this is a good amount of sweetness from fruits. Fruits include dark fruits (plums, dates, figs, raisins, and cherries) as well as banana. Also has a bit of a bubblegum flavor and some spices (clove, cinnamon, and nutmeg being the major ones). A bit of a warming alcohol taste finishes the sip.

M - Medium to full body with a fairly high level of carbonation. Creamy and sticky feel make it feel even more full bodied.

D - Probably a bit too sweet and a bit too heavy (as well as too high an ABV) to have multiple ones of this in one sitting, at least consecutively. However, a sipper that I would gladly sip on again.

Notes: Really good beer. Good Hefe flavors mixed with the big, dark maltier flavors of a Doppelbock/BSDA. A bit like liquid candy/sweet juice and a bit like rum. Lots of good flavors, definitely a nice sipper.
taps. notevole al naso con sentori di caramello e spezie.al gusto si ritrova questo caramello tostato e speziature come chiodi di garofano,luppolo e malto.equlibrata e persistente.
Dark ruby pour from bottle.  Bananas and clove right out the gate.  Smooth mouthfeel.  Warm, fruity finish.  Excellent wheat beer!
amazing taste with a thick texture. def worth a try. :...................................

Powerful aroma thats typical of a strong wheat: banana and clove esters with a substantial alcohol presence. Appearance is a cloudy reddish brown thats almost orange on the edges. Carbonation is light overall with a thin white head and virtually no lacing. Im not sure where that picture came from as mine have never looked anything close to that. Taste is primarily sweet with a significant bitter kick at the end. Very full bodied with a lingering sweet banana and clove finish. This is a fantastic beer. If youre a big fan of wheat beers then you owe it to yourself to try this one.

Bottle from LCBO. Aroma of dark malt, banana, clove. In front of halogen the color is deep reddish mahogany. The beige head was substantial, but left rather quickly. Medium to full bodied. Creamy carbonation. Starts with lots of banana, nearly paint thinner so, caramel malt, and noticable clove. The finish is a bit gritty, banana, spice, and some malt. There is a full banana bread aspect in the end. It has a finishing sour note, but the malt and banana balance that. It is certainly marvelous.

10.03.04 bottle from SAQ 500 ml enjoyed in a tulip glass. Pour reddish brown or ruby. Dense white head this beer is highly carbonated.  Aroma : cloves, wheat. Flavour : Caramel / pleasant malt combinaison full body . Finish is short not that bitter. This is a perfect blend in all of it aspects.

Pours hazy brown with huge beige head; aroma of banana bread, chocolate, clove, some woody notes and even hints of cherries; medium body, smooth with quite a low carbonation; flavor of wheat, caramel and clove spiciness with kind of woody toffee notes in a rather dry finish.
Pours a woodsy reddish amber. Nose shows lots of white grapes and yeasty notes. Quite powerful on the palate with toastiness. Short, elegant finish.

A: A 500ml bottle poured into my Moonlight pint glass. The pour is a dark brown with plenty of reddish highlights. A fluffy off-white head sits on top.

S: The smell is caramel, molasses, toffee, clove, and a bit of yeast.

T: This is one tasty beer! Lots of clove and yeast character in this beer. It goes along nicely with the sweetness of the malt and the wheat. There is also a mild banana and perhaps nutmeg flavor.

M: The body is quite impressive. Its very smooth and creamy, and has a wonderful level of carbonation.

D: Now I see why this is such a popular beer. I was a bit hesitant when trying this one out as Ive never been the hugest fan of German brews, but this is perhaps a new favorite.

Pours a nice dark amber with with a tightly laced head.  Aroma is fantastic with wheat, citrus, caramel and yeast.  Taste is medium bodied with wheat, yeast, malt, honey and citrus.  Well rounded, good beer.

Bottle 500ml. Great beer, specially with spicy food or desert. Aromas of wheat, apple, caramel, spice, and port. The taste was a bit acidic at the start, but then it smoothened; mostly sweet, with balancing bitterness. Palate is velvety, and full bodied. Dark brown, with a frothy head.

Underwhelming aroma but everything else--velvety appearance, wonderfully balanced taste with many notes I wont bother to reiterate, nice heavy mouthfeel; basically, almost all the goodness of a summery Weiss plus the majesty of age. (BuyRite, OB)

Bottle.  Pours a dark brown color with ruby red edges and a billowing off-white foam head that really lingers.  Spiced clove aroma.  Flavors include clove, banana, yeast, molasses, and caramel malt.  Very nice aftertaste and mouthfeel.  The 8.2% is well hidden.

Had a bottle of Aventinus served in proper glassware @ Docks Oyster House in Atlantic City.  Waiter dunked the bottle upside into the Aventinus glass and did an impressive pour.   The diners at the table we impressed.  I enjoyed the Weizen Bock, medium bodied, foamy head, caramel and clove flavors all well blended.

0.5 l bottle.
Hazy chestnut-brown colour, superb off-white (creamy remaining) rocky head, fizzy carbonation.
Banana fruity, spicy smell, sweet taste, sharp start and banana/citrus flavour.
Cereal, yeasty, spicy aroma and citric (not bitter), moderate alcoholy and dry finish.
A great beer with a full body and a sticky/creamy texture.

A very enjoyable brew. Pours a ruby-red with a nice head.  The immediate aroma is of banana and clove, some hints of bubblegum and wheat come through.  Very tasty beer with a light sweetness.  Light bodied, low carbonaton with a long finish.  Very surprised by this beer, liked it immensly.
Amazing brew. Dark red pour. Nice head. Aroma of cloves and spices. Flavor is spice, caramel, and malts. Some hints of sour. awesome beer.

Bottle thats been in my fridge for about 4 months.  Beautiful carmelized sugar color with an off white head that disappears into a translucent ring around the glass.
