Aroma is consistent with the color -- carmelized sugar with faint banana.  I also get some "metallic" aroma which makes me think this bottle sat too long.  Taste is kind of flat.  A litlle sweet and decently  balanced.  I was really looking forward to this beer and fear that I left it in the bottle too long.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2011 actually smelled bananas after pour
honey brown with med head
great palate - thick, kinda syrupy;  a little too malty sweet

will try again...

re-rate 05/2010 - bumped the rating some;  it is NOT to malty sweet; this is a great balance blend - love the honey banana sweetnes!!

re rate 06/11 - dropped a little

Bottle from Kenny Road Market, poured into dimpled mug. The appearance is a dark, almost opaque, reddish brown with a generous beige head. Aroma is sweet with berry, yeast, raisin, and caramel notes. It tastes of raisins, caramel, and hops with just a hint of apple that stays in the finish. Medium to full-bodied palate. I really enjoyed this one.

2003 bottle.  Pour is cloudy purplish brown with a medium beige head.  Aroma is wheat, liquor, apple, lightly sour, blackberry, and lightly spicy.  Flavor is a bit sweeter than expected with notes of wheat, cinnamon, clove, and a lightly fruity flavor in the finish.  Tasty and drinkable with little evidence of oxidation.

I cant believe I havent rated this before. .5L bottle served in a large Weizen glass. Beautiful chestnut pour with 2 inches of creamy khaki colored foam resting on top. The nose is mostly banana with a touch of caramel. Drinking it is very similar to drinking a caramel-banana milkshake. It enters the mouth thick and creamy and taste of Banana, caramel, dark fruit, and a hint of clove. A wonderful beer.

Dark murky brown, thin creamy head. Aroma is roasty, yeasty, big caramel, and berry fruit sweetness. Also a grainier vibe. Taste is dry throughout and beer has an easier start that feels more  full-bodied in the second half with big booze and sour fruits, but also banana, with caramel, and lighter chocolate candy; also  toasty.

Muddy brown pour with an enormous and extremely persistent off-white head. A very fine looking beer. The aroma is dominated by the expected clove character, but also includes plum, raisins, banana and wood. To generalize a bit here, the flavor of the beer reminds me of a belgian in many ways, but possesses a more forward bitterness than most darker belgian brews. Lots of raisin, cloves, port, vanilla, caramel, and an overriding herbal hop bitterness that serves to clean things up very nicely. I get the feeling that this could easily have been a big, messy beer, but everything comes together very nicely. Though pretty sweet, its never too much in that regard. Mouthfeel is thick and velvety. Excellent beer, and probably better than the eisbock in my opinion. I may need to pick up a case of this tomorrow.

Pours hazy brown with slightly off-white to brown head.

Nose has some brown baked goods aromas with clove, spice, maybe citrus and fresh bread esters.

Palate has a beautiful, traditional weissbier fruit core in it with chocolate covered banana, clove, and a dessert spice on the end. Very creamy mouthfeel that is delectable.

Finish is long and hefe-weizen fruit like.

Brown coloured beer with some very light carbonation and a medium white head. Malty and fruity hinted aroma. Full palate. Finish is fruity, banana and light wheat-yeasty hinted with a sweet light malty ending. Nice.

500 mL bottle pours a rich tobacco brown with a nicely retaining khaki head into a weizen.  Aroma of sweet malts, raisins, plenty of yeast, overripe fruits, clove, almost a sweet relish characteristic.  Very similar flavor: quite sweet and malty with clove coming in, vanilla, very yeasty with a strong raisin-like presence, plumb and lemongrass in the finish. Velvety mouthfeel with a strong body and a medium level of carbonation.  Funny to think I hated this the first time I tried it when I was just getting into craft beer.  Love it now.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2010 Pours hazy brownish purple with a medium head and no lacing.  Aroma is floral with strong yeast notes.  Flavor is quite tart with lots of yeast and clove.  Notes of banana, plum, jasmine, wheat and spices pervade.  Finishes slightly bitter but retains its fruity qualities.  One of the most pleasing German beers Ive had since I was last there.

Se mi chiedessero quale tra le birre da me bevute è la regina, questa bruna tedesca sarebbe tra le candidate. Laspetto è magnifico, colore bruno ambrato, pieno di lieviti che nuotano leggeri nel bicchiere con una schiuma cremosa e persistente. allolfatto si sente la tostautra, i lieviti, la frutta candita, la banana, le spezie.. e chissà quante altre cose ancora si riescono rotrovare. al palato tutto è perfettamente equilibrato, morbido, note alcooliche, malto, forse aspro. finale lungo. corpo pieno. ottima bevibilità.

Draught? at the Glöckl Bräu, Graz. Poured a lovely murky brown body with a looong lasting off white head.  The nose was gluey, malty and estery. Lactic, deep and fruity with some banana. Not bad.  The taste was pleasant... what hit me first was the unsettling presence of alcohol but that got much more restrained. Again notes of glue, wheaty esters, caramel, dark malts (chocolate even)... complex stuff, deep, layered maltiness. Rough at first with all the alcohol but that smoothed out as time passed. I must admit I liked the Eisbock better but this is great too. Itd be really interesting to have them side by side.

Pours ruby with a nice off white head.  Theres plenty going on in the aroma, including banana, clove, dark fruit.  Nice creamy medium body with light carbonation.  Flavor includes plum and spice with a nice sweetness backed by some hops presence.  A really nice beer.

Serving type: 500ml bottle, bought at the LCBO
Poured a Dark brown with about a 2" creamy looking foam head.
For me it was very bold tasting, but went down nice. It has a pretty good kick to it. It left my mouth tingling, almost rum like. 
I do have to say, it is one of the best beers Ive tasted so far. I would highly recommend getting some. I will be buying some every time I make a trip to the LCBO. I also got the Aventinus Eisbock. Cant wait to compare the two.
Bottle. Amber colour with a beige head. Aroma is alcohohol, caramel, banana. Flavour is sweet, alcohol, caramel, banana, dried fruits, hop, spices. Full bodied. Very nice beer.

vintage 2004.  pous brown with floaters making a really short lived head that was beige.  the body is clear brown with a lot of floaters in it.  the aromas are light and resemble a malted, wheaty smell with some caramel and sugar.  its full bodied and a little sweet, but very well balanced.  its carbonated nicely and the mouthfeel is smooth.  i taste the bitterness from the hops, a lot of wheat, bread, some sugar and beats.  its a little spicey and fruity with some caramel and toffee.  it finishes a little watery and the aftertaste is light and sticks around for just a little while.  good old beer, very enjoyable.

Now thats an old time favorite. Beautiful dark brown-red color whith thick white foam. Its taste combines the sweetness of fruits with the classic german weizen bock bitterness and a slight caramel and chocolate aroma. So enjoyable going down the neck. Really loved it!!! A must- wherever you see it dont hesitate.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2014 Tap. Dark amber/brown with small tan head. Aroma is malt, yeast, wheat, dark fruits, caramel and banana. Flavour is malt, yeast, banana, dark fruits, sweet, wheat, raisins, plume and caramel.


50 cl bottle. Hazy amber/brown body with medium size off-white head, Flavour is wheat, fruit and caramel. 6 3 7 3 13

500 milliliter bottle from Total Wine in Tustin ($3.49).  Pours an attractive brownish color with some red-like highlights.  Looks a lot like brewed tea in the glass.  The thick beige head is lively and disappears rather quickly.  Aroma is full of fruit esters (plum, banana), yeast, spices, caramel and sweet wheat tones.  A great smelling beer!  Basically everything found in the nose is there in the flavor as well -- fruit, yeast, spice, caramel, wheat.  Small note of alcohol, but otherwise well hidden.  Nicely carbonated -- I had this on draft once at Toronado and marveled at just how vigorous and consistent the bubbles were throughout.  My first rating of a weizen bock, and what a great one it was.  (208, 1894)

An amazing weizenbock. Aroma of malts, yeast, dark fruits, banana and spicies. Taste is full and sweet with yeast and malt in front of the others and hints of fruits, sugar and caramel at the background. Full body, long duration finish.

Dark brown irresistible look. Lots of caramel, roasted caramel and fruits. A cooked malty banana flavour is particularly noticeable. Good body, but not particularly easy to drink. Good beer if you are into sweeter stuff.

Pours a hazy amber with a creamy small head. Aroma is caramel, banana and licorice. Flavor is very nice with sweet caramel and banana. Has a bittersweet long finish and is well balanced. Creamy texture. Very nice

500mL bottle. Aromas of clove and stewed fruit. 
Pours opaque brown with small but effervescent off-white head. Well-balanced with spicy fruit sweetness matching the soft bitterness and slight sour weissbeer undertones, nice full body, thick and creamy. One of my faves!!!

Bottle with purple label from the local. Pours a hazy dark brown with an active off white head. Thick dark fruits, banana, and spice on the nose. Bold flavor of banana, clove, and dark fruit dominate with a hint of yeast character. Superb.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2009 On tap at the Toro. Aroma is banana, green apple, nutmeg, clove, bubblegum,    wheat. Tastes like it smells, only better, cuz it’s more better to drink a beer than sniff it. Top notch in every way. Mos def.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2011 Aroma is caramel malt, minerality, alcohol, and some fruity sour yeast esters.
Appearance is hazy brown with a thick, dense, beige head that lasts till the end.
Flavor is sweet maltup front; followed by strong minerality, warm alcohol, complex yeast esters with hints of dark fruit, and wheat tarness.  Some yeast and alcohol warmth linger in the finish.

-------
br-opq, ^eff, thick foamy head, ^co2, light body.

tart-wheat fermented-apple aroma.

dark-fruity-malt T1, bright-fruit §nutmeg T2, dry §alchl T3.
clean, simple, dry.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2014 [12/09] Pours dirty brown with a massive beige head. Wheat and grass dominate with some cloves, coriander and ginger, soy sauce and orchard fruits.Taste is pretty sweet and unfortunately (from my point of view) quite bananaesque. The malt makes it substantial enough to support the alcohol. Not really a bitter finish, but less cloying than wheat beers often are. Luscious mouthfeel. Marked down a lot because I dont like bananas. [3.3] [9/11] Modest beige head. Aroma of caramel, wheat, cloves, plums, some bananas, grass. Taste has firm darkish caramel, fruits, a wheaty sour tang, cloves and white pepper. Evidently that previous bottle was long gone - this has a little banana, but that one was almost a smoothie. Carries the alcohol dangerously well. The sweetness is well countered by the wheaty sourness and spicy bitterness at the end. [3.8]<diff> Large, well retained pale beige head. Tangy wheat, quite punchy spices - particularly cloves - at the end.

500-ml bottle Marcellos, Lafayette, La - Aroma: banana, clove, nutty (yeast), alcohol, smokey; Appearance: hazy, reddish-brown color, minimal off-white head, no laces; Flavor: sweet, salty, nutty, raisin (malt), bitter, banana, clove, spicy (hop/yeast), alcohol; Mouthfeel: moderate to full bodied, thin texture, soft-moderate carbonation, long dry-bitter finish; Overall: a nice color beer of spicy, juicy reminiscence of a banana bread with raisins, nuts, and smokey background aroma, which balances with refreshing long dry-bitter finish.  My bottle didnt have the nice fluffy/creamy head as others mentioned; I will have to get another one and re-rate.

Refigerated bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Interesting dark brown with dark ruby color around the edges.  Nice head and lacing that lingers.  Taste is heavy clove, banana nut bread, and carmalized sugar aftertaste.  Interesting brew, but a little disappointed.

500ml bottle from total wine in norfolk (cant believe i havent rated this one yet) pours a deep, dark chestnut brown with a full, one-inch off-white head and great lacing. aroma is excellent with huge notes of cedar wood, clove, and banana bread with touches of wheat, yeast, nutmeg, and mild citrus. flavor is wonderful as well with huge, mildly sweet yeast and wheat notes with fruity touches of peach, orange, and banana and spice notes of clove, nutemeg, and cinnamon backed by hints of cedar, vanilla, and pumpernickel. palate is medium bodied with big, tingly carbonation and a lingering spiced, fruity finish. overall, a great classic brew.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2017 Bottle, 500ml. Opaque brownish, creamy to minimal tan head. Aromas of grainy malts, dark fruits, vanilla, banana. Medium to full bodied, fizzy carbonation. Fruity malty flavors into a fizzy finish.

Pours coppery orange color with diminishing off-white head with slight lacing. Moderate bready malt aroma with some citrus tartness and alcohol. The flavor starts with bready malty fullness with caramelized sugars, alcoholic figs and banana esters. It gets more citrusy or phenolic at the end of the sip. Not too lingering finish with dried fruits and sweetish cocoa powder and alcoholic figs. Medium, but quaffable body with active carbonation level. Much more easier than expected, but not bad.

This is as close to perfect as it gets for me.  The smell is a lovely caramel and butterscotch.  The color is  an unbeatable dark mahogany.  Taste is impeccably subtle with hints of banana and clove of course but also a creeping saltiness that makes you want to chug the whole beer.   I buy this beer every time I see it for $4 or less (the 500 ml bottle).  I cant imagine a better beer in this style and Im not sure there is a beer out there that Id rather drink.  Yup, this is my one beer on a desert island beer.

Poured from bottle.  Aromoa of alcohol, banana, clove, and caramel.  Pours nice cloudy dark brown with chunks of yeast floating.  Highly carbonated, medium sweetness, no note of bitterness.  Nice malty, full bodied, complex beer, but very easy going.   Texture is creamy with a long finish that leaves a touch of bitterness on the tongue.  Overall this beer is a show stopper, would have been better if the head lasted longer, but that could have been due to the glass or pourer (me).
Bottle. Cloudy brown/orange with a creamy off-white head.  Sweet, malty, banana, spices, cloves, yeast, wheat, lightly toasted. Not much alcohol. Very creamy and smooth.

Pours a dark, golden brown, with slight ruby highlights. Big head of light tan colored foam. Retention is decent. Lacing is thin and slippery.

Huge wheat-ey, yeast-y, bread smell. Candi sugar sweetness. Hints of caramel. Bananas covered in sugar syrup. Light clove notes. 

Taste is also very bread-like. Huge wheat presence, with big yeast notes, as well. Banana is big here, also, with a nice mild spice presence. Slight bitter, almost sour, quality, in a good way. Very mild hint of cocoa.

Solid medium body. Smooth enough, but not nearly the creaminess level that I like in a beer. Then again, it feels right for its style, the way it is.

Very easily drinkable. Alcohol is quite well-hidden. Very good balance, overall.

Definitely tasty,on a wheat beer level.  Big cloudy brown pour with minimal head.  Banana bread aroma with notes of yeast, clove, sugar, roasted malt. Flavor is mostly sweet with a heavy dose of banana and clove. Glad to have finally gotten this rating under the belt.

Bottle, 50cl.New label: TAP 6 Unser Aventinus. Redbrown coloured, big beige creamy head. Aroma is fresh, a bit fruity, with wheat like a normal weizen. Taste is fruity, something between peach and banana, fizzy carbonation, fizzling in mouth. Soft and smooth in taste, a bit bitter finish. Very nice.
Bottle - Aroma is smoked malts, bready yeast and a touch of chocolate.  Flavor is roasted malts, with hints of chocolate and caramel.  Palate is soft and creamy.  Very smooth and tasty brew.

bottle - I almost cried when I sent the last sip down.....pours clear brown with a light tan frothy head. An explosion of caramel, spice. baked banana, apple pie and biscuit hits the nose right away. Nutty, toasted biscuit flavor, only the slightest trace of alcohol with light citrus notes and the most subtle bitter finish. Light to medium body with a lovely creamy mouthfeel. Danke Herr Schneider Danke..........I love this beer!!!!
500ml bottle. Poured dark red-brown.clear, white foam.full body, soft carbonation,  long finish.

Poured dark red/brown with a thick, rich head.  I got a surprising amount of the caramel tones and less of the nut/malt.  Just delicious.  I think its definitely temperature dependent tho.  Probably would have enjoyed it even more with just 10 minutes in the refrigerator instead of all night.  Cheers

500ml bottle. Really deep garnet colored, with a huge rocky head that dissipates leaving a perfect cylinder down the middle...pretty cool looking beer. Nose is muted classic hefe esters with a touch of alcohol. Flavor is mice malty bananas and hazelnuts with touches of lightly burnt caramel. Crazy drinkable for the abv. Really nice.
500 ml bottle given to me by a friend.  Pours a VERY dark reddish brown.  Flavor:  Roasted malt, dried fruit, and caramel.
Huge head when poured. Smells muddy and earthy. Sweet, yeasty with a wonderful mouthfeel. Big flavors of nutmeg, cloves, and banana. Lots of things going on in this beer.
Large and foamy head when poured. Yeasty aroma, almost wet plant like. Deep brown colour. Very tasty, as it should be for a german wheat beer.

Pours an opaque honey color. Massive head, creamy and white. Long staying pour with massive lacing. Classic German Weizen sediment floating around. Watch it settle while waiting for the had to go down. Nose of clove and banana. Very malty. Intense banana nut bread. Yeasty after taste. Like a hefe on roids. Medium mouth feel. Carbonation is perfect for the style. Smooth as velvet. Awesome beer!
Bottle.  Poured deep sanguine with thick white head.  Aroma of cloves and caramel.  Citrus, clove and banana, with spicy and hop finish.
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text: 50cl bottle, as shown. Big, soapy beige head with little retention. Hazy, almost opaque mud brown colour. Aroma of yeast, malt and banana - with a strong alcoholic note, evidence of the 8.2 % abv which are unusual for a weizen. Full, thick, smooth mouthfeel, very pleasant. Taste is sweet bananas, some citric notes to keep things fresh, some herbs, with a smooth, alcoholic finish and after taste. Its not one of the best-balanced beers out there, as the added alcohol is in evidence throughout. Nonetheless it drinks very nicely, with a lot of flavours - be on guard. A heavy-footer for a weizen, but not in a bad way.
Tops in its class. So delicious. Strong yet so smooth. Spices are up front but they are not offensive like many other wheat beers.

Strong armoas of malts, bananas cloves and smooth yeast. A nice and dark beer That looks EXACTLY like the picture with that same glass. The malts come out in the taste but after you get the banana and cloves tastes, its all very smooth and nicely complimented by the easy yeast taste and the bubbles on the palate. Quite a nice dark beer, the strange name kept me away too long.

Russet colored with medium white head. Highly carbonated. Traditional wheat aromas; bananas, cloves and dark malts. A lot of banana and vanilla in the flavour. Also licorice and chocolate, hard to detect the alchohol. Thick with quite a lingering sweetness. Really easy drinking for an 8.2% beer, but not as complex as i had hoped for all the hype it gets.
Excellent German Bock! It has a hints of banana, plums, and caramel. It is a very complex beer, it has alot going on. Very good beer, Ive had it on more then one occasion.

Pours amber brown with plenty of head and a sweet fruity aroma. The flavor is dominated by sweet fruit flavors of plums and bananas with a bready quality and a good amount of carbonation and sourness to balance it out.

delicious dark brown looking pour. frothy tan head that looks beautiful and laces the glass. banana and citrus on the nose with a slight yeast following. delicious banana taste with other fruits following. Very clean mouth feel..very clean on the palate.

Pours rich mohogany brown with a tall foamy head. Aroma of bread and yeast, It smells great very deep complex aroma. Flavours of malt, bread, some fruit, Bananas, a little bit of alcohol. A little caramel as well. This is a fantastic beer, soo flavourful and complex. One of my favorites. It has all of thoes great wheat beer flavours like clove and banana as well as the rich breadyness of a bock. This is a fantastic beer

Draft. Pours hazy brown with a thick, white head. Beautiful lacing. Aroma of lavender, raisins, figs, cinnamon, spice, and hints of banana and vanilla, Medium body with a warm, crsip finish. Excellent German bock. Almost tasted like a trippel. Highly recommended.
50cl bottle, Alko. Pours brown color. white head, that lasts.Despite the high alcohol , quite easy to drink. Taste of  raisin and banana, very enjoyable.

Bottle. To begin with, the beer has a nice dark brown cloudy color. Smells much yeast and spices.

The taste is quite rich and thick. The classic taste of banana is there, but not as significantly as in other wheat beer. Spices, a pleasant sweetness. Some hints of raisin, plum and black currant. Easy to drink despite its 8.2%. 

A wonderful beer in all ways, well-balanced. After-taste is pleasant with clear elements of yeast and blackcurrants.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2009 Mi trovo nuovamente di fronte ad una birra che mi spiazza terribilmente.. Sarà forse perchè è una weizen (probabilmente la mia prima al frumento), ma laroma e il sapore stesso sono davvero particolari..
Mi è stata servita nel bicchiere corretto, e devo dire che esteticamente è davvero elegante.
In ogni caso ho gradito, perchè ho potuto sorseggiarla e goderla in un lungo arco di tempo; una birra destinata probabilmente alla sola "meditazione" o con qualche accoppiata culinaria molto originale dati i particolarissimi aromi e i sapori che la mia infinità ignoranza culinaria non ne ha saputo determinare una derivazione.

Very nice appearance, nice thick white head over a thinner brown/red liquid.  Not much in the way of lacing.  Scent is a robust combination that leans toward the wheat end of the spectrum, but has hte darker notes behind it.  Very cool.  Taste is also leaning toward the wheat side, as the doppelbocky notes are only hinted at in the aftertaste.  Very good,e specically with the more carbonated feel.  A good good beer.

Poured a dark reddish-brown color with a good sized, long-lasting fluffy off white head. Decent spicy aroma, but where this beer really shines is in the flavor and palate departments. Excellent sweet flavors of banana, vanilla, chocolate, and a creamy finish. Solid offering from Schneider.

my very first bock beer........what a way to start!  Deep red pour with a thick lasting head.  Caramel malt and bananas very evident in the nose.  I tasted toasted sugar, bananas, a little vanilla and chocolate.  A very complex brew.  Thanks to Peggy and Mitch at Ned Cash Jewelers in Brunswick, Ga.

Bottle from the Village Bottle Shop. This is a very interesting and worthwhile dopplebock. A lucky find. The aroma has bread, vanilla, syrup and fruit- almost similar in some ways to many Belgian ales, but thicker. Pours dark and opaque with a lot of head that dissipates shortly with little lacing. The flavor is rich, full and satisfying with strong notes of spice, fruit, grain and even chocolate. The finish is long and complex, ending with some sweet fruit and bitterness. The high alcohol is not too noticeable, but warms and bolsters the beverage nicely. This one is definitely worth checking out if it is available. Will probably get this one again.

Bottle from the Majestic on Eastchase.  Dark brown pour with a lot of white head.  Aroma is grains, malts, and spice.  Taste is fruit and a little chocolate, some dark fruit.  Great aftertaste.  Smooth, rich mouth feel.

500ml bottle. Well carbonated cola colour with a peaked pillow of foam. Rich aromas of banana, vanilla and cloves with a faint chocolate background. Fruity with a big hit of alcohol. Spiced fruit flavours dominate.

Smells kinda mentholy or minty, reminds me of crest toothpaste.  Also has aromas of cigar tobacco and ash.  Tastes of chewing tobacco, brown sugar, molasses and subtle citrus notes.  Really nice lacing in the glass.

A nose of anis, strawberries, yeast and banana. Taste is of yeast, banana, chocolate and sugars. Its salty and has a little complexity to it. This one has been in my cellar for a while, and its probably better fresh.

500ml bottle. Maple syrup-like color with a huge, rapidly dissipating, tan head.  Aroma is full of lots of nice spices, caramel, honey, dark fruits and some earthy aromas come through as well.  Flavor contains dark juicy fruit and roasted almonds.  There is some nice caramel flavors blend nicely with the fruit flavors as well.  Overall this is a great beer, very complex but all the ingredients play well together in this brew.  I need to get back to more German beers now!
From a bottle poured a dark ruby/brown color with a fair amount of head.  Nice strong sweet malty flavor with a lasting aftertaste.
Unusual favor, you cant really compare it to any other beer out there. But, hands down this is one the worlds top 10 best beers.

I think this is my first weizenbock and since it is a top 100 beer, I had to buy it. I poured this into a weizen glass (duh) and the head was aggressively foamy and cream colored. The actual beer is dark, cloudy brown with red at the bottom and edges. It smells very yeasty, cloves, and spice. Tastes like spice, clove, yeast, wheat,some chocolate (barely), and some dark fruit, little apricot (which I havent had in years). Alcohol was unnoticeable but the phenols were certainly there. Good stuff.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 07-05-2007 15:35:17
Perfect looking untill the head disappeared. Smells of spicewith a bit of fruit. Medium fizz. Spicey taste, tastes like leffe with a cleaner finish.

bottle - pours a deep brown with an off white head.  Nice big spicy upfront aroma predominantly cloves with an underlying yeast and malt aroma.  Flavour was not what I was expecting, lovely fresh malt with the spices coming through in the background.  flavours are all well balanced with a slight bitter finish.  You would never pick this as a 8.2ABV it is remarkably smooth and well balanced!

Draft - Poured a darkish brown/amber in color with a very small off-white head.  Little carbonation.  Aroma is grainy and slightly sweet with hints of spices, Belgian-style yeastiness and floral hops.  Flavor is also slightly sweet with a hefty yeastiness that was enjoyable.  Hops not as apparent in the flavor, except at the end.  Finish is lingering, slightly bitter...  This is an excellent beer.

bottle  bought at binnys pours brown with orange hue and big thick tan head and great lacing aromas of heavy grains and spices taste is of wheat grains up front followed by malts and spices,nutmeg cinnamon and a little nut flavor medium body with smooth mouthfeel.the sweetness of this beer hids the 8.2 % abv very well
"Vom fass" heads down the best weizen bock in the world, perhaps the best beer ever!

0.5 L [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Pub & Bar, Stavanger. A fingerthick, creamy sand-colored head upon a near-clear, plain brown colored body. Beautiful, rounded, gently sweet, wheaty malt aroma, added by subtle scent of slightly perfumed fruity and floral hops. Taste has a delicate sweetness from a soft, wheaty malt body. A fine fruitiness underneath. Supersmooth in the mouth. Full body. Fruity finish with an acidic touch. Finally Ive tasted this gem, a delicious beer.

Copper ruby pour with a great creamy head, too bad it doesnt leave any lacing.
Aroma is full of dark fruit, wheat, sultanas, banana and cloves. Sweet clean malt underneath with notes of caramel. Pretty damn good!
Crystal and possibly chocolate malt combine with the lighter wheat to create a very interesting mix of flavours. Dark fruit is once again evident, along with more caramel and some alcohol, which lingers in a very pleasant finish, much like a belgian strong ale.
Mouthfeel is a balancing act between the refreshing light body of a weizen the fullness of a rich, malty brew.
I wouldnt have thought of it, but its amazing how the light wheat combines with the smooth malt of a doppelbock.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2009 Clovey less banana than glockenspiel - a little flat cola-ish. more assertive, not as good as glockenspiel. Smells great, a litle cinnamony. Feels beautiful in myh mouth, thick and bubbly. Sweet beginning, less sweet flavor.

UPDATED: SEP 25, 2009 Bottle. Aromas of bananas mostly with lots of chocolate. Mouthfeel is very creamy thin bubbles delivers the flavors perfectly. The aromas are perfectly delivered in the taste, banana cake with cocoa. For something so readily available this is one of the best.

Love this beer deeply but wanted to make a few comments on the 2004 Vintage that I drank last night.
-Rummy flavours softened
-Deeper dark chocolate taste
-Mouthfeel was very smooth with no trace of acidity. Actually seemed creamier on the tongue.
-Finish ended off drier that the regular version with more of a slight herbal rhubard taste and less sugar

A cloudy dark brown beer with a nice looking 3 finger head. Aroma was spicy & complex almost like spicecake. Taste was banana, chocolate, spicy, & bready with a cake like taste, & undertones of wheat. This beer really looks good in the glass & dazzles with a lot of carbonation activity. I do not know that much about bocks but this is my favorite, & probably one of the best in the world.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2011 Body dark red color with a huge head that disappears extremely quick. No lacing. Aroma has notes of caramel, chocolate, raisins, plums, and licorice. Taste was about the same. Not too sweet and has some bitterness in the aftertaste. Mouthfeel is carbonated and creamy. Very enjoyable.

Had side by side with the Eisbock... slightly lighter in color than the Eis. Aroma is clove and dusty/champagne with fruit esters and bubblegum. Flavor is strangely inviting, like a deep hefe with hints of Belgian Ale... YUM!

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2011 Bottle pours a dark copper with a light tanish head. Complex scent....all kinds of stuff going on. Taste is just as good.

RE RATE

Pours dark amber with a puffy off-white head. Aroma of yeast, cherries, honey, and roast malt. Taste is a perfect balance of caramel malt and wheat. Sweet but also very rich and dynamic. Full bodied and creamy. God bless the Germans.

Colore marrone scuro(scurissimo!).Schiuma cremosa e aderente ,frizzante e leggermente densa, buona persistenza.Ricco e speziato laroma. Gusto  tostato e leggermente amaro. Finale lungo e piacevole. Notevole tenore alcolico, molto equilibrata. E piacevole da bere...e ri-bere!
Bottled - deep color with a big head.  Smelled great with a spicy, banana aroma.  Tasted some chocolate and a finish of clove.

Cool deep burgundy color. Complex nose and equally complex flavor dominated by banana and clove. Spice comes in late. Very well balanced in all facets. Head lingers quite nicely. Supreme for its style!

This poured into a substantial, off-white head and a cloudy, almost copper-red colour.  Aroma was interesting, I cant determine whats on offer there and the taste is equally complex.  Very refreshing to drink.
Cloudy caramel color with a tall tan head.  Strong aroma of clove, yeast, banana, and vanilla.  Banana, clove. vanilla, chocolate, and and some spice.  Just deliciously balanced.

Bottle. The aroma is a bit like standing in an old fashioned sweet shop set in the middle of a vast spice market in some forgotten land. Pours a deep, burnished copper with an off-white head that disappears fairly quickly. Getting a mouthful of that head before it goes is highly recommended. Flavours of clove, nutmeg, banana, yeast, vanilla and liquorice are all present and while the alcohol is detectable it is very subdued. One of the best doppelbocks in the world and one of my own favourite beers.
On tap at Toronado in San Diego. Brown amber color with a big yeasty aroma of spices, ester, banana and cinnamon. Taste was a great balance of sweet from the aroma and a gentle hop bitter.

Yes! A deep dark woody/brown appearance.  Smells so good. Bananas! wheaty, clove, cinnamon, nutty.  Goes down brilliantly!  Very refreshing and bright mouthfeel.  Complex flavours, banana, spices, heavy chocolate, much much more, very, very good! Love it. Must get more!

Brown with a huge almost grey looking head, looks like a king in its glass. Aroma is yeasty of heavy typical wheat components. The body is big but the beer is still very easy to drink, smooth but filling. Flavour is yeasty of ripe banana, light caramell, clove and something subtile that reminds me of very weak coffe.

Bottle. Pours a hazy gentle brown, with a sot white head that gradually reduces to a ring. Nose is soft fruit, cough medicine, root beer, caramel/toffee, nice sourness, a shade of delicate hops, cinnamon, ripe banana, a bit of oaky earthiness as well. Flavor is semi-sweet, nice gentle hoppiness, cinnamon and bananas, Christmas cake with brandy, again slightly sour, especially towards the finish, not as spicy as I had remembered, but very nice and well-balanced nonetheless.

Thick wheaty and sweet aroma, both one of the sweetest and wheatiest aromas I have smelled. Plenty of spices in there as well as a touch of chocolate. Pours a dark unclear brown with a very quickly dissipating head. Looks to be quite carbonated. Not as sweet as the aroma would predict, beautiful beer. Sticky on the lips, long and complex aftertaste. Alcohol is extremely well hidden but after drinking 500mL you can feel the 8.2%.

I REALLY like this beer, I cant believe I only bought one bottle. Have to find more!
A very pleasant brew indeed, I had brought this back to a fall beer party and hid it until later in the evening this particular brew had a very fine reception indeed.

bottle 500ml from Alko EXP 07.04.10 hazy  dark brown small creamy head ring. I tasted this first time around 12 years ago and rated it high on my notes. Lovely kick of banana, yeast , spices dash of chocolate totally full body. Pleasant long lasting aftertaste with kicking phennols. This is perfect night cap after hard day.

(16.9oz bottle) Pours a dark mahogany that lets light through in a ruby color with light tan head thats is voluminous and stays around. Lacing on the glass is superb. Nose has clove, spicy cinnamon, ripe banana, and sweet bready yeast. The taste is also very ripe bananas on the back end, but on the front its slightly chocolaty, clove-like spiciness, coats the mouth with sweetness and velvety carbonation. Body is just perfect, not too thick and not watery by any stretch. Its also quite creamy which most beers fail to achieve. This beer doesnt do any single aspect wrong. It looks, smells, and tastes fantastic. I always love drinking this beer. Maybe the best dopplebock Ive had.

hazy brown pour.  frothy offwhite head.  banana, clove, cinnamon in the aroma.  a bit yeasty.  Mouthfeel is silky, delicious, sticky maltiness with complimenting fruits and a bit of alcohol.  truly one of the greats of the style

questa weizen bock,secondo il mio gusto ha un troppo alto grado alcolico (8,2%)ma ha un bellissimo colore rosso scuro e presenta una schiuma densa e persistente.
è una birra che lascia un lunghissimo retrogusto leggermente amarognolo!!!!

Much anticipated. Pours a near black-brown, with brown froathy head. Aromas of sweet-sour yeast, chocolate covered bananas with some spiciness. Flavors are off the charts: Chocolate up front with nutty malt, light toffee, dark dried fruits(raisin/sour plums), alcohol, some caramel. Very sweet, sticky, chewy, strong alcohol, full bodied-everything about this beer is over the top.
One of the best beers I think Ive ever had, really happy I decided to get it.

Bottle. Appearance: Dark amber with a huge white head. Aroma: dark fruit and caramel. Flavour: Dark fruit, caramel and spices. 
This is one of the best beer I tried.

Bottle at ABC beer tasting. Poured a dark amber with orange tint and a frothy white head. Aroma consisted of fruits and a caramel like aroma, perhaps a bit of chocolate. Flavor started a bit dark but leads to a sweeter lighter wheat finish.

Pours a muddy reddish brown, with a huge head. Dark fruits dipped in burnt candi sugar (dark caramel), very estery with a bit of citrus as well. Fantastically complex. Really nice flavor, as well. Starts strong and just keeps getting deeper. Cloves, allspice, dark fruits and caramel. Just a bit of estery booze - but this is delicious. One of the best German brews Ive tried, and a real testament to just how delicious the eisbock version of it is. Nice!

2007 vintage.

Apperance: Dark brownish with a huge head. Plenty of carbonation.

Aroma: Ripe fruit, Dark caramel, Candi sugar, Hint of chocolate.

Flavor: Ripe fruit, Wheat, Caramel, Prunes, Sugar, Hint of lemon.

Palate: Rich and complex with an incredible drinkability. Lots of carbonation after 2 years in a bottle. Smooth small bubbles.

Ok, ive had this fresh a dozen times but after reading that Garret Oliver recommended putting this beer down for a few years i decided to do so. Very different to what it is like fresh
but the drinkability is still awesome with added complexity. Wow!
Bottle. I absolutely loved this. Beautiful and aromatic, malty and fruity as one would expect of the style.

04-JUL-2009.
Bottle @home.
Beautifull brown but hazy colour with huge off-white head.
Malty and fruity nose and taste. Good carbonation, and slight heat from the high ABV.
Very delicious, but I cannot tell this from Carlsberg Semper Ardens Abbey Ale. Well this one is a bit more fruity, but maybe I should try them together?

Poured a beautiful dark liquid. The nose was set off with incredible touches of cherries, grapes, malt and a floral scent. Mouthfeel had a thick, rich and velvety texture. Taste was of cloves, banana peel, caramel and spices. A wonderful beer!

Bottle. Ap: Beautiful red-brown-orange color with a creamy white head. Ar: Sweet and yeasty. Some caramel. Fla: Nice caramel sweetness, some orange and kind of a belgo touch due to the yeast character.Pal, Ov: Well balanced and extremely smooth.
Somehow haddened had this bought it a ways back.  Pours rich deep orange with a tan head.  Nose is sweet and malty and quite rich.  Taste is sweet, rich, malty with big kicks of caramel.  Yummers.

The pour produced a decent foam up of off white, rocky head that didnt last that sat on top of extremely thick, dark brown muddy beer with a good amount of very fine silty sediment and slightly spotty lacing. The aroma was of alcohol , dirt, tobacco, some dark spice, smoke, maybe dates adn probably cherries. Very complex! Holy hell the aroma is great. The taste of spicy alcohol, dark fruit (plum / dates),caramel, sweet candy adn yeast make this a complex flavoured beer that seems quite balanced. Medium bodied with a velvety smooth feel despite the bite of alcohol. Has a soft, chewy sweet bready finish and a bit of alcohol as well. Leaves the mouth dry. The belch almost burnt my gut out. Drank the last half in under 4 minites. There was a bit of dustiness from the last couple sips due to the sediment chug. Obviously this is an excellent beer.

Cloudy brownish-red pour with a thick tan head. Nice aroma on banana, clove, and sweet malt. Sweet taste, banana and cloves, with sweet cocoa malt taste. Nice mellow balance taste between the the flavors-Alcohol isnt noticeable. Nice aftertaste. Nice lacing on the glass.
Bottle. Deep amber colour with a nice off-white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, hops, fruit, spice and caramel.

A nice deep mahogany brown beer with a small off-whitish head that quits quick. Nose is spicy, with some dried fruit and a bit boozy. Flavor is complex, a lot of dark fruit, dried fruit, spice, a belgian yeasty flavor, and tart. Really delicious chewy mouthfeel. Im no expert in wheats, or weizen bocks, but this seems to me like a belgian dubbel, Im surprised it has wheat in it. Good beer!

Best Weizen Bock ever for sure. Pours a deep amber orange with a nice head of off white bubbles. Aromas of malt, clove, and soft banana. Clean malty slight-citrus flavor hits the tongue with a perfect amount of carbonation before giving way to caramel, banana, apricot, and hard candy. Then a clove like hop finish before going away leaving the palate awake and wanting more. World Class!

I cant believe Ive waited this long to try this one. One of my new favorites. Im kicking myself now for stupidly pouring this into a pint glass. I would have enjoyed that massive head of foam much more in a glass like the one pictured here. I dont have to describe the appearance, just look at the picture. Stunning. The aroma is complex with raisins, plums, banana, prunes, clove and other spices. A bit salty. The taste is equally complex with prunes, plums, raisins, and a wonderful spicy character thats by far the best in any weizen bock Ive had. It ends on a wheat note with mild bitterness. Its medium bodied and goes down very easily. A great summer brew that is light, but massively tasty!

bottle: pours cloudy dark red/brown with thick white head.  Yeasty-wheaty nose.  Sweet, malty taste with nice alcohol bite at the end.  Overtones of charcoal and chocolate.  Light body and medium carb.   Im just not tasting the banana, but still a good brew.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2014 cloudy brown with sediment, lovely thick super smooth large offwhite head.
fruity, peach, faint dark fruits in the aroma, well balanced. almost resembling belgian stuff.
flavori is peachy, yellow fruity, dark fruits, strong flavor but not alcoholic, sicy as it gets warmer. (rating back then 3.5)

re-rate 2014-09-28.cloudy yellow, smooth light brown head. not very nice looks, like muddy waters.mild aroma of banana and what might be smoke, but is probably just roasted malts, wheat.
Flavor is wheat, roasted malts, a little banana, some citrussy like fruity notes, nice weizenbock but not at all something special. Perhaps the quality has changed over the years.

Pours an opaque brown with a big, thick off white head.  Really great aroma of bananas, clove, wheat. A bit of tobacco like clove cigarettes, A light smoke and fruity sourness. Flavor is clove and cinamon, carmel. Medium body with soft carbonation, dry finish. Basically all you could want in a wheat beer.
Bottle. Great beer. This dark wheat beer is full bodied and has a good lasting flavor and aftertaste. Aroma is quite obvious.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2009 An excellent dark wheat beer.  Aroma is full of wheats, yeast, and has that typical "banana" smell familiar with many wheat beers.  Flavor has stronger malts than many other wheat beers, and still has some nice flavors of yeast and and slight sweetness.  Great mouthfeel for a wheat beer.

Bottle thanks to Bigmmartin.  Pours a dark brown with a thin white head.  Aroma is strong with malts, wheat, and banana.  Notes of caramel and chocolate come out as well.  The taste brings out the wheat.  This beer has a clean and crisp finish.  I really enjoyed this beer.
Pours a deep, rich brown with very little head. Rich aroma and flavor--some smoke, some sourness, some spice--make for a very satisfying brew.

Hazy brown pour with a fluffy off white head that lasted through the whole beer. Sweet malty aroma with notable hints of spice, dark fruits, and caramel. Alcohol is noticeable on the finish, however its not too offensive.

On tap @ Toronado.  Pours a cloudy, deep brown color with a large offwhite head.  Dark fruits and bread yeast have the stage on the nose.  Creamy, doughy, hints of berries and lots of banana on the end.  Sweet, but not cloying.  A winner.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2013 500 ml bottle in Germany. I think that I have found my Mecca. Brown almost cholate body color. Nice brown head with a baked banana aroma. Slightly banana taste. Palate is mellow and very smooth. Alcohol so well hidden I would almost guessed it for the half of what it is. Weizen peices spewing carbonation from the bottom of the glass. Unreal beer. number 1 on my list.------- am not sure what happend to the beer but it is not the same as it once was. Over the last six month I have seen a reduction in the quality of the taste and Aroma. Not sure what happend but its not the same anymore.
bottle... fruity aroma with notes of chocolate and other sweet messes... heavy on the mouth for such a fruity aroma and flavor... all in all not my style but very good

Aroma: berry banana clove -light
Appearance: Cloudy headless muddy reddish
Flavor:Sweet berry banana
Palate: Nice full body, fizzy
Good wheat beer

Amazing bouquet of fresh berries. Flavor is sweet and fruity but a little meaty, like a honey-baked ham. Its light and crisp, and has a little stinkiness in the first couple sips, but that dissapates quickly and smoothes out about an inch into your glass. Bottle at Brother Tuckers in Plantation, Florida.

500ml bottle.  Pours a gargantuan, frothy, root beer float-esque, tan, lasting head.  Muddy, deep brown body with fine yeast clouds.  Chunky, abundant lacing.  A sight to behold.  Big clove nose with underlying banana and vanilla.  No alcohol in the aroma.  Smells of sweet crystal and chocolate malts.  Bready wheat malt aroma and some doughy yeast.  Medium, creamy body.  Slight, pleasant warming alcohol with mild alcohol flavor.  Complements rather than detracts from.  Average carbonation.  Sweet and spicy flavors are balanced by a light bitterness.  Bready and delicious.  This beer is a well-crafted masterpiece.

Wow....what a great beer. Incredibly refreshing!! Aroma has hints of fruit and malt and is very crisp and light. Flavor is a phenomenal balance of bananas, cloves caramel, chocolate and wheat. Some subtle hints of vanilla run throughout the experience. Crisp, dry finish. Just fantastic.
Dark amber pour. Taste is banana, spice, yeast. I have to agree with other raters I can taste almost bubble gum flavor. Great beer one of my favs

Pours dark amber/brown with off-white minimal head. Aroma is of malty bread dough. Flavor is very sweet, yeast, lots of malt. Has hint of coriander and banana as well. Minimal aftertaste with awatery feel. A very good beer to go with good food, and have a bottle to store for later.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2009 Dark brown colour with a big foamy head. Roasted and malty aroma with some wheat notes. Flavor was quite sweet with notes of malt, clove, spices and dark fruit. The alcohol is well hidden. Nice weizen bock indeed.
Bottle, Dark ruby color with a big white head. Aroma and spices. Flavor same as aroma, smooth and sweet. One of my favorite beer.

(Bottle from Fat Cat, Norwich) Poured into a dimpled mug, dark brown with fluffy white head, though not as big as expected. Smell was of cloves, bananas, raisons, alcohol, wheat and flowers. Strong aroma. Taste was suitably big, malty with flowery hops, and elements of all the above. Quite sweet with warming alcohol - lots of dark sweet malt. Good carbonation. Rich yet dangerously drinkable. Great.
Drank strait from the bottle. Flavors of spice, alcohol, caramel, and raisin. Smooth and complex. Pretty decent.

This un. big press and i was really looking forward to it. Its nice, lets agree on that, but it doesnt present as nice as Id like in the glass, or on the nose. So, its a drink of two halves. Finish is very complex and very nice palate wise. Good, but not great. Will try again tho
Sample @ Bock&Rock.Aroma was spicey & sweet.Color was dark reddish brown with a good white head.Taste was fruity malt with hints of sweetness and a simple sour finish.Drank very easy,loved this one.

50cl bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Cloudy amber brown with plentiful beige head.  Nose is figs or raisins.  Flavor is delicious.  Notes of dried fruit, yeast, some malt.  Finish is medium, slight bitterness and some alcohol with a touch of sourness.  Full-bodied heavy brew.  Excellent well-rounded beer.

Cola-like color and head. Sweet, almost too sweet, aroma. Taste is definitely too sweet, with some sour notes (which I dislike). The finish is pungent and I guess is supposed to taste of cloves. Reminded me more of eating a menthol cigarette.

Pours a dark ruby with a big white head.  Aroma is huge spice, banana, and sweet.  Taste is banana, spice, yeast, and I agree with the below rater who said bubble gum, which is really weird.  Interesting beer and different from most of what I have had.
A 0.5L bottle from Alko.Sweet nose with some banana. Pale beige head. Hazy dark orange reddish colour. Sweet slightly applelike syropy and fruity taste. Mild hoppiness.

500 mL bottle from Total Wine.  Dark orange pour with a thick and creamy off-white head.  Aroma of bubble gum, yeast, and sugar.  Taste of raisin, cloves, and caramel.  Ever so slightly sour finish.  An excellent representation of this style.

Pours Murky brown-amber with a dense medium tan head.  Aroma - Lots of clove, yeast, and caramel. Taste - clove, yeast, & caramel malts finishing off with some bitterness. Overall - This is a great beer that hides the 8.2% very well. Its very drinkable and and has a very creamy mouth feel would definitely drink this again.  Its a real tough decision but I think Id go with Ayinger Celebrator as a winner though both are great beers. Aventinus is just too strong on the cloves and it cover most of the other flavors, although the smell if Aventinus is better. But in the end you drink the beer more than smelling it.
Great beer.  Pour dark with a very small head.  Aroma of fruits and spices.  Some cloves in aroma.  Flavor same as aroma.  Very good.
Hazy, rocky head, fruity aroma. Caramel and yeast aroma and taste. Very drinkable. an excellent beer.

Bottle, 50cl. Pours an ambercolored beer with a firm offwhite head. The aroma is fruit, alcohol, raisin/plum and cloves. The flavor is malt, hay, alcohol and fruits. The palate is bold with a good carbonation. Good bock.

500mL pours a slightly cloudy reddish-amber with loads of white head, probably 3 fingers.  Strong carbonation leads to plenty of champagne bubbles to keep the frothy head alive.

Strong aroma of sour fruit like lemon with plenty of summer wheat or rye.  Starts smooth with a bold sour aftertaste and a dry finish.  Dissolves across the palate, with a bit of a soapy feel.  Surprisingly astringent for only having 8% ABV.

500 ml bottle in weizen glass.  Cloudy reddish brown with lasting soft head and lace. Strong banana bubblegum and clove aroma.  Richy fruity flavor with mild caramel and tangy bready wheat finish.  Medium-full body and creamy texture.  Definitely a classic.  Awesome.  Ive had this many times, including at the taphouse just off the Marienplatz.  Im glad I didnt rate the grungy bottom-of-keg pour that I had last month at BT.

Bottled, tnx to DH8VV. Color is hazy dark rown with warm nut brown transparency. Huge off-white head and sweet nose where the alcoholic kick comes through. Aroma is dominated y sweetness and stingy alcohol, which should have been hidden better. Reminds me the Weizens but  finished as duppelbock. Flavour is dominated by malts, alcohol.

Pours a dark brick red with a thick white head. Aroma of cloves, banana and brown sugar. Flavors of banana, vanilla and roasted malt with a hint of bitterness. Highly carbonated and VERY refreshing. An outstanding beer.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2014 1 pint bottle. pours hazy brown- very nice to look at. Little to no head, no lacing (might have had this one a touch too chilled... or it is an old bottle?) Aroma is typical fruits. Flavor is complex and very enjoyable. High carbonation, some bitterness in the finish. 

This is my first venture into the Wheat-Doppelbock realm, and Im impressed. This beer is a winner!

Re-rate:

Purchased a bottle of the aged variety, 2009.

Pours dark brown, hazy. Same head, no lacing. The first difference is the aroma: like that German carbonated apple-juice. Strange, but thats what I get now. Flavor is less banana than before, more subdued, kind of just dark fruits at the beginning, then turning into a long chocolate/port finish. The alcohol must have gone up from 8.2, but it is still well hidden, and the entire thing comes together nicely. Awesome to get this beer for $5, and I didnt even have to muster the patience to age it myself.
Clear deep brown pour with a thin light tan head.  Bubblegum and clove aroma with sweet candy and malt.  Very dry with clove, banana, and bubblegum.  Bitter finish.  Smooth and creamy.

500 ml. bottle (2008) in a weizen glass. Pours a deep mahogany w/ a complex color profile approaching the edges, large ivory head that eventually remains steady at a half-inch height, thick and creamy. Bananas and cloves dominate the nose, especially the latter- huge cloves and undertones of anise. Vanilla comes through in the very first sip; crystal and dark malts give it a complex, rich malty profile that leaves a ring reminiscent of hastily eaten cotton candy. Bananas are even stronger in the flavor than in the nose. Full in the mouth and very quenching. Some bitterness at the end disappears as the beer warms up. Lovely brew.
Poured Amber brown, caramel, bananna, spice, malty, bready, little dark fruits.
This is a classic beer. Intense, dark colour, good head yet the balance of strong spice, chocolate, cloves and caramel makes you want to go back for more!! Fills the palate and pleases the appetite.

Eyes. incredible cream head. goood carbonation and yellow pale color
Nouse: Aroma was citrus, clove, frutal banana aroma. 
Tonge: The flavor is good and very complex. Many fruity notes malt wheat yeast and citrus. it is very cream and smooth. 
Very Niceee

Serving type: bottle
Poured a beautiful amber/reddy colour. Long lasting off white head. Flavours...so many. Apricot, banana, caramel, fruit with spicy notes. MMMM! I do love this beer. Highly recommended. (Bottle 500ml)

Bottle. Ruby coloured beer. Persistent head. Banana, peach, apricot, vanilla, very sweet, hint of caramel too. A magnificent beer that is better than most Belgians IMO. I wish it was more widely available here in the UK. One of my all time favourites.

Appearance: Pours a near clear, brown-amber body with a fluffy, downright voluptuous, off-white head.

Smell: Dark, sweet-scented wheat malt aroma full of notes of cocoa, caramel, banana chips, dark fruit, and with a particularly fragrant spiciness and minor whiff of peppery alcohol.

Taste: Deeply toasted wheat malt flavor with tastes of spiced chocolate powder and a bit of dark caramel candy. Heavy-handed dose of cracked cloves and cinnamon. Raisin-flavored bubblegum and banana fruitiness. Spicy, slightly herbaceous hops with a subdued bitterness. Sourish yeast quality. Dovetail of spicy phenolics and sweet malted wheat in the final tastes. Finishes malty and warming with a lingering spiciness.

Mouthfeel: Medium-plus body. Medium-high, lively carbonation. Theres a delicate touch of stickiness to the mouthfeel.

Drinkability: Recommended. An exemplary weizenbock full of fine complexities to savor and indulge in.

500 ml. bottle. Pours a thin long lasting head over a cloudy brown body (SRM 15-20).....nose of citrus, lemon and clove with some allspice....taste is initially very spicy, almost fruit cake like with clove, allspice, as well as sweetness, finish is lingering spice and licorice medium dry end....mouth feel is light, carbonation medium. The spice flavors are incredible. DELICIOUS!!!

Bottle (500ml). Poured extremely dark muddy brown (boarder lining black) with a small, lightly tanned, frothy head which was very shortly lived. A rich complex aroma with plums dunked in brandy, raisin toast, caramelized dates, orange chocolate, white pepper, all spice and dried bananas. Flavor was of rum & raisin chocolate with a light bitterness, ripe plums, yeasty malts, cloves, all spice, dried pears and a pepper finish. Very well hidden alcohol content. Full bodied with medium carbonation, a dry mouthfeel, somewhat syrupy texture (but not overly so) and a long finish. Perfectly balanced.

Pours murky auburn/brown with a nice tan head. Nose is very complex. Trademark banana and clove as well as some dark fruit and caramel/toffee. Palate translates well & is multi-layered. Some caramel malt & banana sweetness early before dark fruit and spice. Finishes malty with a a slight sourness from the wheat. High ABV handled beautifully, classic!

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2009 Pours a hazy dark brown with a delicious rocky, off-white head. Smells fresh yeasty and a bit "dunkel" with some cinnamon, cloves and bakery - reminds me of christmas. Those aromas continue in the flavour... I cant put my finger on it exactly, its like christmas bakery, almond, ginger bread and dark chocolate... No clear hint of the alcohol and no bad aftertaste. Great, flavourful brew that goes down quickly with a creamy mouthfeel.

dark and cloudy. pairs the best flavors of weizens and bocks. great banana bread flavor from the hef and intense malts from the bock. theres lots going on here and all works out to create a great experience.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2010 nose of weizen yeast esthers, but more subdued or subtle then even some regular-grade weizens.  the flavor reveals why some of those aromas are stifled: nearly opaque ruby appearance leads to flavors of pit fruits and dark herbal qualities.  mouthfeel remains just as smooth and feathery as a regular weizen, but with amped up flavors that go beyond the somewhat sweet and airy notes typically found.  the dark apperance defies the easily likable interior of esters and love laced fruits.  i had the eisbock before this (which i enjoyed immensely) but i feel like i just took a weight off my shoulders, for this is so drinkable i am staggered as a result.  overall maybe a fresher specimen would have provided greater fruits as i have experienced in other weizen bocks but this still sits in a very comfortable position amongst the greatest beers i know of, and one i will be returning to soon and often.

1 pt .9 fl oz bottle.  Pleasant and airy aroma that noticeably adds well with the tasting experience as it kind of fires up the nostrils with every sip.  Slightly more clove and spice notes in the smell than expected.  Banana a strong player too, brown sugar, caramel-toffee cookie dough, as well as minor bubble gum.  A very pretty beer as the pour is great, nice inch and a half of part fluffy cream and part wispy milk head, a nice layer of retention,  full body appearance, dark golden amber in color.  The flavor profile is more heavy weighted toward the malty dopplebock side of the brew, something that the aroma would suggest otherwise.  A good amount of caramel cookie, mild fruits, yeast, and pears, with the more spicy, clove, and wheat grain elements fulfilling more of a background role. Some citrusy and grassy bitter elements come into play here maybe alittle more so than in the eisbock version.  The mouthfeel was not as nice as i was expecting from a beer this highly regarded. It was not bad, but a little too much carbonation. Balance was good, but the flavor profile overall to me also did not come together as well as in the eisbock.  So I would have to say Im alittle disappointed with this offering, but its still a very good beer overall.  Maybe I will need to rerate sometime in the future.
A superb, full-bodied German brew. Smells like banana, tastes like caramel, feels like staccato tuba music.

Pours a murky brown with a hint of rust in coloration. A thin slightly white head. aroma is very sweet, the presence of alcohol easily noted. Caramel and syrup are distinguishable in the aroma. Pleasant flavor  malt leads to a beer with less sweetness than the aroma suggests. In all its complexities it is still a very simple brew

On tap at the Blind Tiger in NYC.  Poured a nice dark brown with a big foamy generous white head.   Aroma was sweet malt, a little sourness, some clove, banana.  Flavor was a bit more of the same with a nice full sweet mouthfeel.  Kind of bready.  Nice beer.

Pours a cloudy, dark amber with a creamy head

The aroma is bananas, apples, caramel malt

The flavour follows from the nose, a lot of tart, sweet fruits like apple and banana.  Spicey and yeasty as well

Mouthfeel is pretty creamy with a sharp carbonation
Bottle.  Pours dark amber with a  big head.  bananas, cloves, other dark fruits.  sweet and a little sour.  not bad.

Typical nose of banana and clove, some cinnamon-like spicyness comes through and fresh white bread.  Hazy brown, nice head, thins quickly.  Spicy and phenolic in flavour with some fruit, also some caramel, with a touch of sweetness that finishes with a light tartness.  Medium body and carbonation.  Quite nice.

1 pt. bottle.  It pours a hazy dark amber with a tall, light tan head.  Boozy fruit aromas abound with wheat, spice, and yeast notes as well.  Medium carbonation with an initially sticky then dry mouthfeel.  Lots of flavor here.  Ripe fruit, wheat, roasted malt, alcohol, and candy sweetness.  Lingering spicy wheat taste.  Definitely clove and vanilla in there.  Lots of clove.  Excellent drinkability and definitely a beer I would have again.
Murky dark amber with a light tan head.  Dark wheat and spicy caramel aromas. Medium body. Lots of sweet wheat flavors here, clove, bananas, with light roasted malts and spices.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Pours a huge head of fine beige head.  The lacing is also of particular interest.  This hazy brown has the great combination of wheat interjected with malt overtones.  Finishes with a note of hops and a touch of clove.

100th March rating.  Hazy orange brown with a thin finger of off white foam.  Lovely banana and clove spice aroma.  Taste has more chocolate up front, with a caramel and banana fruitiness in the middle and a light spice finish.  A fantastically varied beer from the front of the lips to the back of the throat.

On tap at Ølbaren. 
It pours cloudy brown, with a huge light brown head.
Aroma is banana, sweet fruit and spices, with notes of alcohol. 
The flavour is refreshing and fruity with notes of malt, citrus, raisins and banana. 
Nice mouthful.

Pour a hazy brown with a large fluffy  off-white head that stick around.  Nose is very spicy with some banana, caramel, chocolate, malts, yeast, grass, and wheat.  Flavor is also pretty spicy with some wonderful sweet flavors coming through.  Bananas, dark fruits, hops, clove, vanilla, chocolate, yeast, wheat, and caramel.  Very high carbonation and a dry, bitter finish.  Excellent.  One of the best.

.005 hectalitre botle with cryptic numbering. Looks clear while pouring, though when massed in the glass it looks cloudy. Medium brown, tall head. Smells slightly of banana and clove. Lots of flavors, including brown bread, raisin, cocoa and tartness. But I was surprised at how light, or at least non-heavy, this is. Its almost refreshing. One of the best wheat beers, one of the best doppelbocks.

Comes in a beautful glass specially designed for the beer - glad to see Germans learning a bit from the Belgians. ;) Pours a dark brown with large off-white head and great lacing. Aroma of bananas and spices, slightly sweet. Taste is malty sweet with bananas, bread, cloves, dark fruit, caramel, a faint hint of rum. Mouthfeel is full, ultra-smooth and a real pleasure to sip. Basically imagine a dunkles Hefeweizen with all flavours and aromas turned up to 11. Impressive and imposing complex beer and yet so easily drinkable. Contender for one of the best beers brewed in Germany.

Bottle - Pours a hazy brown with a nice foamy head. Nose is spicy, yeasty, and sweet. Tastes very smooth - surprising for how spicy it smelled. Was expecting a bite for sure. The wheat and malty flavors dance together in perfect concert and finish nice and smooth. Medium-bodied with nice carbonation. This beer seems so simple but is obviously finely crafted. Awesome. I could drink a lot of these.

Pours a rich tea color with a significant head.  Very complex nose. Im picking up lots of banana with cloves. Some sweet chocolate aromas are coming through too. Very sweet flavor. Great mouthfeel. Almost a belgian amount of carbonation but has a nice rounded wheat subtlety to it. Very carmel flavor with a nice fruit blend backtone. You really have to let the beer sit in your mouth to get all the flavors out and there is plenty going on. A very interesting and unique beer.

Really dark with a very German head. Sweet wheaty smells with odours of banana and light caramels. In the mouth we have a small amount of bitterness that dries the mouth in the finish. Also making an appearance are slightly burnt toffee flavours with confectioners banana making an appearance again. Possibly a little orange to it also. 
Big and lively in the mouth texture-wise. Its a great beer. It has a real depth that one doesnt find too often in a Weizen of any style.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2016 (Bottled) A classic high boost wheat  beer;  So much going on with mad complexity but its united and harmonious .   Burnt purple colour with an intense beige head ; The nose is black banana , perfume , pie crust , cloves covered in booze - dark chocolate expressions ; Holy shit that is an almost perfect smell .   It drinks grate , really refreshing for a robust wheat beer -everything mentioned in the aroma is showcased on the palate , long dryish finish .  I love this beer .

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2010 It was interesting. I had never had a wheat/doppel mixture. It turned it into a dark wheat beer which I was on the fence about.3.6
RE-RATE 6/29/10 thanks to Mike at the Ginger Man for this one. Dark murky color with heavy red colors. Floral notes with crayola and Belgian yeast. Taste is red fruit with yeast and light bread. Easy finish. A little better than I remember but for much different reasons.

A- Huge fluffy off white head with some larger bubbles within that break making a rugged texture as the head drops. Great head retention but minimal lacing.

S- Lots of nice spicy and sweet aromas in the nose. Caramel and honey blend together in the to make nice sweet aromas along side some dark fruits and herbal spice. Some earthy aromas come through as well, hints of hay and grass, with a nice floral hop presence.

T- Lots of dark juicy fruit hits the tough, raisins apricot and plums. So sweet roasted almonds and nice caramel flavors blend nicely with the fruit flavors. The yeast adds a nice spicy herbal taste that brings out great character. Lets not forget the hops, Bring some nice bite to the palate and balance the flavors out with a nice citrus and pine bitter.

M- Very soft and silky medium bodied beer, great balance and good carbonation, I am not sure I could ask for more out of the mouth feel.

Overall this is a great beer, I love this stile, it is very soft but yet very complex. Great malt and hop character and the wheat does wonders. All the ingredients play well together in this brew.
bottle, pours dark brown with a tall tan head.  Raisin and brown sugar nose.  Slight sour malt backbone accented in a lingering spice finish.

Not too bad.  This has a nice thick head to it.  Color is a light brown/ dark gold color.  This has a mild malty aroma.  Taste is full of a sweeter malt flavor.  For 8.2% abv, this might be one of the smoother brews Ive had the pleasure of tasting.  Aftertaste has a very slight but pleasantly bite.

500ml bottle. Maple syrup-like color with a huge, rapidly dissipating, tan head. Aroma of sweet malts with banana, dark fruit, and cloves. The flavor adds a bit of spice and bitterness. Nice warming alcohol with a delicate carbonated mouthfeel. Aftertaste is fruity and slightly sour.

Poured cloudy dark amber with ruby hue.  Great beige head.  Aroma was typical banana with some malt.  Flavor was great, malty, banana-wheat.  Somewhat sweet, nice alcohol bite in the finish.  This beer took me by suprise, overall amazing, I love it and cant wait for my next bottle.

1/21/09 From the bottle. Aroma is rich dark fruit forward with light alcohol and a clovey background. Appearance is hazy tan with a well maintained cream colored head. Flavor is tart, candilike and rich with low alcohol. Mouthfeel is creamy, medium bodied, with a very low carb texture. Overall, very yummy and rich.

Whats left to say about this beer? Its a world classic and one of my faves, starting with the pour: a towering white head over a richly-coloured mahogany body. Before the first sip, I drink in a complex aroma that includes the standard banana-clove trait, but also dried fruits, grain and a slight nuttiness. The smells carry over into the taste, but make up only a part of it: add big dark malt flavour, nutmeg, plums and a sweet finish. Theres a slight alcoholic burn, but its subtle considering the actual alcohol content. Full-bodied, smooth and a pleasure to drink from beginning to end.

fantastic alcoholic, malty and yeasty, like mischung of cbock and kristal weizen, darkred-brown body, fantastic firm head, It is a very important beer as i drank It with my newly married wife in Vienna in a small cafe during our honeymoon trip, I love its complexity and palate, 1 bottle is too little to enjoy it fully, I will one buy more of them and get drunk halfdead - this will be sublime
Pours an appealing tan with an off-white, foamy head. Tastes like a much darker beer. Taste is sweet with noticeable hints of fruits and sugars. Very enjoyable beer.
Great German beer, very malty taste. Has hints of plum raisin and has a very mild aftertaste. Very tasty beer well worth trying

This is the king of wheat double bocks.  I call this my "nap" beer.  I have one of these and it is a best nap ever.  The sweet yeast and mellow aroma are perfect with the 8.2 ABV.  The fruits and tartness are perfect.  Try this and youll be hooked!

Like the last guy said theres not much to this beers aroma. The magics in the taste. Theres chocolate, bananas, bread dough, grapes, miscellaneous fruits and strains of coffees; just great, one of a kind, hard to describe without experiencing it. The best way I know to rate beer is by comparison to other beers of the same style. However, theres no comparing  Aventinus to any of its brethren. Ive had the dunkel wheat Franziskaner and Hacker Pschorr but they dont seem to be playing the same game as Aventinus. World class!

My favorite of the wheat bocks.  First thing I noticed was the incredibly thick, long lasting head.  A not particularly enticing aroma, but the feel in the mouth was very full and rich.  The a.b.v. was apparent, though well balanced and not overpowering.
bottle, pours cherry-brown. Medium white head, lots of carbonation. Strong yeast aroma. Long finish, nice hints of alcohol. Fell carbonation on the palate. Awesome beer, well balanced. Rating no 16

Bottle into stine, pour is definetely more murky brown than "dark ruby", big foamy off-white head.  Smell spice, wheat, yeast, alcohol.  Taste is sweet, sugar, some fruit, dried prunes, figs, cherries, sour finish without much alcohol, and a lot of carbonation.  Not as interesting or complex as Id expected, decent enough but not remarkable in my opinion.

16.9 oz. bottle.

Pours reddish-brown with a good amount of off-white head.  Fruity aroma that includes apples, cherries, bananas, and raisins.  Flavor is slightly sweet with malts, bananas, raisins, and alcohol.  Smooth and nice palate.
Brown body with large bulging head. Fruity and spicy nose. Taste of bananas and raisins comes through. Also malts. Quite sweet. Bitterness in the finish.

This brown beer has an orangey glow and orange peel and cloves in the flavour, which is dominated by raisins, currants, and other dark, dried fruits. There is very little bitterness in the finish; most of the flavours are at the front of sides of the tongue.
Tap @ BQ. Cloudy brown body, with typical weizen head. Esters (banana), clove and yeast. Full-bodied. Well hidden ABV. A classic.
sweet cherry and marshmallow nose. cherry stays in the the taste, add banana and raisin. very sweet, port like.  strong, but juice like. not crazy about it.

16.9oz bottle from Trinity Liquors. $3.00 a bottle! What a great bargain. Aroma is really nice cherries, bananas, apples, malt, and a really nice toasted marshmallow smell! Pours a cloudy raw honey color, thin off-white head and tons of carbonation. Flavor is very nice malts, cherries, and some alcohol. Great mouthfeel...very nice warming feeling and the carbonation literally clears your sinuses! Overall...im really impressed...This is a great beer...very different and would be the ultimate to drink around a campfire...

I typically suggest this stuff at Toronado to beer noobs who arent ready for the double IPAs or imperial stouts, but hey, I dont mind drinking this myself.  In fact, I love it.  Pours a cloudy dark brown with a big white head.  Aroma is banana and other fruits, caramel, and yeast.  Flavor is sweet caramel malt, bananas foster, clove, raisin, and mild alcohol.  Smooth yet lively on the palate.
Wow, buy this beer now! So good, cloudy brown body, enormous white head, apple cider flavor, bright fruit, alcohol amazingly well hidden, this beer is so good

Aroma was suggestive of cherries and some light spiciness. Very little head, but brownish appearance, with ever present carbonation. Flavor was once again full of cherries, apples and some malt. Palate was fairly lively. I liked it.
Deep amber brown with a large off-white head. Aroma is of clove, prunes, raisins, date, caramel and yeast. Flavor is of toast, sweet malt, dried fruits, figs and caramel.
UPDATED: MAR 26, 2013 Bottle. This is one of my favorite beers. Itâs beautiful in appearance, aroma and flavor. Big banana and a light caramel chewiness.

Pours with a three-finger light tan head that fades quickly leaving no lace.  Almost cloudy dark amber color, ton of yeast in bottom of bottle.  Medium carbonation and medium bodied.  Caramel nose.  Flavor is sweet yeasty caramel, clean finish.  Cellars well, brewed 2004. $6.75 for a 500ml bottle from a Tullys Beer & Wine Wells, ME.

Gift from donfardz64.
Pours a dark brown/amber hue, nice and cloudy.
Complex aroma of wheat, caramelised banana and sweet malt. Dates and hints of toffee. A Strong, milk chocolate aroma engulfs the nose each time you go for a sip.
A beautiful, balanced sweetness and rich, rich flavours. These rich and complex flavours begin with spice that, along with the carbonation and alcohol, warm the palate nicely.
Through the spice (such as clove, cinnamon and allspice) comes immense toffee malt flavours, along with milk chocolate dancing with caramelised banana.
Wheat and bubblegum and mild bitter hops are present.
The alcohol is only moderately present, and seems to fix the flavours onto the palate.
Has a creamy, smooth mouthfeel thats perfectly suited to the flavours, and has a great, long lasting finish of toasted malt. Gorgeous!

Bottle (2004).  Pours a clear, beautiful ruby, thick head from the medium to high carbonation.  Aroma is fruity and hints of clove.  Flavor is fruity, hints of vanilla and clove, mild spices (maybe some pepper).  Very smooth.  Alcohol gives a nice subtle warming sensation.  This is an excellent beer.

Bouteille de 500 ml. Dégusté avec french tickler et Agaguk. Biere de couleur brune brumeuse avec un mince collet non collant. Odeur de sucre, pommes, clou de girofle, pelure de bananes et citron. Gout salé, sucre à glacé, épices et un semblant de gomme baloune et crémeuse.
The beer had a little to much fruit for me. Has a orange pour little noticeable nose. Raisin to the taste.

Bottle sample courtesy of Shawn.  Pours a hazy orange brown with good off-white head.  Nose is lightly spiced wheat and rum fruits. Tastes of raisin and wheat and alcohol on the finish.  Pleasant alcohol warming effect.
Bottle. with Butters.  Pours an off-white head with a burnt amber body.  Smeels of wheat, alcohol, and spice.  Tastes of wheat, banana, caramel, and alcohol.  Pretty good finish on it as well.

Deep amber brown, spices and fruit in the nose.  Tons of flavor...clove, slight banana, faint hint of chocolate.  To me, a very sweet taste overall.  Nice zing from the carbonation with an almost buttery mouth feel. Very good.

Comes out of the tap an opaque chocolate brown with a fine bubbled pale tan head. Very appetizing malty and chocolaty aroma is slightly sweet. Rich, malty, smoky flavor has chocolate undertone and nutty and molasses hints, and just a whisper of sweetness. Texture is smooth and tingly, giving a pleasing finish.
Immense variety of flavors from the first drink to the last; the dark color is particularly appealing and a bit misleading, as the beer is smooth throughout.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2009 Dégusté dans un verre tulippe pour en voir les subtilités olfactives. Couleurs ambré brun foncé au reflet orangé cuivré.Elle présente une bonne mousse et est dapparence épaise avec peu de carbonation.Une odeur de clou de giroffe, de levure, de date et de banane. Un goût complexe de fruit sec, de banane, de sucre brun et de caramel.Il y a de tout:du salé, du sucré, des épices et de lalcool. Une bières de dessert ou de complémentarité culinaire avec goût pour ceux qui ont du goût.
Aroma de fermento e banana. Coloração caramelo, densa. Espuma cremosa e duradoura. Sabor acentuado, também com toques de frutas e paladar com discreto amargor residual. Excelente carbonatação.
Drank this with fellow taster oldrtybastrd from this site.  Pours a nice brown with aroma of banana and fruit.  This has a clove taste with a bitterness on the end.

Pours milky and slightly peach beer bottle brown with a tall chunky and foamy light tan head. Aroma is like a super hefe, lemon, overipe banana, clove, banana-nut bread, nutty, berrry, and woody notes, a decently noticeable but not too strong overtone of clove. Flavor, is full of wheat, maybe too much. Yeasty wheat bread rolls, huge cloves, a little bananna, walnut skin, honeycomb, lots of spicy yeasty and fruity clove covered bread rolls. For christssake this thing is like a hefe on super steroids. Nice and wheaty and full of fruity and peppery esters. Good stuff.
Has a mysterious kick... probably something in there they’ll make illegal someday. Stock up! ;)

Ruby with swirls of brown and garnet in color.  Cloudy throughout.  The head rose quickly but did not last long with this guy.  Sweetness, vanilla, caramel start this one out as it moves to a sour finish.
