Bought on a whim after I heard the clerk tell another patron he thought it was the best beer in the world.  As stated, pours murky, and finishes smoother than some other wheat beers I have had lately.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2010 500 ml bottle. Finland.
Dark murky brown with nice beige head.
Very appealing full fruity wheat aroma.
Weizen flavour with very nice warming finishing. Excellent! Wanna drink again!

500 ml bottle. As Schneider Weisse - Tap 6 - Unser Aventinus. From Germany.
Dark brown colour with small to average tan head.
Aroma is fruit, banana, wheat, caramel, malt and notes of hops.
Flavour is quite hopped, fruity, banana, malty and caramel and notes of warming alcohol. Rich and full palate.
citrus, floral, alcohol, caramel, hazy, brown foam, browno color,rocky head, light sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, long finish, lively, slick feel, good christmas weizen
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text:
2005 bottle courtesy of Tony at OTH.
Pours amber with tan head.
Aroma of wheat, dark fruits - fig and prunes -, malts.
Taste, close to the same as aroma, plenty of dark fruits, thick grainy mouthfeel with presence of wheat, caramel malts. Lots of sweetness. Gains a lot of flavor as it warms up.

500 ml bottle, a bit of a gusher!  Poured a murky, ruddy brown with a quickly fading, bubbly head.  Definitely a lot going on in the aroma, which is full of spicy clove, dark fruit and caramel sweetness.  Flavor highlights the dark fruits and finishes with a touch of sourness.  Any heaviness in the body is balanced by the bouncy bubbliness. Bravo to this lovely beer, and this from someone who normally avoids all brews Teutonic.

Poured from a 500mL bottle into a pint glass.

Pours a hazy brownish amber with a fluffy white head that dissipates to a ring but with tons of carbonation drifting up from the bottom.

Aroma is very complex and sweet. There is the sweet banana sweetness of the wheat in addition to caramel malts and dark fruits and even some spices.

The taste is an even bigger version of the aroma with the caramel malts really melding well with the sweetness of the wheat - cloves and bananas especially. The alcohol burn comes through slightly in the finish.

The mouthfeel is medium bodied with good carbonation and sticky sweet.

This is the best weizenbock Ive ever had and one of the best German beers Ive tasted. Highly recommended!

Tan-red with a near paper-white head. Nose is banana, peach, bubble gum.. very refreshing and slightly sweet, yet also a yeast, spice, and alcohol. Flavor has wheat and caramel, significant spice. Robust body yet somewhat dry, I really like the long finish of chocolate, spice, and banana. Good stuff.

Dark amber pour...small white head.  Just like the commercial description suggests, there seems to be massive amounts of clove in the nose on this, other notes of fresh mint, caramel and a back end of the malted wheat are very much noticeable.  Lively body, great carbonation.  Flavor is mainly mint, clove, some light fruit and a beautiful yet subtle sour wheat finish.  Very good stuff.

Pours a muddy brown with a huge tan head with great lacing and retention. Aromas of cloves, yeast, black cherries, milk chocolate, and other complexities. Taste is equally complex. Dark fruits, yeast, chocolate among other things. Amazing.

50cl bottle into weizen glass. Hazy amber tan beer with an ample dense off white head. Aromas of wheat caramel yeasts and cherries rather like a Ribena. Rich chewy mouthfeel with flavours of cherries, yeasts and mocha but it is not too sweet.. Goes down very easily considering its richness and ABV.

bottle. Hazy deep amber-brown colour, large beige head. Very aromatic. Full-bodied, sweet and malty background with flavours of prunes, raisins, caramel, chocolate. Pleasantly yeasty and wheaty in the background. Delicious!
Dark red/ brown, fully beige head, full flavor balance, nuts, oil, bits of roasted parts,  very nice complex one.

Poured from a bottle into an English pint glass (shocking I know), so did not get much head. The aroma had strong citrus characters, as well as a prominent caramel sweetness. An incredibly smooth beer, beuatiful mix between the fruity citrus, malt and slight chocolatey flavour. A very strog coffee taste throughout which creates a welcome bitterness. Perhaps a little more caramel would balance the flavour more, but a beautiful beer none the less.

Bottle pours a two-inch tannish head that lasts a good few minutes.  No lacing.  Color is a translucent dark caramel.  Spicy aroma.  Taste is sweet, smooth, bready. nice mouthfeel, a little tart at the end.  Great beer.

Appereance is murky brown almost like sewer water.  I know that sounds bad but its the best describer for what this beer  looks like.  Aroma is caramel, wheat and yeast overall it has a sweet aroma.  Flavor is wheaty up front with a complex tart to sweetness in the finish.  Carbonation is great, noticible in the finish.  Smooth beer that finished slightly sweet and clean.  Outstanding.

Bottle, shared with my buddy Nick.  Cloudy, rusty brown with a short head.  Complex Nose of belgian yeast and molasses, slight breadiness, a little bit of sweet brandy,  slight sourness.  Apple Pie.  MAYBE a little over-ripe banana.   Strong black cherry flavor.  Slightly thin, well carbonated.   More black cherry in the aftertaste, some sourness, crisp.  Pretty good beer would drink again.

Crushed with Jakebra.  Smells like a cross between a quad and an imperial weizen.  Complex as shit.  Oh and tastes awesome.  About as wheaty as a beer can get, but a nice complement of dark fruits makes this one excellent brew.

Smells slightly metallic and slightly sweet smell as it warms.  smooth, sweet, slightly milky taste that is very rich.  A nice balance of wheat and fruitiness with darker ans sweeter flavors as it warms.  A very nice beer.  I only wish it were lower in alcohol so I could drink more!

bottle picked up at metzlers in denton, tx.  poured a cloudy brown with an off white head.  aroma of caramel, floral notes, spices, and fruits.  flavor had some caramel, dry spice, and alcohol.  overall i was not real impressed, maybe it was past its prime.  will have to try again.
Bottle. aroma of spice, yeast and fruit. Flavor was sweet and mild and malty and just damn good! lol A nice smooth drinker this one is and will be having this again.

Shared this one w/ SkyCop32.  Picked up at Maruhn Getränke in Darmstadt, also picked up the authentic glassware pictured to the left.  Pours a crisp cola brown color.  Aromas of clove, banana, fruit, and alcohol.  Flavor is alcoholic clove and spice with a bittersweet finish.  Good beer!

bottle.  Pours a dark cola color with a large off-white head.  Nose is of spices, bread and banana.  Taste is nutty malt, bread and dark fruit.  Complex brew.  Mouthfeel is medium and carbonated.  Very nice.

Poured from bottle a hazy brownish-copper with a large light-tan head.  The aroma is fantastic with sweet and spicy notes of clove, rising dough, yeast, and a touch of banana.  Flavor is heavy with spicy clove, caramel, yeast, bread, orange rind, a mild touch of sweet banana and honey.  The palate runs from sweet to tart with a good carbonation tang that keeps the sweet  notes from over-powering the brew.  I can’t say enough how much I liked this beer.  It was fantastic.  If you like weizen beers this is one not to be missed.  How did it take me so long to try this one?

My favorite german beer without a doubt.  I prefer American Wheat to German Hefe & Weisse beers...but I absolutely love this beer.  I have yet to have a Weizen Bock that is better.   You will love the mixture of wheat and caramel/scotch malt flavors mixed with chocolatey prune boldness.  Just amazing...try one today!

This poured a murky copper to brown in color with a moderate extremely bubbly head that dissipated quickly.  The nose is semi-sweet and filled with banana, wheat, malt and chocolate with a touch of raisin and spice.  In the mouth it was medium-bodied, rich and concentrated showing the sweetness from the mouth.  This had great balance with fresh carbontaion and a lingering finish.  There is nothing out of place in this one it is just enjoyable from beginning to end.
Bottle, 500 ml. R$ 6.00 (US$ 2.70) in Bompreço Iguatemi, Salvador, Brazil. Very nice beer.

On tap at the flying saucer in KC. Pours a reddish brown with a big off-white head. Remains slightly lacy with an everpresent swirl on the surface. The aroma is a sweet wheat with a definitive german malt backing. Rich banana and even a hint of milk chocolate. Flavor is sweet with a slight yeasty and sourness to it. Acidic fruits and some toffee mixed with lurking spices. Medium bodied and smooth with a slightly carbonated and dryer finish leaving only a drop of bitterness. Overall, a nice beer representing a style I’m pretty unfamiliar with. Glad to have tried.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2009 sorry but this is just the best beer on the planet i keep coming back to this again and again lovely
Pours a nice cloudy brown with a good two finger head.
Smells of yeast and cloves  
Tastes of banana and cloves nice warm felling
A great beer on my short list for sure
Loved it!! Banana is very stong in the nose.  Nice sweet malt character.  Loved the color nice redish dark brown.  Flavor was chewey, plums, raisins, other dark fruit.

Aroma of banana and clove, Pours a clear light brown color with a pillowy head that sticks around for a bit. Taste is a bit thin and has a some sourness to it that I’m just not a fan of. I wish it had more mouthfeel to it, and maybe a bit more sweetness. I wanted to like this but it just wouldn’t grow on me. Tastes like a hefe-weizen with a pumped up alcohol level and a bit of dark malts for color. Nothing special IMO.

Consistent liquid with a cloudy-opalescent brown body and a nice creamy tan head. Fruity and roasted, caramel, yeastly and banana aromas  are opened slowly. Complex body whit creamy caramel, banana and spices(clove and nutmeg). Roasted taste on the finish comes with some coffee and dark chocolate aftertaste. Well hidden alcohol. Nice beer!

Pours a dark brown-red. Aroma of banana-nut bread. Flavor has notes of malt, clove, caramel, banana and a hint of coffee. Surprisingly smooth for such a complex flavor. Abrupt, nutty and citric finish. Great beer at a good price.
Brown, red colored brew. Wheat, yeasty, fruity aroma. Flavor is wheaty, yeasty and some dark fruits. Chocolate, caramel malty goodness. Nice.

Arômes de levure épicée et de pruneaux. Robe rousse foncée, belle mousse et belle effervescence naturelle. Moyennement ronde en bouche, la levure épicée accompagne un malt aux touches de caramel et de chocolat. On retrouve également une légère acidité rappelant la présence de blé. L’alcool est relativement apparent.
Pours a brownish red color with a tan head.The nose is of dark fruits with some sweet maltiness.A big mouthfeel of the dark fruits.Sweet with some breadiness.It finished of with a nice belly warming.

[Bottle] Pours a clearish ruby/caramel brown with a smallish beige head. Aroma has a whole lot of wheat malt, banana, yeasty aromas, a touch of alcohol, and quite a bit of clove. Flavor is malty and a bit sweet, but is balanced by the tart, citric wheat. Theres a bit of caramel in there, It changes greatly as it warms, a hint of vanilla and more dark fruits come through, and the beer smooths out incredibly.

Cloves and pepper with a slight amount of bannana on the nose. Taste was one of raisons and a slight choc/toffee flavour, this kept developing as the beers temperature changed until fruity bannana became evident in the taste as well as aroma.
Pretty awesome beer.  Pours dark dark red, off white head.  Nice and wheaty and sweet. Lots of clove  and fruit iin the nose and throughout the palate.  Great fall beer.

This deep rusty russet beer poured with a creamy thick head, the sediment gets stuck in the head leaving little dusty dots all over the top, reminding me of a cappucino. Spices on the nose of cloves, with cinnamon and vanilla. The taste of fruitcake (orange peel, sultanas and treacle)  and toffee lollipops, but with a alcohol warmth you won’t find at the lolly shop. Comfortable in your hand. Will this beer improve if cellared?
Bottle. Dark ruby colour with a nice off-white head. Aroma of banana and malt. The flavour is sweet, fruity, malt and wheat. Medium to full-bodied. Very nice weizenbock.

Very well done.  Rich malty aroma. Lots of wheat and yeast in the flavor, with clove and banana and raisin, and a creamy body.  The sweetness becomes a little too much as it goes on, but this is a good beer.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2008 [500ml bottle at the Royal Standard of England, Beaconsfield] Gorgeous branded glass with this one. Chestnut black with a large beige head.  Some carbonation - I would prefer a little less, but its in no way excessive. Tatses of raisins, prunes, figs, treacle, cloves, orange, plums and all things Christmassy (um... apart from turkey...).  Like Christmas pudding in a glass - you could imagine using this as a sauce to go on your desert.  Despite the sweet, rich flavours and the high ABV, this beer surprisingly does not leave a sticky mouthfeel - although I swear I could still taste .  Very very good indeed as a winter dessert beer - although not something Id particularly want on a summer afternoon! Very impressive stuff! c9

Raisins, prunes, and apple in the aroma.  Small off-white fully diminishing head.  Small floating particles.  Dark clear amber color.  Moderately sweet initial flavor.  Medium bodied and a lightly astringent finish.
Great beer.
Pours a very dark purple with a thick head. Smells of grapes and spices. Tastes of raisins, spices and a pleasnat bitterness at the finish. Really good, complex beer.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2008 Pours a dark amber color.  Fizzy off white head that quickly diminishes.  Sweet spica Aroma.  Excellent mouth feel on this beer.  Very smooth.  Fairly sweet through out wth a lightlly astringent finish.  Lively carbonation.

Bottle, Pours a cloudy brown with a large lasting head. Aroma of cloves,chocolate and slight phenolics.
Flavour is a very good balance of chocolate,caramel.
Overall a very good beer, the 8 % alcohol is well hidden and the wheat sourness balances the chocolate body.
Very well made.
Bottle. This is a great beer with a perfect hint of caramel and sweetness, and good alcohol notes near the end. One of my favorites upon arriving home from work.

Bottled. Porus hazy amber to brown. The large head really looks nice: smooth and creamy. The aroma is full of malty sweetness, earthy yeast and lots of dark and sweet fruits like dates or raisins. Banana esther is luckily not that overly presented. Delicate spiciness especially int he finish with clear cloves aroma and less obvious peppery tones. Alcohol is barely noticeable in taste but it warms up nicely. Tha flavor is  sweetish wheat-malty and with brown sugar or syrup. More sour towards the finish due to yeast and fermented fruits. There´s also light bitteration in the finish. Palate is full bodied and amazingly soft. Carbonation is just perfect: it´s enough  to give some spine without being fizzy at all. Leaves sticky syrupy feeling on your lips. You can easily tell by palate that this is a strong beer but still... 8,2 ABV?! Amazing. Aventinus really is a magnificent combination of complexity and supreme drinkability.

Really liked this one.  Very cloudy amber pour.  The cloves are really present in the smell.  Nice carbonation.  Wheat and carmel tastes are great, and the cloves and fruits shine through too.  Really like this guy.
Getting notebook online. Bottle. A quality beer with good caramel tones. Cloves come through nicely as well. Good drink but a bit overrated.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2008 this is velvety smooth with a fine dark colour and a sweet enchanting aroma.  the flavour is sweet with a hint of cloves in a sort of xmas pudding without the stodge way.  nice sour notes to the finish.  unbelievable beer!
I tried this several times and just realized I haven’t rated it!  One of my favorite bocks.  Chocolate and caramel are evident--full bodied, yet smooth.  One of my favorites.

Bottle into Weizen glass. Pours straight up hazy brown, big foamy off-white head. Nose is brown sugar, banana and cloves. Variation from a standard hefe nose, but only because of the brown sugar. Taste is sweet - caramelized brown sugar, banana and cloves, hints of dark fruit without really asserting, crisp and fairly light. Noticeable alcohol, especially towards the finish. Mouthfeel is crisp, light, fairly standard hefe, with a bit of dryness from the alcohol. really interesting beer.
Bottle, thanks ekstedt. Brown with white head. Banana, raisin and alcohol to the nose. Sweetish taste with some acidity. Dry mouthfeel.

(Bottle).  Very fruity, sweet aroma.  Beautiful dark red brown with a huge head.  Taste is sweet plum and other fruits, extremely powerful flavor profile, and the alcohol is not intrusive.  A bit too sweet for me, but I can easily see why it’s so highly regarded.
Bottle.  Just a darn fine beer with fruity sweetness, and good alcohol notes near the end.  One of my favorites when dining at the local German place in Plano Texas.

Pours hazy orange/brown, off white head. Aroma is very nice, sweet bananas and chocolate with malt and caramel. Some fruitiness also. A very drinkable beer for 8.2%, barely taste the alcohol at then end. Sweet flavour of caramel and banana, some nice roasted malt, slight bitterness at the end. Enough dryness in finishing to make you want another sip but still pleasant. Very good.
Hazy amber with medium beige head. Sweet aroma with ripe fruits, roasted malt, wheat and caramel hotes. Sweet flavor with roasted malt, wheat, yeasty and banana notes. Ends sweet.
Bottle. Not my type of beer, far too shallow and piquant. Decent enough on the nose, amost exotic. Very insubstantial on the palate, with unsatisfying mouthfeel. Overall not something I’ll repeat.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2008 Hazy, dirty orange-brown color with cloudy, beige head. Sweet malty aroma is banana-like and a bit caramely. Sweet and sour flavor is malty, spicy, citric, yeasty and alcoholic. Quite full-bodied and foamy carbonated palate. Reminds me of some belgian strong ales, especially aftertaste.

From bottle.  Pours deep cloudy amber-brown with a generous tan head.  Classic German weizen aroma.  Sweet start on the palate but finishes slightly sour.  Very complex.  Deceptively smooth - no hint of 8+% alcohol.  No chocolate flavors because I drink it too quickly.

Creamy top on a hazy maroon bottom.  Jammy, strong cloves and banana with smoky wisps of chocolate and spicy fruit cake.  Piqaunt, racing carbonation, plumy sweetness and acidity into a drying alcohol finish.  Fluffy, slick and full.

Delicious, strong and spicy; a different beast when young!

50 cl bottle, best before 25 June 2009.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2008 smells incredible.  Yeasty, a little musty, some alcohol, comes together somehow sweet and makes me want to sniff it instead of drink it.    nice big white bubbly head on top of a murky brown body.  Robust flavor with banana notes, hefe flavors, semi sweet caramel along with a nice dark malt presence and quite a bit of alcohol.  warming as it goes down but the alcohol flavor isnt obtrusive at all, even though its very noticeable.  it fits in with the other flavors.  chocolate flavor is very subdued but its there if you let it warm up.  this is rated highly for a reason, and at $3.99 a bottle its a no brainer.  i’m not the biggest wheat/hefe fan but if you are this is going to knock your head off.

One of my favorites.  Pours a dark redish hue with a considerable tan head.  Aroma of wheat, malt, and citrus, very nice.   Can taste wheat, spice, and dark cherry.  Mouthfeel is perfect, not to thin but easy to drink.  Strong beer, it sneaks up on you, its easy to forget that it is 8.2 because it tastes so smooth.  One of the best out there.
great  beer. Good aroma of fruit, head dissipated quickly. great mouthfeel and flavor with tastes of cherry and spices balancing nicely. all around excellent beer.

A Magnificent beer. Dark brown with a nice fluffy off white head.  Banana/plum and spice aroma.  The Alcohol radiates off the palate.  Full bodied but not filling.  One of the best Weizen Bocks I’ve ever had.

Aroma: Caramel, banana, cherry. Some brown sugar, clove. Appearance: Beautiful large creamy head. Off-white. Head lasts forever. Murky purplish beer. Superb wheat taste, moderately sweet, some plum, cherry. Super thick body, soft carbonation. Superb example of a weizen bock.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2009 Possibly my favorite ever.  Poured into a Celebrator glass.  Poured a hazy brown color (really did look like crap) with a huge and sustaining tan head.  Aroma was of bananas and cloves with some wheat.  Cloves dominated the aroma.  Flavor was caramel and bananas with a decidedly sour flavor at the end.  Body was full with high carbonation.  I think I may have discovered my favorite beer.  Love this beer.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2008 Pours deep amber-brown with copious off-white head that really sticks around.  Really unique aroma of spicy bananas.  Creamy mouthfeel with a nice, clean, balanced taste with hints of fruit and chocolate.  Leaves a pleasantly bitter lingering sensation.

The colour of this Weizenstarkbier, Dunkle, is bloody weird, a mix between a real shitty sewage water with a vaguely green tint to it, like the mud banks of the River Avon! It is the colour that really put me off before I tried. It is a dopplebock, twice brewed to make it stronger. I didnt read the label and was taken back by the strength. It is a flavoursome brew which has a complex spicy chocolate-like aroma with a hint of banana and raisins. On the palate, you experience a soft touch and on the tongue it is very rich, though fresh with a hint of caramel. It finishes in a rich soft and lightly bitter impression.
Brown cloudy colored with a good sized beige head.  Smell is fruity, sweet, grapefuit, spice, and banana.  taste is fruit, caramel, spice, wheat.  good overall.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2009 (bottle) beautifully murky dark mahogany colour with a huge off-white head. aroma is dominated by gorgeous banana esters, with notes of vanilla, sweet spices and faint alcohol. flavour has all the sensations from the aroma along with caramel, chocolate and roasted components. alcohol is not detectable, but the finish is warming. strong, full body, mild carbonation - very mellow. a superb brew.

The aroma was like some exotic over ripe fruit fermenting on the damp ground in a dark forest.  The flavor added a sour malt/sour mash liquor flavor.  Very luxorius feel in the mouth.  Definitely a beer to turn to in this category.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2008 Murky brown with big bubbly beige head that quickly thins. Love the thin lines of bubbles going up the glass. Strong yeasty banana aroma. Strong bubbly malty, dark fruit, banana, spicey, yeast taste.

Caramelly, coffeey, nutty, spicy in aroma...a nice dark brown with a red tint, just a little hazy, like an early morning before the dew has evaporated....just sweet enough for me, not too bitter, for I am a shrew that hath a bitter tongue already, with just a touch of sourness...very light bodied to me for a dark beer...smooth and slick like satin when it touches your lips and slips around your tongue and down your throat like angel’s tears...finishes clean and fresh, with nothing bad lingering...

My favorite thus far in my drinking career.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2009 pours an extremely dark brown with red tints, moderate head. Malt, plum, dark fruit, cinnamon, and raisin are all over the nose. Flavor is very similar, but extraordinarily good- the dark sweetness is phenomenal. Palate is ever so smooth. Very unique and delicious brew.

Pours dark ruby brown with one finger beige head. Aroma is a malt assault- chocolate and raisin, date and plum. Flavor had every malt facet covered- creamy, chocolate, and loads of dark fruit- without the roast. Palate is sticky and smooth. Wondrous.

Bottle. Rich gray head and a dark brown color. Aroma has earth, bananas and clover. Really nice thick flavor of banana and plums, also that nice bite from the actual alcohol. As it warms up also more of the pepper flavor finds its way out. Just excellent beer.
Cloying malt sweetness and too much alcohol.  Doesn’t even look good; ugly brown color. I can’t get into this one.

Bottle, Beer Ritz, Leeds. Poured a dark reddish brown with a big ol’ white head which lingered nicely. Aroma was clove, banana and yeast. Flavour was dark malt, chocolate, spice, plum.  Creamyish mouthfeel. Mild sweetness with some bitterness in the finish. Could well be one of the best tasting German beers I’ve had thus far, but can’t help thinking this is a tad over rated on here.

500ml bottle. Beautifully cloudy reddish brown with a nice fine head. Big aroma of wheat malt: bananas and cloves, with a touch of dark fruit. Big, complex malt flavor, with lots of everything: bananas, figs, cloves, and a touch of chocolate and caramel even. Just enough sour in the finish to keep it from going over the top. Great full body. This is the weizen bock that sets the standards. Was even better at the brewery on tap.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2009 ssa super conceituada Weizen Bock é, de longe a melhor dos produtos Schneider & Sons. Logo de cara, ao despeja-la no copo Weizen, já se nota que não é uma cerveja qualquer. A aparência inicial de sua espuma é grande, coloração marrom-claro e excelente formação de colarinho, este bem duradouro. Seu corpo é lodoso, com partículas de grossa densidade e tonalidade caramelo (4/5). O aroma é o clássico do estilo: banana, banana-passa e cravo; há, ainda, lufadas de baunilha (7/10). O sabor também está acima da média: o saboroso gole inicial é levemente doce e ácido, sensação que apresenta leve doçura e amargor no final, de duração média - do início ao fim percebe-se a presença de notas amadeiradas. O paladar apresenta como componentes um corpo médio, de textura cremosa, carbonatação bem gasosa e final levemente alcoólico (3/5).

Bottle. Gusher!! Popped the top on this one, turned my back for a split second to grab a glass and as I returned it was spewing out the top. Dark brown once I got it in the glass with a fizzy tan head that settled out quick. Dark fruits (raisin & prune) in the aroma with molasses and light alcohol also noted. As it warmed some spices and banana also came out in the aroma. Dark fruits and malts in the flavor. Also some clove and slight smoke in the flavor. Full body that is bitter in the beginning but ends sweet. Tingly carbonation and a slight warming feeling.

Bottle,Thanx to ekstedt. Copper red hazy colour, with a werry nice creamy white head. Aroma is malty,yeasty , fruity,some bananasweetnes is there too, and a touch of alcy in the end. Flavor has a nice malty,and creamy mouth feeling,with rasins in the end. full body, and a nice medium fruity finish. werry nice indeed!!
scent is of fermented fruit and carmel.  taste is of molasses and some alcohol.  there is some fermented fruit as well.  very nice beer.

Pour is dark golden/brown with a fizzy head.  Aroma is real fruity with a lot of yeast.  Flavors include more fruit, sweet wheat, more yeast, and finished with caramel malt.  Another damn good brew.  Would buy again.

500 ml bottle. Deep murky brown color, tan head. Yeasty aroma with lots of banana. More banana in the flavor, as well as wheat and notes of alcohol. High carbonation, full body. I may have to re-rate this later, because right now I don’t see the reason for its popularity.

500ml bottle in weizen. Large milky tan head lasting like frosting on a cake. Murky toffee colored body ... head just wont go away ...
Yeasty aroma with some nice toasted malt smells of molasses. Fruity notes hit immediately with a more robust sweetness taking over from there. Orange, currents, some others. Slightly bitter finish. A bit too sweet for my taste, but complex and beautiful.

No 505
Rated: 18.08.2008
Bottle brown, 500 ml
Appearance: Pours hazy fat brown, pastel in hue, gently carbonated body with ridiculously huge, off - white, brown, pillowy - frothy head, very vivid and form very regular near the beer base to rocky at the top. There is an impressive lacing, very compact firm head and well defined body colour, naturally brown.
Aroma: Very well pronounced, sweet and pleasant banana, intensive clove, rich in juicy sweetness of banana, coconut, gentle notes of milky chockolate, white chockolate, peanuts, gentle toastyness and notes of mature prune and plum spiced up with a kind of chalky harsh character. Despite its high alcoholic content it is perfectly hidden. Very complex with notes of vanilla and dunkel - roastyness. Notes of cherries, prune and resin.
Flavour: Nice full bodied flavour starting with mature oakyness, wood bark, very high bitterness for a weizen or a bock beer that binds your tongue at the very start, later this bitterness is covered with a gentle alcoholic warmth, later on the aftertaste becomes chalky and finally slighty accidic with gentle sweet accents of caramelly and prune. Impressively complex in flavours begining with banana - carrot - raspberry - clove oriented dimention to prune - plum - red grapes notes spiced up with a robust bitterness, gentle alcoholic dryness and crystalized honey accents. Nice aromatic complex nose. Really huge beer of 3 types of malt: wheat, Munich and seasonal combined with sophisticated yeast strains and hop types contributing to a perfume like nose.
Palate: Body is full, texture is moderately wattery, carbonation on palate is moderate, finish feel is complex, hifhly astringent, clean and intriguingly mineral.

Well, I guess you can take the boy out of America, but you can’t take the America out of the boy. My point being that I just plain am not impressed with this beer. I mean, it is a really good beer, from an obviously good brewer, it just doesn’t have the "wow" factor that I was hoping for. It pours a cloudy dark reddish brown, with huge dense head. aroma is sweet, as well as the flavor.

I first enjoyed G. Schneider & Sohn Aventinus beer at the Mainstreet Pub up in Melbourne, FL. it was love at first sip. I savored my Aventinus with much relish and pleasure while also nibbling on some delectable fresh almond brie, crackers, and grapes. It was beer meets food nirvana, and I almost didn’t come back. Thankfully it is now readily available to me here locally. Aventinus is a brew I must have on a regular basis, and I would also like to try aging one and giving it a tasting a year or two from now.

She pours from her bottle into my goblet a rich darkly moist earthen brown. A smooth fluffy head of foam forms at the top and slowly lingers into a soft cottony ring around the sides of my glass. In the nose I detect sweet whiffs of malt with a caramelized mix of prunes and other dark-pitted fruit. Essences of raisins and spices, cinnamon and nutmeg. The first quaff ~ heavenly. I am reminded again why I love this beer so much. Such delicate deep complexity in its palate. Despite looks, Aventinus has a rather light yet full body and mouthfeel with light effervescence which doesn’t weigh down the palate. Smooth, creamy and chewy, sweet caramel and prunes come to mind first. As the taste lingers on my buds, there is a pleasant dryness to the palate and pleasant warmth creeps up in the back of my throat, a testament to the high ABV of 8.2%. As I delve further into my Aventinus, small trails of Brussels lace take their time joining the rest of the brew in my glass. As she warms, I detect gentle flavors of prunes, raisins, and some nice nutmeg spice. From start to finish, Aventinus is a soft, delicate beer overflowing with a perfectly balanced blend of winter spice, warmth, rich and decadent prunes and raisins with malty notes. 

For whatever reason, I am reminded of Christmas and the holidays as I quaff my Aventinus. It could be the warmth of the beer, the soft yet full-bodied chewy mouthfeel which blends dark fruits and warm wintery spices such as cinnamon and nutmeg. Truly a beautiful beer, there is no other wheat dopplebock like Aventinus.
This cloudy dark bronze beauty is topped by a modest beige head and delivers with a full-bodied flavor with a slightly sweet caramel note.  This is a supremely well-balanced winner.
Draft at the Green Leafe.  Deep brown pour with an off white creamy head.  Caramel and chocolate in the taste.  Bit of smoke and slightly sour.

16.9 oz bottle. Spicy, wheaty aroma. Dark amber with a good bubbly head. Tastes of wheat, caramel, spices, and a light sour yeast. Great mouth feel with a slight creaminess and full bodied. A superb brew from a master brewery.

Deep brown pour with a big creamy tan head that lasted a while.  Sweet fruit and caramel malt in the aroma, along with yeast, grain and spice.  Very enjoyable flavor starting with the fruit and caramel and becoming richer throughout.  Creamy on the palate with a good spicy finish.  Seriously good!

Bottle. Hazy red brown with no head. Aroma of fruits and spice with a slightly sour (yeasty?) note. Medium body with plenty of carbonation, but fine effervescent carbonation. Complex flavour that evolves from a fruity start with banana and maybe a hint of citrus and apple with spices. It develops through a sweet toffee phase into a rich finish with chocolate, burnt toffee and cloves. A superb beer.

Pours a cola brown with a thick, rich foamy head. Great aroma of cloves, spices, and a slight hint of bananas. Nice clove taste and bubblegum..Someone was dead-on when they said they tasted Marmite in it. Spicey finish.

Unimpressed, fail to find the fascination (nifty alliteration or what?). Smells like sweet cigar butts steeped in root beer. Mouthfeel alot of effervescence but not the substance i like to see.... likely just the style and my own preference being mismatched here. Only drinking the rest of the case as it bought and paid for. Shall not be revisited.
Probably the best German beer i’ve ever drunk.Great aroma,impressive touch in the palate,sweet aftertaste.This is Weiss for sure!!!!

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2009 Poured a dark brown with a white head from the bottle at NYCs Loreley. Great wheat aroma with cloves, pepper, and bananas, not to mention plenty of malty sweet goodness from a bock. Raisins, fruit, and dark bread. What a wonderfully balanced beer. Excellent on its own. A new favorite.

Now this is what makes me understand why there is a different rating part for appereance of the beers. Looks absolutely great. Big wheaty aroma, full body, sweetish taste with a lot of things going on, banana and marmite and all kinds of things pop into my head when I taste this great beer.

...bottle from Cloudwine.  This stuff was very impressive.  On the nose, has raisins, grape, plum dark fruit like aroma, with hints of spicy clove.  Pours a dark browish red\purple, with an off white head that didn’t seem to last for me, but oh well.  On the tongue, it massages the taste-buds with a wheaty, slightly caramelitic, fruity goodness, with hints of clove in the finish.  Went down very well for such a high ABV, with almost no alcohol flavor. Not too heavy, with nice carbonation that distributes the many flavors. Very easy drinking, and I wish I had gotten two, or more.  I definitely want to find this on tap, but doubt I can here in Melbourne.  One of the best weizen bock’s I have had so far, and it seems hard to top.  A must try for Weizen fans.

500ml Bottle:  Aroma is slightly sweet.  Smells of spices, cloves, pepper, grains, yeast, and some raisins.  Poured brown in color with a large, fizzy, tan head that lasted throughout.  Cloudy. Flavor is medium sweet.  Tastes of raisin, cloves, pepper, spices, malts, and alcohol.  Medium body.  Sticky, tingly texture.  Lively carbonation.  Spiced, clove finish.  Over-carbonated.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2009 On tap @ Blågårds Apotek. Pours dark reddish brown with large solid head. Sweet aroma. Very good flavour with a full and smooth body.

Note 30/11/2009: Had it from bottle, very inferior with way too much carbonation compared to the tap version.

I tried this the other night at a local bar, I loved it so much I had to find it again. It has a very cloudy golden red tint to it. I tastes just like it smells, kinda fruity with a slight bitter finish to it.

Pours hazy brown/red with a dense white head.  Aroma is pure phenols...  lots of banana, christmas spices, and sweetness.  Flavors follow suit.  Strong banana flavor, with a huge clove kick as the beer warms.  Obviously a strong beer by the flavors, etc, but the alcohol is hidden.  No burn or flavor from the alcohol.  A true testament to what can be done just by fermentation.  Amazing that yeast can produce this many flavors.
I am sure this is a good beer for some people but not to my pallete.  It is likely the raison flavor that comes thru.  I did not care for this brew.

Maybe it was because I had this beer at Cafe Brucke in Milwaukee, where the owner is fastidious about presentation detail and the beer always seems super-fresh, but this tasted great to me.

It poured a dark but brilliant mahogany color into a weizen glass.  Lots of head with great staying power.  Aroma is clovey with a significant malt presence and quite pleasant.  Flavor is clovey, fruity, with some bock-like maltiness.  It is a substantial beer, but is not heavy and hides its ABV quite well.  Mouthfeel is light and crisp.  If youre looking for a 8.2% ABV that will go down great on a hot day, this is it.

Seriously, I dont know where Cafe Brucke gets their import beers, but they always look to be in mint condition.  If I bought this beer from Discount Liquor across town, it would be old, stale, and the bottle/label would be dust-covered and beat to hell.

I would highly recommend this beer.  A fine choice for a 700th rating.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2008 I m not gentle with my beers so after riddling my bottle to stir up the yeast I pour out this fine elixir into my Chimay glass. Cloudy brown but if you hold the beverage up to the lamp you can see a slight reddish hue. Bringing the glass to my nose Im first hit by the yeast which Im a big fan of, then a banana, raisin & plum with a sweet background the banana is not over powering like some Weiss beers. Bringing the glass to my lips the very smooth liquid coats my tongue. Full flavor plenty of backbone to stand up to the 8.2% alc./vol. overall a very good beer
A great dobblebock.  In fact this is the beer that my friend BeerFanDan got me into dobblebocks.

hazy brown with nice tan head.  flavor of crystal and chocolate malt with that classic fruity ester provided by the yeast.  a very enjoyable brew that has more complexities than any other weizen that I have had.  very good

Aventinus is a dim, cloudy brown ale with a foamy off-white head.  There are plums, raisins, cloves, apples and deep roasty malt in the aroma.  It has a smooth medium body with a slick, delicate finish.  It’s bubbly on the tongue.  The flavor fills my whole head!  It is deep, syrupy, resiny and wooden.  It’s a touch sweet, sour and bitter.  Is this a wheat beer from Germany or is it a Belgian Dark?  It is very complex and well blended.  There are notes of prunes, cloves, orange peel, coriander, maybe chocolate... it goes on.  What a treat!

Almost black with nice white longstanding head. Strong malty notes of overripe fruit, plums, spices, coriander and some cellar. Sweet flavour and long well balanced sweet finish with some nice well hidden alcohol.

Pours a murky purple/maroon color with a large tan foamy head that lasts.  Nose of yeast, cloves and blackberries.  Blackberry, raisins, clove in the taste and noticeable alcohol.  Bitter, tart, and alcohol finish.

Poured a cloudy, chocolatey brown with a small head, about one finger thick, that dissipated quickly.

The nose contains some yet unidentifiable spice notes with a hint of red grapes and toasted malt

Starts with a light, somewhat fruitiness and the feel is quite remarkable. Fuller than I expected with the carbonation lingering on the tongue for an extended period. 

The finish is much richer with toasted malt, spice and fruit notes.

I am not really familiar with Wiezenbock but I may have just had one of the best of the style I am likely to have. Try it if you get the chance.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2009 Bottle. Pours dark copper/red/brown with a fluffy beige head. Aroma is wonderful banana, clove, a bit of gumminess, wheat, and spicy notes. Flavor has the perfect banana/clove thing going on, with other assorted spices leading to a nice, somewhat fruity yet mildly bitter, finish. Mouthfeel is medium-full, yet prickly from the carbonation. This is a beer I always end up throwing in my cart while beer shopping.

500 mL bottle.  Pours slightly reddish brown with a large off-white head that dissipates into a small but stable head.  Aroma is dominated by yeasty banana and apple aromas, with some sweetness detectable.  Flavor is again yeasty banana and apple, with a nice smooth quality.  Also present are bubblegum sweetness, hints of caramel and dark fruits.  Not much in the way of lacing.  Other than that tiny nitpick, no flaws here.

50cl bottle.   Hazy deep brown with a big head that dies and leaves some thin foam.   Tried to go for the massive head in the pic, but apparently I wasn’t anal enough about cleaning my glass... oh well, it happens.   Aroma of caramelized bananas, like bananas fried until a dark brown color.   Add a little bubble-gum, nut liquer, and clove spice, and you have a pretty sweet aroma happening.   The flavor has a rich caramel quality, with bubble-gum sweetness, bread, and a hint of alcohol.   Banana and clove are their, but don’t manifest as assertively as in the aroma.   full bodied with the same effervescent carbonation that you would find in a regular hef.   Something about this just doesn’t quite work for me.   It’s OK, but more subtle bubbles would work better for me.   I like how smoothly the wheat character blends in with the rich caramel components.   Good stuff.

One of those beers I’ve had a ton of times but never got around to rating.  RUby/mahogany body, tons of visible carbonation, fluffy white head forms a bit of a crown in my schneider glass.  Nose is clove & banana, bubblegum, grapes, some spice I can’t determine, fruits.  Flavor is banana, toffee, yeast, nice malt, dark fruits, perfect bitterness.  Sweet yeasty clov finish w. fruit.  Stunning.

Plum colored dark pour with a big, stark white head that holds on, dissipating slowly.  Little carbonation in the body.  The label is purple, the beer pours plum, and it smells purple.  Definitely notice the wheat in the nose but it is sweet, almost berry like.  If purple had a taste, this is what it would taste like.  A complex balance of sweetness and grain, some bread-like qualities and clove, which I don’t like, but mainly a battle between sweet malt and dry wheat.  Unique.  It does have more of a doppelbock finish than a wheat finish, sticky.  Overall, unique and fair but I feel the two genres should remain divorced.

Gorgeous color, dark brown core blends into copper towards the edge.   Head was as dense as shaving cream.  Aroma is very full of alcohol, slightly sweet.  The feel is very smooth, the alcohol is well hidden, not at all what I expected when it was so prevalent in the aroma, very well hiden.  Starts off very sweet on the tip of the tongue, and progresses into a nice full wheaty flavor, bitterness comes out in the end.  The progression of flavor is wonderful, realy a joy to let it sit on your tongue and experience all that it has to offer.  A new one of my favorites.

Looks amazing.  Dark caramel body with a nice fluffy white head.  Cloves and caramel malts in the nose.  Taste is wonderfully sweet and quite strong.  No bitterness at all.  Finishes nice and light.  Very tasty weizen.

on tap at the devil’s den, philadelphia. huge glass, inspiring head. what makes this beer so loveable is the combination of summery crispness and luscious grainy fullbody with a bracing spicy finish.
this is a beer that truly caters to summer without surrendering to wimpiness. 
a second glass from the same source was duller and under-carbonated, but i’ll rate the best and assume that’s typical of the brewer’s work.

On tap, Jacob Wirth’s.  This is a beautiful beer.  This style (of which I am a huge fan) executed to perfections.  A nice brown, with a great head.  Banana and cloves in the aroma and taste, goes down real smooth, just a superb beer all-around.

Bottle from Cracked Kettle, @ home. This is something different. Hazy brownish colour, nice head.Smell of banana, alchohol, liquorice, some dark fruits. Taste is liquorice, malts, candy sugar, dark fruits, a bit sour. Prickling finish. Creamy mouthfeel. Not my taste but it does stand out.

Tap at Lucky Baldwin’s.  First: the head on this is just silly, and the goofy glass didn’t help: it was like three inches of marshmallow cream; the most dense head I have yet encountered.  That sentence was needlessly prolonged by my choice of punctuation.  Secondly, anything called ’weizen’ or ’weiss’ should never be this color, so it was confirmed that I’d be surprisingly intoxicated on finish.  Third, the color belies its non-roastiness; this is almost like a dark Flemish red.  Very surprising.
Long lasting head. Never a bad thing. Pleasant aroma, but a very delicious flavor. Definitely a beer I will purchase again. Cheers to Weissbierbrauerei G. Schneider & Sohn.

Poured into a big glass from an 18 oz bottle.  Poured a thick, nutty brown with a foamy off-white head.  The smell was all banana and cloves, which seemed to mask the wheat but it was quite a pleasant aroma.  The flavor was much like the smell, but without any one flavor being too overwhelming.  It’s medium-heavy body was smooth and delicious all the way down.  Definitely recommended.

The first time I tried this beer on tap, I was blown away.  Never have I had a beer that was such a pleasure to enjoy.

Flavor contains a rich fruitiness that would best be described as a combination of raisins and well ripened apples.  Initially very complex, giving way to fruit flavors, followed by just the lightest tangy bitterness.  Just a hint of sourness.

Aroma is strongly clove like with a hint of apple cider, and chocolate.

Mouth feel is well carbonated and complex - makes you want to hold it in your mouth to enjoy all the flavors before swallowing, but a little bit thick.

Taste is an explosion of well balanced flavors, I’m getting a bit of ripe cherry, apples, raisins and caramel.

Highly recommended.  Can be purchased at CT Beverage Mart in Newington, CT, also available in bottles at The Half Door in West Hartford, CT.  First tried it as it was rotated on tap at Eli Cannons in Middletown, CT.

Well worth the $3.50 for a bottle as you won’t be disappointed.  The beer changes flavors and characteristics throughout the whole drinking experience.

Color is a rich Amber brown giving way to a reddish cloudy brown under light.  Because it’s bottle fermented, some solid particles floating around are normal.  Pours a nice thick head with good lacing.

One finely crafted brew with well balanced complexity that raised the bar for all other beers I’ve had.

A wonderus brew. pours a strange brown slightly hued purple. Thick headed beer that allows for every sip to come through a cloud of bubbles. The smell had the typical yeast but also contains a ginger/clove smell. The taste is clean and refreshing. Slight sweetness made a friend who i shared this bottle with say it was "root beer" like. But most spectacular is the palate with a superb carbination that seems to make the flavor envelope the entire tongue.
UPDATED: SEP 19, 2013 Thick dense head. The aroma is malty and sweet with hops, alcohol, cocoa and a hint of citrus. The mouthfeel is rich and has a pleasant carbonation.

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2009 Immense. Loved it. You know how some beers seem to really get you away with a mixer? This is one of them . Alcohol hidden perfectly but packs the punch. Like a shy girl you get her clothes off and boom, absolute nailageness. Dark caramel kind of colour. Kicks the fuck out of any wheat Ive had so far. Shit fucking hot.

16.9 oz. bottle into pint glass.  Pours a nice dark and hazy honey brown with an active and tall white head that doesnt leave much lacing.  It smells like a typical wheat beer with a spicy (a bit of nutmeg), slightly citrus and banana-y  body.  Flavor is soft and refreshing, as par usual with wheat brews but with some unique subtleties including banana on the gulp and a grape/cherry flavor on the finish.  The alcohol is hidden remarkably well.  It is light bodied with tingly carbonation on the palate.  Overall: great refreshing brew that is dangerously drinkable.  Great for the summer.

Pours a dark red-brown color with a bit of a white head.  Aroma is a bit spicy... some clove with a little yeast and sweet nodes.  Flavor is of yeast, spice, alcohol, but also sweet of caramel, slightly bitter too.

1 pt. 0.9 oz. bottle.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2009 The aroma is gorgeous, spicy and fruity with a hint of port wine.  Pours a deep chocolate brown with a pillowy white head.  Flavor tastes of berries, spices, port wine, and chocolate with a hint of caramel.  Absolutely amazing and worth the purchase.

Update (3/26/09): Recently had again.  The complexities of this beer are overwhelming but the accessibility makes it truly quaffable.  Amazing beer.

500ml bottle- nice tenacious, lasting head.  Mahogany color. Yes, the clove is right out front, but backed up by some dried apricot, fresh cooked oatmeal, sweet stewed prunes. As it warms up the yeast character reminds me of St.Bernardus Abt 12- its like a freshly washed fuzzy blanket that has been dried with a fruit scented fabric softener(!?!)  Taste is a nice amalgam of the aforementioned aromas,  they dance a bit,  then bow out for a finish that is the opposite of cloying (unexpected but very nice, makes an otherwise sweet beer very drinkable) Alcohol shows up in the nostrils after a few sips, but is not harsh. I dont see how this style could be improved upon very much. Easily blasts through the 4 barrier.

Aroam is spicy, thick with colves, and wheat grains. Slight fruitness also.  The appearance is an appealing ruby red, with a little haze, and a lot of carbonation, and a thick off-white head.  The flavor is spicy, notes of clove and ripened bananas.  Very enjoyable.  Slight tinge of bittering hops at the end, a little more sour than bitter.  Very nice.  This is not my favorite style, but this beer is very well crafted.  One bummer:  the bottle (16 oz) ran me $4.50.

The best beer I ever had so far.
To me it has a smokey and somewhat fruity flavor.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2011 Bottle. I probably had the worst serving of this beer ever - brown bagged on a hot-ass night in nyc. It was still legit. Aroma is wheat and clove. The taste is wheat, clove - almost like a witbier - with balls. There are just slight notes of alcohol towards the end of the bottle, but it hides it extremely well. Great beer.

Best beer ever! Tart, malty aroma with a long lasting head. Flavor is rich and heavy, giving way to exquisite accents of chocolate, apples, caramel and bananas. Surprisingly non-bitter considering its 8.2% alcohol content. An ale for the ages!
(Bottled on 2008-06-27) Dark brown with hints of orange. Cloudy. White head with some tan colour. Banana in nose. Some carbonation in full palate. Malts, liquorice, banana and hops in taste.
Deep amber pour with an off white head.  Alcohol is noticiable.  Banana and caramel malt on the nose.  Some spice and caramel in taste.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2008 Appearance: Caramel brown, cloudy. Little bit of head.
Aroma: Wheaty, but not too wheaty. Raisins?
Taste: Not too wheaty. Hint of fruit/malt. Cloves.
Info: 500ml bottle, 17/11-2005, 53/300, 33/500

Oh, one of my alltime favourites. Greats taste of gingersnaps, mature bananas, koriander and some fruitiness too. Very warming, I guess thats why some people think Its seasonal, perfect after a cold winters day. Love it!

Deep brown-red colour with a thick white head. The aroma is really complex, there is spices, clove, apple, banana, alcohol... It is full bodied, taste is very complex too, with spices, clove, banana and caramel, really malty. Excellent beer overall. The 8% of alcohol is well hidden.

Appearance - Pours a dark reddish brown. Big rocky head. 

Smell - Aroma is sweet brown sugar and carrots, Whole grain Bread, Dark fruit esters. Not much detectable Alchohol. 

Taste - Bannanas, clove, and grains were at the front flavor. Low alchohol taste and pretty complex. 

Mouthfeel - Moderatly dry. Long lasting finish. Pretty heavy. 

Drinkability - Totally drinkable for the gravity and alchohol content. Very sneaky beer.

Nice head that remained for the duration as a light ring. Reddish-brown color. Sweet, fruity nose with a touch of clovers. Malty somewhat carbonated intro with a super smooth mouth that transitioned to a milk chocolate and malty finish with hints of overripe bananas. The alcohol is present but not cloying. Some smokiness is detectable in the aftertaste. I forgot how good this beer is. I felt like I was in Germany and Austria again.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2009 Incredible beer. Extremely complex, I dont know where to begin. First of all, there was none of the syrupy sweetness that I was worried about. The beer starts off with the lightly sweet taste of plums, spices, bananas, and some vanilla and yeast. The finish is lightly bitter and lingers. Very carbonated. Highly drinkable for a strong beer. Full bodied and full flavored. No alcohol taste.

Bottle from Westmere in Albany. Pours very dark brown with great carbonation. Tastes of banana bread. Alcohol is well hidden.
One of my favorite beers.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2008 Update rating: 2002 vintage. So many layers of flavor on my palate. A lot of fig and prune, malt, and spice, chocolate? Alcohol present on the nose. a lot of sediment.


serious meaty yeast nose, coriander spice. Darker color then I had expected, thick head. Fruits, not necessarily dark, belgian style hops, coriander spice, malty notes, meaty yeast for sho. So enjoyable
meaty like a jerky. Would be great with brisket. Smoky sweet notes and a touch of banana corieander. Smother and richer in body than expected. Ruby mahagony light lace and a nice head.
Absolutely amazing. Easily in my top 3 beers. I love wheat based bears, and this is up near the king. So smooth, so flavorful, sweet notes and finishes very clean. Ill be buying a case.

50cl bottle from Total Wine (Jacksonville, FL). Pours a dark, cloudy dark brown with a white, creamy two finger head. Good head retention. Smells of malt, cloves and spices with hints of bread and yeast. Flavor is rich and malty with hints of caramel and with a soothing barley finish. Excellent weizen bock, one that we drink nearly every week.

A clear dark amber colored beer, with a huge light beige foamy head. An aroma of roasted malts, cloves and some sweet caramel. The taste gives a nice mouthfeel, with notes of clove and caramel with banana tones. A very nice beer.

5/1/08 notes:  From oversized bottle.  Appearance is a very cloudy dark amber brown with a two-finger lasting head.  Scent of caramel, malt, wheat and banana.  Flavor is a mature blend of caramel, toffee, wheat, dark malts and ripe banana.  Very smooth and tasty, both qualities enhanced by the small-pearl carbonation. This distinctive champagne carbonation really opens up the dark robust flavors in your mouth.  Finishes sweet with unabashed alcohol flavor, yet the whole package works so well together.  This is an excellent beer, a great example of the style.

Poors murky brown with an off white head that lasts impressively.  Sweet citrusy/wheaty aroma.  Full bodied, but smooth despite ample early carbonation.  Caramels and citrus, along with wheat and yeast, dominate the flavor.  Great balance between sweet, sour, and bitter.  Smooth finish with a lingering spice flavor and a hint of bitter.  Amazing beer.
UPDATED: FEB 13, 2009 Had this at the Oldsmar Tap House and everything about this beer is great.  From the way its poured to the amazing aroma and taste.  One of my favorite beers.

Bottle.  Complex appearance: cloudy, rich brown.  The head is intense and overflowing.  Aroma is very spicy and yeasty.  Tastes sweet like caramel, with hints of berries and a lot of spiciness.  Complex but with a smooth finish and a strong but not overpowering aftertaste.

Dark amber with much head. Its a weizen bock and so much more. Complex array of flavors, especially toffee, fruit, and spice. Bitter and sweet at the same time. Epic drinking experience as far as Im concerned.

My 500th beer on ratebeer.com, wow that was quick.  Not much better at writing up these paragraphs than I was a few months ago.  Dark amber with a thin off-white head.  Aroma of banana, clove, caramel and sweet malts.  Taste of banana, fruit, caramel, sweet malts and light clove.  Creamy and smooth with a spicy finish.  Good stuff.
Amber colour, medium white head. Aroma has yeast, malts and some spices. Flavour is spicey and of dark fruits. Complex beer.

big, fluffy white head, smell is spices and grain. the taste is that wheaty taste with a low heavy malt, alcohol is a little apparent. i caught a tiny taste of that bubblegum smell/taste that some beers have and banana.. a thick, carbonated feel in the mouth. pretty good value for the money

Nice gleaming ruby with a thick creamy white lacing head. Complex aroma, full of clove, toffee, fruit, spices, very inviting. Same in mouth, strong but yet fresh and drinkable. Sometimes a bit ethilic.

On tap Capital Ale House. Dark amber brown with small white head. A lot of wheat and caramel/roast malt notes and spicey yeast character in the nose. Roasted malts, spicey clove, raisin and fruity bock like yeast notes in the flavor. Finish is semi-dry with some lingering hop bitterness and a touch of sourness. Not the first tasting of this beer for me and it remains a favorite.
Slightly roasty, banana and syrupy aroma. Sweet roasted malty aroma with banana, syrup and yeast. Some alcohol also.
0,5l bottle. Pours dark amber with big but a bit too airy head. Malty aroma with maybe some plum in it. Very similar aroma with perhaps even bit more plum. Very solid.
Great poor in dimple mug with nice lacing and good head.  Very organized wheat, yeast, buble gum and dark fruit. Enjoyed this beer alot.
from bottle pours a deep amber color.  Dark fruit, yeast, and a wine like aroma.  Notes of more dark fruit, wheat, raisens, and caramel.  creamy texture.  good brew
Deep caramel brown with reddish tint. Flavor of fruit with a strong wheaty aftertaste.  Creamy and light despite the dark color.  Too many of these would be a good way to die.

Strong malt and dark fruit aroma. Color is deep brown with a small off-white head. Flavors starts out sweet and fruity with a strong wheat flavor through the finish. The fruit creaminess lingers in the aftertaste. Definitely tastes like a weizen with the fruit but is full bodied like a bock. Very solid beer.

My favourite wheat beer to date.  Typically wheat beers are refreshing but lack depth in flavour.  This retains the smooth and easy drinking components associated with german wheat beers while adding a slightly sweet caramel taste and full body.  Really nice.

500mL bottle from the LCBO.  Pours dark, murky brown with a large light brown head.  Spicy aroma with touches of banana and dark fruit.  Flavour is complex, dark fruit, cloves.  Excellent mouthfeel, creamy but not undercarbonated.  Superb.

Quite sahti-like banana/strawberry. Mouthfeel also very much alike medium-to fool bodied, but with a bit more carbonation which is good. sweet, strongly yeasty and round. beautiful colour and big off-white head.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2008 Dark doppelbock. High alcohol content is largely unnoticeable thanks to the great bold taste. The taste is sweet and then later bitter. Great beer. Had in bottle at Bottlescrew Bills Calgary, AB.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2009 Bottle. Very cloudy redbrown color with a big beautiful head. sweet smell of bananas and some spicet notes. Really nice mouthfeel with flavors of banana,other fruits and malt. Finish is smooth with some alcohol burn.

Simply one of the best wheat beers Ive drunk. Pours dark brown, with lots of lovely sediment swishing about, large white foamy head. Champagne-like carbonation in the glass. Tastes of clove, raisins, banana. A real winner. In fact, Ive got one in the fridge & I think Ill have one tonight!

pint bottle into an imperial pint glass. Pours a very cloudy brown with a nice head. Sweet malty smell with some bread smell. Bananas and malt in the taste. Nice carbonation, crisp mouthfeel. Strong alcohol is very well masked. As good in the style as I have had.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2008 Cloudy brown murk. White fizz on top. Wheat, fruit and malt aroma. Full bodied, sour and even. It tastes as good as it looks murky. Very. Wow.. alcohol isnt present until the end. Mmm..Very good. (Tried the 4 yr old, didn’t enjoy much.)
Excellent stuff. Pours a great brown red with a slight sweet smell. Flavor is very doppelbock, but it has more to it, way more depth of flavor, very nice.

I have had this a good number of times and it is simply wonderful.  Brown pur wtih a foamy head.  Very sweet nose, dried fruit, candy sugar, chocolate, sweet spices and super malts.  Tongue is much of the same.  Sweet, caramel, malt, honey, molasses.  Just a beautiful brew.

500ml bottle.  Pours just like a coke -- a pale brown with a billowy-but-fleeting off-white head and loads of carbonation.  Aroma is so strong it hit me from a yard or two away -- lots of caramel, brown sugar, dark fruit, chocolate, roasted malt, spices, and a bit of wood.  Taste is creamy and fairly full, with loads of roasted malt, syrupy hops, and caramel building up into a long finish of dark fruit, spices, and warming alcohol.  If you need proof that Germans know their beer, look no further.

2001 on outside of bottle. Pours a cloudy dark caramel color with no head. Gushed a little when the bottle was opened, but no off smells or taste. A rich malt bouquet of dark candies and a hint of chocolate. A full body and a heavy malt background is accented by a creamy bitterness. The finish is a well balanced sweetness. Great.

bottle poured into Aventinus glass... pours a beautiful dark brown with a lighter bottom... excellent 2 finger white head... it is a beauty to look at in this glass... 5/5 for sure.  The best weizen bock ... lives up to its rating.  Aromas of fruits, spice and brown sugar.  Medium to full body with a wonderful palate... the finish brings out the alcohol and some caramel... very well balanced and full of flavor.  The commercial description really sums up this beer well... very drinkable, very soft and one of the best beers in the world.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2008 Excellente bière, présente en bouche, bonne redescente.
Assez forte (8,2%) mais agréable.

Amazing clove aroma right off the bat.  Wonderful cloudy copper color with a really foamy head that overflowed (pour down the center my ass!).  Nice sweet bready flavor with a touch of bananas.  A slight bitter finish as it goes down.  Nice... A bit too perfumery for my taste but overall it is very nice.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2008 Bottle.  That glass looks very phalic, i had one, i gave it away, the idea of putting that to my mouth, eh. Ruby grown pour with off white large head.  Falvor is spice, caramel, fruit.  Great beer.

Poors a dark copper, huge thick head.  Low carbonation and no lacing.  Smells of malt, banana, clove and pepper.  Medium body, smooth and well rounded with some nice banana, not bitter but a nice long lasting kick that trickles down your throat.  After taste is spicy and warm.  Very nice.

Bottle courtesy Naka.  Pours brown with amber hues, one finger, off-white head, dissipates quickly.  Nose of brown sugar, banana and spicy clove.  Banana wheat taste with barley wine notes, bread and caramel.  Slight hops, good mouthfeel.  Very tasty brew.

I love this beer, always have, but had always had it out of the bottle, until I found it on tap @ a Mellow Mushroom.  Wow, pours a deep burnt auburn color with a 3 finger cloudy puffy head.  Absolutely delicious, lots of toasted cereal maltiness, a bit of burnt caramel, and lovely yeastiness, banana and clove, some warming alcohol in the finish.  Just this side of being a perfect beer.

50cl Bottle. Hazy brown color with a big and persistent nice head. Sweet malt , fruit , and yeast aroma. Full bodied and low carbonated, with long yeast finish. Sweet malt, yeast and very fruit flavor with notes of toasted malt ; alcohol is perceived. Very balanced Beer ! The best weizenbock of the world !

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2009 Pours a deep reddish brown color with a one-finger head.  Head dissipates fairly quickly.  Wonderful aroma of sweet malts, wheat and some fruits.  The flavor is similar, only better and fruitier.  The flavor is actually similar to a trappist, with a wonderful yeast and sweet fruit flavors.  The palate is fizzy but very warming.  Very simply, a great beer.

Shared with dpjuart.  Pours a deep amber brown color with a 2 finger off-white foamy head.  The nose is figs, fermenting crab apples, spicy yeast, and brown sugar.  The taste has a solid fruity yeasty flavor.  A small amount of roasted character underneath everything.  Rich creamy mouthfeel.  One of the best wheat beers I have ever had.
bottle, fluffy head with bitter first taste, muddy red color, clove and cane sugar flavor with very balanced finish

Wow, what a beer! 
50 cl Bottle poured into a chalice.
Aroma is of banana, cloves and bubblegum.
Crisp, carbonated palate with undercurrents of caramel and cloves.
Very complex.
Probably the greatest beer Ive tasted.
Gorgeous pour with beautiful lacing, albeit not great retention...Strong clove with hint of caramel taste. Excellent mouth feel, nice hint of alcohol on the aftertaste. Overall, a very good beer.

Bottle. Bright maroon color with a thick white head. Delicate malty nose and flavor. Lovely balance, smoothness, and a complexity that grows on you. Has the simple flavors of a much lighter beer up front, but just keeps growing as it goes down and the more you drink. Really good beer.

Bottle. Wonderful beer. Smells spicy, with cloves coming through very strongly. Nice brownish red color that is slightly cloudy when held to the light. Nice head. Just like the description "compact, stable and long lasting...." Taste is one of the best weizen beers out there. Highly recommended.

This Ale is amazing!  Mine came in a 1 pint bottle.  I roused the yeast off the bottom prior to opening this bottle.  Then I opened the bottle and let it sit for 5 mins.  Then poured about 2/3 into my favorite pint glass.  Then roused the bottom again and finished pouring.  It pours a smokey burnt-umber with glimmers of deep maroon when held to the light.  The nose is yeasty-cloves with warm bread overtones.  Very exciting aroma, make one want to drink.  The mouth feel is pleasant, full, creamy, light carbonation.  The taste in the front of the tongue is sweet citrus, but not ordinary orange or lemon... more like star fruit.  The sides of the mouth and cheeks pick up the cloves and the back of the throat get the tamed bitters.  After taste lingers cloves.  Even though the alcohol content is high, you dont taste it, but it does warm you from the inside out.  FANTASTIC.

2004 Bottle from Westpark in Richmond, Cant believe I havent rated this yet! Orange amber color with a big head and a fair amount of lacing. Aroma of deep raisin and alcohol. Taste of caramel, dark fruit and vanilla. Effervescent and a little thin bodied. Disappointing compared to fresh.

Bottle. Pours dark, murky brown with thin off white head. Aroma is wheat, clove, malt and butter. Soft palate that is creamy. Delicious flavor. The wheat seems to present a somewhat subdued forefront followed by a decent bitterness in the finish. Very good beer.

Pours deep brown with an excellent cream colored head. This brew smells of sweet fruits. The taste is also of sweet fruit, namely dried apricot and darker fruit. It is highly carbonated with an average viscosity. It is fairly drinkable however it just isnt my style, the taste really doesnt do it for me.

wow great roasted malt flavor with the wheat flavor balancing it well...
super nice finish...
the best dopplebock wheat or otherwise ever!

Poured a translucent brown cola with a light tan head of big suds.  The head began life at 2cm, but remained at 2mm for the rest of its life in the glass.

The aromas were molasses, celery, bubblegum, and banana.

The mouthfeel had medium carbonation.  Perfect feel on the tongue.

The taste was very sweet--that bubblegum flavour, I suppose--chased by cloves (which went undetected in the aroma for me).  The bitterness was all unsweetened cocoa, and there was a barely-noticeable warming from the higher alcohol content.

All in all, an excellent brew that Im glad to have sampled.  Alas, its not sold in my region.  Ill have to be patient to have another.
Scent is nice with good color that is very cloudy.  Great flavor with a smooth aftertaste.  One of my favorites.

16oz bottle. Poured into a Stein. Dark mahogany colo with a big puffy head. Nose of raisins, bananna, clove, some underlying citrus and caramel. Taste is strong on bananna and clove but the warmer this beer gets the more the crazy complexity comes out. Cherries, chocolate, caramel, toffee all come through. A complex, smooth, full-bodied and incredibly tasty brew. Awesome.

Scent is very nice, with lots of yeast and sweet coco aromas.  A beautiful brown color which is very cloudy. The head is tight, very big at first but settles down a bit, the bubbles are big. There are some weird "yeast turds" in the bottom of my glass.  The taste is huge & complex. There is a really great fruitiness, but at the same time there is a good creamy & chocolate flavor. Plenty of yeasty tones, virtually none of the alcohol is present in the flavor. Palate is good, creamy on the top of the tongue and sharp on the sides. A great beer, and undoubtedly the best weizenbock I have had.

chocolate & basement aromas dominate the smell, dark brown color; perfect for wheat-Doppelbocks. Cloudy appearance with a long lasting tan foam, full body with a lightly bitter savory taste that tingles the palate. Overall Impression; an excellant German Weizen Bock. Absolutely would purchase again and recommend to friends

500 mL bottle releases a dark brown liquid that puts out quite a head.  Aromas are wonderful... bananas, cloves,candi sugar, brown sugar, plums and the like.  Dang, the flavor is spot on and this is wonderful stuff.  I cant believe I havent tried this before.  THe banana and clove flavors come through stronger than in most of the other weizens Ive tried, which is an interesting and nice touch.  I have to say that I completely enjoyed this.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle. Dark brown/red color. Aroma is banana, some spices, bubblegum, caramel. Tastes pretty much is the same. Compared to other darker weiss beers, the spices are a bit subtler. palate is pretty light. I find this beer exceedingly easy to drink and very satisfying.
Not a big bock fan in general. Dark color with loads of malt, sweetness, and fruityness. It actually does a lot for the style.

Bottle. Aroma primarily candi fruits with hints of caramel and spices. Flavor brings out more spiciness, including a distinct BBQ edge for me. As the body warms, more and more complex wheat flavor comes out, truly solidifying this brew as world class. Ill be picking up a few more of these at my first opportunity. Excellent.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy brown with a medium-sized white head.  Aroma of light fruits and some BBQ sauce, if you search for it.  Taste of bubblegum, spices (clove), and some vegetable.  A very good weizenbock, although Im not sure Im a fan of the style as a whole.

Bottle, Pours a cloudy dark brown that appears lighter at the bottom then the top with a nice white head. The aroma is of complex spices and sweet malt.  A great flavor for this amount of alcohol. A little heavy on the stomache since it drinks like a meal but I would recommend this one to anybody.

2002 bottle.  Pours a dark brown amber color with fluffy white head and lots of yeast chunks floating around.  Aroma is very spicy with belgian spice, raisins, clove, brown and candied sugar.  Taste is much the same as the aroma.  Soft carbonation and chewy finish.  Wasn?t feeling this one.

A 2002 bottle.  Pours an amber brown color with tons of particulate and a medium white head.  Aroma is spices, banana, candied sugar, and raisins.  Tastes as it smells.  Pretty good but nothing special........maybe I dont care for the style.
On tap at The Blind Tiger in NYC. Roasted and fruity at the beginning, with a slight spice and sweetness in the finish. Its very refreshing, high in flavor, and complex.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2010 Hazy dark brown with a huge dense head. Sweet aroma of banana and spices. The flavours are just amazing: toffee, roasted malts, banana, tropical fruits along with some spices, all in a perfect mix. All in all a perfect beer.
Pours dark cloudy amber brown.  Aroma of fruits, banana caramel, and bread.  Flavor of figs and wheat.  Very complex and delicious.  Alcohol well hidden.  Excellent beer!

Pour: Dark mahogany brown with a nice off white head.
Nose: Banana, toffe, wheat, cloves, caramelized malt, dried fruit, molasses, and  hints of raisins.
Taste: Banana, toffee caramel and toasted malt, wheat, coffee, fig.
Body: Medium to heavy
Finish: Sutle bitterness that is well rounded, which helps blends the alcohol to a seamless beer.

2008 Bottle @ Bardenay - This was an enigma of a beer, aroma of dried fruit and brown sugar, taste was of malt, yeast and old raisins and cloves, alcohol was well hidden and this was a treat for the senses, very nice, would drink again

The beer pours a little cloudy probably because of the protein rich Wheat, the alcohol leave long legs on the glass, the aroma is amazing with Cloves and Bananas, the palate is full bodied even with all the alcohol, no hop aroma or flavor to speak of.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2008 4/2/2008 bottle wrapped in a fancy paper dated brewed in 2003 with a tag stating this is part of a yearly release of 240 cases they hold back and release after three years. color is a reddish amber with a quickly fading head and good carbonation. aroma is plumb, spice, and yeast. taste is malted with more acid but the flavor has mellowed and blended nicely. less creamy texture and the dry finish has backed off quite a bit. i love the fact i can go to the store and buy a five year old bottle and a new one to compare the two.

3/31/2008 bottle fresh from the store poured a dark amber brown color with a thick one finger light tan head with great retention. carbonation is medium and the aroma has yeast, plumb, spice, wheat, and sweetness. the taste is heavily malted for a wheat beer with a nice creamy mouth feel. wheat and spice mix well with layers of sweet fruit and banana. finishing with sweetness on the sides of the tongue and drying in the middle. really a tasty beer with loads of flavor and incredible balance.

500 mL bottle. Pours a clear dark amber color with a large light tan head. The aroma is banana and clove. Decent lacing on the glass. The taste is raisin with a dry finish. Hides the alcohol well and easy to drink. A very good weizen bock from Schneider.

Truly impressive complexity of flavor - the wheat is so subdued as to fade into the background, and yet still be detectable. Above all else this beer is balanced. Despite all the gently clashing notes of fruit, yeast, and candy this beer never overwhelms in any one dimension. Conducive to savoring and introspection.

Alas, I failed to rate this while I was in Munich and drinking at the Schnieder taphouse caouse its the only decent beer in Munich.  This is a bottle from here in the states, not nearly as good as on draft.

Brilliant golden amber, some ruby notes.  Creamy off-white head.
Sharp alcoholic, malty aroma, major yeast fruitiness, some toast.
Clean somewhat sweet malty flavor, yeast fruitiness and a delicate bitterness that balances the malt.
Full palate that remains for the flavor but smooths out, allowing real drinkability as well.

Pours opaque brown with a thick white head. Nose is spicy and wheaty. The flavor starts with a blend of dark fruits and wheat.  Good carbonated body. Hides its alcohol really well. The aftertaste is straight banana.

Pours a beautiful cloudy brown rust with an immense off-white head that completes the image. Smells of wheat, yeast, and dry plums. Very floral and spicey taste. Some sweet malts and caramel at first with the clove/spice coming on in the middle before a sharp start to a lightly bitter, alcoholic finish.
Bottle from BevMo La Mesa.  Nice sweet aroma, vanilla. Tastes sweet, like a Belgian abbey but its German. Roasty, sweet, earthy, wheaty in the finish. 8% abv. Excellent beer! Awesome glassware too.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2008 (GERMANY) Amber/Brown color with a Sm-White Head. There is definitely a spicy/ alcohol aroma, with a fruity/raisin taste. But the alcohol is well hidden !!!  Slight bitter finish, But a yummy brew. :)

This beer is the epitome of a great weizen bock.  I had heard a lot about this beer and had high expectations, it exceeded them.  The nose, of dried, rotten fruit and clove spice is incredible.  The alcohol is hidden at 8.2%, and the flavor is rich but yet refreshing.  My favorite night cap beer.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2008 Dark and majestic appearance, almost violet color (perhaps my notion is influenced by the nice label). Pours a terrific head. A very complex nose with hints of banana. Flavor is enormous with all sorts of "gadgets", full-bodied and strong, this is a truly great beer. Ein Prosit!

Deep, dark, almost opaque brown. Fluffy head dissipates quickly and left no lacing. Really nice fruity, nutty, sweet aroma. Flavour of nutty fruit, malt, dates, caramel and carbonated, but to me mildly reminiscent of Coca-Cola (not a negative), but not highly sweet like the soda. No overwhelming bitterness and nice finish.

Pours a gloriously beautiful, tick head.  Thick columns of carbonation stream up the edges of my 500ml mug.  Yeast-taste is prominent in the head, then you get through the thick and foamy seal and feel the cold, mild caramel cover your tongue... aint life grand?  The head is very long-lasting, and the lacing just as foamy.  Aroma of yeast and a gentle spice.  Its palate is insanely entertaining.  I love it.  Ever so slightly bitter touch on the finish - if you wait a while before the next sip you can actually feel a little of the alcohol in your cheeks.  THIS is how to make a wheat beer.

Thanks to MaliMisho. I like the commercial term to describe the appearance of this beer: "Dark Ruby." Aroma is banana and spicy. Flavor is dark fruits like raisin and plum. There are also some spicy notes of cloves. Finish is rather bitter, and if surprisingly does not hit you until the very end. However the bitterness fades just as fast as it came on.

Pours into a hefe-glass with a shaded redwood color, the stable and very present cloud of toasted ivory foam, hovers overhead.
