Warm banana spice cake tones find their way into your mind via the incredible nose of this Weizenbock. Malt and sweet plum flavors give way to a perfectly balanced, slightly tart, dark fruit finish. The mouth feel of this beer puts it over the top, giving it all the qualities of a incredibly crafted brew. The wheaty, medium bodied fresh finish lingers favorably until the next sip. 
Brunnen getan, meine Deutschen Brüder, gut getanPairs as well with bacon wrapped bockwurst, as it does with a medium rare filet mignon...enjoy

my favorite beer to date.  Pint bottle.  Poured a cloudy dark brown.  Sweet Malay and yeast aroma.  Cannot place aroma quite yet.  Very nice palate with a sweet flavor that has a delightfully lingering bitterness.  Overall great and would drink Many in one sitting

Bottled 500ml, aged 6.5yrs. Dark brown, red with beige head. I dont get the hype with this one, quite sweet and sickly, porty with cloves and various spices and a big dose of nasal alcohol, but for a beer to be looked forward to it is a bit lacking. A beer trying to be a wine rather than a beer. Its ok, but nothing special.
Bottle. Pours a dark ruby with long lasting white head. Aroma is of cloves & banana, sweet on the palate, alcohol is well hidden.  An enjoyable wheat beer.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2008 According to me, this is fantastic. Its so refreshing despite the quite high alcohol percent. A lot of spices, like clove, in the taste together with banana. I think Im going to have many of these in the summer... nearly perfection. A litte bit of an alcoholic burn in the finish, especially as the beer warms up, but overall a very enjoyable weizen bock.

Pours dark reddish brown with off white head. Aromas of cloves, bread, and malt. Cloves are the dominant flavor with some sweet maltiness and brown sugar. Full body with average carbonation and creamy mouthfeel. Good desert beer.
Aroma is excellent. Spicy, dank and bold smelling. Poured murky brown with a rich foamy head. Tastes of cloves, malts, brown sugary and alcohol.

500 ml bottle.  Poured a nice mahogany/brown color with a 2-3 finger dense light brown head that lingered.  Average lacing.  Medium malt aroma with wheat/cereal grain notes also present.  Yesty banana smells really comes through in the aroma along with a touch of alcohol.  Taste is nice!  Sweet malty taste up front followed by competing yeasty banana and wheaty flavors.  Very nice.  Fnishes with a nice kick of alcohol and ligners with an interesting nutty taste.  Palate is nice, its a little thinner than I expected but that is nice - keeps it drinkable.  Carbonation is nice and lively.  A great beer.

Dark reddish brown, off-white weizen head. Nose is spicy, yeasty and wheaty with fried bananas and syrup. Flavor has warming spices and syrupy, liqueurish bananas. Warming alcoholic finish. Medium to full bodied with strong carbonation. Complex and comfy without being too heavy.

0,5l bottle with dad. Dark mahogany colour with a huge steady beige head. Clove , malt, coffe and a bit of germinated grain in the nose. Heavy alcohol in taste, which did put me off a otherwise excellently round and perfectly brewed beer.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2016 500ml bottle: Cloudy dark brown with huge frothy head.  Fruity nose with cloves and hints of warm alcohol.  Sweet malts, wheat, raisins, banana, toffee and a dash of Sambuca.  Rich, dessert-like complexity. Robust and Unequivocally indicative of the style. This is one of my favourites.

Bottle shared by Crosling in one of the fancy glasses shown in the picture.  Poured a deep caramel color with rising bubbles and a thick beige head.  Light aroma of fig and raisins, caramel, and yeast.   Flavor consists of light caramel, fig, and an earthy yeast flavor that finishes with a soft bitterness.  Full, but not overly thick.  Really nice beer.
Pours Hazy brown, with a off white head, aroma of yeast adn dark fruits, flavor is dark fruits, chocolate and yeast. Not really my style.
16.9 oz bottle.  Pours ruby/brown with nice head.  Aroma of sweet dark fruit.  Taste of molasses and caramel, strong alcohol but not overpowering.  Very tasty!
Pours a deep amber with a large off white head. Aroma is sweet, caramel and fruity. The flavor is sweet, clovelike, fruity and just a slight hint of alcohol. Medium bodied, more alcoholic finsh.

BEER: G. Schneider & Sohn Aventinus Wheat Doppelbock Ale
ABV: 8.2% 16.9 fl oz bottle
BREWER: G. Schneider & Sohn
GLASS: Weizen
PURCHASED AT: Shop Rite Liquors, Hamilton, NJ
PRICE: $ 2.95
Price per fl oz $2.95 / 16.9 fl oz = $.17 per fl oz.

Date: Tuesday, March 11th, 2008

Aroma : 10

Malty - heavy, dark bread, burned cookie, straw, burnt, nutty, molasses, dark chocolate, mild coffee.
Hoppy - light, perfume, herbs, resinous, orange and lime citrus,
Yeasty - heavy, dough, leather, soap, mold, broth.
Miscellaneous - banana, prune, apple, cherry, red wine, tar, butterscotch, maple syrup, clove, alcohol, sulfur.

Appearance : 4

Head - initially large, rocky, firm. Turns to thin film. white with virtually no Lacing. Longevity is Fully diminishing
Body - Clarity is minimal, with normal carbonation. A murky, muddy, milky brown. Medium body, with average density. Bottle conditioned. Hue is brown with deep orange highlights.

Flavor : 9

Initial flavor is moderately sweet, somewhat acidic, lightly bitter and slightly acetic.
Finish - long finishing flavor is lightly sweet heavily acidic, moderately bitter, and quite sour.

Palate : 4

Body is Medium to full
Texture is very Dry and somewhat creamy.
Carbonation is Soft
Finish - Feel
o Astringent - light
o Alcoholic - moderate

Overall Score (1-20): 16
Comments: A very nice ale, overall, and an amazing array of flavors. Much different from all of the American beers Ive been enjoying. The subtlety of flavor compounds, texture, and aroma are exquisite. A fine ale, but not necessarily the first thing Id go for, though for someone who appreciates complex and fruity flavors, its an amazingly complex and inviting drink.

wow what a great beer whether on tap or from a bottle this beer is up front , it is amazing because I am not into fruit or chocolate notes in my beer but this has a definate banana and chocolate taste but by the time you have swallowed the taste is gone and you actually need and want more and more,,, wow enough anyway you can get your hands on it

There is a strong aromatic presence of clove that intertwines with a yeasty and sweet smell reminiscent of bananas. As for appearance, it is a cloudy caramel with a light cream colored head that disappears quickly. The flavor begins with a clove oriented spice mix which rolls into a nutty taste and ends with a very slight sour and tangy taste. It leaves a fizzy sensation on the tip of my tongue and creates a slight film on the roof of my mouth, however, for the rest of the texture it is slightly creamy and very smooth. Overall this is a complex beer that encompasses a myriad of pleasures for the mouth to furnish the drinker with a good experience; I will definitely be partaking in this beer again.

Pours a cloudy reddish brown with about three fingers of rapidly dissipating white head.  Prune, caramel, and just a general kick of malts hits you with the aroma.  Really soft mouthfeel, it starts off with a hint of clove and spice, and morphs into a light caramel malt and banana aftertaste.  Almost a creamy, Id say "velvety" mouthfeel.  This is just a overall solid beer.

This one of those beers that if you try it during your craft beer infancy, itll just absolutely stun you with its deliciousness.  Pours just like the picture basically, khaki colored head eventually settles into a creamy long lasting foam.  Aroma is very spicy and jumps into your nose with cloves, mild banana, smoke, hay, caramel, brown sugar, holiday bread, and maybe even a bit of gouda cheese.  Taste of cloves and spices at first followed by a nice caramel sweetness, raisins, a bit of smoke on the roof of the mouth, some grass.  Finishes with a bit of banana and fruit flavor, followed by a sort of nutty tasting dry sensation, slightly tangy.  Highly carbonated, but very creamy feeling, drinks effortlessly.  This is the absolute benchmark of what a weizenbock should be and to boot, its top-rated and widely available.  What more can you want?

This beer turned me into a borderline alcoholic last week. I blew like 100 dollars on this beer, I actually bought out the local store that sells it, and after that I bugged the stock guy to tell me when theyre getting another shipment in.

8.2 alcohol/volume, but you can barely taste the alcohol.

Drink two of these and youll be feeling right.

aroma reminds me of cafeau lait mixed up with grapes, wood, and a slight hint of butterscotch.

tastes almost like candy, and must contain alot of sugar...I say this because I spilled a few drops and within seconds, it was ultra sticky on my skin. How to explain the taste? Butterscotch, grapes and other fruits I cant identify, along with woody/earthy notes. You can barely taste the alcohol, but believe me, after half a bottle youll definately know its there.

Three bottles of this stuff and youre done for, lol

16.9 oz. bottle courtesy of a trade with douglas88.  Pours a cloudy brown with a moderate off-white head that lasted until about mid-glass and left partial lacing.  Pleasant aroma of caramel, grain, and sour fruit.  Very nice bright flavor with caramel, bananas, tart cherries, and grain all present.  Very smooth at the finish with a well-rounded mouthfeel. The alcohol was very well hidden.  I really enjoyed this beer.

World class beer! Reddish brown hazy colour with huge white head. Aroma of dark fruits, candy, banana and clove. Creamy smooth body. Massive taste of banana, caramel, wheat and some alcohol all finished with a long bitterness. I want more!

beautiful aroma with a hint of caramel or something chocolatey and sweet like it. 
A slow pour produced a lasting, massively froth filled head.  The appearance was a brilliant dark brown/amber in my dissapointlingly weak beer glass.

bottle..  dark ruby to light brown pour. thin white head, little lacing. aroma of bananas ,clove and raisins or dark fruit.
sweet malt ,yeast ,clove ,caramel ,and raisin flavors. finishes dry and sweet .medium bodied and lively carbonation .

Very nice beer...poured a dark cloudy brown with nice tan head that had nice retention...Aroma was terrific, nice aroma of bannana, alot of clove, dark roasted grains.....flavor was the same. Medium carbonation. Would have again...

Bottle, dark red. Big head, two fingers. Smells sweet. Flavor that is all over the place. Sweet malt, raisons, spices, wheat, and a nice touch of caramel. Really smooth and easy to drink. Overall good beer!

medium dark brown with red highlights. haziness develops as the yeast is introduced.  its topped by a big  fluffy off white head. sweet malty aroma with notes of yeast, wheat, raisins, flowers/light banana esters and something piney. fruity dark raisin and malt flavors dominate over chocolate, wheat, spice, yeast and finally banana (only after yeast is added). lots of sweetness but its not overbearing. alcohol shows up on the finish along with a salty yeast hint. medium to full bodied with a rich smooth mouth feel.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2010 Bottle. Pours brown with a very long lasting beige head. Malty aroma with notes of raisin and wheat. Medium body, very mellow and smooth. Flavor is again malty. Starts with dark fruit and yeast, then a hint of spicy clove and raisin, followed by a dry, sweet, fruity finish, with notes of banana and citrus fruit. Original Rating:3.9 
Re-rate: Pours brown orange with a beautiful beige head. The aroma has banana, clove, and a hint of vanilla. The flavor has fruity banana like notes and some clove like spices, with some vanilla, citrus, and dark fruits hiding underneath. Wonderful, one of my favorite beers.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2012 Aventinus is a dark brown beer with a medium and blond head. Aroma is quite sweet, wheat, carnation and spices, hint of toffee. Taste is quite sweet, toffee, sourness balancing the sweetness nicely, also some belgian impression of spicyness and dark fruis. Medium bodied, lots of carbonation but that is smooth, nice to drink. Pleanty of different nuancees from different beer styles, but still the beer is very balanced.

50 cl bottle...Nice reddish brown w/ a fizzy white head. Nose was very heavy on molasses, caramel, and dough. The flavor was of caramel, and dried dark fruits. Very sweet , light and short finish. Overall, a very drinkable beer.

50 cl bottle.  More brown than ruby in color, and nicely hazy with a generous off-white head.  Aroma is subtle to me, more so than expected.  Nice carbonation and lovely mouthfeel.  Well balanced overall.  Caramel malt, slight cloves, dried fruits, even banana bread (as my wife pointed out) on the back of the palate.  Pleasant sourness. In a word: delicious.

50 cL bottle. Pours slight hazy light brown with an off-white head. Wheaty, fruity and mild grainy aroma. Clove like flavour embedded in a solid wheat flavour, light caramel malt and a lingering almost dried fruity note. Ends with a lingering caramel malt and wheaty blend, mild note of spice inbetween. I like the way the wheat is downplayed - but it is still a wheat beer more than anything else.

Pours like a dream with enough head, but not too much.  Beautiful smell and texture to the beer.  If you want to get a healthy buzz going on with just a few pick this up.  Fair warning: this perfect beer comes at a price.  But truely one of the best German beers out there.

Bottle. Pours barely translucent, hazy ruby brown. Aroma is spicey, mild yeast funk and wheaty grain. Definite fruit notes in aroma, as well - cherry, raspberries, some sour fruit. Flavor is soft bread, fruit notes of raisin & citrus peel, slight sweet, light nuttiness.  Finish has mild alcohol, light bitterness and doughy flavors. Extremely well-structured beer.

Wow.  This is a phenomenal beer.  I thought I had good Weizenbocks before this one... dang.  Malty aroma with some fruit in the flavor profile.  I can taste the "sour impression" in the finish.  Great beer.

A dark brown beer thats cloudy with a large off white lasting head. The aroma is thick and malty, fruity and a little spice with a hint of cocoa. The flavor is strong and like dark wheat malt and spice and chocolate with a hint of alcohol. The finish is a little hard. No lacing on the glass.

UPDATED: FEB 29, 2008 Pours dark ruby with BIG lasting head. Impressive appearance. Mostly wheat and somewhat malty aroma. Nice rounded fullness for something so wheat-y! Like Dirk Nowitzki, it is a great German creation!

Egy nagyszerű erős dupla búza bak sör!Sötét vörösesbarna színe és pergamen színű habja is jelzi hogy nem mindennapi főzet!Kortyolva egyből melenget az alkohol de nem tolakodik.Ízében ott a mazsola,füge és valami érdekes fűszerezetség.Kellemesen pezsgősen buborékos,élénk.Kint esik a hó,bent duruzsol a kandalló,csendben szól a zene és az ember a lángokat bámulva elmereng az élet dolgain,miközben néha bele-bele kóstol ebbe a szépségbe.Valahogy így kéne vele bánni!

Bottle.   Pours exactly like the picture, brown with a decent off white colored head.   Aroma is banana, caramel, raisin, yeast.   Flavor is again banana, caramel, yeast, light alcohol.   palate is medium bodied, medium carbonation, finished sweet.   Excellent.
Schneider Aventinus is excellent. Aroma is of banana with a strong hint of wheat. The flavor is mainly of fruit and wheat with a little bit of an alcohol taste
pint bottle pours brownish -amber with a thick off white head.  Aroma of spice, bananas, yeast , and fruitiness.  Flavor is sweet bananas, ripe fruits, spice.  There is a nice bitterness at the end.

Draught at Bar Great Harry.  Poured into the smaller (33 cl.) Aventinus glass.  Dark brown with a frothy off-white head.  Cookie malt aroma with clove and some fresh hay.  Smooth sweet malt flavors accented by the basic banana yeast profile and a slight wheaty/lemony tartness.  Lively carbonation.  Nice tasting classically rounded flavors, though I cant say Im overly floored in the end.

Bottle. Pours deep hazy brown with a moderate off white head. Smells of clove and sweet malt. Taste is rich and strong with pleny of sweet but balanced with an alcohol finish. On the tounge there is a nice sensation and airy mouth feel. A very nice Doppelbock.

Pours a very nice, dark brown that is a tid bit murky. It smells of spices. It taste of spices and licorice and is a little bit to sweet for my taste. I did enjoy the palate, it left a nice sensation on the tongue and had a slight warming. Overall I would say that it was an ok beer but I have had better, just not my style.
Letdown.  I thought it was too thin.  Taste is sweet with malt, molasses.  Little bittering finish.  I appreciated the beer but expected more.

Its hard not to be affected by the hype, but this beer has lots of hype and I was eagerly anticipating this one. Aventinus pours darker apple cider brown color with a huge head that dissipates very quickly. Bananas and clove are readily present in this one (lots of banana). Beer really sweetens as it warms as banana flavor goes nuts with some bubblegum thrown in. Increases in complexity dramatically as it warms.
Bottle. Very nice dark brownish pour with a ncie medium head. Smell is of banana and clove. Taste is of banana and strong clove. Quite light and refreshing.

good color...hints of cherry and fruit give it a  nice flavor but on the palate this particular one left a heavy taste like that of a hint of cough syrup...not enough to throw the batch away, but noticeable nonetheless

A great beer overall.  The pour is a gorgeous deep ruby/amber color.  The head is a wonderfully thick and frothy off white.  The flavors are a complex mix of yeasty bred and caramels with slight citrus hop notes underneath, and a hint of plum?  The aftertaste is something that not many people will forget.  Nice and smooth with just about the right amount of carbonation.  It does leave a bit of a stickyness in your mouth as part of the after effects.
500ml from fourwinds,pensacola...smooth as slik and flavor for days...like the eisbock better but still not one to miss...

Pours a dark brown color with a large tan head.  Has a wonderful malt-wheat aroma.  The taste is a wonderful blend of bock and weizen (imagine that!) that works amazing well.  I love dunkelweizens, but this is even better.

Poured from a 22 oz bottle into a Rogue pint glass. 

Gorgeous off-white head of 2 fingers. Beer takes on an appetizing dark caramel hue. 

Smells like BANANA BREAD. Banana from the wheat, bread from the malt: literally smells exactly like banana bread. 

The taste follows the smell but carries some spiciness and a hint of maple syrup. The 8.2% alcohol becomes apparent as the beer warms. 

This beer strikes a balance between the warmth of the alcohol and the refreshingness that comes with any good weissbier. Leaves the mouth a bit sticky though. 

Less drinkable than a hefeweizen, more drinkable than a doppelbock, imagine that! Wish there was a 4.25 for this category, but gave it the benefit of the doubt.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2009 Pours dark cloudy prune color, decent head for the style.  Flowery, fruity, yeasty aroma.  Tastes of fruit (specifically pears) and yeast combine with a champagne consistency to make for a unique experience.  Good beer.
Not my cup of tea, but very interesting.  Chocolates and plums and spices.  Bit too fruitcake like for my liking.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2008 Hazy pour with a deep prune color. Nose is flowers, fruit (pears, blueberry), and significant amounts of yeast.  Taste is adventurously sweet and strong, but comfort is found in a familiar wheat and clove notes.  Carbonation dancing on the tongue with a spritzer palate similar to brews made by Unibroue. Lingers sweet.  Incredibly Satisfying. One of the best wheat beers, period.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2011 Bottle. Pours a red/brown with a nice creamy head. The aroma is mostly dark fruit, some alcohol, malts, and some sweet caramel. The taste is really great; raisins, banana, cloves, some sweet and soft malts, a sort of bitterness combined with a great alcohol bite. Really a great mouthfeel and body. Awesome! Overall, a top beer. One of the best. Re-rate: Pours a cloudy mahogany color with a large Grey head. The aroma is rich Belgian-like fruity and spicy malts and yeast. A smooth rich flavor of raisins, cherries, some heat, dry earthy grains, banana esters. Lovely.

Tried this beer at the suggestion of a local beer store owner.  The appearance was very nice deep brown with an off-white head.  The aroma was a sweet malt, which was backed up by the taste.  Mouthfeel was very good.  I could not detect the alcohol at all.  A very good beer.

Bottle at the White Horse, Parsons Green, 18th Jan 08. Pours a hazy mid brown with a big, persistent white head. Great glass too. Very strong sweet aroma of vanilla and cloves. Very smooth on the tongue, with a sweet chocolatey malt taste. Overall, a lovely beer.

Very differenet. Aroma is almost exclusively banana and vanilla. Appearance is a hazy monochromatic brown with a large off-white head with excellent retention and lacing. Flavor is rich in clove and quite sweet. Goes down like syrup (in a nice way). A pretty sophisticated beer. Some of my less expirianced friends (not that I am too expirianced) said that it tasted a lot like bubblegum. Overall quite nice, but not something you could drink a lot of.

Pours a seriously dark amber with a nice big, off-white head. The aroma is pretty unique... typical weizen characteristics, big banana and clove, but with dark fruits coming through as well. The flavor is more typical weizen, but one of the better that Ive had.... some cola in the finish. Great mix of weizen with a dark beer... highly recommended.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours a dark amber with a small off-white head and a smell of yeas, grains, citrus and banana. The flavor is dominated by banana, with yeast and citrus too, mainly fresh and slightly sweet it is. The finish is slightly sweet and hoppy bitter. Very nice!
Incredible flavor... perfect balance of the two styles. Absolutely world class.

Dark murky red/brown weak head not much lacing(small) good carbonation.Aroma spicey,wheat,malty,pleasant fruit also cloves,flavour,nutty,grainy,vanilla or tangy sweet caramel,syrup like mix ,finish,sweet spice very pleasant beer to drink at 8.2% al vol.

Bottle 50cl. Creamy, stable head, carbonation is very small for a weizen but matches to the beer. Smells like dry fruits, raisins. Taste is full-bodied, never had a Weizenbock with this complexity and harmony. Great stuff!

bottle......pours a transparent caramel brown with very little in terms of head....aroma of dark fruit, cloves, and banana. a lot of weiss qualities.... flavors of spritzy dark fruits and again very weisslike attrbibutes. well carbonated and easily drinkable....its hard not to like this one although the style isnt my favorite.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2010 [2002 Vintage] Murky brown pour with big bubbles and a medium foamy white head.  
Chocolate aroma and some fruit and alcohol.  
Tastes like a liquid tootsie-roll!.  Toffee and banana flavors.  Very nicely balanced.  Palate is great, not too carbonated, nor too watery or sticky either.   8.4.9.4.18 . . . . .. [rerate 6.17.10]  8.4.8.4.16, soapy, boozy, nutty

Aroma:Phenolic, with spices, banana, with some cocoa, and carmel in the backround.  poured brown with a small white head that quickly disipated, I poured it the same as I have poured other beers, maybe the bottle is a little old?  Flavor is spicey and estery, with hints of carmel and coca, and a clean hop bitterness towards the finish.  Great active mouthfeel that makes your tougue feel alive and works well with the flavor of the beer.  slightly disappointed with this, but maybe I need a fresher bottle, its happend to me with other European beers too.
Pours dark caramel, with thin head, moderate carbonation.  Spicy aroma of cloves.  Rich and thick, perfectly balanced. Smooth with little hint of the alcohol level.
Tap at Blind Tiger NYC. Lots of banana in the aroma.  Some alcohol hits immediately.  A little too sweet of an aftertaste.  Lots of depth though, I really like it.

The bottle looks good, very different than the weizenbottles from that brewery. Aroma very hefeweizen-like. Flavor the same. Tastes simply like a dark hefeweizen, where is the bock? I think it tastes too much like weizen. Ive exspected more.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2008 I love this beer.   Extremely well balanced.  What a beautiful combination of sweet malts, earthy fruits and spices.   My favorite German beer, maybe my favorite beer.

Note:  Had the aged (2002) Aventinus Easter Night, which was appropriate, since it tasted like Jesus died and was resurrected in this beer.  Would rate it a 4.9 (not using this rating since most people will have the non-aged variety).  Beautifully smooth, the beer had a ton of complexity and a much more vineous qulaity than non-aged Aventinus.  Bottle cap had slight rusting, and there were large amounts of sediment.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2008 1pint 6 oz. bottle, Soda pop! looks like soda, tastes kinda like if there was a soda out there with mix fruits and wheat flavor this would be it! Poured a dark cocacola looking with off white creamy head. smells like wheat and fruits. Tastes like I said before, the alcohol is hidden perfectly. Smooth and refreshing, might be to smooth. Very good overall. Id say this is my top German beer, easy to drink, good taste, enjoyable.

Aventinus is my current favorite beer. I ordered one at a restaurant, and oh boy did I ever enjoy it. At about 11 bucks for a beer, I ordered several. This is a fantastic beer. The taste was of fruits and some clove, with a hint of bitterness. You can find some hints of caramel in the taste as well.

This one poured a caramel brown color with a small tan head. This had a very nice aroma of dark fruits, banana, clove, and sweet malts. The flavor is much the same with the sweet malts and dark fruits pushing through at first with some spices. I also get soem chocolate and caramel in there as well. Just a really full flavored bock. This is medium bodied that finished smooth with a touch of bitterness on the back end. This is just really well done, but I expect that from these guys. Ill be coming back to this one often.

Pours hazy mahogany with a finger of quickly dissipating fizzy head.  Aroma of banana, apple, wheat, caramel, vanilla, and spicy clove.  Flavor is wheaty with a caramel backbone.  Vanilla, clove, and cinnamon also present.  Flavor is a bit thin for my liking.  Palate is medium bodied with a slightly dry finish.  Not bad, but I was expecting more.  Maybe Im just not well acquainted with weizenbocks...

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2008 Garrafa, em 2008. Âmbar escura (marrom), com creme bege médio. Notas de canela, cravo, banana e amêndoas. A consistência é um pouco mais densa que as demais Schneider. O álcool é muito bem inserido. Drinkable. Equilibrada e complexa. Muito boa.
Strong malt aroma with slight amount of apples. Very dark brown color with a small white head. Thick malty flavor mellowing in the finish

Definitely my favorite beer right now and the best Weizenbock Ive ever had. The caramel/raisin/vanilla flavors are excellent. The taste is even more impressive when you consider it has an 8.2% alcohol content.

From bottle : Pours a hazy dark brown, with a nice smooth finger of white head.  Pretty nice lacing as well.  Very aromatic, with wheat, bananas,  chocolate, malts, and tons of other smells that i cant put my finger on.  Taste isnt quite as exciting as the smell, but it still has plenty to offer.  Wheat and some fruits, leaves a slight bitter sourness in the mouth on the aftertaste.  Medium body, smooth feel on the palate, nice beer.

,33L. Brand new bottle. Pours just the faintest turn of the color wheel shy of dead solid black, with a dense if not massive heavy tan mousse. Decent film left, decent lace. Nice forward malty brown bread on the nose, caramel and maple showing. Medium body that still attains full-fledged velvetiness. Soft fizz. Sweet swirling malt flavors of seemingly every kind roar to life on the mid-palate: caramel, maple, vanilla bits, very soft roasty caramelization, and some brown and black bread. Dense and complex but still clean and easy drinking on that svelte lager yeast. This bottle died as a baby and I still cant imagine running out of good things to say about this beer.
UPDATED: JAN 4, 2008 yummy dis german tasty! yummee yum yum i like the malty delish taste!  mm mmmm good!
Smells like olives; maybe I got a bad bottle?  Ill have to try this again.

One of my favourite beers...what can i say....i judge all other wheat beers against this (slightly unfair i know) but its just great. huge flavours, chocolate, bananas, cloves, stone fruit....stalky raisins? massive body a pleasure to drink!

Bottle via Irishkyle21. Apperanace is murky chestnut/iced tea. Head quickly dies. Nose is bready with banana phenols. Taste- very subtle mix of flavours. Caramel, bready, slightly fruity. Some chocolate and spices. Creamy mouthfeel, high medium to high carbonation. Finishes quite dry. Some booze is picked up at the finish. Great beer to start christmas eve off with.

2000 vintage, poured into hefe-weizen glass from the Galgen Hölzle in Ueberlingen.

Pours a dark amber color with a thick head, but is more fizzy than creamy as you would expect. Head slowly receded and left only a ring around the glass and no lacing. Much more of a caramel and chocolate aroma, with subdued spices and hints of banana. I find more molasses, chocolate, caramel, bread, with only a little bit of banana. Taste is definately much more mellowed after nearly 6 years, but it is pretty nicely blended. Seems a little light and watery by now with almost no carbonation. Still a good beer but it just seems to be lacking compared to a fresher bottle.

Pours a muddy cider colour with a big white head that dies quick with no lacing. Smells much like apples, some dark fruit, and spicy clove. Taste as it smells with a nice hybrid of flavors going on. Very mild and somewhat creamy in the mouth. Very drinkable with no ABV noticeable.

0.5l bottle. Pours a really thick brown, with visible carbonation. Frothy finger-width head. Aroma is very pungent, smelling mostly of wheat and yeast, but also a little fruity. Palate is a little thick but quite smooth. Leaves a slight tingling on the tongue. Tastes fluctuates a lot, mostly between wheat, alcohol, banana and cloves. Fantastic.
UPDATED: DEC 24, 2007 bouteille brune de 500ml, belle bière brune -rouge orangé, nez de blé, sucre-brun, caramel, goût agréable, rond, finale de chocolat avec cerise au marasquin, exquis.
Yes.  A beautiful brew that was well worth the wait.  Tasted this fine brew at a great little place in Media, PA called Quotations.

(Bottle) Pours a brown color with a good-sized tan head. Yeast, light fruity notes, and yeast in the aroma. Fantastic malty backbone, with the typical hefe yeast flavors mixed in. Spice and caramel notes as well. I didnt get any sour notes. Fine carbonation and great mouthfeel. The alcohol is well masked. An excellent beer!

Poured from large sized bottle into a regular pint glass.  The aroma was a compelling mixture of wheat and yeast, but also some dark fruit hops, and maybe a bit of caramel and chocolate hops.  The beer was a cloudy brown-orange color with a lightly foamy, tan head with average retention.  Pleasant taste, mostly bitter and a bit sour, with an alcohol kick at the finish.  Some tastes of fruit and chocolate.  The beer was quite fizzy and carbonated, with a medium to light body and mouthfeel.  Its a great beer and an interesting combination of styles that was well compiled.
Beautiful dark red/ruby colour. Robust and sweet, with a refreshingly dry aftertaste. A rare top-fermented bock beer.

One of the great beers in the world, incredibly smooth with complex flavors that last and last. My favorite double bock (Celebrator being #2) that I insist on having at least once/week. Great with dessert!

OK, so this was pretty good for a wheat beer, and the darkness factor helps that along.  Its smooth and has all the banana and clove taste and all that, but maybe a little too smooth.  I wasnt picking up much of a smell.  Very well respected brew, but a little too bland for my taste.

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2013 [Bottle] Pour reddish brown with a lingering creamy head.  Aroma is clove, banana, some wheat, a little chocolate, and at times there is a very faint apple-like scent too. Taste is about the same with a tiny bit of alcohol present. Fairly thick--but I would like to see it just a little thicker, good finish. A very nice beer. Old rating: 8/5/8/4/17 = 4.2Re-rate:  [Bottle, labeled as "Tap 6"> Wow, even better than I remember. Lovely integration of banana and dark fruits with perfect full, creamy mouthfeel. Outstanding.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2008 (bottle, thanks OSLO) Pours brown with a nice light tan head.  Aroma is just great with a large amount of banana, light clove, wheat, and when the beer warms the aroma switches to caramel and light chocolate, slight toasty notes, with an undertone of banana.  The flavor itself is wonderful, with a nice dose of banana, spice, light caramel, and a toasty taste too.  Fairly thick mouthfeel, what a great beer.

This is the 2000 vintage Aventinus:

I bought this bottle in Wisconson on my last beer run right before Christmas. Im excited to try an aged Aventinus and wonder what the differences are between the 5 to 6 year aged and the original. I dont know if its because of the aging process, but there is a little white powderof some sort around the rim underneath the cap.

The beer pours out a little less head than a fresh hefeweizen, but I can only guess that that is due to the aging process. The lacing is a little less pronounced. The same dark brown color is present, but looks more inviting.

Smell is very spicy and very fruity and flavorful. Its excellent! It has so many flavors like raspberry. Its very mellow with a little more coffee tone.

The taste is familiar, but with slightly different tones. I taste a dark fruit that is light. I also taste clove with a hint of nutmeg.

Mouthfeel is smooth with a slight carbonation.

Drinkability is good, but to find another 2000 is most likely impossible.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2008 re-rated:  old rating 6/5/8/4/16 - 3.9
purchased at wine a little in port orchard, washington
pour is dark brown with a ruby tint, large, thick, foamy egg-shell head, good lacing.
smell is of smoke, wheat, yeast, hint of cocoa, roasted malt, spice. 
taste is prunes and raisens, bitter-sweet chocolate, wheat, malts, spice, pepper.

wow - really heavy fruity aroma with a scent of baking bread(!)  You can also smell the alcohol in the background...Solid head - leaves moderate lacing...a bit fizzy but not overpowering...an aftertaste of apples or pears??  The yeast reminds me of a lot of homebrewed wheats Ive tasted - much more fruity than your average bear...a lingering taste of banana follows after the citrus fades.  I didnt detect as much cloves as others have posted - but I may be mingling it in with the fruity description in error...this is a fantastic brew.

Special treat for Fall Blowout! (Last day of Fall classes at William and Mary). Without a doubt the best beer Ive ever had. Took forever to pour because of the huge head that developed. Strong, dark, and fruity. Delicious! I could drink this everyday if I could afford it.

Complexa. Aroma com notas de chocolate e cereais amanhecidos. Coloração vinho escuro, com uma espuma densa e sempre presente. Muito bonita de se ver. O sabor é frutado, densa na boca e suave no gole. Um espetáculo. Forte, sem a presença do alcool no sabor. Vale a pena ter no estoque para os dias de comemoração.

I had it on tap, it had a thick white head and exuded many aromas.  Even with its high alcohol content it was masked with its strong taste.  I really enjoyed this beer, but i could only find it in NYC.  I am still unable to find it on Long Island.  The appearance is one of the best you can see why.

Dec. 3, 2007; bottle.  A Weizen Bock masquerading as a Belgian Quad. Dark-fruity & startlingly aromatic; rich head.  Tart, with a slightly-sour (but pleasantly so) palate. Very much reminds me of Ommegangs Three Philosophers. A way-above-average brew that Id like even more if it was a bit heartier.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2008 Bottle - Purple body with a medium head. Delicious oak-malt aroma with hints of cherry and brandy. Huge apple-brandy flavour with a suprisingly short finish. The Alcohol content is well disguised. Nice winter beer.
bottle.  very sweet aroma and delightfully well balanced sweet taste.  excellent malt notes, i did not experience the "sour impression".
Ruby red, rich malt, cherries, very little hop profile but perfectly working in the background to balance the malt.  I love this beer.

Pours a very dark brown.  Aroma of banana and dark chocolate.  One of the best dopplebocks I have ever tasted.  There is a rich chocolate maltiness that is balanced out with a hints of banana and citurs fruits. Yummy!

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2008 Had this on tap at the Blind Tiger (NYC), where it was called a wheat doppelbock.  I am stunned that this is apparently a kind of wheat beer - it seemed more like a Belgian ale.  I tasted sweet malt, clove, other spices, a little peat - even something like prunes or bruised fruit.  This was crisp, rich, and robust.  As it warmed, the flavors came out to play, and I sipped it like a fine wine.  A unique beer experience - more Aventinus, please!

On draft at the Beer Engine, quite a find in Ohio. Strong and sweet flavor, with a very complex and spiced overtone. Little or no head, as it has a higher alcohol content. Has a strange bubblegum like tone-- but one of my favorites

Deep rust colored with small head.  Smells of pippin apples & cinnamon.  Taste is nicely yeasty (bubblegum & almond flavors intensified by residual sweetness).  Not cloying. Thin feel, with not enough roast or hops to enjoy more than a few sips with some pie.

A solid beer in a somewhat underrated and under-represented style.  No surprise that Schneider did such a fine job.

As described - a beautiful ruby red color that pours a very foamy head.  Head did not last very long - it looked like the quick-dispersing foam that you get on a soda.  Aroma has mild clove notes from the wheat yeast.  Pleasant but a bit less pungent than I had expected.  Flavor is perfect - full body, malty sweetness and just a touch of caramel.  I got the slightest bitterness on the finish.  Spectacularly rounded, delicious flavor.  A nice way to close out Thanksgiving night.

Pours a deep, deep robust looking color with a very, very off white -huge- head.  It did smell of traditional wheat style, full of clove and banana, but this added a slightly different feel with it dark appearance.  It was more full bodied, but also had a sour impression near the back 1/3.  It was good, but just not my style.

dark amber with a giant head (caught me by suprise..made a mess)..aroma of dried fruits and spices...light sour also in the aroma...very smooth caramel malt taste with a great finish...1st weizen bock but wont be the last

Nice nice nice looking. Complex aroma of fruits which was misleading concerning taste. First sip the alc% is apparent but as you drink on its not so obvious. sip after sip the 8.2% taste disappears leaving a crisp taste. I wouldnt go as far as to say its one of my favorites or all time best but its good, real good.

very nice amber, ruby color with a great head on the pour.   very sweet malty smell along with some notes of dried fruit mainly apricot.  very thin on the palate considering the color and the fruit really stands out over anything else.

Poured a HUGE head. Amber/red. So much banana in both the aroma and taste. Also, a decent amount of clove. Alcohol is very noticeable, and detracts a little bit. Pretty smooth, nice palate. Seriously, so much banana. It was remarkable that it was still good, drinkability definitely suffered however. Would certainly drink again, but not for awhile.
A top ten beer of all time for me. Full of rich fruits and spice, balanced, and absolutely divine.
This was gorgeous. My first dunkel weizen (bock). The wheat flavor was there and it was very balanced by the maltiness and fruitiness. Nice slightly sour finish. I want more.
this is a great brew,excellent for its class, pours a ruby brown with big white head, taste is very sweet along with its aroma.
Simply one of the best beers I have ever had. Rich full flavor and just the perfect example of a dark wheat beer.

500mL bottle into weizen glass. Pours a cloudy dark amber with a thick white head that laces beautifully. Heavy aromas of bananas, yeast, wheat are present with a hint of oranges. Wonderful flavors of banana, nuts, wheat and a sweet cherry finish. The flavor seems to come forth more as the warms slightly. Mouthfeel is SMOOTH and velvety. I thought the Orval I had before this was good, but this is awesome.

Bottle.  Pours a deep rich amber in color with a sweet fruity aroma.  There is quite a bit of carmely sweetness to this beer with a bit of toasty malt.  There is just enough hop bite to balance the sweetness.  The wheat flavor is there in the background but well masked compared to a standard Weizen.  Very good.

500ml bottle. Cant believe it took so long for me to try this one. I suck. Beautiful caramel soda colored body with a full, dense off white head. Around 2 fingers thick before it finally backs off a bit. Nose is concentrated and awesome: huge blasts of citrus fruits, bananas, clove, wheat, peppery spice and a nice earthy note that I cant quite pinpoint. The flavor isnt a let down in the slightest, with following notes of banana, clove, wheat and spices. Also a pleasing sweetness ends up at the back of the throat once swallowed. Medium bodied, very creamy palate. Finish is lengthy, full of wheat and fruits, and then that same nice caramel sweetness. Outstanding beer. This would be a fridge staple for me if I could find it every day for $2.99 or less.
Syrupy caramel pour with a fluffy two finger white head.  Aroma is of banana and cloves with a strong hint of wheat.  The flavor is mainly of fruit and wheat with a dash of alcohol.  Excellent beer.
Hazy brown colour with large head.Aroma is fruity and spicey with nice taste of wheat aswell,but with strong hidden alc.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2017 Re-rate 3/17: Bottle sample at a tasting at Tom Ls place. Thanks Vova. 2012 bottle. Sweet, oxidized, caramel, honey, fruitiness, a bit of cardboard. Not bad, but too old. Score not calculated. 6/3/7/3/14=3.3

Bottle (Thanks a lot Roman!). Hazy (although not cloudy) deep brown color with a huge but fully-diminishing beige head with huge bubbles - beautiful appearance. Aroma of wheat, caramel, banana, toast, some alcohol, and maybe some notes of dark fruits. Sweet flavor of malt, caramel, wheat and some fruitiness. A dry finish with alcohol, spices, and some acidic notes. Medium to full body with lots of carbonation. Great stuff. 8/5/7/4/15=3.9

Bottle. A very dark amber beer, with a nice foamy but dismiss fast, too bad to a nice beer. Aroma is sweety and fruity notes of banana. Flavor is balanced bitter and sweet fruity (banana again), also can percept the carbonation and alcohol. Mouthfeel is long and bitter dry. Unfortunatelly this rare and expansive to find this beer here in Brazil. Português: Cerveja De cor Âmbar escura com uma espuma bonita e grande mas some muito rápido. Aroma doce e frutado com notas de banana, sabor equilibrado entre o doce frutado(banana novamente) e o amargo, percebe-se a alta carbonatação e o álcool. Retrogosto prolongado seco e amargo. Infelizmente é uma cerveja rara no Brasil e cara!
Lovely dark wheat beer, with tones of raisins and cloves. Aroma like fruit and molasses. Really a pleasant beer, although it goes down fairly heavy.
Sweet malty brew with a strong rich flavor and a very pleasant aftertaste thats not too bitter. Beautiful color and aroma that pours a nice but not exceptional head.
UPDATED: JUL 9, 2010 Quite sweet, poured a thick generous head that lingered for ages. Very smooth but a strong alcoholic presence. Highly recommended

Not brown, not red, not red/brown. Absolutely beautiful what ever color it is. 
I don’t remember ever hearing a head diminish. All that commotion and it still takes longer to drop than an American lager.
This beer has an aroma that instantly sparks the candle that lights so many memories. 
Thick and rich with all the flavor a true Weizen lover yearns for. Its sweet and then sweet with hints of sweet. Then to add to that is this tangy caramel and sour dough finish that leaves you wondering why this isn’t prescribed as in place of Prozac. 
I am quite upset that this is the only pint I have on hand.

Pours in a brown/orange color.  The flavors include banana, clove, nut - and others that I had a tough time distinguishing.  Very interesting feel and taste, but not the type of beer I would want to repeat in the same night.  The aftertaste is bitter/harsh.

500ml Bottle from Bevmo. Pours a cloudy brown with an orange tint. The head was off-white and quickly disappeared, too quickly (Extra appearance point deducted for no head). The aroma was light in strength with notes of raisins, nuts, caramel, malts and vanilla. The flavor was distinguished with ripe bananas and plums in the forefront and walnuts and vanilla filling in the sides. The mouthfeel was full and satisfying with lively carbonation. The finish was long and sweet with vanilla. Overall: this is a beer for the ages. Recommended.

How is it that Ive managed to log in nearly a thousand reviews and miss this beer? Ive had this a dozen times or more, and for some reason I just checked and havent reviewed it. So to fix that oversight, Ive popped the cap on a bottle and plan to review. 

The nose on this beer is really, really insane. There are complexities everywhere. I could pick up notes of overripe bananas, toffee, milk chocolate, raisins, caramel and the wheat notes. Appearance is clear with a reddish brown hue, almost diet cola in color with a nice off-white head. Flavors are equally solid as the nose and combine damn near in perfect harmony. Sweet malts, banana, dark overripe fruit, toffee, caramel with a subtle bite of alcohol to remind you that its an 8% beer. Excellent beer. I highly recommend you getting one wherever you can.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2007 2002 cave aged bottle. I will start by saying I love Aventinus so trying the 2002 cave aged example was a treat. It pours dark brown with some sediment and a large head.  Aroma has the sweetness and wheat of normal Aventinus. The flavor seems more complex. There is the sweetness but also more malt and bannanas. wonderful mouthfeel and great aftertaste. This does add a point or two over the normal unaged.
This is a great beer. Dark and easy to drink. Very rich flavor so many  aspect to it in the mouth, sweet, bitter, smoky.and back again

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2008 500ml bottle. (Alvar, Turku)
Hazy reddish brown, tight cream head. Not as bananaey as I remember it, but its definitely there on the nose, along with a sweet brown maltiness. Smooth and lively on the tongue. Banana is also in the taste, but the majority of that is a sticky-sweet spicy malt body. Im not going to say coriander, but there certainly is a hint. All of that hangs around in the mouth for ages. Alas this one was a bit alcoholic - Ive had ones which were smooth and barely alcoholic.
Wow you twits finally gave a German beer its deserved rating...... I guess Germans arent the cause of all things evil in the world......

Wow, this is a solid beer.  Pours out a nice reddish brown color with a large white head.  Aroma is sweet with a nice hop malt to it.  flavor has cloves, caramel and a slight bitterness to the finish.  This was a great brew.

Bottle. Sweet malt, liquor, honey, light alcoholic. Dark cloudy red-brown body, small off-white foamy head. Moderate sweet & bitter finish, long duration. Medium to full body, oily & creamy texture, soft carbonation.
Bottle is perfect for pouring.  Dark brown, with good head that fades quickly.  Soda-like but with good wheat flavor.  Clean good soft fruity flavor.

A cool "smoke" effect when poured. Cloudy tannish brown. Lots of head, I had to come back a minute later to finish pouring the bottle. Smell a lot of fruit. Thick finish. I taste the cloves about a minute out from the end of my sip. Good beer for a casual dinner/sit-down, but I could not imagine drinking more than two bottles at a time. (pretty thick)
user_location: Heart of the Rockies, Colorado, USA

text: Sweet and dark, fruity and malty.  A bit of the 8.2% peeks through but this beer ends with enough bitterness to avoid an over-sweet finish.

Bottle,
Ripe fruits and some spice on the nose,
Pungent spice and dark sugar on the palate, very pleasant

Hearty, bitter, malty, chocolate, fruity. A classic Weizenbock with a verty rich bitter fruity tase. Compared to the Australian beers I normallly have to put up with (not including Coopers or Little Creatures!) its a welcome change.
user_location: Somewhere in the Sout East of OZ, AUSTRALIA

text: UPDATED: SEP 17, 2011 Good color, very dark.  Amazing dark malt aroma.  Hints of coffee and chocolate.  Very robust flavor full of malt.  Fantastic.  Had it in the bottle at the brewery.

Sweet, fruity, and a tiny bit of caramel and banana aroma. The flavor is sweet, strong, with a powerful but not troublesum wheat hints, and lesser alcohol notes. It starts out as a light beer - even though its so strong, but the palate and alcohol stregth hits the palate and your overall experiance.  If only grading wheat beers, this might be the best. Unbelieveable finish-sweet malty goodness. Hops still at the bottom of the glass when i was finished, but finished more sweet than hoppy, very goood!

Bottle. Many, many bottles over the last 5 years.  God I love this stuff.  Banana sometimes wafts up a little too strong, but damnit this beer is a malty wet dream!  I have a man-crush for Mr. Schneider.  Oh, and his sons. Wonder how many sons he has anyway?  The mouthfeel is a fantastic vessel for the malt explosion; giving way itself to just a smattering of bitterness to prevent a cloying sweetness. I am drooling like Hooch!
good looking dark brown beer with wonderful aroma and thick lasting head. drinks easily as it has a nice carmel taste and malt smoothness. slighlty bitter.  one of the better doppelbocks i have had.
Ruby colored, huge poofy off-white head.  Smells of a hefeweizen with a bit of cinnamon and caramel.  Taste a bit of the alcohol, but its not too sweet, smooth mouthfeel.  Very good.

An absolutely gorgeous beer to look at - pours a wonderful deep garnet with a huge billowy wheat beer head. The nose tells you its a hefeweizen....and I will confess, hefeweizen isnt my favorite style. This one, with its caramel overtones and smooth mouthfeel, make it the best Ive had, but again, its not my cup of tea...OK, glass of beer. Why did I try it? Because Aventinus should be on every beer geeks "Must Try"list!

Une des bonnes bières fortes, avec 8,2% dalcool, son goût reste délicat.
Le dosage des épices et des fruits sont parfait. Cest un choix sur!!!

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2009 Exceptional appearance and aroma, and it smells unique: banana bread but also faintly like cherry pie. Almost opaque but not quite. Dark, reddish-brown color. Soft, pleasant mouthfeel. Creamy when it hits the mouth: absolutely delightful. Medium to full-bodied, malty but dry at the same time. Straightforward--solid--unpret Slightly alcoholic. Towards the end of the bottle, I swished the sediments out and added it to my glass, which immediately transformed the flavor, making the brew thicker, mellower, and less alcoholic although also sweeter, richer, smoother, and more pleasant. Draft at Munich. Intense murky brown with thick white head. Clean aroma oozes banana. Palate is smooth, the tap does wonders for the carbonation level/palate. Is fruity. 7-5-8-5-15

Wow. Bottle from Oliver Ts. Pours dark brown  with a beautiful lasting off-white foamy head. Aroma is of caramel, cloves, apples and cinnamon. Perfectly carbonated with a somewhat thick, creamy mouthful. Flavors present in aroma area all present in taste, along with raisins and wheat. I may have a new favorite beer.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2007 Bottle conditioned and courtesy of the LCBO. Beautiful deep ruby pout with a frothy white head. Scent is of cloves and cinamon. This is carried through in the flavour, which reminded me a bit of some of the Chimays. Pleasant warming feel.
UPDATED: NOV 29, 2007 On tap, pours a beautiful caramel brown shade, malty sweet nose and flavor, along with some caramel. Very clean finish. Awesome beer.

pours a ruby amber with a bubbly white head.  nose has roasted malt, some smoke, alcohol & spice.  flavor is a little smoky with some spice, clove, malt, & a nice little a dab of bannana.  mouthfeel is pretty smooth with a decent amount of carbonation.  not bad!
Lots of carmel and raisin here to satisfy the alcoholic sweet tooth in beer drinkers.  Very nice finish to boot, Ill have it again (several more times).

500 ml bottle: pours a cloudy dark brown with a good initial head, aroma is of typical wheat beers with a little roast malt, flavor is a wonderful wheat spicyness with underlying prune and raison, alcohol presence is felt after a while with a tremendous warming in the stomach which explains why the head disappears rather quickly, the body is lighter than most doppels but is delicious nonetheless. Hop presence is understated allowing the malt flavor to reign supreme. A great beer!
Ethan told me I was going to like this beer, and I wasnt dissapointed.  It had an engagingly strong/sweet initial taste and a euphoric aftertaste.  The head was big and thick.

From a 500 ml bottle this poured a rich and attractive red to brown color with a fat off-white head the lasted a long time and left good lacing rings as it slowly settled.  Nose of flowers, fruits like raisins and a hint of banana.  Smooth mouthfeel and and great flavors that mirror the nose with a hint of spices.  Slightly sweet caramel finish.  Superb brew.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2008 Original rating: 10/1/2007. Pours cloudy brown. Aroma of caramel, alcohol, ripe bananas, and a faint hoppiness. The flavour hits with toasted malt, banana, a caramel sweetness, and a sort of sweet and sour quality to it. The beer really begins to show as it warms. Many flavours that are drenched by the caramel and banana begin to crop up -- spices and mint. Clean, dry, alcohol warmth on the finish. Loads of character, medium bodied.
 6  4  8  3  17
  Rerate 4/6/2008. From bottle. Aroma of cream soda, banana and pineapple. Has a tropical feel to the smell. A little alcohol is detectable.
Cereal whacks the tongue. Loads of clove. Slight overripe banana taste. Fig. Pork crops up as it warms. Alcohol, sodium and yeast are also present. Flavour is more complex than it is pleasant, but it is still enjoyable. Medium bodied. Leaves a yeasty aftertaste.

50cl bottle with 8.2 ABV...could be trouble.  Poured a clear dark browne with a nice off-white head.  Very balanced bock where no flavors or alcohol content get out of control.  Enjoyable and a recommended bock.

Thickly brown with a light brown head. Sweet and malty aroma, malty-fruity center and a touch of booze. But awesome balance. Mild dusting of hops keeps the sweetness or alcohol from getting away. So very happy that I have a couple more in the cellar.

Bottle poured into a Avenitinus goblet. Pours a cloudy red/brown hued beer. Noticeable carbonation. Looks fantastic in the glass. A decent head forms.  Nose of fruits, raisins and plums. Has that aged smell about it. On the palate it is soft, and delicate, with dates and raisins in the ascendancy. A nicely malted taste with a balnced sweeteness. A beer for bocks to measure themselves against.
500 ml bottle purchased at Total Wine Fort Lauderdale, FL $2.99 Excellent & good prize/size.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2007 500ml.  How did I miss this when I lived in Germany?  Too cold at first, but a bit of warmth brought almost floral aromas, tightly integrated body with spice, clove, and maybe just a touch of menthol from the alcohol.  Be careful with this one!

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2011 500 ml bottle. poured dark brown with red edges and a medium sized off white that just kept on comin. aromas of wheat, spice, and dark fruits. great waves of complex flavours that get more pronounced as this beauty warms. reminds me of an abbey from the flavour profile to the warming effect it gives you. no trace of the 8.2% in the flavour but you know youve had one when you get to the bottom of the glass. a truely marvolous brew.
A great tasting beer, one of my favourites. Pours deep brown with spicy aroma. Nice creamy smooth finish.

500ml bottle. Beautiful deep ruby color, with a nose rich in prunes, clove, and raisins. A somewhat sharp beginning gives way to a sweet but complex palate. Alcohol evident, but not overwhelming. Dry finish leaves you wanting more. A very rewarding and interesting effort.

Capping my personal "trilogy" of Schneiders available at Bottle King, I saved the richest for last...deep purple mahogany body with a tremendous, lasting head--the doppel effect is clearly noticed...notes of perfume, flowers, grapes and cassis--complex...medium to full body with a soft finish...alcohol is only hinted at ( a slight wine burn?)...bubbles form gently around tongue...moderate to heavy acidic pressure...strong winish presence...overall, a confounding creation--a dark wheat abbey that really comes on like a merlot...the head adds flavor throughout the evening, and suddenly, like a wine, you realize how sneaky quick the good feeling of this brew is upon you...nicely done

Sampled at Cellars Wine & Spirits in St Paul, MN. Pours a semi-hazed dark brown amber brew with a thick off-white head that has good retuention and lacing. Aroma of caramel malt, some cloves and coriander, brown sugar and a touch of iced tea. Taste is medium bodied, lightly carbonated with flavors of yeast, sweet caramel malt and cloves. Finish is semi-sweet, smooth and a yeasty and alcohol aftertaste. Cool glassware!
[Sampled in 2005.] A big challenge, but a good one. Lots of complex notes, ex. whisky, stickyness, sharpness, alcohol, wheat, fullbodiness and a true warmer.

500mL bottle:  Sweet, fruity and spicy aroma.  Gorgeous frothy tan head on an opaque dark brown body, carbonation looks naturally occurring.  Flavor starts off sweet with notes of prune and cloves, dissipates and then dries off all the while leaving a smooth sensation.  You might even forget youre drinking beer!  Sensational palate.  Sensational brew.  Really wow.

Pour out a nice brown with ruby red elements to it with a thick tan head. Aroma is very much molassas, brown sugar, spices (cloves and corriander?), and yeast. Taste is very sweet but somehow smooth. Caramel jumps out at first as well as brown sugar, molassas and rum. Then a slight sour after effect after the sip is halfway down the throat. Alcohol is noticable but not overpowering, in fact the slight burn at the end of the sip adds a bit of character to the beer. Very nice beer and one that I could have occasionally with no problem. I will say that this is a bit too sweet for me normally but still an excellent work of art and very appreciated.
Banoner! Classic top ten of all time for me.  Gots to get one of those proper glasses (the big feckers) to drink this one.

2002 vintage: Pours a dark brown with hues a red. Has a quick dissipating white head. Has hints of figs, caramel, plums, dark fruits in general. Spices are balanced well with the carbonation. Alcohol is more evident than a typical aventinus. Saved and well worth opening.

( vintage 2002 )Pours a clear ruby color with no head. It has a perfect balance of fruity spiciness(banana, clove, vanilla, and plums).Also hints of chocolate  malts and sherry. Finishes with a smooth, creamy, warm alcohol taste on the tongue.

Flaske. Fantastisk. Flot dybrød farve med et kæmpe skum ovenpå. Kompleks og balanceret, med en smag der skriger efter mere. Tog mig selv i at drikke videre fra konens glas efter mit eget var tomt, indtil hun gjorde mig opmærksom på hun faktisk gerne selv ville have den. Lækker.

Pours a clear but dark ruby/brown. Light tan head. Nose is sweet with what seems like an inky tone to it. Yeslike pen ink. I feel like I am smelling the inside of a thoroughly wet barrel. Flavor is extremely sweet with a tart kick in the back of the mouth on the first swig. Sweet brandy and port tones permeate. Very sugary sweet on the flavor overall though. Feel is standard. Borders on slightly syrupy. Drinkable. Sure. But for me this is an experience drink, not one to go back to again. I had it, and I will move on.

Had this from the bottle at Emerald Coast Brew Fest in Pensacola, FL.  Poured an attractive caramel/brown color.  Had a nice white head that hung around a while.  Aroma is sweet, possibly of caramel and brown sugar.  Flavor is sweet up front, but finishes with a bit of a sour note.  Mouthfeel is good.  Drinkability is high for a beer with an abv north of 8%.  My first weizenbock.

(draft @ The Old Toad - Rochester, NY) Dark brown in color with a puffy tan head. Aroma is sweet with fruity notes and a touch of yeast and a little bit of alcohol. Flavor is extremely potent. Lots of yeast, sweet fruits, some banana flavor, and a touch of wheat at the end. Very creamy with a warming alcohol finish.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2007 The bottle pours dark brown good white head. Aroma of sweet fruity yeast, along with some caramel fill my nose. This has a wonderful creamy mouth feel with a slight tingle on the tongue. Great tastes of sweet banana, wheat, and a nice spice. The alcohol is well hidden 
 I have bought a quite few of these this summer and enjoyed them all

A excellent beer.  It pours a rich amber, caramel color with a persistent tan head.  The aroma is yeast and alcohol mostly.  Flavorwise it is full bodied yet balanced and creamy.  The main notes are of wheat, maltiness, and alcohol.  Definitely worth buying on a cold winters day.
Pours dark brown. Aroma is sweet and lightly fruity. Mouth feel is thicker with a caramel, sweet flavor. Alcohol tingle fills the mouth.

500 ML Bottle-Pours a dark amber/mahogany color w/a fairly large white head which faded to good lacing which lasted thru the beer. Floral wheat aroma. Definite wheat flavor on the front end w/traces of banana, bread dough & colander. Develops more of a roasted malt, almond, raisin, plum, Bock flavor at the finish. I flips back and forth between the two w/each drink. This was a very good beer. Long finish w/a full mouthfeel. Alcohol was well hidden.

Poured a dark amber/brown with golden highlights and a huge 2 fingers of tan head. The nose was of yeast, spice, clove, licorice and rye bread. The taste started with chocolate, followed by spice and clove. There is a slight earthiness apparent with just a hint of plum/raisin. A little wheat sourness appears before some banana and spicy yeast tones take back over. Everything in here has a nice and subtle balance. Smooth, dense and satisfying. If your looking for a world class summer bock-style ale. Definitely try this if you can; Very close to flawless!

Dark cherry body with deep violet hues.  Large off-white head that settles to a 2mm layer with excellent retention.  Virtually no lacing noted.  The aroma shows vinous fruit up front, dark roasted malts, fresh lake water, and ample amounts of wheat.  The flavor is comprised of sweet, dark, fruity malts, red wine, and almost no detectable hop bitterness.  Medium body with a sweet, slightly cloying palate.  High carbonation is quite apparent in the striking fizziness that it leaves on the tongue.  Finish is short, with concentrated dark fruits and drying wheat.  Nicely crafted brew, just not one of my favorite styles.
Bottle: pour is as described on the bottle - dark brown, thin head, fruity aroma, taste is slightly spicy and sweet.  Pretty nice beer.
The first thought was, this is a kriek. Much cherry taste. It is a very taty beer.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2011 
Date: July 31, 1999
Mode: Draft
Source: Taco Mac, Cumming
Appearance: dark brown, thin white head
Aroma: strong banana aroma
Flavor: rich malt flavor, slightly sweet, no bitterness, hint of banana

Date: January 30, 2002
Source: ss summit
Appearance: frothy head, heavy lace
Overall: sweet fruity aroma, lots of banana in the aroma, lots of banana flavor

Date: July 11, 2002
chocolate and banana

Date: July 24, 2002
Mode: bottle
Source: bacchus
lots of tartness in the aroma, 

Date: May 07, 2003
Mode: bottle
Source: bacchus
no tartness this time

Date: April 13, 2006
Source: Wild Wing, Marietta
chocolate and banana with a bit of clove creaping in, none of that tartness

Date: May 10, 2006
Source: blind weizenbock tasting
Score: 3.9
Appearance: opaque brown, nice fine cream head, visable carbonation
Aroma: huge sweet banana aroma and a hint of chocolate
Body: big creamy body
Flavor: big malt flavor, great sweetness, lots of banana, touch of clove, small amount of chocolate

Date: May 10, 2006
Mode: Bottle
Source: Blind Tasting
Appearance: opaque brown, nice fine cream head, visable carbonation
Aroma: huge sweet banana aroma and a hint of chocolate
Body: big creamy body
Flavor: big malt flavor, great sweetness, lots of banana, touch of clove, small amount of chocolate

Aroma: 8/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 8/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 16/20
Rating: 4/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: *** /4

Name: Aventinus, Distilled Edelster, Couveur Whiskey Barrel
Date: October 13, 2011
Mode: Bottle
Source: Mac McGee
Appearance: clear yellow, viscous
Aroma: sweet fruity aroma, touch of banana, hint of chocolate
Flavor: sweet caramel flavor, sweet chocolate comes through, touch of fruityness that may be banana, peppery

Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 15/20
Rating: 3.6/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: *** /4

ark ruby, glistening mysteriously, streaked with fine, top-fermented yeast, this beer has a compact, stable and long-lasting head. It has an intensive, typically top-fermented clove-like aroma. The palate experiences a gentle touch, on the tongue it is very full-bodied, compact and yet fresh with a hint of caramel. It finishes with a light and delicate taste of bitters leaving behind a strong, smoothly rounded, sour impression.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2010 Bottle. Cloudy, middling brown colour with a moderate, short-lived tan head.  Aroma of yeast, cloves and sweet fruit. Mouth was smooth for a beer of this strength, with only a touch of warming alcohol. Flavour had a mild touch of bananas with more yeast and some caramel. Finish was spicy. Excellent [4.0]. Re-rate 7/01/10 - this was a 2007 bottle. Colour was similar to previous rate, but the pretty was clear. The aroma was more yeasty with less spice. Alcohol was more prominent in the mouth, with a sweet edge and subdued banana and clove flavour, leading to a dryiish finish. Still very good, but less impressive [3.5].

Pours a nutty brown that is heavily clouded. Has a quickly receding head that leaves minimal lacing. The instant smell of banana bread was shortly joined by the company of yeast and delicate sugary malts. The taste is of sweet, slightly fruity yeasts, and spicy clove with a touch of honey. The taste isnt as strong as the smell, but its not exactly faint either. The body cradles the flavors wonderfully, too. This is a wonderfully balanced, dark weizen.

Big brownish head. Cloudy brown body. There is a picture right there, which does not necessarily do it justice, but ought to give you a pretty good idea. Banana and spice aroma. Taste is pretty similar with a strong banana taste like most weizens. There are a bunch of spicy tastes as well like cloves and all. Pretty sweet taste. No alcohol in the flavor, but it is still a heavy beer that needs to be drank slowly.

500 mL bottle from LBCO, sevred almost cold in a Weissebierglas.
App.:  Cloudy reddish-brown, with a large tan foam.
  
Aroma:  Beautiful combination of Weissebier  estery, wheaty, slightly funky, plenty of doughy yeast  combined with sweet, gooey malts  brown sugar, caramel and treacle; cherries, apricots and peaches; raisins and figs; a faint spicy/herbal aroma, a touch nutty.
  
Palate:  Medium body, quite effervescent, a little powdery/astringent.
  
Flav.:  Raisins and volumes of bananas, cloves and caramel, a touch woody and herbal; finishes a bit spicy and with a bit of alcohol.

Im a really big fan of the style and of the beer.  I really enjoy good German Weissebier and this adds some wonderful extra dimensions.  The boost in alcohol is ok too...
Incredibly refreshing!  Easy to drink, light palate.  Fruity, sour notes, light but full bodied at the same time.  Finishes clean and dry.  I like this very much.
UPDATED: SEP 9, 2007 Dark brown/copper color, off white foamy head, chocolate/fruity aroma, one of the best beers Ive had.

Brewed in 2002, 500ml bottle, and its a gusher!  Pours a nice looking reddish amber with a fizzy white head that quickly reduces to a thin ring, slight lacing, somewhat distracted by an abundance of floaties.  Aroma is yeasty with spice, raisin, banana, and a hint of vanilla.  Flavor is more yeastiness, banana and some spice, with an overall sweetness.  Palate is sticky and lively, with a medium body and mouthfeel.  An interesting beer.

500ml bottle from west lakeview liqours in Chicago.  Brown/red color with large white head.  Fruity, malty aroma with some spices.  Very fruity, sweet flavor with dark fruit, raisin, light chocolate, light alc, very satisfying.  Med-full body with carb tinge.  Very tasty and classic doppelbock.

500ml bottle.  Carbonation was unusual, more like soda than beer.  Aroma was spicy and sweet.  Tasted notes of clove and fruit along with the caramel malt.  Decent beer, but I dont know if Id go out of my way to get it again.

500 mL bottle.  Pours a murky dark copper color with a loose off-white head.  Aroma mostly warm dark spices with a bit of caramel, but the smell is more peppery than sweet.  Medium-bodied and effervescent.  Lots of spices - allspice, vanilla, nutmeg backed some sweetness and a slightly hot finish that actually ties everything together.  Robust and satisfying.
Bottle.  Great beer, was not dissapointed here.  Nice color, aroma, and Great flavor.  Dont even notice its 8.2% alcohol.

Bottle at Birreria Paradiso in Georgetown. Pours Ruby brown black, off white head. Aroma is smoke, caramel, roasted nuts, vanilla, grass. Flavor is candied caramel, malt, dough, vanilla, brandy, wheat. Delicious!
Hazy brown with a fluffy white head.  Caramel malty aroma.  Banana notes with with a strong malty taste.

Pours an amazing dark brown/deep copper color, decent but compact head.  Amazing complexity and lively carbonation... plum, cloves, chocolate.  Seems like a triple, but that does not do it justice.  Really nice beer and definitely packs a wallop.
Dark amber of color with a nice off white head. An aroma of wheat, fruits and yeast. A flavor of wheat, caramel and sweet fruits.

wow i never expected this from a german purity law anachronism, but this beer has all the complexity and flavor of a top of the line quadrupel.... a magnificent dark cloudiness with a perfect amount of yeast , velvety smooth, and the complexity... hops, malts, caramel, an amazingly long finish, you have it all here, with the alcohol exceptionally well hidden even compared to trappistes
Looks delicious.  Clove/banana aromas, same as the others. This is an awesome beer.  Im going to enjoy it now.
This beer is magnificent my all time favorite.  Commonly served chilled.  If you are feeling adventurous I suggest to try it at room temperature.  A whole new experience...

Wow.  Pours a beautiful dark/coper brown, nice head, nice lacing.

Smell of clove, bananna nut bread.

Taste of cloves & banannas. Wonderful.

Finishes as a sweet, clovey-molasses with a desent hop feel. Cant wait to have another this fall/winter.

Excellent!

Pours a really dark brown. The aroma is a really nice malt, plum, banana, and clove. The taste is very similar to the smell, masking the alcohol quite well and delivering the best wheat experience I can remember. I wish my homebrew wheat could come out somewhere near this.
Color reminds me of cider,a darker mahogany.  Tasted of brown sugar, caramel (I thought) , and fruits.  Very unique taste.

Pours a hazy mahogahny with an initially rocky head that immediately after, quickly disipates like no other head Ive seen. The deep brown body reveals an effervescent quality of carbonation, like most yeasty beers. The aroma is most obviously banana, dark malt and clove, but other spices and fruity yeast esters add more complexity. The flavour clove, bubble-gum (yeast), dark candied fruit, dates and figs and that grainy wheat taste. The finish isnt as long as I hoped and the body wasnt as full as I expected.

Aroma of dark malt, banana, clove. In front of halogen the color is deep reddish mahogany. The beige head was substantial, but left rather quickly. Medium to full bodied. Creamy carbonation. Starts with lots of banana, nearly paint thinner so, caramel malt, and noticable clove. The finish is a bit gritty, banana, spice, and some malt. There is a full banana bread aspect in the end. It has a finishing sour note, but the malt and banana balance that. It is certainly marvelous.

From Immy via trade.  Tim sent be a bottle from 2002 (I mean the bottle was brewed in 2002, I dont mean Tim went back in time and sent me the bottle...nevermind).  The pour was dark ruby with lighter copper notes to it.  The head was a meager one-finger tall of white to off-white bubbles that only offered up minimal lacing.  The aroma was cloves, malt and brown sugar.  The flavor was very clove-forward with malt, banana and some apple/pear.  The flavors were contained and refined, not explosive.  Seems a tad past its prime (we should call this beer Sammy Sosa).  The mouthfeel was above average and the finish was nice.  Really want to try a fresh bottle of this to compare it against this gem.  Thanks again Tim!

bottle from dccharms: pours a cloudy ice tea colour with an off white head. aroma of banana, spice, some bubble gum and just a little bit of wheat. flavour is full of roasted malts, spice, yeast and finishes a bit of chocolate bitterness. a very nice beer.

Pours dark milky-brown with a rocky head that dims but does not fade. Aromas of cloves and molasses. some cinnamon. Taste  is heavy on the fruits - bananas come to mind immediately, as well as pear and lemon. ..wow, theres a lot going on here! This is a beautiful beer, but not something I could see myself having all too often...I might put a few aside for the cooler weather.
Excellent.  Cant place all of the aromas, but I sense cloves and some molasses as it warms.  Just a beautiful dark and smooth bock that Ill be sure to go back and buy more of.

georgoues looking brew. deep auburn brown. good head. 2 flavorful styles where one doesnt dominate over the other. Dopplebock and wheat characters are easily discernible- nice sweet malt flavor, with that tangy and chewy wheat profile (lemons, banana,etc). yet this carries a slightly dry body, not overly sticky sweet. decent subtle hop flavor and some carbonation. In my neck, always available, but its pretty $$$

pours a ruby cola color with a medium diminishing cream colored head. great aroma of bananas with some apple, toffee, and spice. great medium thick body and light crisp carbonation. tastes of maple syrup , bananas, apples, and spice kicks in right when you swallow it, and leaves a nice syrupy taste in the mouth.

poured into a tulip.  it is good.  pours a brown with full frothy head, smooth malty aroma, strait and yeasty, close to a belgian yeast in taste, very good and it is like a german- belgian hybrid, yum

From a 500mL Bottle.  Pours a mostly transparent, toasted brazil nut color with fiery red hues and a thick layer of foamy off-white head.  Estery aroma of bananas and clove play among a spicy bouquet of apples, pears, and a thin rose grape.  Fruity and spicy, abandoning all things seemingly German about this beer for a bit of Belgian flair.  Light bodied, spritzy carbonated mouthfeel.  Tons of munich malt up front on the palate, with a chewy nutty quality that compliments the spicy esters quite well.  Apples, mild chocolate, and delicate caramel come through, although the body is exceptionally light and easy drinking.  The effervescence of the brew seems to detract a little bit for my palate by allowing the malt complexities to sizzle away more quickly than desirable.  Clove spice and a nutty breadiness lingers in the final smack.

Dark clear hazelnut brown, sparkling, thin head. Aroma - banana, clove.
Taste - banana, toasted bread, fruity.
Light semi-spritzy mouthfeel. Not heavy at all for such a strong beer. This is more hefeweizen than doppelbock. Good stuff.

500ml bottle pours baking-chocolate brown, and thick, as is the head.  aromas of sweet malts fill with warm chocolate, a tangy, nectar-like aroma follows anise and dark, ripe berries.  the flavor reveals heavy clove that blankets the palate.  the sourness hits more on the finish, and the weiss carries its character through the aroma into the finish, which lingers for quite a while, leaving an apple-esque taste in my mouth.  truly an interesting brew, and different to anything which i have rated in the past.  at a lower price point, this will be revisited from time to time.
rosso scuro maltata corposa caramelata lievemete tostata non troppo amara molto alcolica

THOUGHTS: Very easy to drink. I will probably buy this one again and again and again. Not much to say about this one other than its great. I cant really explain why, but it is. Somewhat dark fruity, wheaty flavor with some underlying chocolate and some spiciness.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a cloudy, medium brown and was bottle conditioned with a large, slightly off-white head that mostly lasted but left virtually no lacing. The aroma was very light mikl chocolate, light yeast, and wheat and spices. The initial flavor was light to moderate sweetness, light acidity and sourness, while the finish was moderate to heavy sweetness with an average duration. The medium body was oily with soft carbonation (but I burnt my mouth a couple of days before trying this so it might be wrong) and a lightly astringent, smooth finish.

Aroma was a very malty weisen,Chocolate and caramel with distinct banana and wheat,not heavy but still attractive, taste is banana with bakers chocolate and caramel,and touches of wheat tang. The benchmark of the style,nobody else evens comes close

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2008 Aside from missing  a large woman delivering beers on her breasts, red cabbage, and a pretzel with mustard, I feel like Im in Munich. This beer, and pan gravy are Germanys best liquids ever. It was smooth with banana and clove, and a strong finish. Ja und Zwanzig!

Nose of malt & fruit.  Pours walnut with amber highlights.  Decent cascade resolves into a frothy tall beige mostly lasting head with light lace.
