Pours a rich amber ruby color with a thick reactive head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, banana, clove, fruit. Flavors in addition to aroma with fig, complexly delicious. Warm alcohol mouthfeel with a dry finish. This is a good combination of flavors and has a good german wheat taste to it.
Groovy. Sweet and yeasty nose. Chocolate, sweet body with lots of carbonation. It finishes with usual bock bitterness and spice. Hides alcohol content well.
Thick thick dark creamy malty.  A "big" beer with strong complex flavouring.  Great if you like chewing your drink (and I do).

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2003 What happen to my head, disappeared way too quickly...hum? Color is a nice ruby brown and it is medium-bodied. Detected raisin/prunes, bubblegum, roasted malt, and bittersweet chocolate in the aroma, very nice! Sweet, fruity, and spicy tastes rush to the forefront followed by a warming honey sweetness, not aggressive, but you know the alcohol is there. Very complex beer. Great mouthfeel and nice lingering sweet and sour taste. Yummy. Among the very best beers I've ever had! RERATE: Poured into the same Aventinus glass shown to the left, the head now remains and the aroma is even more pronounced. Again confirming my opinion that this is among the world's greatest beers!

Very nice dark amber/brown color,large tan head that had some staying power.Malty sweet aroma with hints of fruit.Very nice flavor,sweet with a spicy fruitiness,malty,with the alcohol being fairly well hidden,it does come through but in an over powering way.The after taste was malty,mildly sweet with a slight spiciness along with a warm alcohol feeling as well.This is a great brew and i'm glad a have a few more for later enjoyment.

When I write my own "great beers" book, this one is going to be in there.  Huge head.  Complex, multi-layered nose of caramel, clove-like spices and fruit.  Equally complex taste, with the fruit showing up a little more, but balanced by the malts.  More than enough alcohol to warm you up.  Excellent.
Low B high C grade Beer.  Very good flavor, nice body, just not the bite I expected in a dark beer, expected something just a bit stronger.  Still a good beer though.

5/17/03: bottle.  cloudy, deep brown-orange gradation with a full amount of head.  full aroma of raisins and wheat galore.  very complex.  very fruity.  wheat with apple, raisin, and banana flavors.  sour finish.

This is a very interesting weisse bock.  The appearance is a deep, somber purple-brown with a large, creamy and carmel-like head.  The nose is fruity with something that resembles a very pleasant burnt wood aroma.  The taste is quite complex and deep at first, growing more interesting toward the back of the mouth.  The wood flavor I picked up in the nose finishes out with a soft, ruby-plum taste.  Overall, this is a really nice beer... dry but fruity, with complex flavors throughout the tasting process.  I highly recommend this one!
Beautiful dark red/ruby colour. Robust and sweet, with a refreshingly dry aftertaste. A rare top-fermented bock beer.

Pours with a dark brown cloudy body topped by a thick rocky head with a good amount of lace left behind.  Sweet and fruity aroma with flowery notes and cinnamon & clove accents.  A touch of yeastiness is also detected.  Sweet and fruity flavor with a slight yeastiness, cinnamon and clove notes and a touch of spice.  medium to full bodied and warming.

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2003 Dark like ruby with a head that seems to keep for a long time.  Aroma of banana, wheat, cloves.  Fabulous flavor and excellent clean taste!  Perfect balance.  Perfect taste that I expect in a wheat brew!  Perfect yeast and hops!  This is the best among this style.  This is one of my new favorites.  Very "old-world" brew taste, at an excellent price.  Local store has these one sale for $2.79.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2004 A very fresh beer despite its journey. Very welcoming caramel and crystal malt colour with a subtle aroma of same. The mouthfeel instantly gives a hint of the ABV. This is not a heavily hopped beer but is nevertheless balances well with the malt. A touch of wheat character in the finish with some spicy overtones. The only problem was the lack of head all the way down. RE-RATE: When a perfect specimen is found it really has an edge over many other beers. The uniqueness of its style is also a real treat.
user_location: Potts Point, New South Wales, AUSTRALIA

text: Nice, largish mouthfeel with caramelly malt character.  Moderate acidity and carbonation keeps the feeling "clean".  Gentle bitterness rounds out the flavor.  Overall, very nice.
White head, some lacing.  Nice dark color with touch of cloudiness.  Nice flavors, very complex.  Chocolate, banana, bits of spice.

Large white head, stays with the beer. Dark ruby color. Banana aroma, with strong yeast, banana, wheat, little bit of chocolare and bubble gum flavor as well. Easy to drink, can taste a bit of alcohol. Great beer.
Dark brown/black, nice brown head. Fruity, crisp flavor. A WeiZen Bock to die for. This beer is oh so good!

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2004 20% light nut colored frothy head on top of a dark tea-colored body.  Couldnt really grasp too much in the aroma, I guess you can say it had some clove.  Palate was quite light and a fair amount of carbonation.  First impression was not very good, but it grew on me.  Not as complex as I had imagined, yet it is a wheat doppel...there was some noticeable ethanol in the finish.  A pretty good beer.  -------- was my 59th beer rated and my 4th that has an overall rating of greater than 4, so I figured I'd re-rate now that my palate is more mature.  Aroma is largely banana and clove-like.  Pours a murky slightly browner than apple cider color with a fizzy light tan head.  Lots of wheat in this beer, bananas and cloves in the middle.  Some sweetness too.  A little alcohol burn at the end.  Bitter finish.  I would say that my original rating is probably right on the money for this one.  I may have decreased a point in appearance.  Solid, but a bit overrated IMO.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2003 An absolutely beautiful murky orange/dark brown color that can only come from this style of beer...of course, a massive tan head. The aroma was very sweet...full of banana/clove (I actually confuse those two often), subtle alcohol, some wood tones. The flavor was very sweet...clove, bubblegum, banana, alcohol (well hidden), and at times I got some great vanilla chocolate flavors. The feel was soft, bubbly, very smooth. Fantastic beer.
As far as I could tell this is the same beer as Ommegang Hennepin.  I really enjoyed it, but it tasted exactly the same.

Hazy dark brown with a large creamy uneven offwhite head.  Big clove, yeast, and banana aroma.  I found the noticable alcohol taste an unwelcome intruder that distracted from the other flavors of this beer. Perhaps I should try again when I am in a more tolerable mood but I see no reason to.

Ruby red in color, kept an awesome off-white head throughout the half liter, full body, a floral hint in the aroma as well as the aftertaste, very smooth, very drinkable, I would have drank this all night but there were others that I needed to try while I was at Ludwig's Garten in Philly, outstanding weizen bock!

(Bottle). Theoretically I might encounter a better Weizen than this one, but I doubt very much that will ever happen. Murky brown colour, large head, aroma of Paradise: Cloves and other undefinable spices, dried fruits (figs), oak and sandalwood. Oaky cloves flavour with hints of burnt caramel. Alcohol is present, but not overwhelmingly so. Dry aftertaste. This is a thoroughly well made beer! (Thanks, joss!)

This is Great beer. The alcohol is the first thing I noticed in the nose, then comes the bubblegum estery aroma.  It pours redish brown with a short lived head. Very rich and smooth, not too sweet (or cloying), very warming with that wonderful Barvarian yeast flavor. Well balanced.  I can just about chew this beer.  Weizenbocks just don't get any better than this.
UPDATED: NOV 26, 2003 This a Great Wheat Bock beer. Impressive head and a malty ultra smooth flavor with nice yeasty tones overall. Comes off better on the warm side. Great with german food.
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: Great beer, beats Mahr's by a long shot.  Not as many different tastes, but nice and malty, slightly sour(not much) touch of alcaholic warmness.  Very smooth, easy to drink for such a strong beer.  Great beer.
On tap at the Steinkeller.  A rich, dark wheat bursting with banana-flavored esters and sweet malts.  Definitely in the top echelon of wheats.  A return visit is already in the works.
I haven't had an orifice-related experience like this since last time Stan came to visit from Walgett!

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2005 Dark, murky, ever-so-faintly reddish brown. Creamy white head. Spotty lacing. This is an intense beer. Reminds me more of some of the yeastier belgian styles than it does an ordinary German wheat. Strongly spicy aroma--loaded with cloves with some fruity yeast esters as well. Full, round body. Creamy carbonation. Has a sharp, slightly tart bite up front. Sweetens as the beer progresses. Toffee, caramel, cloves, and brown sugar come to the fore. A warming alcohol presence helps hold things together. Short, slightly sweet, slightly hoppy finish. Leaves a bit of sticky residue on the tongue. Easily my favorite wheat beer I have tried to date.

Belgian, spicy aroma. Pours an amber brown, mid-range carbonation with a thick head. The mouthfeel starts off slow but becomes more complex as you drink it. The alcohol is dominant throughout,resulting in a drink that packs quite a wallop. A satisfying sipping beer.
This is one wonderful beer.  Best served from bottle, not tap !!  Leave about an inch in the bottle and shake it real hard then pour the remaining amount in your glass this will distribute the yeast.

This wonderful beer poured a deep brown color with a medium head that quickly dissapated and lingered in bubbles upon the surface. The nose is floral with hints of spice and wood. A tingly carbonation on the tongue and a medium body. Hints of plum and a woody earthiness arose with some sour notes followed by cloves. A warming quality yet fully refreshin and fullfilling. A great beer!! Deserving of the overall rating.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2003 I like this beer. My first of the style. I dont like wheat beers but I guess a Weizen Bock is different. Higher alcohol content but I can hardly taste it. Aroma is of bananas but I dont taste them in the beer, thank god! Taste is very much like grapes with a hint of wheat, to me its similar to a red wine but maybe that's just me. It has a very creamy mouthfeel. This was a good choice and Im glad I gave it a shot. Try one if you havent!

Dark brown w/ shades of yellow & red. Pours w/ a massive head that settles relatively quickly. Banana, clove & sweet malt & even some chocolate on the nose.  Creamy, full, carbonated feel. Banana, apple(?), toffee, honey, butterscotch(?) & pepper flavour. Finish is long & quite dry. Alcohol leaves a warming tingle on the tongue.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2003 Good double bock ale, Aventinus is quit an exceptional German beer. This is a dark amber wheat beer with a fruity aroma and a sweet finish. Definitely worth your time, effort, money, soberness, it’s strong. I am actually rerating this beer 6/6/03, every time I have this beer I enjoy it more. This sampling I noticed how naturally effervescent this beer is.

Fantastic nose—vanilla, caramel, cloves, cinnamon, malt, yeast, alcohol, apples, and pears.  Incredibly smooth.  Nice full mouthfeel.  Not as complex as it smells, but still full of malt, vanilla, and roastiness.  A hint of fruit.  Pleasing.  Rich swallow that is just slightly dry.  Fantastic but too pricey here to have on a regular basis.  Save for special occasions!

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2005 Great big frothy head which lingers for quite a while.  Aroma of wheat and spices (cloves very prominent).  Little bit of dark fruit in there also.  Excellent color of foggy dark orange/amber.  Good carbnation which keep a thin layer of foam on the surface for the duration.  Flavor is spicy with subltle wheat flavor behind.  Slightly sweet and fruity also.  Little bit of sourness in there with the fruit.  Finish is creamy and smooth with slight sweet wheat overtones.  Alcohol is well hidden.  An excellent beer which should appeal to many different people with varying tastes.
To me this beer had way too much of a clover aroma and I just couldn't acquire a taste for this beer.I thought it had a slight bitter aftertaste.To each his/her own.
Draught - Very wheaty aroma.  Beautiful dark copper color.  Nice head.  The wheat flavors are really drawn out in this Weizen Bock.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2004 This brew poured a nice dark brown pour with a very lively medium head full of medium sized bubbles. It has a very mild cloven aroma. The body contained some yeast residue floating in it. It's taste leaves a lasting impression on your tongue as it goes down. It has a very nice taste with a hint of raisin and at the top of my list, but not the very top. After a few drinks, the alcohol content really comes through. 

Re-Rate 1/31/2003 was 8-4-8-4-16 this rating 7-5-8-5-17 bumped palate up to compenate.  This bottle was aged 3 years prior to opening by the manufacturer.  It came in a specially wrapped paper wrapped to distinguish it from the unaged brews.  The wrapper had Aventinus brewed in 1999 on it in purple letters with a light yellow background.  It poured a very large head of mostly diminishing light brown colroed finely sized bubbles.  The body was very carbonated transparent and dark brown in color.  The aroma was sweet with caramel malt notes and the mouth feel was bubbly tingly and vinuous yet smooth.  Very nice indeed!  The flavor was that of caramel malt mild clove and mild dark chocolate.

Very yeasty and very malty. A surpring indication of wild berries on the nose that really came out in the flavor. Sweeter than most weizen bocks, almost to the point of being cloying. Finished nice though.

Strong bread, banana, and clove nose.  Has a certain sulfury character but that diminishes as it warms. Mildly wheaty with mildly sweet bready malt, banana bread, Chianti, and cloves, and a little alcohol. Finishes much of the same with a slight medicinalness

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2003 Wonderful appereance: dark brown colour, huge and creamy head. Caramel, yeast and banana in the aroma. The flavour is initially yeasty and malty, but after a while it becomes fruity (apple, banana, pear) with swet caramel and toffe notes. Incredible aftertaste with traces of chocolate and nuts. Complex and well balanced, with the right amount of sweetness. Very interesting!

Aroma of clove and caramel is excellent. Pours a cloudy dark amber/light brown. Flavor is also well done with caramel malt notes coupled with the banana/clove yeast flavors. Finishes a little dry, but very good.
UPDATED: MAR 13, 2004 Unusually smooth, creamy texture; nice dark brown color with a huge head; very pleasant taste and smooth finish.

Huge lasting tan head.  Murky brown body (not clear like in the picture).  Aroma of wheat, clove, chocolate and caramel.  Flavour is intense dominated by wheat but I also notice a strong banana presence. Finish is extremely smooth and leaves a nice coating of flavour in the mouth; of course until you take another gulp.  A beauty and perhaps legend.

Pours deep redbrown with huge beige-brown sudsy head. Strong aromas of banana, cloves and yeasty bread. Very smooth. Initial malty caramel, followed by an aftertaste of banana with hints of citrus, spices and hops. Very nice.

I still cannot believe this is rated at 4.1, but what confounds me even more is the ratebeerian communities love for anything so much as resembles a port wine as this does in taste. It pours a ruby red but it a fiery cloudy reddish mess in the light with a white fluffy head which dies off very quickly....even more so than i would have imagined. The aroma has some of the strangest stuff i could possibly pick up....everything from malt, to candy and sugar, to wheat, to, i swear i smelled this...vitamins!!! It smelled like vitamins!! The taste was just as complex and weird. There is a massive plummy deep fruit taste. Very strong port wine qualities with a grape-like sourness coming through. On the other hand, there are instances where it begins to taste like a wicked dose of cough medicine..just nasty. The carbonation level is medium to slightly prickly with a definite resiny mouthfeel. Not bad...but once again..far too port winish for my tastes...just strange.

Pours cloudy red/brown with initial beige head that diminishes quickly.  Very nice malt flavors mix with caramel, spices, grass, dark fruits and some citrus fruit.  Good full body and lightly sour malt after taste.  Very good beer.

Pours a hazy ruby-brown with a big, creamy off-white head that retreats fairly quickly. Dark, rich aroma of malt, banana, spice and toasted raisin bread. Creamy mouthfeel, and flavours of caramel, malt, banana, clove and a hint of chocolate. A definate favourite of mine, and I'm glad the supply in Ontario is cheap and plentiful!
This is a great weizen bock.  Caramel, spicy and malty flavor goes down smooth.  Finishes slightly bitter and (good)sour almost tart like. Recommended.

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2003 A nice, cloudy, brownish red color and ungodly amounts of head start this one. Aroma is nice and wheaty, though not overpowering. The flavor, in my opinion, is very unique. It's wheaty, full, strong, and long lasting. VERY nice, and original.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2004 I don't know what I was thinking last time I rated this, I must have had a bad batch or something. This is a fantastic brew!
Very dark mahogany in appearance. lively carbonation. aroma is typical of a weizen: sweet yeast, banana, apples. 8% alcohol is hidden very well, very drinkable. I just can't believe how wonderfully balanced this stuff is. Good thing it's a regular release at the LCBO!

Pours a cloudy dark brown, with a huge, light-tan, puffy and cloud like head.  Head slowly dimishes to a pretty strong lacing.  Aroma is strong on the banana, with some clove sneaking in, too.  Flavor is also strong on the banana, with some slight hints of chocolate, and ending with some clove and spiceyness.  In the mouth, it has some tingly carbonation, and a tiny hint of alcohol as it gets warmer.

I'm not disappointed exactly - this thing is huge with flavor and the aroma is breathtaking.  But the particular flavors themselves aren't my thing - banana pudding, butterscotch syrup. Some sharper acidic and spicy notes burn the thing into balance, but it's not for me.
Great wheat beer!  Dark, full brew, rich yeats aroma, and the slightly sour wheat taste was perfect.  Cross a belgian with a wheat and you get this.  Amazing stuff, one of my favorites.

This a nice twist on a Wheat beer.  Pours a ruby and hazy color. Little head. Smells of wheat and light spice.  Tastes is more spic than wheat, sour on the palate, with a fuzzy spice aftertaste.  Not being a fan of wheat, I can say that I would drink this again.

Comercial description is bang on. Pours hazy brown with a monsterous rocky head. Spicy aroma, reminds me of a trappist ale. Complex flavours of roasted malt, banana and a fleeting taste of bubblegum. Beautifull in the mouth. Don't drink this too cold since the taste seems to get better as it warms up.

This beer poured a murky brown color and formed a huge, I mean huge, foamy off white head that retained for quite awhile. Heavy amount of carbonation present. An aroma of clove, citrus and malt. The flavor was of clove and malt.

This beer lived up to the commercial description. Head on a 3 oz. pour took at least 2 mins. to die. Strong clove aroma. Full bodied. However I didn't notice any sort of sour finish. Just spicy slightly dry aftertaste.

Boy I'm not the guy to rate a wheat beer.  This one seems very much like the Commercial Description.  Stron clove like flavor.  Brown color and very hazy.  I don't taste the carmel at all, sure wish I could.  I haven't had an IPA with a flavor as pronounced as the ones.  I think if you read the description and it appeals to you as does wheat beers, you are going to love this one.  I don't and I didn't.
Holy shit! This be da BOMB. Insanely flavoursome with watties baked beans dominating lightly smoked Mary Jane... I think Im in love Mum...

Yeasty, sharp apple nose... very nice. Gentle mouthfeel; soft up front, somewhat crisp near the finish. Nice amount of carbonation. Sweet malts complemented by a roastiness and a mild bitterness in the finish. Apple and banana notes here and there; maybe even a touch of bubblegum too. Extremely well-balanced and complex, yet easy to drink and enjoy.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2003 Wow!  Did i mention...Wow??  One of my favorite beers.  Nice Belgian wheat smell with a great bock flavor. Reddish merlot color.  Lingering maltiness and very sweet.  One of the best.

Very complex.  Nice maltiness in the nose, bit citrusy and sweet.  Good fruitiness in the flavor, banana and lemon predominate.  Slightly wit-esque in its clove spiciness, but restrained enough to not overpower.  Big, big malts finish up.  Great palate, nicely creamy and full.
Tremendous beer in the fashion. Failed to read the abv on this beer until a guest pointed out that it seemed pretty strong. Just terrific.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2013 Rich, sweet, complex, refreshing while still appearing big... the fruity easters are unimaginable.  So complex, its behavior changes every time I drink this beer.  A wonderful wheat beer that deserves a new rating from me.

What a fine, fine beer!  I wasn""t expecting to like this beer as much as I did.  Complex doesn""t begin to describe it.  Pours out to a plum darkness in the glass with a light brown head that reminds you of brown sugar.  The aroma is that of fruit.  The taste.  Man, the taste.  Where to begin?  Initially, there is a presence of nutmeg, cloves and banana, much like a regular wheat beer.  But just when you think this is what you get, the beer transforms as it warms and the clove/banana taste leaves and a warm fruit taste of  raisons takes over.  A wonderful beer that truly hides the 8% ABV very well.
UPDATED: APR 29, 2003 Cloudy brown, large beige head. Spicy nose.Spicy unpleasant cloying yeast flavor with medium alcohol heat

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2007 1 pt bottle - Fairly cloudy deep brown color with smallish creamy off white head. Aroma has fair amount of bananna, clove, touch of dark chocolate, toasted caramel, grains of paradise, hint of vanilla, mint leaf, oak chips. Flavor is very malty, with chewy caramel, touch of bananna, red grapes, vanilla bean, mildly sweet finish.
I love this beer.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2004 1999 Paper-Wrapped Vintage:
Dark brown coloured body with violet and crimson hues toward the bottom. Frothy off-white head that dies down quickly, but you have to expect that with a 5 year old bottle. Aroma of roasted malt, raisins, figs and some light spices. Medium-bodied; Mild taste of pit fruits, nuts, a twang of coffee and a decent amount of spices, but much less than a normal (fresh) bottle. Aftertaste lingers, but fades off unusually quickly. Overall, this beer is a great doppelbock, but after 5 years, lost its touch...I wouldnt give this bottle so long next time. I sampled this 50 cL paper-wrapepd bottle, from 1999 purchased at Premier Gourmet in Buffalo, New York on 10-December-2004.

Very light and grainy in the nose, but it pours a wicked murky brown with a thin head that dissapears quick. The taste is an awesome blend. Spicey, but not overpowering, sweet, but not cloying, hopped, but not blindingly bitter. A very, very well balanced beer, never any blatant alcohol tinges for such a strong beer, this is a wonderful dark wheat.

Slightly cloudy dark amber appearance. Nice plum-like aroma.  The flavor starts very strongly with the banana clove flavor from the yeast with a alcohol flavor also present.  Finish is slightly tart but very pleasent.  Only bad thing was the high level of carbonation.  Maybe this varies since its bottle fermented.

One of my favorites.  Used to be my second favorite (behind Kasteel Bruin), but after my beer tasting vacation, it may drop down a little.  Nice rich, spicy beer with all the flavors of a good hefeweizen a dopplebock combined.  Its not as sweet as a dopplebock though.  Excellent beer
UPDATED: FEB 14, 2003 The only drawback to this was that the bock maltiness covered up the expected spiciness of the wheat style.  Very dark.  very colourful.  Good head.

Musty purple brown colour.  Caramelized bananas blend perfectly with the wheat in the nose.  Lingering halo around the glass, with constant bubbles.  Creamy and sweet, with just a hint of banana, just enough for a good flavour, even though I dont generally like banana flavour.  Great balance of yeast, malt, spices (cloves), and sweet honey and caramel.  Mouth watering finish.
UPDATED: DEC 27, 2011 When poured a large head formed and it slowly disipated. Clovish flavor and aroma. A full bodied beer. The more I drank the more it grew on me.

Poured a big head but it didnt last. Dark brown with ruby tones. Had a big chunk of yeast on the bottom which I swirled off. Has the typical-for-the-style banana, yeast flavors. Alcohol well hidden. Very good.
Huge dense head.  Awesome in that it is just the right amount of bitter, alcohol, and wheat.
Thinner than I expected, but no less in terms of complexity.  I will have to try it again to get a better rating.

Pretty good.  Not much head, but I poured slowly.  Spicy clove and bananas are in this beer.  Caramel and wheat is present... some alcohol is noticeable along with the malty sweetness.  Nice full body.  The sourness lingers for a while, but it isnt unpleasant.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2008 My re-rate:  Pleasant, malty aroma - with just a decent amount of wheatiness.  Not bitter at all.  Big, lush head on first pour leads to soapy bubbles around the sides of the glass.  Mostly I aste the caramel,. clove/raisin in the flavor, next to the full array of maltiness.  A bit of apples seems to stick with me from this beer as well.  Somewhat chewy finish.

Long lasting head?  Theres no head at all.  The color is nice, but the carbonation is too high.  Pleasant, fruity, yeasty aroma.  Slight hints of fruit and yeast in the flavor.  There isnt much going on here.  The body is very thin, and the finish is watery.  Im not exactly sure how this made it into the top 50.
Very pleaseane aroma. Beautiful dark color and thick head. Flavor is full and balanced. Good carbonation, Delicious.
UPDATED: JAN 6, 2003 Dark redish brown, huge head. Yeast aroma. Banana and yeast flavor. Over carbonated and acidic. Repulsive
Banana wheat bread. Very nicely hopped with a wonderfully rounded finish almost reminiscent of a sour cherry. Very nice beer.
Pretty good. Lots of fruit and hops up in the taste. Not as good as the Celebrator, but still quality.
the aroma is of a wheat beer. very bananna and clove like. however the flavor is a mixture of wheat and bock. an excellent beer

Incredible aroma, with baking banana nut bread, clove, toffee, just a slight hint of citrus and a touch of alcohol for good measure.  Ample head, light tan streaked with darker bottle-runnings (swirled and poured) and lasting at least a day.  Attractive, opaque deep reddish-caramel color with a good bit of sediment.  Flavor is very satisfyingly malty, with some toffee, doughy, estery and spicy yeasts, date, nut and again a light dosage of alcohol.  Finish is creamy and quite long, lightly astringent and full of yeast and malt flavor.  Full bodied and with a  satisfyingly thick, velvety mouthfeel.  This is the rightful standard by which all other Weizen Doppelbocks are judged.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2003 I love this beer.  I tried it after seeing it mentioned on here and only have good things to say about it.  Only thing I do not like is the clove taste I get when I first start a bottle.  After that its all good! 

Had to re-rate because I keep buying the stuff and loving it more...

Remember the first time I heard about this. Thought it was crazy for a split second before thinking that I like both styles weiis and bock. Works remarkably well. Loads of fruity, yeast. malty flavors. A tad syrupy, but not a major complaint. Prost!

Dark brownish-gold, high foamy off-white head.  Spicy and intriguing aromas, fruity, almost belgian-like.  Big malty flavors with tart yeastiness.  Ripe fruit (plum, berries) and spice (clove).  Alcohol adds to the spicy/pepper undertones, but does not get in the way of the overall experience.

Wheaty, yeasty, bread aroma. Sweet malt, estery, bit of citrus. Less bitter aroma than a dunkles Hefeweizen. Opaque brown color (unfiltered) with tinge of red. Big foamy off-white head. Medium body, slightly chewy. Low carb, almost flat. Very smooth palate. All the nuances of a wheat beer, sans chalky bitterness and hoppiness. Big malt flavor without being overly sweet. Alcohol. Malty nutty after but pretty clean. Really good beer. Quotes my wife "this is what beer is supposed to taste like".  One of these days Ill convince her to get her own account.

Big yeasty, estery nose with hints of berries. Murky brown color and a low tight head. Meaty, chewy body with a complex mix of spices and fruit flavors (berries). Dry finish in the front of the mouth. Thick consistency and a gritty mouth feel. This is Hefeweizen squared.

Nose of Orange, vanilla, yeast and colves. Brown body with hints of orange. Little frothy head. Spices tastes, also oranges, vanilla black berries and cloves. Thick. Kicks on the roof of the tongue. Awesome that I had to buy it in the States, as it is hard to get it in the North of Germany.
Huge head on this one! This bock was great. Slight tastes of plums, black cherries, and brown cider apples.

Re-rate 12/02/02 Great beer,dark brown with nice head great malty taste with taste and aroma of cloves and other spices, slight hint of chocolate as well, a wonderful beer, even better the 2nd time around
UPDATED: AUG 12, 2003 (Bottle) An extremely dark wheat beer. Very enjoyable! I love the 12 of quarts in Germany. Re-confirms that achoholism is international. God bless German beer!

You know its been 7 years since I have last had this beer and it has left a lasting impression on me.  It was a great beer!!  I just about bought it today. But I bought others to sample that I have never had. Its was amazing. It was wheaty and bubbly and harsh to the palet but it was still enjoyable I loved it.  I should buy this one again really soon!

deep amber, extremely lively carbonation, thick (almost 2") foamy light beige head. the head didnt last the whole beer, but stuck around for most of it. aroma is strong on bubblegum and spices. raisin and other fruity flavors which unfortunately i wasnt able to discern at this drinking.

A good beer to be sure, but not as good as all the hype most of the other raters give it.  I have never tried this style before so I was expecting more dopplebock-like qualities... what I got was a slightly more flavorful wheat beer.

No head at all! Bread and glue in the aroma. Sweet, malty taste with banana, mango, bread, cola and butter flavors. Full bodied. Alcohol present, but well hidden. The taste is magnificent, the aroma is limping behind.
initial head is off-white and creamy dissipating into a wonderous malt ring. ripe bananas cloves subtle tartness good hop flavor one of my top ten
This brew was just like the bottle read, very malty and grainy!  I liked the melloness of it, and the alcohol was noticed but the flavor of it was not over-powering!  Very good.

who knows when: dark existence with a mellow red gleam...off white head started gigantic and bubbley but shrunk considerably...aroma of a bowl of chereos with grain alcohol instead of milk...fizzy start...wheaty with wierd alien tongue tinglers..medicine...berry flavored maple syrup at IHOP...spicy..maybe nutmeg or cloves... a tad sour with a lingering alcohol wheat aftertaste...still not my thing... Re-Rate 11/23/02: clove encrusted banana fumes...very spicy and yeasty, an aroma thats growing on me...yeasty backbone and spicy sweet malty foreground with notes of banana, cherrios, cloves, french toast, and warming heat..I like this beer this time..hell i dont know what i like or dislike anymore..

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2003 What a tremendous beer. Beautiful murky brown with a touch of orange hue, Good off-white head that dissapates into a ring around the edge. Aroma was spicy but mellow with charecters of fall harvest fruits, and bananas that have sat on the counter for a week. Flavor is smooth and flows amazingly well across the palate, starting off with the banana, or mabe even a sweet squash. spices of clove or possibly nutmeg, warminng in the ending with just enough hop to round everything out. an absolute must try for all beer lovers. RE-RATE 2/05/03 After drinking this beer regularly now for a month or so and consuming well over a case I have to give this beer a few extra points. Every bottle has been supurb. I geat a huge head every time even when I accidently chill it too long and it's ice cold. Flavors continue to intrigue me. I have noticed that the clove becomes more apparent in the finish when allowed to warm to around room temp. A great beer.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2008 Sampled for the first time in its trademark glass:  Just as refreshing and full-flavored as ever with great banana esters and clove balance throughout.  Ive had a lot of weizenbocks and this is still my favorite.

1999 Aged Version sampled on 11/21/02:  Clouded murky brown with a puffy tan head.  Complex aroma of sweet caramel and wheat malts with some dark and light fruits.  Sweet sticky finish covers the alcohol very well.  This seems to have picked up some more complexity over the past 4 years, but nothing too different from its fresh version.

Original Rating: Dark brown with a huge puffy head (see picture).  Smells like a really malty wheat beer with the typical banana and clove character.  The body is full and a touch spicy with a mellow bittering finish.  It warms the inside as it goes down, although the alcohol is masked well in the flavor.  I love the yeast as well.  Perhaps the best wheat doppelbock ever.

Looks like a brown wheat beer.  Tastes like a brown wheat beer.  Taste starts with ripe banana; mid taste is wheat, bread, yeast; finish with spice.  Bread, yeast, and clovey spice become more pronounced as the beer warms.  Definitely a favorite, maybe my favorite German.  Hides the alcohol well, but be careful ... it is there.

Lots of banana in the first smells but getting sweeter.
Dark red color with a creamy, white head.
Highly carbonated with a big wheat kick at the end.
Not a huge alcohol taste but its quite warming.
Nice lacing of the glass.
The esters are really shining as the beer approaches room temp.
Nice, thin head is maintained.
Need a typical dopplebock with low ester character to compare this high ester dopplebock to...

Medium brown color, medium white head, and wonderful strong fruity aroma that reminds me of some of the Belgian style ales. Medium body, nice carbonation level, and tastes very sweet but still retains that yeasty, citrusy, banana like flavor of wheat beers. This is good stuff, definitely the best wheat beer I have tried. Sweet and mildly alcoholic, more brewers should make this style.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2004 Bottled:  WOW!  Came out a little fizzy, but the head died down immediately.  Malty, wheat and cloves make for a rich taste.  Undertones of alcohol, but doesn't overpower the taste.  Nose is a bit floral.  Also hints of clove.  Very full taste.  VERY GOOD!  This bottle was aged for a year and a half.  It was much better than when new!

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2007 Pours a deep dark cloudy redish brown with a medium head that fades in a heart beat. Nose is clove and maybe a little banana. Flavor is complex, fizzy, banana and clove.  Alcohol is evident, but not overpowering. Reminds me of Belgian more than German.
Over-ripe banana aroma and flavor.  Thick lacing on top.  A bit syrupy.  A good beer.

Tasted at the Barrelhouse Brewing Company Microbrew Fest on November 9. Dark amber color with an off-white head. Nifty fruit aroma of grapes and raisins (same thing I guess). Complex flavor of fruits and malt. I am new to the Weizen Bock genre but this was good!

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2003 forget the raisin-plumcake and the bananas foster, here is real dessert. Drink it in the winter if you try it stateside, 02883(julian dating - 288th day of the year, expires one year later) on the bottom of the back label means it came out of the brewery approx. 08/08/ 2002. Should never be exposed to high temperatures as it is an unpasteurized product - bottle conditioned(yeast in bottom helps though). MAY BE THE BEST DOPPLEBOCK OF ANY KIND!
An excellent wheat doppelbock.  Slightly sweet.  Pours a beautiful dark bronze.  Alcohol mixes beautifully with the banana esters.  Clove flavor as well.
A classic.  Huge malt aroma and tremendous banana, chocolate, clove, caramel flavor set in relief by alcohol.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2004 Sweet brew man.  As a lover of the german beers I get a bock and a weiss! HOT DAMN  it is all alone though, so nothing to compare to it.  Definite alcohol presence covered by smooth sweet mouthfeel and roasted malts.  Complexity adds up to a wonderful finish.  A hint of chocolatiness on palate with a real late clove finish. Hooraah for originality, especially when it links two beauties as such.  Re-rate feb2004:  Well, I've now had a couple of weissebocks, yet none as good as this one.  I no longer can give it a 4.4 though; flavor, palate, still awesome.  nice warming effect, and awesome balance with just enough cloying.  soft, subtle andd beautiful.
I held it up to the light and there was an outline of a tornado in the glass!   Cool.   Crisp head, sweet tangy clove melon nose.   Dances on the tongue when cold.   Settles as it warms.

Nice, light brown head, pretty solid.  Dark caramel colour (almost opaque!).  Sweet, yeasty/spicey aroma.  Taste is like a nice, fuzzy hug...  banana, strong clove, wheat malt on the end.  No alcohol on the nose when cold, but comes through strongly as it warms.  Excellent!

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2003 tasted during the live, orgy/tag-team tasting on ratebeer: 10/30. jack o'lantern glowing orange brew, so opaque it's clearly (unclearly) a tribute to yeast. the head was manic-depressive, it blew open like a parachute, huge with audible popping, then--before i could even write down the description, it was gone. cinammon apple-fritter aroma is fattening just to sniff. sweet with bristly carbonation. gerber applesauce baby food doused with cinnamon oil and vodka. swimming in yeast. it became too sweet, i believe it cloyed me. without provocation. (one should never cloy a stranger).
very full bodied, it crowds out other tastes, sensations, thoughts. my tongue couldn't take the pressure and dangled out my ear, it's THAT full. it should be called a doppelyeast.  the most sublime gagging i've done in ages.

rerate: well, i got most of it right, except the color, it's muddier brown than "jackolantern" suggests. and  the level of sweetness, it's certainly NOT too sweet, it's magnificent. and the body, it's medium to large, clearly not overbearing. and the rating, i'm an ass to even mention gagging in the context of this beer,  it's a classic. the rating goes up, way up.
Toffee and banana aroma. Redish brown, off-white head, fair lace. Sweet, banana, toffee and wheat flavors. Burning sensation during a long lasting finish.

deep brown orange.  poured with a huge head that stayed till the end; along with medium lace.  Started with fruit/apple/clove and continued to develop as it warmed, gaining chocolate/bubble gum flavor as well.  Mine started off a bit cold - even then the palate was medium - got very thick.  well carbonated, but not fizzy tasting.  (tasted in the RateBeer Chatroom - 10/30/02)
A nice dark brown color, big head and lots of different notes. Their is Banana, chocolate fruity thing going on in it.

This beer pours a deep, cloudy copper color out of the bottle with a huge active tan head that crackled as it shrank with big bubbles.  The nose is darkly complex with spice and apple/fruit notes.  Huge malty sweetness with dark plum, apple and caramel flavors combining well with the clove spiciness.  Fruit and brown sugar flavors come to the fore as it warms.  Wonderfully well blended and balanced flavors.  Great beer.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2004 Re-rate 10/20/02:  Changed some numbers, still same rating. explosive nose, rich taste. Almost like drinking a nutcake.  If you consider the price when drinking beers, I'd dare say this is the best on the planet.  Re-rate 4/24/02:  Very strong alcohol aroma that knocked this down.  Although I should be using a better glass.  First ratings: If I lived in Germany, I would only drink this.  Well, I'd drink Celebrator too...(12/13/01) I just gave this beer another point. I have a 100 beers in my cellar and I can't stop thinking about this beer that I CAN'T BUY IN NEW HAMPSHIRE!!! Aarrgghhh! 12-31-01:  This beer is really good!  It's aroma is enchanting.

Aroma and taste is very estery and alcoholic.  Nice fruits and malts in aroma- almost smells like a barleywine.  Taste is sweet and smooth with some phenolic/wierd sweetness and slight hops.  Head died too quickly and not quite enough carbonation.  Could be a little too old- there was no date on the bottle but I dont really think it went too bad.  I think this is about the same as Victorys Weizenbock, as far as overall impression, but I think if I had this fresh, then it would have gotten better ratings.
[draught] This extremely nice coloured beer with a great head looks superb in the cool glasses. Unfortunately thats all. Unpleasant alcoholic wheat aroma. Strong and bad taste of farmyard manure.

Initially impressed. Im not a fan of wheat beers or lagers (even dark ones), but this has loads of flavours bundled together in an attractively spicy package. The dark lagers (Bocks & Viennas) are more complex and flavoursome than Pilsner type lagers, though they seem to fall into the same trap as rose wine - being neither flesh, fish nor good red herring. This Aventinus, however, seems to pack quite a punch. There is, however, quite a lot going on for a thin bodied beer - too much for a simple refreshment which is what most thin bodied beers are good for. An interesting taste to accompany the lager is very pleasing, like a well strummed acoustic guitar, but a 32 piece jazz orchestra is a little too much. As I continued to drink I found that the orchestra was a little too intrusive, that there was not enough sweet malt body to comfort my increasingly tortured palate. The medicinal tastes began to overpower, and I started to feel I was in a hospital undergoing open throat surgery without enough anaesthetic.
Spicy alcohol aroma.Layers of alchohol,chocolate,cloves and bananas.balanced bitter sweetness.Chocolate cordial finish.
Didnt care for the banana notes.  I much prefer the Weltenburger or Celebrator.  Really, this is MUCH more like a wheat than a bock.  On rerate, I think it is quite tasty.  A VERY malty weisse.

Dark brown color. Large creamy head. Malty spicy aroma with a touch of banana and clove. WOW. Big, bold beer.Banana and cloves moves to raisins, fruit, chocolate and citrus. Taste really grabs at you. Which is NOT a bad thing. Warming taste. Alcohol is evident, but not overpowering. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly bitter. NICE beer.

I cant believe I waited so long to try a beer of this type.  Truely the best of both worlds.  Aroma similar to a weisen with a healthy dose of banana, plus some extra goodies like clove, apricot, pear, and apple.  And pleanty of ethanol.  Lots of spice in the flavour: cloves, corriander, nutmeg.  More bock like and less weise like in  flavour.  Some chocolate, apple.  Nicely carbonated, smooth, rich, and creamy.  A fascinating beer.
Hazy brown, huge head.  Big banana aroma with yeast and malt notes.  Banana and chocolate flavor on a wheat base.  I had this beer about 7 or 8 years ago, its good to drink it again.

Rerate: Well Im glad I did get it again! Looks great (although not quite as good as that picture to the left...), dark maroon/brown with nice off white head. Aroma is strong malts and alcohol (but is not overwhelming). Flavour is beautiful: not too sweet and as Merc said, the best of both worlds (doppelbock and wheat). Clove, some weak esters, honey and molasses(sp?). Palate is almost perfect: as smooth as you would want with a nice little hop and alcohol bite. This could become a regular for me.

This is a great beer: full of sweet fruitiness and definately a strong clove finish. Great appereance and mouthfeel yet somehow I was expecting more... Id still get it again though!

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2004 Clear dark amber with a well retained off white head.  Aroma is rich, fruity and complex.  With notes of wheat, clove, alcohol, and some fig.  Flavor is full with flavors of pear, cloves, grapes.  Verry full flavored and highly delicous.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2003 I have been waiting for my beer store to re-stock this one for some time, watching that empty shelf was getting me thirsty.Nice Malty, hoppy and somewhat complex. Finish is a little off,and dry. Dark Brown, golden color. Not exactly my favorite style of beer still very drinkable and recommended 3.9.     Re-rating Vintage 1999 Bottle paper wrapped bottle deep garnet colored extremely yeasty aroma. Yeast, bread dough,figs, raisins,spicy acidity. This one is more complex more full bodied than others I have had before.Tea and toffee with Plums. Really a fine beer, a winner !

An interesting very dark golden brew that presents a lasting cloudy top. Its aroma is complex with citrus, banana and yeast.  Despite its high alcohol, its firm, clean, crisp and drinkable with strong weisse beer flavor chock full of yeast, tang, and citrus, with alcohol and malt hues.

rich and full tasting yet with a fizzy lightness which made it quite quaffable. dark ruby brown, opaque. very small bubbled 1/4 inch head but it lasted throughout. sort of a vinous aroma but that didnt make an appearance in the taste. the taste was all dark yummy wheaty goodness. yummy. and did i mention yummy?

Hazy dark honey brown colour with a medium size shortish lasting medium beige head. When cold the aroma is faint grainy spicey with a hint of fruit. As it warms a smorgasbord of floral sweet nectar malt honey, fruit and honeycomb develope. Medium body with luscious smooth mild sour palate. At 5<SUP>o</SUP>C its relatively bland but as it warms it becomes much more exotic with fruity raisin floral nectar and cinnamon bread flavours. The superb balance of sour grain, bitter hops and sweet malt make this an absolute classic beer. Wonderful clean refreshing finish. ABV well masked but it does sneak up on you towards the end of that 500mL bottle. Anyway, what a relief to find such a great beer in a local store after rating all those awful lagers in the last few weeks.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2003 The aroma does something to my brain that I can't really describe. It's appearance was its only weakness, I think. Little head, quickly disappeared. Other than that, this beer is spectacular. Plenty of hefe and plenty of bock. A perfect marriage. Nice and strong.

(re-rate) Slight hazy brown/red. Moderate to high carbonation. Insane aroma of cloves, banana, spices, wheat, malt and others.  Creamy mouthfeel, medium to thick bodied, palate bombarded with flavors of cloves, banana, chocolate,dark fruits, green apples, bubble gum and more. Complex as hell. Finish is sweet and clovey. Alcohol is masked wonderfully. This is simply world class.
A very fruity beer.  Seems almost syrupy.  A very alcoholic smell.  quickly dissapearing head.  A reddish brown color.  A pretty good beer.
Cloudy brown colour, sweet smell. Soft, smooth taste, little alcoholic. Bitterand a little spicy palate. Definately good.
This is a very good beer.  Somewhat sweeter than I expected but very drinkable.  I will be coming back to this again.

Hazy, dark brown, minimal head. Fruity, malty, spicy, yeasty aroma. Flavor is fruity/malty/spicy with definite notes of banana and raisin, with a moderately strong alcohol aftertaste. A bit sweeet for my taste, although there is enough hop presence to prevent excessive sweetness. Those who enjoy brandies, Belgians and barleywines will appreciate this beer more than I do.
Malty and  fruity with a spicy alcohol kick.

Heavenly sweet estery aroma of malt and brandied fruits.  Hazy brown color with wispy light head. Malt and fruit wave hits right away, with hops and carbonated bite close in-tow. The warm burn that kicks in during the finish reminds one that this sweet elixer also packs a punch! Outstanding mouthfeel--great malty substance with mild compensating  bite that gives buoyancy. This is wonderful stuff, a worthy choice for my 200th review!

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2003 Special release 1999: Fruitiness has subsided,big time malt sweetness and breadiness.Thicker than fresh versions.Ages like a champ.    Old rating: Cloudy,brown,with a mid sized soapy head. Bursting aromas of banana,clove,wheat,and lemon zest.Palate is soft but barely lacking.Might be because it is too cold.Flavors also clovey,bananas,sweet and thick malts.Finish is very yeasty(bubblegum)flavored.Too cold to start with but got much better as it warmed.I hate buying beer cold.
Wow.  Love the dark colour and the wonderful malty smell.  A great beer, one of my favorites.
Every Weissenbock should be compared with this one absolutely th e best tasting

A celebration of the art. Pours thick and dark with a quickly disipatting head. Smells of figs and chocolate. Taste is refreshing like a hefe but has the maltiness and punch of a great doppelbock. Wonderful in every respect. Re-rate 9/15/02: This is quite possibly the finest beer to come out of Germany, and man can those people make some incredible beer. This is everything a relaxing desert beer should be. On the one hand its very refreshing, nice for those summer nights. On the other hand its sweet and warming, great for a romantic winter evening with the old lady,... even she really likes it. And it aint even that expensive! I could drink this every night and be a happy man.

On tap: The colour is very dark brown/reddish. Pours a huge head. The aroma is distinct. Yeast and banana. The flavour is heavenly. A palate of flavours just hits your mouth while drinking it. As others I can highly recommend this beer.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2011 I was lucky to have this beer yesterday in original Schneider glass hey. The head was so great and thick and bubbly. Lasted for years. It had all the great wheat qualities, that aroma that makes you ummm . You drink this and you know that it cant get much better than that. Highly Recommended.
deep brown soft white cream like head.  Cocoa, fruit brandy like aroma.  rich soft palate, fruit notes, spiciness, long lingering finish warms the back of the throat.  Truly an outstanding beer.

Aventinus is unlike anything Ive ever tried before.  From its huge aroma of banana, citrus, chocolate and clove to its amazing smoothness, this beer is deserving of very high marks. How can you not love this beer???
Dark with huge head. Nice aroma and fruity taste. Top notch brew.

Re-rate: i seem to always re-rate this beer, so here i go again. Interesting clovy, banana smoothy/Banana Paddlepop aroma, with suggestions of toffee or caramel. Clovy, yeasty, fruity (banana), chocolatey/caramellly palate, quite complex. The ingredients seem to blend well together. Sweetish, but dry-ish finish, totally insane in the end. i am so happy that i can just walk down the road and get it.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2003 My first rating of this was a 1.7  This was due to a very bad bottle (tasting of urine), I bought another bottle and was VERY pleased to find that my taste buds weren't in complete opposition to everyone else here.  Other than a slightly unusual smell (very strong smell of sour banana), this beer is phenomenal.  Very cloudy with lots of fine sediment.  At the beggining of the bottle there was a very strong fruit flavor - banana and currant.  As the bottle warms there is an enormous swell of clove...very good.  This beer starts out solid and ends excellent.
Now this is a BIG beer! Although I wouldnt make it my daily drinker, this beer is packed with flavor. The bock hits you first, followed by the wheat. A very different beer. Excellent!

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2003 WOW! This packs some punch! Darker brown in color and cloudy when the yeast is mixed in. Spice and fruit notes throughout and possibly a floral taste/aroma as well. Recommended highly to all.
wheat beer tasting 02:  amazing to put it simply.  beautiful cloudy dark ruby/brownish colour.  big yeast and banana aroma.  burnt sugar, figs, dried fruits, and spice.  extremely complex.

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2009 Dark brown coloured, thick lasting head, absolutely beautiful. Aroma of wheat and malts, some yeast and spices. Very smooth flavour, banana, caramel, wheat, quite complex and very delicate. Lasting finish. Very, very good beer.
Second only to Celebrator... Ive had aged, ice and the standard and find all to be  malty with nice yeast flavors.

Beautiful colour. Very full and lasting white head. Complex fruity aroma (banana etc.). Nice fruity and malty (for a weiss bier) flavour, combined with the classic weiss bier spices (first of all cloves). All in all this could be the best weiss bier ever made!

This phenomenal beer comes with a frothy white head over a deep brown body with reddish, almost purplish, tinges.  The aroma is full of banana esthers, and it sits in the mouth with a creamy feel.  The flavor is fantastic, combining all the positives of a hefeweizen with an understated but balancing level of malt.  Magnificent.
Nice sweet aroma.  Lovely flavor with hints of banana.  Most complex wheat beer Ive had so far.  Quite excellent.

Red brown until you add the yeast, then sludgy mud colour. Good rocky head with good condition. First aromas suggestive of a big malty estery trappist but the the banana notes kick in to remind you its a wheat beer as well. Lots more chewy malt, banana and fig notes in the mouth and a sweet long fruity finish. Like someone mixed a westy and a Schneider Weisse.

Thought this beer would be cloudy due to the wheat, but is was a brilliant, clear brown.  Huge off-white head, pulled a Dr. Evil Belgian-dip while drinking.  Imagine mixing a beer that is half hefeweisen and half doppelbock - thats what this beer tastes like.  Chocolate, fruit, banana, bubble gum, wheat, clove, and the kitchen sink.  I dont think I would drink this beer on a regular basis, but a very complex and unique brew.

This beer cleans up in the appearance department. Good bottle and label, huge corky camel-colored head, cloudy rootbeer brown brew.  The aroma is good but mild except of the alcohol.  Very warming bock, a bit tart.  Woody, grainy, peppery, banana taffy flavor.  Perhaps a stab of anise or coriander. A worthy brew, and better as it warmed and lost the CO2 sting.

Is this an ale or a lager? Its fruitiness suggests this is an ale, an ultrastrong hefe-weiss dunkel. It also bears a strong resemblance to dark, strong belgian ales like Rochefort, or a dunkel version of Don de Dieu. In any case, it is an absolutely wonderful beer. Flavors of chocolate, figs, cloves and banana.. a different taste in every sip... If you are a fan of both hefe-weizens and bocks, this is the ultimate beer!
mocha color is absolutely beatiful, a wonderful wonderful beer
Very filling, classic example of style. Orange-peel and cloves, and great fruity malt/wheat flavours.

Deep reddish-brown color with diminishing head. Very complex aroma and flavors. Yeasty and  bready, with cloves and vanilla aromas. Sweet, but balanced with full mouthfeel. Hints of roots or bark, like root beer (sassafras), or birch beer (birch bark). Also tasted anise, apples and bubblegum. As it warms up alcohol burn is present, though neutral as a flavor element. Finished clean.
UPDATED: AUG 26, 2007 Delicious brew! The spicy hefe smell and taste are fantastic! One of the best German beers ive ever had, though i stick to Belgian beers.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2004 tasted in Toronto.  Tasted in a dimpled mug.  Pours a deep dark almost purple colour.  Head is large, white, fluffy and lasting. Yeasty, malty aroma.  Nice.....Flavour lets you know the alcohol levle is up there.   After several sips, warms the lips.   A nice strong bock,very deep and complex flavour.  Slight taste of corriander.

Lovely hazy orange-auburn appearance, but the head was far too thick and poofy.  I expected a full-bodied doppelbock malting, but a received a clean dose of wheaty ebullience instead--with a hint of woodiness in the atmosphere as well.  Wheat is again the predominant character in taste though enough malt underneath stanches the appearance of any bitterness. Eventually, the alcohol breaks through in both aroma and taste.  Overall, this is a great beer with good balance and the alcohol masked superbly.

The aroma is excellent.  I was hit by a warm bread pudding, which is to say, nothing as simple or trite as raisins but a full panoply of such flavors, including nutmeg, raisins, cinnamon, apple cider, plus a caramel sauce and a little banana in the bread.  Nice hazy brown color reminds me of the same kind of toffee syrup, only the sweetness is balanced.  Some liquor-like flavors in the tasting, with a more wheat and yeast influenced finish.  Perhaps some clove coming out more in the taste.  Alcohol, like the sweetness, is understated.  While likeable, I wouldnt call this an easy-drinking beer--sometimes rather challenging.  Perhaps, too, a bit more carbonation than is necessary.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2003 Contemplate, fellow apostles, the god-sent treacley-dipped bananas that overtake your palate…Venere the sagacity of its finely balanced fieldberries and dark rhum…With love and perspicacity, you may even observe lemon bubblegum amidst a spicy smoke…You are holding, dear beer pilgrims, a portal to the heart of pansophy…
one of the best this was our desert at the brewery before the tour which i skipped and found the other kelheim brewery down the street.great yeast and malt influences quite drinkable
Its replaced Salvator as my favorite in this style. Truly an exceptional (if all too costly) beer.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2003 Rerate 2/27/03.  I am not sure what I was thinking during the first rating.  Yeast spiciness, nutty malts, nice alcohol warmth.  This is one great beer.
I am not crazy about this style, but I admire this brew for what it offers.  I didn't note the wheat character as it seems a little overwhelmed by other malts -- there must be numerous crystal malts to build this kind of character.  Delicately hopped and filled with a nice spicy-ness ... I am not sure if it from the yeast or physically introduced.  A good beer to welcome in the the summer months.

Not exactly what I expected, being my second bock after the Paulaner Salvator. Nice earthy flavor, but the aftertaste is not quite my gear. Has a pleasant enough aroma, but, again, this is not really my style. A worthy beer, though.
I broke this out last night in tribute to my newborn baby girl, and drank some with the wife.  Wonderful licorice, dark fruit, and some smooth cloves.  A great weizen-bock.
user_location: Lake in the Hills, Illinois, USA

text: Best example of style period. One of my top 3 beers
Brown color, citrus bannana aroma, sweet flavor
Nice dark brown color but not much of a head. Kinda expecting more considering the Top 50 rating. Very good, nice balance just didnt knock me out like I thought it would.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2003 Dark reddish brown, like strong cloudy tea. Easy head had fairly large, soda-like bubbles form the head, but without the fizziness. As for taste, it's got the same strong esteriness of the Schneider weisse with the richer slight caramelly taste from the darker malts. Finishes with cloves. Tasty.
The beer is very dark with a beautiful colour. The experience is total when you drink it. The smell, the taste eg. is so wonderful! Bitter and light at the same time!

This might just be the greatest beer Ive had yet.  A wonderful fruit flavor, with hints of raisins, cloves, and I think caramel.  A very nice wheat taste as well for an all around excellent beer.  Track this one down and drink heavily.

Re-Rate:  I really love this beer!  A thick, malty double that goes down smooth.

My only complaint upon re-rate was that it left a little sludgy residue in the bottom of my glass.
so hyped that it only lived up to my expectations rather than surpassing them. last bottle was much better and nice and salty

God this is good stuff. Full of cloves, bruised fruit, raisins, chocolate, with a slight saltiness, and that grainy, creamy Bavarian texture. If I wore aftershave Id want it to smell like Aventinus - I guess that could be arranged pretty easily if I could hold myself back from drinking the stuff.

Every time Im interested in a wheat beer something from Scneider seems to find its way into the shopping cart, and usually its Aventinus!! I really like this beer. Its a dopplebock, but the wheat flavor is very pronounced, so I would think of it more in line with the wheat catagory than the bock catagory. Nice yeast at the bottom of the bottle. Heavy clovey flavor, with hints of banana too. Only downgrade is that the head doesnt seem to last as long as Id expect for a wheat-based beer.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2003 I was a little disappointed considering it's extremely high rating by others. I might have to give it another try. Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed every sip. A very hearty, strong bock/wheat beer. Not dissapointed in the beer. My expectations were unfairly high.

This beer has a very nice, complex aroma when poured. Its nice frothy head dies down quickly. Its dark amber in color w/ a flavor of cloves w/ hints of banana. Its a nice beer, but for my taste, its nothing too exciting. At $3US a bottle, I wont get it again, not that its bad tasting, it doesnt justify the cost for me.

Two beer styles that the Germans do well combine for even better than the sum of the parts. Great foam on the pour, deep complex aromas. fruity yeastiness and cloves are very soothing and relaxing. Palte is syrupy smooth without getting too heavy. Rich and flavorful, deep sweet malt fruitiness blends well against a sour banana hefeweizen like finish with a touch of cloves.

a bit light for a doppelbock - but it has the strength.  
just the right amount of wheat - a bit of sour dryness - but not too much - prevents it from having that mouth of nothing but malt feel some doppelbocks suffer from.  hopped about right with some spicy flavors.  some fruity notes - but theyre subtle - not funky.  very well balanced and easy to drink.

color is a hazy dark amber.  excellent beer

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2003 How this has changed since my first tasting! I bought this bottle at the same time and aged it for a year, it now seems a whole lot mellower than I remember, chocolate and banana, with a clean wheaty palate. Mild, finely bubbled and smooth it finishes really nicely.
Strong beer.  Creamy, thick head.  A nice murky amber glow.  Sweet smell, with a bit of orange.  High carbonation with a taste of malt.  Surprisingly clean and fresh.

Bottle.  A dark golden amber color with a nice large head.  A nice spice, clove, and banana flavor that is clean and crisp.  It appropriately finishes quickly, making its punch but not overstaying its visit.  A wonderful combination of the wheat and doppellbock, borrowing from the best of both worlds.  I could almost think this was a Belgian.
Fizzy at first. The eisbock version had more flavor and seemed more complex as this seemed more wheaty with less of the spiciness.  And just like the eis, it was better as it warmed up in the glass.

I was a little dissapointed in this beer.  The head was enormous, and the beer seemed way overcarbonated to me.  The intensity of the fruity flavor threw me off at first but got better as the beer warmed or my tastebuds were numbed.  I liked the maltyness but the yeasty-fruit flavor seemed overdone to me.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2003 Re-rate:  Several recent samplings of this have shown that I didn't know a damn thing last time I had this.  Wonderful clove and chocolate covered bananas soaked in alcohol.  Sweet with occasional bits of bubblegum and a bit of yeast.  Thick and wonderful.  Something I plan to continue to drink regularly, especially as a nice summer beer.  5/8/2002 3.7:  Certainly can't ignore the malty taste.  Nice color to go with the flavor.  Certainly worth the try.

A very intersting beer. Had this last night at the Rathskeller in Indianapolis. A very strong yeast/bannana flavor seems to dominate accentuating the wheat aspects of the beer backed by a malty doppelbock backbone. An interesting beer.

Re-rate: Over the past six weeks after my first sip of Aventinus, this has become one of if not the best beer Ive had yet. The rich full bodied malty taste is just great. First rate-Started my day on an empty stomach and a Coopers Best Extra Stout, a dangerous combo! Now, one hour and lunch later I will pop the top of this....great color, like an opaque Anchor Steam, nice malty spicey aroma, wow, what a great taste, I am impressed with the complexity and balance. I had a Schneider Weisse last night, this beats it hands down. Worth every penny and then some.
Medium paced drinker. Good belch undertones. Dirty colour. Good taster. Bit of a sweet baby.
I still rate the Celebrator as my favotite doppelbock, but this one would be my second choice.
Wheat, yeast, and sugar smell. Russet colour, huge head. Malty taste, but also bitter. Thicccck and rich. As it warms, takes on a Belgian Ale feel. Fine Beer.

My first impression is its extremely cloudy appearance.  It also has a large, but light head.  Smells good too.  It has nice chocolate/banana elements, and drinks easiliy (dont they all!).  A very good beer, but I wouldnt rate it quite as highly as some of the former reviewers have.  To me, it came into its own as I drank more, and it lost a little of its gas.
Gold brown colour. Pours thick. Big aroma of toffee and banana. Full bodied, rather sweet.
It has that wheat beer zing and the fruity, heavy flavors af a dopplebock. A unique style.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2008 There is no other equal when it comes to a Weiss Doppelbock.  TO get the balance and flavors in this beer are next to impossible, but Schneider does it! RERATE additional info. - Near brown color with a tall creamy head. Smooth with just enough spritz to make it lively. Wheat, light clove and bananas, and fresh yeast aroma. Caramel, light fruit and light fruitcake spice mingle in the flavor. Simply stated "Perfect"!   Rerate ala leap year. Will my past haunt me, is this just a figment. Brown garnet color with a taller bone colored head.  Aromas are faint with only some wheat and lightly toasted malt. I fear an older bottle, but I can only assume this is what many have come to expect from the typical shelf stored import. At least the flavors do not let me down, spice, wheat, and malt. Somewhat thinner than I remember as well. An awesome brew fresh, still a great brew. I now am without a 5.0 brew thanks to big black bear. and I must keep searching.
Nice fruity aroma and taste.  Very rich and smooth.

Wow.  Just a great beer.  The appearance is somewhat cloudy, which isnt very appealing to me, but its nice and dark.  The aroma is good.  Its got a fruity/choclatey smell.  Very pleasing.  After my first sip, I exclaimed Oh, thats delicious!  Extremely palatable.  Perhaps the best beer Ive ever had.

The aroma is rich with fruituness and malt, has a dark cloudy appearance and a good head. The flavor is very complex with strong hints of chocolate, bannana and maltieness. Has a silky texture and leaves a chocolate-malty taste on the palate. You can taste the 8%, but in a purely positive way, an excellent beer that ranks in my top 5 of all time.
Great beer for enjoying with freinds and relaxing to drink but not too (>4)many or it makes it hard to get home
Deep copper/amber colour good head, yeasty/banana/wheat aroma with a good maltiness in the body. Good balance, smooth as well. Best in its class? damm good.
It had a very smooth flavor of fruits and spice.  Lots of banana came out as well.  Not a bad beer but nothing would make me buy it again.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2003 RE-RATE: Nice sweet-toffee and banana flavoring, with hints of other neutral fruit: apple, pear.
ORIGINAL RATING 4/14/2002: 7-4-7-3-14: Very distinctive banana aroma and flavor.  Medium bodied, nicely balanced.

Wonderful head!  Great amber gold color.  All the cloves and banana flavor that one would expect from any great wheat beer.  Spicy, which I like.  The moutfeel reminded me of the great malt base in this beer.  Not overwhelming with the alcohol notes.  A classic, very exciting beer.
My favourite beer.This Doppelbock Weizen is the best of its style.Big blast of cloves and wheat with some belgian ale undertones. Very tasty and wonderfully complete beer!!!!

Very dark amber, almost black color with a very creamy, light beige head that eventually dissipates completely.  Yeasty doughy hefe aroma with hints of toasty, nutty, caramely sweetness.  Strong characteristic hefe taste (acidic banana flavored twang) with complex toasty, chocolatey, winey notes.  Noticible alcohol taste with minimal alcohol effect (7.5% 8-Ball wrecks me far worse).  Hefe sourness well balanced with a sweet finish.  Damm, this is some good shit!

A great beer.  I didnt find it a very great doppelbock but awesome deviation from normal Weissbier.  An awesome beer.  I have a second bottle I hope to rate again soon maybe wihth a better palate.  I rated around six beers tonight.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2004 RERATE 7/16/04: 1999 vintage. Brown body, hazy, small off-white head, vinous nose with spices. Rather mellow body, but complex with doughy malt, dark fruits, clove, bubblegum and some vinous notes. Five years aging seems to have taken care of any banana esters and most of the original sweetness.
two styles in one - a sweet, wheat treat thatll knock you off your feet

Sweet, somewhat malty or caramel-like aroma.  At first it seems more Belgian than Doppel because of the fruity sweetness in the aroma.  The taste is also sweet, fruity and spicy with a strong, malty finish.  The 8 percent ABV stays hidden in this one, at least until the very last second.  I like it very much and it compares well with Celebrator except the finish is more bitter.  I am grateful, too, for the slightly higher ABV here than in Celebrator.

This 8% ABV Münchener is bottle fermented -- is unpasteurized and unfiltered -- and pours with a deep brown color and a thin foam head. It has a sweet taste, featuring chocolate, fruit and spice flavors. Finishes with a clove-like aftertaste.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2012 Bottle. Head is initially large, frothy, light brown, mostly diminishing.  Body is hazy medium orange-brown, bottle conditioned.  Aroma is moderately to heavily malty (caramel), lightly yeasty (cobwebs), with notes of banana, brown sugar, cinnamon.  Flavor is heavily sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter.  Finish is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.  Medium to full body, syrupy texture, lively carbonation, lightly to moderately alcoholic. Too syrupy sweet for my tastes, and these recent bottles (with the new "Tap 6" design) seem sweeter and more caramel-sugar heavy in the nose than I remember too.  I dont know if its been dumbed down a bit to suit more peoples desires, or if I just have gotten so tired of syrupy sweet beers that I cant appreciate this anymore.  Either way, I cant get excited about this at all.
Very smooth - spicy aroma and moderate creamy/fruity flavor.  Very clean aftertaste.  Excellent!

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2004 Good Lord. I've had some good wheat beers in my day, but this is next level. Similar taste and structure to a Weiss, but extra cloudy, with a reddish-brown hue not unlike an ice cream float. Make sure to really smell that head, because it will break down soon: slightly burnt, peppery, like a clove cigarette -- and a heavy, lingering clove flavour from middle to end. It's a pastrami sandwich in a glass. This is much more flavourful than any similar beer I've tasted, and it gets stronger as you go further south down the bottle. Has a genuinely creamy texture, too.

Had a fresh Aventinus when I was in a biergarten in Germany (long before it was imported into the US.)  Excellent complexity of weizen flavors and esters with the maltiness and alcohol of a doppelbock.

One of my favorites.Very complex for a wheat beer with hints of anis and dried raisins.Does not have a heavy alcohol taste destite having an 8% rate which is a good indication that this is indeed a high-quality beer.Appearance is great with chmpagne -like bubbles.You can leave it there for a couple of hours but the taste still remains.Also very malty but not heavy.After one,you will be begging for more.

Great looking beer, but its flavor was kind of funky. A little dissapointing, as this beer came highly recommended.  Wouldnt go out of my way to get it again. It wasnt a bad beer, but didnt reach my expectation.
My new favorite beer. I would describe it as beery...

The aroma is sweet, caramel and fruity.  the taste likewise.  Theres a slight hint of alcohol, but youd never guess at its true abv.  The beer sits well on the palate, and goes down very smoothly.  The problem I have with this beer is that by the time youre at the end of your first bottle, you realize you have no interest ina second -- the sweetness that was so welcome at the beginning has become cloying.

This beer is very good.
Its a heavy doppelbock
Fruity aroma and flavour typical of German wheat beers, but with a little added punch to it. A very interesting and worthwhile experience.
One of the worlds best brews.  Very complex for a German beer.  Highly recommended.
This is the closest to a near perfect beer. Each time you taste this beer new flavours and aromas appear. Everyone must try this beer at least once!
A wheat and a double bock, maybe a unique combination.  great malty flavour, fruity aroma and dark without tasting burnt.  Dont even really notice the 8% abv.  Another fantastic brew.
Aroma of pears. Mildly yeasty. Reminded me of a heavier and fuller Unibroue Blance De Chambly. Generous malts and very tasty.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2003 Wow, if this is any indication of a typical Weizen Bock, I need to try more.  Malty with nice sweetness and hints of clove and vanilla.  Medium-light palate with lots of carbonation.  Very drinkable.
Best of the dark German Wheats. Carmel colored, nice and yeasty. Very malty, goes down easy but is a meal unto itself. Fantastic!

It said doppelbock (my favorite style) on the label, so I had to try it.  Certainly didnt come off as a normal double bock, but as a special kind of wheat beer.  Ive come to the conclusion Im not a fan of wheat beers, so my opinion of this may be skewed by that.  Maybe somewhat better than the few other wheat beers I tried, but in my case that isnt saying all that much.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2007 Aroma is of ripe clove-infused bananas and raisins.  Malty, chocolate, rich, raisins, semi-dry, bananas and pears, cloves, nuts and a froth head to boot.  Slightly acidic and elegantly creamy.  A tad bit more hops and alcohol would have made this beer a little better, IMO.  I cant complain however.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: My first wheat doppelbock...a lot of wheat flavor and did not seem as much of a dopplebock as it did a wheat ale. Lacking much hop character, but strong yeasty citrus/banana malt flavor followed with chocolate flavor reminiscent of a Scottish Ale. Definitely unique and enjoyable, but not as good as a lot of these ratings suggest.

From the moment of the first pour, I thought this looked and smelled like a Scottish Ale. The head developed in the same way, the color would be a perfect match, and there was this earthy maltiness right up front that was fantastic. From a taste standpoint, obviously, theres no comparison to a Scots! I know nothing about wheats, and only a tiny bit about dopplebocks, so my comparisons here are to slim pickins, but this is unique. The cloveiness in the taste took some getting used to, and I can tell that this is a superbly brewed beer. Like a couple of other raters, my overall and flavor scores are down a bit...its just a sweet, acquired taste, like my old dad used to tell me about martinis, and I aint acquired it yet. I cant believe I was able to find this in Jackson, which is only 15 miles from me.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text:
This beer brought me closer to true bliss than any other I have ever had.  Wonderful finish, taste, aroma, color.  Beware the kick - have two of these, call a taxi.

Those in the Dallas/Ft Worth area can find this at Planos Bavarian Grill; see http://www.bavariangrill.com/beer.html for a list of what else they have.

I too would put this in the dopple category rather than a weissbier.

Absolutely superbe. Best beer I have ever drunken. 
Unfortunately it is rarely available.

The second weizenbock i have tried and although this is the standard, i think i prefer Victorys Moonglow over this. That being said, this is an excellent beer, dark and cloudy with an awesome aroma typical of a wheat beer. Good malty backbone and definite banana and chocolate flavors and a nice finish. Great beer.
It smells great!  The second time I tried this beer I added a point to flavor & palate... maybe the 1st was a little off.

Very good beer. Dark, strong and sweet. I could taste hints of plums and apricots.
My only drawback with this beer is that it was a little too sweet for me. Otherwise an enjoyable beer. By the way,
I think this beer should be categorized in the Doppelbock family, not the Wheat family.
I am spending most of my salary on this excellent beer. I would recommend this to everyone. Best beer I have had.
This wheat doppelbock is malty with a nice wheatish accent.  A contender for the throne.
this is very potent shit. enough said
excellent wheat-bock - dark and unclear, fruity (banana) with a bit phenol in the nose

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2009 Dark russett brown with a light tan foam with less than moderat foam retention. Milk chocolate, tobacco, raisins, slight notes of oxidation. The flavour is a little more obvious with the oxidation. Raisins and chocolate dominate. A good beer but this two year old bottle seems to be a shadow of what Id imagine a fresh bottle is like.

I like this beer quite a bit.  Maintians a good head despite the potent alcohol. Big full body.   The mixture of sweet treacle and tangy bannana fruit balance each other well.  Each part is perfect harmony, grain, yeast, hops and water.
Great beer! Leave it to the Germans to produce a wonderful wheat ale.

Very complex to say the least.  First off, when I poured it, the dark opaque color surprised me.  The aroma is very sweet as is the taste.  I can taste so many varieties of flavors in this beer it is crazy.  I taste an apple/raisin/nut flavor that is good.  But in my opinion, the flavors are too complex for most drinkers.
